1:::"Hello everyone.
I want to tell you about last night.
I could not sleep untill 2 o'clock.
I do not know the reason but I needed to wake up at seven o'clock.
Finally I drank water then I fell into a deep sleep.
It was 2:00 so I am very tired.
But I can do my homework.
The end.":::

2:::"Hello.
I have a good news.
What is it?
My mother is better. But I also have a bad news.
What is it? Now my dad is sick.
I do not want hime to be sick. Why? I love him.
And if he is sick
column2:
how can we go to places?
And I have to stay at my aunt's house again. Now he is at the
hospital. Please help me to pray to God for him.":::

column2:

when she went out.
Please
column3: </del> <mod target = Mom>mom</mod>
column4:
get well.
Mom
column5:

The end.":::

The end.":::

column3:
"" but I will try to call her ""older sister.""
The end.":::

Bye Little Fox.":::

column1:
17:::"There were three skinny goats.
They wanted to eat grass and then they needed to cross a bridge.
But there was a witch at the bridge.
The first goat walked across the bridge.
The witch saw it and said
column2:
""I'm going to kill you.""
The first goat said
column3: ""Please spare my life
column4:
a bigger goat is going to come.""
""Okay
column5:
then you may go now.""
The second goat tried to cross the bridge and the witch let him go too.
And then the third goat tried and they began to fight.
And the goat won.":::

column1: 18:::"On Saturday
column2:
I'm going to see my aunt and a dog.
I like it. He is cute.
The dog's name is Gamdori because it is black.
I like him very much.
Since he saw me before
column3:
he will remember me.
Also
column4:
there is an older girl. She is 17 years old.
I like her
column5:
but the dog likes her more.
I wish I had a dog.
My mom will buy me one later.":::

column9:

The end.":::

column1:
20:::"Kelly and Kim decided to give mom and dad a big gift.
They are getting a box. They are going to put the best present in it.
They all got into a big box and Kim was too short.
So Kelly lifted him. They needed to hide now.
They closed the lid. Mom and dad came.
""What is this?"" Mom said
column2:
""Something is moving."" Then the box
opened and Kelly and Kim said
column3:
""Surprise!"" What a wonderful gift!
I liked this story very much.
The end.":::

column2: it is me

column2:

So people went up and they did not see the sheep.
How stupid the sheep was.
And I bought some shoes. The character is Hello Kitty.
I was happy.
The end.":::

25:::"Today I woke up at 7:50 and watched Little Fox.
And then I watched an Internet vocabulary program.
If I give the right answer
column2:
they give me a point.
I did well like I did in Little Fox. and After that I studied some Little Fox vocabulary.
I can memorize the story even though I read it only once.
How clever I am!
And then I read a book.
Right now I'm still studying.
How about you?
Are you studying like me?":::

column2:
I went to Everland.
There were a lot of things to ride but

And I went to the science museum.
Best of all
column3:

a straws. I made a hat
column4: a balloon
column5:

my father.
The end.":::

column1:
27:::"I like Taekwondo class.
Today I went to Taekwondo class. I played chicken fight.
I like it very much because I do it very well.
It is not hard to do it.
You just have to do it with only one leg.
And you cannot use your hands.
When I play I have to attack my friend with my one leg.
Also
column2:
I am good at running.
I run very fast.
How about you?
Maybe what you can do is not hard.
The end.":::

column1:
28:::"Today was my third time going to art class.
I went to art class and I drew an elephant.
It was flying and the birds were pulling it.
They were very tired and they helped the elephant because he wants to fly. and The elephant has a gentle heart.
Even though they had bloody noses
column2:
the birds did not give up. and The elephant was spreading
water everywhere and now you should be a genius and a hard worker.
The end.":::

column1:

I played with my cousins.
We played ""To Catch Robbers"" and ""Hide and Seek.""
We ate pizza. It was very yummy.
And on Saturday
column2:
I went to my uncle's house because of my grandmother's birthday.
We had a cake and we blew out the candles.
I had a great time.":::

column1: 30:::"Today
column2:
I had a good day.
I went to Taekwondo class and my teacher gave me a blue belt.
I like my blue belt because it is beautiful.
I played at 5:30.
But not many of my friends were playing outside because it was very cold.
So I don't go out now.
But I went to my friend's house.
The end.":::

column1:
31:::"Do you want to know what i did?
On Chusok
column2:
I went to my grandmother's house
and I played a game with my daddy. And once
column3:
my father and I caught frogs and dragonflies too.
We went to my other grandmother's house and also
I played a board game. And my aunt came too.
I had fun there. I like Chusok very much.":::

column1:
32:::"I read this story.
Can you imagine a magic donkey who has
shiny fur? He can also fly in the air at midnight.
And he has a friend named Yoo jin and only he knows the donkey
can fly. And the magic donkey is Yoo jin's best friend.
And I know this story is just a story but I thought it was very interesting.
The end.":::
33:::"Today
column2:
in Seoul it is raining a lot.
Most of the day it rained.
I don't like rainy days because I have to take
an umbrella and wear a raincoat
column3:
and if the rain stops
I have to take them home again.
I do not like the rainy season because I can see
earthworms. I hate worms and of course snakes because
these animals lie in water.
How about you?
The end.":::

column1:
34:::"I read a story called ""Wolf's Garden"" and it was a very funny story.
Can you believe that a wolf is not eating animals in this story?
Do you want to know why it does not eat animals?
Because during the winter
column2:
the wolf was hungry so he decided to
eat vegetables.
In the spring
column3:
the wolf had become so kind to animals even though the animals
ate vegetables when it was sleeping.
I guess you can imagine that in the forest
column4:
everyone had no problems.
The end.":::

column1:
35:::"I read a story called ""Nature's Mother.""
I thought that she was so helpful for other moving things and also had such a kind heart.
I think she loved everything and now I feel so kind. And I want to help living things by myself because I like to be kind.
And I hope you will learn this lesson too and have a kind heart like me.
She helped by giving (?) things what they liked most liked
column2:
I mean their most favorite things.
She gave them food and I will help others.
How about you?
The end.":::

column1:
Maybe I woke up at maybe 8:40 in the morning.
I have to go to kindergarten at 9:15.
So I had to be quick
column2:
because there was only 35 minutes left to take the bus.
The bus came to pick me up.
I arrived there at almost at 10:00.
But that is okay and I went to kindergarten by walking.
Of course I had a fun time.
And I am lucky if I go to Taekwondo class. And then
I picked up my baby sister.
My teacher was waiting in front of the elevator and now
I am in my home.
The end.":::

column1:
37:::"Do you want to know about my younger sister?
My younger sister went to kindergarten and
she is only three years old.
You will be amazed.
because she went to kindergarten with me.
I went to kindergarten when I was four.
I went there because I liked kindergarten more and
I liked the five-year-old children. And my sister has
a friend
column2:
but maybe she does not know they are
older sisters. I wonder what my sister is doing
at kindergarten?
The end.":::

column1: 38:::"On Friday morning
column2:
my family went on a trip to my grandmother's house.
It took a long time
column3:
but I was happy.
We went to the beach to go swimming.
I cannot swim
column4:
but I want to learn.
My mother said she would take me to the swimming school next time.
My baby sister likes swimming very much.
She did not want to come out from the water.
I bought a water gun and played with my sister.
In the afternoon
column5:
I caught cicadas with my father.
I caught 12 cicadas.
And at night I played Paduk with my grandfather.
My father taught me Paduk. Paduk is very fun.
It was a happy day.":::

column1:
40:::"Sep. 3 2013.



Last weekend
column2:
I went to Gui-San for ""Beolcho"" with my family.

Beolcho is a Korean tradition to take care of our ancestors' graves.

Chooseok is coming so there are many things for all family members to do together.

In Gui-San
column3:
I met Hoo-Seung. He is my cousin and friend.

We caught a frog
column4: a cricket<ins>
column5:
and many kinds of grasshoppers.

It was very fun
column6: but I didn't want to touch the cricket<ins>
column7:
because the cricket made me crawly.

It had a dark brown body and long antennae
column8:
so it looked like a cockroach.

When I caught the cricket I used a cup.

And then mom said ""Come here
column9:
Lucy.""

So
column10:
I went there.

There was a little snake. My dad pressed the snake's head down with a branch.

The snake had a red and black stripe pattern.

I thought maybe it was a king snake

but my dad told me
column11: ""It is not a king snake
column12:
just a little baby snake.""

And my dad let the snake go.

The snake disappeared very fast.



We bowed at the tomb
column13:
and we had a snack time.

It was a very exciting day!":::

column1:
41:::"Today I'm very very very happy!

Two weeks ago
column2:
I started to learn badminton in the school gym after class.

In the first class
column3:
I learned about badminton positions and how to hit a shuttlecock.

A shuttlecock is the ball used in badminton.

In the second class
column4: on Friday
column5:
I hit the shuttlecock five times. It was fun and made me happy!

My coach said
column6: ""Lucy
column7: you have to hit the shuttlecock 20 times
column8:
please practice more by yourself.""



Last Saturday
column9:
my father and I went to the gym at Seong-Jeong Middle School.

There was a badminton club there.

My father and I played badminton and he corrected my movements
column10:
and I practiced hitting the shuttlecock by myself.

Finally
column11: I <mod target = could>was able to</mod> hit <ins>it </ins>11 times
column12:
which was 6 more than the first time.

But I was a little worried about it. My coach said I have to do more than that.

Today
column13:
I had my 4th badminton class.

I can hit a shuttlecock only 11 times.

But I got praise from my coach.

He said
column14:
"" You are getting better every class. Good job.""

It makes me practice harder.

I'm going to hit the shuttlecock 100 times.":::

column1: 42:::"There are many types of typhoons. For example
column2: Nabi
column3: Maemi
column4: Kirogi
column5: Doksuri
column6:
and more are names of typhoons.
Long ago people named a typhoon Thelma
column7: which is a woman's name in English. They used a woman's name because a man is much stronger than a woman. Typhoons are weak
column8:
not strong like a man.
Now they have changed the names to other things like Nabi because it sounds very calm. Nabi is a Korean name. It means butterfly.
Several days ago
column9:
Bolaven came. The name came from Laos. Bolaven means tableland in Laos.
Typhoon names are very interesting!":::

column1:
43:::"I love to play my violin.
Last week I was in a violin contest. I was very nervous. But my mom encouraged me and told me that I could do it. I knew it was hard but I did my best to be calm. When I was on stage I took a deep breath and played my violin. My music was a little fast and long.
""Ding! Ding!""
The bell rang. It meant that I had to stop playing the violin. The hard part was over. I could have played much better than that so I was a little bit disappointed.
Next year I will not be frightened to go to my next contest.":::

44:::"I went to Jeju Island last Sunday.
I was very excited. I went to Jeju Island with my family
column2: <ins>including </ins>my grandma
column3: my uncle
column4: and my cousin. First
column5: we rode to our hotel<ins>
column6: </ins> <ins>which was </ins>called Jeju Shilla. We went to the hotel's beach. The waves were very rough. I ended up drinking some <del>of the </del>sea water. I also made a sand castle. I used a bucket. When a wave hit my hand
column7: I let go of the bucket. I think it was all alone. Most of all<ins>
column8:
I was very disappointed. After eating dinner we went to the hotel's swimming pool. I swam there until 11 p.m. It was the first time I got to swim late at night.
I think Jeju Island is the most wonderful place to live!":::

column1:
45:::"Every night we go walking.
We walk for about one hour. We go to the same track everyday. I like outdoor walking because it is cool. If it's raining I don't go outside. When I go outside
column2: I feel like I'm flying over the sea. The wind makes my cheeks feel cool. I run like the blink of an eye. The night breeze is cooler than I thought. The cooler the wind <mod target = blows>is</mod>
column3: the faster I run. I can run very fast. Sometimes I almost fall. Sometimes I ride my bike<del>
column4: </del> too! I speed like a bullet. I can not drift
column5: but I can run with my bike. How much can I run? How fast can I go on my bike?":::

column1:
46:::"My dad is the best.
He earns money for our family. He is an eye doctor. I think he is the hardest working father that I have seen. He wakes up early in the morning and comes home late at night. I am very proud of my dad. He is handsome
column2: </del> too. Even though he is tired
column3: he goes to exercise with me. He goes to a yacht race place and Camellia Island with me. I usually ride my bike. I went to the yacht race place with my bike and went around two times last week. Yesterday
column4: I went to Camellia Island with my bike. My dad said he loves me very much. I love him
column5:
too!
He is my loving dad. I wish he could live a long and happy life.":::

column1:
47:::"I had a cooking class. I made pork with pepper and mixed vegetables.
First
column2: I mixed the pork with a sauce. Second
column3: I cut the pepper and onion into <ins>long
column4: </ins>skinny <del>and long </del>pieces. Third
column5: I put the pork into a big frying pan and fried it. Fifth
column6: I fried the vegetables with the pork. Sixth
column7: I put everything into a dish. Seventh
column8:
I enjoyed the meal.
I think it was very yummy. I like cooking class very much. My friend said it was very exciting to be taking it with me!":::

column1:
48:::"I went to Namhae Island to see the Yeosu EXPO yesterday night.
I was very tired and sleepy. I went to sleep in the car. When I opened my eyes
column2: I was in a bed in a big house. It was early morning and I turned on the TV to see some news. When our family all woke up
column3: we went outside. There was a car that took us to a dock. I was a bit scared because I had never been on a big boat before. I thought it would sink. But I got bored soon. I stopped thinking about the boat sinking. When I got off the boat
column4: I saw a sign that said
column5: ""Welcome to Yeosu EXPO!"" I saw people lining up to see lots of different performances. Now I want to go to another EXPO. But I need to wait at least another 3 years to see the next EXPO. The next EXPO will be held in Milan
column6: Italy. I want to have a chance to visit Milan to see the next EXPO.":::

column1: 49:::"Now it is summer. The leaves turn green and many fruits grow. People change from their sweaters to shorts. The rain is turning into sun<ins>shine</ins>. The monsoon<ins>s</ins> <mod target = has>have</mod> already come. People are looking for ice cream more than tea. The butterfly says
column2: ""Bye-bye!"" and the mosquito says
column3: ""Hello!"" The heater went into our storage
column4:
and the fan came out of our storage. People like going to the water park more than the aquarium. People enjoy exercising more than doing their homework.
I think it is going to be a peaceful summer!":::

column1:
50:::"It is almost summer vacation. I would like to plan my vacation.
I want to wake up very early. After eating breakfast I want to do my vacation homework for as long as I can in the morning. After eating lunch I want to exercise. When I get hot I want to play with my friends. After saying goodbye to my friends I want to read books at home. Then I will take a nap. After that I will practice my violin. Next I want to see many stories on Little Fox.
Well
column2: I hope to have a great vacation.":::

column1:
51:::"Nate the Great is a detective.
One day he was washing himself in the bathtub. Just then the doorbell rang.
""Oh
column2:
no. Not now!"" he thought.
He put a towel around him and went to his door. His friend Pip was standing in front of the door.
""Hi
column3:
Pip. Why are you here so early?""
""Help me
column4: said Pip. He gave Nate a note. The note said
column5: ""Step left until you reach the middle. Step up and you will solve this riddle."" With some help from Nate
column6:
they solved the mystery together.
""But I am still looking for another mystery to solve
column7:
said Nate at the end.
I think Nate the Great is the best detective in the world. But I think I could solve that mystery faster than him.":::

column1:
52:::"I wish I had a pet.
When I am lonely I could play with my pet.
I wish I could have a puppy. I would name it Mimi or Steve. The color of its dog collar would be red. Even thinking about it makes me happy. I want to have a small
column2: gentle dog. I want a dog that would also hold its pee or poop. I want to teach it some tricks<del>
column3:
too! It will be so much fun to have a dog.
When I am sad
column4:
we can share our feelings together.
My mom said
column5: ""When the dog is angry
column6:
it will pee everywhere!""
But I don't care! We won't make the dog angry. Who knows?":::

column1:
53:::"I have nothing to do but work.
My mom says
column2: ""Do this. Do that."" My brother says
column3:
""Do this! Do that!""
My mom makes me do homework. My brother makes me do chores! The only thing I do is work. I don't like to work. My life is full of chores and homework. No time to play! I must read my book that I have been assigned for homework. Giving a pencil to my brother is my chore! There are so many things I have to do that I don't know what to do! Oh no
column4: <mod target = another>more</mod> homework! Oh no
column5:
another chore! I am in a bad mood these days.
Maybe because of traveling
column6: I am tired and have more homework. Next week I think I will be better!":::

column1:
55:::"What is it?
It is yellow and long. There are little bumps on it. It is very yummy. It is a vegetable.

What kind of vegetable is it?
It is a secret. You have to guess what it is. The farmer plants it and sells it. What is it?
It is corn!

What is it?
It is cold and creamy. People like it especially during the summer. It is usually kept in a cooler. What is it?
It is ice cream!

Who am I?
I skate very well. I am famous these days. I won a gold medal in the Olympics. Who am I?
I am Kim Youn Ah!

What is it?
It travels to space. Everybody cheers for it when it blasts off into space. What is it?
It is a spaceship!

Who am I?
I take care of you. I am an adult. I am a woman. Who am I?
I am your mom!":::

56:::"I will go to Italy next week. I will stay at my aunt's house and also in a hotel. My aunt lives in Milan. I will stay at her house for seven days and stay in a hotel <mod target = at>in</mod> Rome for three days. I will visit the leaning tower of Pisa
column2: Venice
column3: Milan
column4: Rome
column5: Pompei<ins>i</ins>
column6: Sor<ins>r</ins>ento
column7: Napoli<ins>
column8: </ins> and Milan. I will go to Switzerland<del>
column9: </del> too! I will take a mountain train. I will go to the top of the Alps. I will have lots of fun. It takes three hours to go to Venice
column10: Pisa
column11: and Switzerland from Milan. It is very convenient to be able to stay at Milan! I will eat pizza and pasta in Italy. I will have a great time there. What fun!":::

column1:
57:::"I have a brother. His name is Sumok.
He looks very handsome. Most of the time I like him. But sometimes he makes me a little bit sad. He is thirteen years old. We are in the same elementary school
column2:
too! He is very smart. On science day he participated in the water rocket competition. He won the first prize at our school. So he competed with the other Haeundae elementary students. He came in second place during that competition. He will participate in the water rocket competition at Busan elementary school next month.
I think I love him very much. He will always be there for me. No one can stop us. My brother is the best! I think he likes me
column3:
too!
I think he wants to ""protect"" me.
I love you
column4: my brother! You are my hero!":::

column1: 58:::"Today I read a book. The title is ""The Twiddle Twins' Amusement Park Mystery."" The author of the book is Howard Gold Fish Smith and the illustrations are by Charles Jordan. The characters are Tabitha
column2: Timothy
column3:
and Daisy.
First
column4: </ins> Tabitha lost Blippo. Blippo is a doll that Tabitha likes. They looked for it everywhere but couldn't find <mod target = Blippo>it</mod>. Someone told her
column5:
""I saw a girl playing with Blippo."" Tabitha asked her friends to help her find the doll. Daisy had gone to the amusement park with Blippo. But she didn't know where she left Blippo. Finally they found Blippo at the amusement park.
If I was in a similar situation to Tabitha
column6:
I would call my friends right away.
I think Blippo was very scared. Tabitha and her friends were worried. When they found Blippo
column7: they were all happy. I was happy

column1:
59:::"My friend Dayoon went to Seoul. I was very sad.
When I heard she was going to move to Seoul
column2: I thought
column3: ""I'm going to be really lonely when she leaves our school."" Then I got a great idea! I would play my violin for her. My teacher said we would each give her a letter<del>
column4:
too! It was soon time for her to leave. We all read our letters to her. She almost cried. Then I played the violin. I knew something! She wanted to cry but she didn't cry! I wish she had enjoyed the song I played on my violin more.
The day she went to Seoul
column5: my heart felt like it sank into the deep
column6: deep ocean.":::

column1: 60:::"My plant had lots of water
column2: sunshine
column3: and air for two weeks. Now there are many sprouts. They are almost 5 cm tall. They are so cute that I took a picture to remember them. It seems like the dew on my plant sparkles brightly. I always water the sprouts every morning. The more they grow
column4: the happier I will be. I want to tell the sprouts
column5: ""You are the best plant!""":::

column1:
61:::"My idol is Aung San Suu Kyi. Her name is similar to mine.
She is Burmese. She is very smart. She studied politics
column2: philosophy<ins>
column3:
and economics at Oxford University. She worked for the U.N. in New York. She went to Burma again and tried to help her people. Burma is a dictatorship. But she wanted to make her country a democracy. She received the Nobel Peace Prize.
I wish I could be like her one day!":::

""When you plant your seeds

column3: ""<mod target = You>you</mod> have to know what your are doing. You have to do it very carefully
column4: too."" ""I will
column5:
I said.
""First
column6: mom said
column7: ""<mod target = You>you</mod> have to put some dirt in a pot. Then dig a hole. Put the seed<ins>s</ins> into the hole. Fourth
column8:
cover the seed with dirt. And then there's only one more thing left to do. Water the place where you buried the seeds."" ""That sounds fun! But mom there is one problem. There is no sunlight!"" I said. We opened the curtain.
Be careful! If you water the seeds every day
column9: <mod target = it>they</mod> will die. You should only water them three days a week. I <mod target = wish>hope</mod> that my seeds will grow very well!":::

column1: 64:::"I have a lot of dreams. For example<ins>
column2: </ins> I would like to be an artist
column3: a scientist

column5: a cyclist
column6: the president
column7: a doctor<ins>
column8:
and so on.
I want to be an artist because I like art
column9:
especially painting. I want to be a scientist because I would like to know more about nature and perform experiments. I want to be a swimmer because I want to swim and become a famous swimmer like Park Tae Hwan. I want to be a cyclist because I like to ride bicycles. I want to be the president because I want to rule our land. I want to be a doctor because I want to help people who are sick.
I can hardly wait for my dreams to come true.":::

column1:
65:::"My mommy is very pretty.
Her nickname is Blanche. She studied French language and literature at her university. So her nickname is French. Blanche means white in French. She is 42 years old.
I would like to describe my mom. She has long brown hair and white skin. She always paints her lips with red lipstick. At night
column2: she reads many books. Her dream is to be a children's author. I will help her <del>to </del>make her dream come true. She said she wants children to enjoy her books. She wants children to be happy. She would also like to write fiction
column3: realistic fiction
column4: nonfiction
column5:
and an essays. Her dream hasn't come true yet because she is taking care of my brother and me for now. She also has to help my father.
I wish her dream can come true as quickly as possible!":::

column1:
66:::"I saw our new car yesterday.
The name of the car is Veracruz. Its color is vanilla white. I saw that there are eight seats in the car. There are two seats in the front
column2: </mod> <del>There are </del>three seats in the middle
column3:
and three seats in the back row too. I noticed that the chairs in the middle row can move!
The vents for the air conditioner are everywhere. Some are on the ceiling. Some are on the side. They are also in the front
column4: middle
column5: and back of the car. I can control the air conditioner not only from the front
column6:
but also from the middle of the car. It is very convenient.
I felt very proud that we have a nice car. It is all thanks to my daddy of course.":::

column1:
67:::"I got a new book. It is called ""Treasures 2.1.""
I looked in the book.
The first thing I saw was a seal. It was so cute!
The next thing I saw was the title of a story called
column2:
""My name is Yoon."" The girl named Yoon seemed strange. Her eyes are small and pointy. Her mouth is making a sad face.
I think this book will be very interesting. I anticipate studying with this book in the future.
Then I said to myself
column3: ""I can do this!""":::

column1: 68:::"I went to my new school. I saw the new blackboard
column2: new chairs
column3: new desks<ins>
column4: </ins> and my new teacher. She is nice and pretty. She is also very smart. I like my teacher. In the middle of the class
column5: she let us all speak aloud. It was very strange when she said
column6: ""Climb up on your chair and speak loudly."" During playtime
column7:
she also played with us.
In my classroom
column8:
there are 24 students. All of the students in my class are my friends. Seoyoung is my best friend ever. She always plays with me. She goes to the same English institute as me. She is also my classmate there. Last Saturday I went to her house and played with her and her brother.
The first time I went to school it was a little bit dirty. Now it is clean. My new teacher and new friends are really great. Our school will be waiting for you!":::

column1: 69:::"I am very sad. When I was little
column2: I liked 3 things. They are <ins>my </ins>cleaning aunt
column3: a big towel
column4: and dolls. My cleaning aunt took care of me for 8 long years. Now my aunt has a backache. So I can't see her until she is well again. I have to wait until she gets better. I remember<del>ed</del> when my aunt was going back home
column5: I said ""Don't go aunt!"" I smiled when I thought about doing that. The second thing that I liked was a big towel. When I was a baby
column6: it stayed with me all the time. At bedtime
column7: I looked for it until I found it. Yesterday my big towel had to be thrown away. The dolls were my best friends ever. I played with them and talked to them. But I will have to leave them tomorrow. <ins>I </ins>wish this didn't have to happen. The air is not moist
column8:
and if I play with them my body will become too dry. So I can't have them right now.
But there is good news. During the summer I will get to have my dolls again
column9: but not my aunt. I will send my pictures to her cell phone. I hope she will be better soon. So I will be waiting until I can be reunited with them.":::

column1:
70:::"Tomorrow is the last day of school.
I am very sad. My teacher is leaving this school and I am also leaving. I am leaving my school because I moved to Haeundae. My new school is being built right now. I haven't been able to see it yet because it is still being built. I want to go to the new school
column2:
but I don't want to leave my friends behind. I have no choice. I have to leave my school. But I think that it won't be that bad.
The last words that I am going to say to my teacher and my friends are
column3: </mod> ""Good bye! I love you forever!""":::

column1:
71:::"I've recently read a book about Horrible Harry.
Harry likes spooky
column2: slimy
column3:
and terrible stuff.
That's why people call him Horrible Harry.
In this book Harry falls in love with Song Lee
column4:
a Korean girl.
One day
column5:
he gives her a letter that says:

Song Lee
column6:
Do you like me?
I like you very much. Please choose one of the following choices below.
a. Like a lot
b. Hate
c. Kind of
d. None of all above.

Song Lee said that she would choose ""a"" if he stops fighting with his enemy
column7:
Sidney.
Luckily
column8:
Harry decided to get along with his old enemy.
Now Sidney and Harry have become best friends.
By the way
column9:
this book was written by Suzy Kline and illustrated by Frank Remkie.
The author of this book graduated from the University of California State.
She was selected as Teach of the Year in 1989.
I think Harry is very happy now that Song Lee likes him and I wish that Suzy Kline will write more books for kids.":::

column1:
72:::"I've read a book about witches.
Do you know how to spot a witch?
Well
column2:
I've got 4 facts regarding them.
1. Witches always wear gloves because under their gloves they have no fingernails on their fingers.
2. Witches have 3 nostrils.
3. Look deep into the witches' eyes and you will see a small fire ball in the center of the eye.
4. Witches wear wigs because they are bald.
If you find a woman with all of these things
column3:
she is a witch.
In this story Jim becomes a mouse after drinking some potions. His body becomes smaller and his brain becomes twice as small as his normal one.
But he figures out how to destroy the grand high witch with his loving grandmother.
And do you know what else?
Never take a bath! Then
column4:
the witches cam smell you very easily.
After I read this book I think I learned a lot about witches.":::

column1:
73:::"I have recently read a book titled ""Jane Eyre.""
Jane is an orpan who lives with her hateful aunt.
Soon she goes to a boarding school where she stays until she gets a job as a governess.
She was sent to Thornfield Hall
column2: a mansion
column3: where she teaches Adele
column4:
a little girl.
Then she meets Edward Rochester who is the owner of Thornfield Hall.
Edward and Jane fall in love.
But Jane suddenly finds out that Edward is already married to someone else.
So Jane left and became a wanderer.
Then she heard the news that Mr. Rochester had become blind in an accident.
Jane was heartbroken and returned to him.
She felt pity and married him.
I like this book because of the romantic plot. And I'm sure you will like this book as well.":::

column1:
74:::"This is a story I came up with over the last two weeks and I want to introduce it to everyone who might be interested in it.

There was a girl named Juliet who aspired to play soccer.
Her mother told her that soccer is for boys at least a billion times.
But she never listened and kept her dream of playing soccer even as she was going to school.
Juliet was only in the second grade but she was also a genius. One day her mother got a letter from her homeroom teacher. This is what it said:

Dear Mr. and Mrs. Berry
column2:
Juliet may be young but she is truly a genius. We decided to put her in the fifth grade. Please respond to let me know if you agree with this move.

Sincerely
column3:
Miss Honey

Juliet was really surprised. But she didn't want to leave her friends. So her parents replied with a letter that said:

Dear Miss Honey
column4:
Juliet says she doesn't want to agree with your request to move her to the fifth grade. We are terribly sorry.

Sincerely
column5:
Mr. and Mrs. Berry

To be continued soon...":::

column1:
75:::"I want to talk about changes in perception.
The way we think is very critical in our lives. This is because it will significantly influence our life decisions.
What sort of TV programs do you enjoy watching?
My family and I take pleasure in watching the program
column2:
""A Master of Living.""
This program introduces people who have been working in their field
column3: doing something with unbelievable techniques<del>
column4:
for 20 or 30 years.
The skills they possess go well beyond our imagination. Some can make products much faster than a high-tech processing machine can. Others are capable of hitting a target while blindfolded
column5:
only relying on their keen senses.
On top of that
column6:
they can amazingly perform what we think is inconceivable with great ease.
Being fascinated
column7: my sister and I once tried to do what they did. However
column8:
there was nothing we were able to do.
They have reached the level of unbeatable legendary genius in their spheres
column9: through persistent efforts and creative ideas
column10:
which don't allow anybody to emulate them.

As I watched them on TV
column11: I realized that they take great pride in their work
column12:
which others may not put as much value on.
Nevertheless
column13: they consistently study and practice to do things much more effectively and quickly
column14:
without giving up no matter what.
I admire their ingenious imaginations
column15: granted by god
column16:
which enables them to carry out any challenge they are given.

Even though many of us share similar circumstances
column17: only a few are able to live in a way<del>
column18:
similar to those on ""A Master of Living"" are able to. The people on the show are different from most people because they enjoy what they do and think different from others. The majority of people just do their work without seriously thinking about what they do.

Then
column19: despite being equipped with an incredibly huge reserve of latent talent
column20:
why are some people inhibited from exploring all the possibilities?
I think one of the main factors is a stereotypical view which limits our potential to do something more challenging. Many people are skeptical of their abilities and say things like
column21: ""Since there hasn't been anyone who tried this kind of tough stuff
column22: of course
column23:
I can't do it either.""
Another factor that holds people back is a pessimistic view of life that causes them to lose self-esteem. People are always grumbling and saying things like
column24:
""Who cares if I try my best? That is not important to me at all. I will just do what I am asked to do and that's all.""

Please
column25: listen. This is what the Bible says
column26: ""What do you mean
column27: 'If I can?' Anything is possible if a person believes."" Let's alter our perceptions
column28: and accept every possibility. Then
column29: I believe we will gain tremendous momentum that can change ourselves and the world.":::

column1: 76:::"My name is Jun Chae Eun
column2:
and I am in the second grade.
I am absolutely honored to be here with you and tell you a story
column3:
""The Vivid Glasses in My Heart.""
So
column4:
why do you think people wear glasses?
Yes
column5:
you know the right answer.
We usually wear glasses when our eyes become worse and we want to see the world clearly. Simply put
column6:
we wear glasses to see things better.
However
column7:
sometimes glasses don't function as effectively as we expect.
Let me share an awful experience that happened when I was in kindergarten.
The kindergarten that I went to was going to put on a musical in English.
I had to play a role of a doctor
column8: </del> with black horn-rimmed glasses and a graduation cap
column9:
but the glasses that I wore were so thick that they made me look rather stupid.
When I stepped on stage
column10:
everyone in the audience started cracking up at the sight of me.
To make things even worse
column11:
I was unimaginably dizzy because of those bulky glasses.
However
column12:
that was just the beginning.
I almost lost all of my self-confidence from seeing so many eyes staring at me
column13: </ins> and<del>
column14: </del> to make it worse
column15:
I could hardly locate my position. I couldn't do anything but cry.
Though the musical had turned out to be a disaster for me
column16:
it taught me a good lesson. I learned that the way we see the world varies according to the type of glasses we wear.
There are some bad common sayings with regard to sight.
For example
column17: <mod target = '>""</mod>Look at something with a jaundiced eye<del>
column19: everything we see in the world turns blue; with red lenses
column20:
everything we see will be red.
Generally
column21: we want to believe what we see
column22:
and we don't believe in things that we can't see. I think all of our potential will be totally different according to how we view the world through the appropriate glasses.

I would like to introduce a couple of people whose lives have been changed through the proper spectacles in their hearts.

There was a girl named Lee Ji-Seun
column23:
who was badly burned in a tragic car accident.
Because of that
column24: she suffered permanent disfigurement. However
column25: she didn't give up hope. Instead
column26: she thanked god that at least she had survived. With a thankful heart
column27: she went to America and studied really hard<ins>.</ins> <mod target = and
column28: >And</mod> eventually
column29:
she was able to give vision to despairing people and was able to give them hope.

There is one more person who changed his unfortunate life into a fortunate one.
He is Dr. Gang Young-woo
column30: who was appointed the Assistant Secretary of State Council on Disability Policy. He was an orphan and lost his sight. Despite all the obstacles
column31:
he trusted that he had talent and never stopped studying.
Now
column32:
he works for disabled people from all over the world.
What kinds of glasses are you wearing now? And what sorts of glasses are you going to pick for yourselves?
The ones that help you see the world with plenty of hope or the ones that magnify your mere problems and ruins your life?
It is up to you to decide which of kind you will select.
With the most suitable glasses for you
column33:
making yourselves open to all the possibilities in the world can be very simple.
Now
column34: reach out your hand for your new identity and perspective in life!":::

column1: 78:::"I was very happy because it was a very special occasion<mod target =
column2:
>: my birthday!
I woke up extra early
column3:
around 6:50.
We bought an ice cream cake with chocolate syrup on top.
It was awesome.
When I got to the ice-cream store
column4:
there was a variety of beautiful cakes that caught my eyes. Actually it took so much time for me to make up my mind and choose only one cake.
However
column5:
I did eventually manage to choose the prettiest one.^^
I longed to go to a water park but my mom refused to take me since she was extremely busy. Instead
column6:
she bought me some books that I've wanted to read.
Mom! Please
column7: do me a favor and take me to the water park someday soon.":::

column1:
79:::"I feel really sorry for my daddy because I made him wait for me in the cold weather for a long time.
I go to a swimming class three times a week with two friends of mine from my class.
It has been already 1 month since I first started my first swimming lesson last month.
I usually take a shuttle bus that runs every four hours around my neighborhood.
However
column2:
one of my friends' mothers gave me a ride home after class.
Not knowing this
column3:
my father waited for me outside to get off the shuttle bus for almost 30 minutes shivering in the cold.
Had he known that I already went home in her car or had I let him know that my friend's mother would drive me home
column4:
he wouldn't have needed to suffer on such a freezing cold winter day.
Though I was terribbly sorry that he had to suffer
column5: <del>on the other hand
column6: </del>I could feel his love <mod target = toward>for</mod> me.<del>^^</del> Daddy
column7: thank you and I love you!":::

column1:
80:::"I have learned about football.
Football is such an exciting sport.
Back then
column2: </del><mod target = in>In</mod> 1492<ins>
column3: </ins> King James I of Scotland outlawed this game. Later
column4:
Queen Elizabeth I of England did the same thing too.
Why? Because during the Medieval Ages
column5: </ins> people were allowed to hurt each other by punching
column6: biting
column7:
and even hurting people with the ball they carried with their hands.
It was too violent. Therefore the both rulers decided to stop people from playing this sport.
However
column8:
no need to worry!
In 1815
column9:
England's famous college made rules for the sport.
Ta ta~ That was the beginning of modern football.":::

column1:
81:::"Do you believe in the idea that positive thinking will have a great effect on our lives?
People around me keep encouraging me to speak positively
column2: reminding me <del>of the fact </del>that
column3:
""Everything you say will come true regardless of whether you do it consciously or unconsciously.""
As for me
column4:
I used to partly agree with what they said and also be partly doubtful if it would ever work.

However
column5:
now I appreciate the people for giving me such great encouragement and pushing me to pursue my dream.

For many years
column6: I've had a dream of becoming the UN Secretary General one day. Hearing my ambitious goal
column7: there have been some people who have said skeptically<ins>
column8:
""It is such a huge dream that you probably won't be able to make it come true."" This disheartened me a lot.

However
column9:
now I believe that I am getting closer and closer to my dream by believing in myself. I think that positive thinking will change my whole self and help me to achieve my goals.


I constantly imagine myself being the UN Secretary General and committing myself to managing the problems that threaten world peace and harmony.

Some of you may probably say that this sounds like I am deluding myself and avoiding reality.
No
column10: I am not as talented as Song Yoo-Geun
column11:
the well-known a child prodigy who passed the university qualification exam at the age of only eight.


Nonetheless
column12:
I really believe in myself and think that I must have something awesome that no one else possesses.

Someday I will let those who scorned me to witness my success and prove to them that they were absolutely wrong.



Ladies and gentlemen
column13:
What I really want you to keep in your mind is that everything that you want to get and the person you would like to be definitely depends on how much you believe in yourselves.

Then
column14:
in the near future I'm sure you and I will alll find ourselves confessing that we used to be a nobodies but now we have become a somebodies.


Thank you for your close attention.":::

column1:
82:::"I just say ""Abracadabra.""
I'd like to tell you a story that I heard a few days
ago. It made me think about what kind of person I am.
It started with a little boy wearing a nice uniform walking into the backyard. He shouted proudly
column2: ""I'm the best hitter
column3:
then he tossed the ball in the air and swung his bat as hard as he could. He missed the ball.
""Strike 1!""
Not hesitating
column4: he tossed the ball once more and wielded the bat and- BANG! He missed it.. ""Strike 2!"" Then the boy paused for some minutes to carefully examine his bat and ball. He spat on his palms and rubbed them together as if he were a real professional baseball player. He straightened his cap and yelled triumphantly<ins>
column5:
: ""I'm the best hitter on Earth."".
He tossed his ball and swung the bat. He missed it again. ""Strike three!"" he yelled.
He took a deep breath and he exclaimed with great satisfaction on his face
column6:
""I'm the best pitcher after all!""
After listening to this story
column7: what comes to your mind<del> </del>? As for me
column8: I burst out laughing and I asked myself
column9: ""Can I think in the same way this boy does?"" To be honest
column10: I'd be discouraged by this failure. However
column11: the boy in this story didn't take it too pessimistically. Instead he chose to have a positive attitude. I admire what he said and the way he acted. He gave me a good lesson and a reminder that when one door closes<ins>
column12:
another door bangs wide open for us as long as we have a positive mindset.
Yes
column13: I can't deny that everybody sometimes faces unpleasant and unexpected situations
column14: such as getting a lower grade at school or arguing with friends. These things get us down a lot. Then
column15: we immediately become miserable and begin to complain
column16:
""Why can't I be as lucky or as popular as the other kids?""
You know what? This negative attitude won't make anything better.
Now
column17: I have a question for everyone
column18:
""How do you see the things happening to you- positively or negatively?""
Usually
column19: we focus on the negative side
column20: stopping ourselves from trying something <del>again </del>that is challenging<ins> again</ins>. Listen! The only difference between a failure and a success is how you react when you face the situation. Positive thinking is contagious and it leads to the ""I can do it attitude"" especially
column21:
when we are encouraging each other.
Just remember that everything you want to get and the person you would like to be depends on your attitude. If you believe this
column22: just say what I say
column23: ""Abracadabra
column24: I will get what I think about. I can be whoever I want to be.""":::

column1:
83:::"There was a devastating tsunami that brought chaos to the northern part of Japan. Almost 2000 people were left dead or are still missing.
Therefore
column2: the Japanese government is trying to make preparations to <del>prepare
column3: </del>face<del>
column4:
and counter such unexpected natural disasters.
A small firm is also contributing its ideas. A company called ""Cosmo Power"" invented a way of avoiding tsunamis. This company made a capsule that looks like a tennis ball with a pole in the middle of it and it can hold four adults in it at a time.
I hope this kind of fascinating invention will save many people who are in a desperate situation. I am really thankful that I live in Korea which is far safer than Japan. He~he~":::

column1: 84:::"I was on <mod target = the>my</mod> way to my piano academy but before i went out
column2:
I looked out the windows. It was a clear day.
However
column3:
I saw a big blob of paint falling to the old concrete street outside.
I realized that they were painting our apartment. Then
column4: a man swooped down and said to me
column5: ""Hey there kid! Don't come too close! It's dangerous!"" I didn't even need to know why because
column6:
he was covered in paint! I ran away from him. -----------------------
After my piano class finished
column7: I was coming home<del>
column8:
when a blob of paint fell onto my hair!
I screamed and ran towards my apartment. My mommy washed it right away
column9:
but there is still a blob. Do you know what I hate the most in the whole wide world?
The answer is PAINT!!!":::

column1:
85:::"I needed to get my picture taken at school.
This past Monday
column2: my homeroom teacher told Ju Eun
column3: Joung Su
column4:
and me to get ready to get our pictures taken since we are the class presidents.
I felt very jumpy that day.
I didn't know what to wear for my picture.
Soon
column5:
my mom made a decision for me and gave me a skirt and a sweater to wear. She also tied my long hair into complicated braids.
The principle stood right behind me grinning sheepishly for the picture.
The photographer was a funny guy. He made us laugh a lot.
One
column6: two
column7:
three! Snap!
A picture floated down onto the soft grass in our school field where we gathered to take the picture.
I am glad my picture was taken. So there! Haha!":::

column1:
86:::"Interviewing Mr. Einstein
Hello. I am Sally and I'd like to interview you.
Mr. Einstein
column2:
What is your religion?
""I was Jewish. I loved it! I wanted to be loyal to God and to be His servant. I worshiped with my all heart and now I am in heaven.""
Okay. Why did you abandon your family and go to the university in Berlin
column3:
Germany?
""With the exception of Mileva and Hans
column4: my true calling in life is to think. I knew it was wrong to leave my family
column5:
but I wanted to study and succeed.""
Oh I see. What is the secret of relativity?
He answered while smiling
column6: ""When you are sitting with your boyfriend by your side
column7: an hour feels like one minute. However when you are studying boring stuff<ins>
column8:
one minute often feels like one hour.""
Hmm very interesting! Weren't you scared of the Nazi soldiers?
""No
column9: no. How scared can you be when the mightiest soul is right beside you and will protect you? With God by my side
column10:
I don't have any fears.""
Um.. Okay! Thank you for answering my questions.^^
You are not only smart but also a faithful guy.
We still remember you all the time.":::

column1:
87:::"Aesop's Fables.

I read a book written by Aesop
column2:
the great story teller.
Actually
column3:
nobody knows who really wrote the book.
Aesop lived in Greece. I love his stories. Some of his stories were in the book I just read. Each story has a moral lesson.
I'm going to tell you some of the lessons I learned.
1. From ""The Tortoise and the Hare""
column4:
"" I learned that slow and steady can still win the race.
2. I learned that if you try hard enough
column5:
you will get what you want after reading ""The Thirsty Crow.""
3. I learned that one good deed deserves another good deed from the story ""The Ant and the Dove.""
4. In the story ""The Fox and the Stroke
column6: </ins>"" you learn that when you play mean tricks on people
column7: they will get you back.":::

column1: 88:::"Friday
column2: September 2
column3:
2011
My Journal
Dear Journal
column4:
I am writing this with a little pencil.
I usually have a lot of fun on the weekend.
However
column5:
today my family just read some books which were kind of boring because we had already read those books a bazillion times before.
I want to do an activity like cooking an unusual food or drawing a picture. I hope that I can do this and have a good time.
P.S. I hope I can do all of these things after I get all my work done.":::

column1: 89:::"Monday
column2: August 15
column3:
2011
Boohoo.
My lovely
column4: cute
column5:
little babies have disappeared. I only had them for 9 days.
My heart is broken. I had two hamsters.
Since they are animals I couldn't take them to churches
column6: schools<ins>
column7:
or theaters.
One Sunday morning
column8:
when I returned home from church I rushed toward my hamsters' cage wanting to see my babies.
I plopped myself down on the sofa
column9:
searching for them.
But to my surprise
column10:
one of my babies was gone.
I was shocked and worried a lot. Most of all I was scared.
I talked to myself
column11: asking
column12:
""What if she climbed into the toilet and drowned or what if she fell out of the apartment while wandering around?""
I was really anxious but I had no idea what to do.
I just crawled around on all fours looking into all the cracks in my house hoping to spot it.
I burst out crying. It was no use. I ran into my room throwing myself on the bed and thought miserably
column13:
""Hammy is gone! Yes ... absolutely gone!""
I regretted how badly I had treated my Hammy.
I thought that if I were trapped in a cage with enormous eyeballs staring at me all the time
column14:
I would be really stressed out indeed.
But that's what I would do to my babies everyday.
I could imagine Hammy running around the house feeling free and shouting something like
column15:
this ""My hopes and desires have come true. Yahoo!""
I decided to tell my parents everything.
Actually I was worried that my daddy would scold me for my carelessness.
However
column16: unexpectedly he just comforted me by saying
column17:
""It will show up soon.""
He gave me a big bear hug.
I smiled feeling much better.
I love my daddy.
Meanwhile my mother called me
column18:
""Catherine! Come and take a look at this!""
There was my little sweet Hammy on my mommy's hand.
I was so happy that I cried again.
After this commotion I went to bed feeling relieved.
Hammy you little rascal! Never run away again!
You know what? There is nothing better than your cozy cage even though it is a little smelly.":::

column1:
90:::"Today I participated in an arithmetic competition.
At first I was really nervous. I participated in the contest. It was very fun.
But I was feeling sorry for myself because while I was solving one of the
problems
column2:
one of the proctors said that I could use the abacus.
So I used it. But I should not have used the abacus.
Usually I practice using mental math.
That's why I was feeling really sorry for myself.
But I had learned from a good teacher so I won a silver trophy!
It is very shiny and pretty.
I am glad but I will practice a lot and win a gold trophy next!
If I hadn't used the abacus I think I could have won the gold trophy..
Next year I will practice a lot more.
I called my homeroom teacher to tell her that I won a silver trophy.
So she said to bring it with me next Monday.
I think that my class is going to congratulate me.
That's part of our school's tradition.
I think I'll like that very much.
Good-bye! See you next time Little Fox readers!":::

column1:
91:::"Finally I got a cellphone! I am thrilled!
Today I was on the school bus with my friend. I called my mother
with my friend's cellphone. Then I got some shocking news!
My mother said she was going to buy me a cellphone.
So I raced to the fountain where we were going to meet.
I rushed there so quickly that I felt like I was flying because of the air rushing past me.
I met my mother and went in the store where we can buy cellphones.
I looked at all the amazing cellphones
column2: </del> and thought
column3:
""Wow!""
I thought my eyes were going to pop out!
I looked at the green one but I didn't like it. So we went to another store.
There was a sparkling pink phone that I really wanted! The salesperson came to
us and asked us what we were looking for.
So I asked if I could see the pink phone.Then she took out the pink phone
and gave it to me.
It sparkled like crystals and was as shiny as a diamond.
I asked my mother if I could buy the phone.
She said yes! Then the salesperson said that I could go and choose one of the rings.
I chose one in the shape of a horn and an Angry Bird one which is a game character I like.
And I am now happy. Good bye~!":::

column2:
we went to Lotte World.
I am going with my sister. We went on Tuesday. In the morning we ate our
breakfast real quickly and went out to play. But the funniest part was when we
ate ice-cream secretly. It was really tasty because if you eat anything
secretly it is very tasty. Yum. Then we went to Lotte World.":::

column1:
93:::"Yes! My family is going to Jeju island and we are taking a ship to get there.
The ship's name is ""Kodailia"".
We arrived at the harbor at 7:00 pm. When we got on board I was so
excited. It was my first time getting on a big ship.
When I got to our room it was fantastic. There were two two bunk beds which
I loved.
We all went to eat dinner in the cafeteria. I ate ramyeon Yukgaejang.
I like it because it's not spicy. After dinner I ate ice-cream. Then we
sat near the window and watched the sea. The sea was beautiful but it was a
little dark.
When we were done looking we went to the game room but it wasn't fun.
So I went on the deck. It was raining but cool.
My dad took some pictures then we went inside.
I watched a movie (""Home Alone""). It was really noisy so we went into our room.
I was sleepy and fell asleep.
The next day we got off very quickly. Then I remembered I left my hairpin on the bed.
It was a brand new hairpin! I am sad.":::

94:::"Today I made a new friend named Yeo-lm. I am so thankful for her.
Because my friends on my block don't want to play with me. But now
Yeo-lm is my second best friend.
I played at her house and she introduced me to her friends named Jee-min
column2: Su-jin
column3:
and See-en. Now the four of us are best friends.
And next Monday I am going to introduce Yeo-Im and the other girls to Yun-oo
column4: Yun-soo
column5:
and Na-young.
We are going to meet at 3 o'clock.
When we meet
column6:
all eight of us are going to go to my hiding place and eat ice cream
and donuts. And I will also make ttobboki and soondae which is a type of
Korean sausage as a surprise for my friends. Mmmmmmmmmm yummy! I hope all eight of us will be best friends.
Yeo-lm said that if the eight of us become best friends she will buy necklaces for
all of us.
My brother thinks that best friends should just be two friends. But I don't care what he
says. I like all seven of my friends! Bye-bye.":::

column1:
95:::"Today is a bad day because I tripped on a piece of string this morning.
My knees hurt very much. Then I went to eat breakfast which was Jjangajji.
When I looked at the clock it was 9:05 am! I rushed out of the door.
When I got to school my teacher was a little mad at me. So I said I am
sorry and rushed to my seat.
It was math time. We had a test.
I got 8 problems wrong. Then it was time for art class. I drew shoes. When my picture was finished
it looked like a trash dump
column2:
yuck! Then it was lunch time. I got in the line for lunch
but Kyungmin pushed me and I fell over. Then he said he was ahead of me in line.
So I had to eat last.
When lunch ended
column3:
it was time for physical education. We had a soccer game.
Our team color was red. We won three to one. Then it was time to go home.
I ate Ttokbokki with Yunsoo but I spilled it on my clothes! What a mess.
Then I went home. On the way home
column4:
I met a strange person. He chased me.
So I attacked him with my backpack. I ran home. It was a very
column5: </ins> very<ins>
column6: </ins> very bad day...":::

column1: 96:::"Yes! Tomorrow my family is going to Noul campground. It'll be very exciting! I can't wait to go there. Three of my friends are going with me. Their names are Yun-Soo
column2: Yun-Woo
column3: and Na-Young. As you know
column4:
Yun-Soo is my first best friend. Na-Young and Yun-Woo are my second best friends.

The best part is that there is a playground
column5: but the really best part is the dare! It's a game in which one person is picked by others and must do dangerous things. It's very fun
column6:
I think.

And when night comes
column7: we're going to watch a movie. I think the movie will be <mod target = '>""</mod>Charlie and the Chocolate Factory<del>'</del>.<ins>""</ins> It's so fun. I saw it! I want to go right now. It's going to be funny. And when we go
column8: we will play hopscotch
column9: rolling balls
column10:
and chess. And we'll eat cupcakes.

And tomorrow I am going to make peanut butter sandwiches with strawberry jam and Jajang noodles. But we don't have marshmallows
column11: so after a while my family is going to buy some marshmallows. Thinking of marshmallows is making my mouth water. Oh! It's dinnertime! Bye-bye.":::

column1: 97:::"Hello! I am very angry and sad today. That's because I had a fight with my best friend
column2: Yun-Soo. The fight began at lunch time. Yun-Soo pushed me
column3: so I pushed her back. And then she said some mean words. Usually when school ends
column4: we buy some Ttokbokki and eat it. But today when school ended
column5: I went right back home. And now I am really sorry. So I must apologize to Yun-Soo tomorrow.":::

column1:
98:::"Today my dad bought an iPad 2. I was really surprised when I saw it.
I asked my mom if I could watch movies and eat popcorn. She said yes!
So I ate popcorn and watched movies. I saw ""Rapunzel"" and ""Home Alone.""
I watched ""Home Alone1."" The movie was really exciting.
There are robbers who disguise themselves as police officers and find a family going away on vacation.
When the family leaves
column2:
the robbers make plans to rob their house at night.
But they actually don't rob the house. Are you curious about what happens? Find out by watching the movie yourself.
I like ""Home Alone"" better than ""Rapunzel."" But Rapunzel is more amusing and funny.
What do you think?":::

column1:
99:::"Yesterday I went to watch Kung Fu Panda. It was so fun.
The character Kung Fu Panda is very comical and awesome.
I like it when the panda is fighting.
But I don't like the peacock. because his feathers give me the creeps.
The tiger is really good at fighting. Also there were other sad
column2: hilarious<ins>
column3:
and
creepy moments.
When Kung Fu Panda fights
column4:
people gather around to watch who wins.
There was the peacock
column5: who was a bad guy
column6: </del> with the dizzy feathers<ins> who was the bad guy</ins><mod target = .>
column7:
and the wolf was also an evil guy.
But the panda fights them all and wins the battle.
I hope there will be a Kung Fu Panda 3.":::

column1:
100:::"Yes! We are going camping on Odemountain. That means I am going camping with
my mom and dad. I am so excited!
Actually I didn't like camping before because I missed my family right before going to
sleep.
I will barbecue corn on the cob and marshmallows on a stick.
It's going to be so delicious.
My mother said we are going with my best friend Yunsoo! Wow.
It's really going to be an awesome weekend.
At night we are going to make a campfire. It's going to be so fun.
But we have to crawl under our sleeping bags during the night.
When we go to Odemountain we will have to have warm T-shirts in our backpack.
Just thinking about it makes me cold. Brrrrrrrrr.
I am planning to make BBopgi which is sugar and baking soda mixed
column2: heated
column3:
and then dried.
It's an old candy my mom and dad enjoyed eating when they were children.
I am determined to make it!":::

column1:
101:::"Do you know Franny K. Stein?
She is a book character. But do you know the author of the book she is from?
His name is Jim Benton. My favorite book is the fifth one in the Franny K. Stein series. In the
fifth book my favorite chapter is called ""Get Your Head in the Game.""
In the chapter
column2: </ins> Franny goes to the robot and says
column3:
""Hey I know a robot that can kick its legs as high as your head!""
When the robot heard that
column4:
he tried to kick his own head and smashed its body into a
thousand pieces.
I like to draw Franny
column5: Igor<ins>
column6:
and Franny's experiments. Franny's hairstyle
is the same as mine. My favorite invention of hers is the Fran-bot. But I wonder
why Franny has only two outfits
column7:
her pajamas and the white lab clothes?
I want Franny to be my pen-pal. But I know that I can't do that. Whoo~

column1: 102:::"Today I lost a tooth. Before I go to sleep tonight
column2:
I will put the tooth under
my pillow so that the tooth fairy can come and switch my tooth with presents.
But the problem is that I want to see her.
I want to know how old she is
column3: where she lives
column4:
what her phone number
is
column5: where the tooth palaces really are
column6:
and if my tooth will be in the cleanest and shiniest
tooth hall.
These are some of the questions that I want to ask her.
Actually
column7:
I wonder if the tooth fairy is a girl or a boy.
I think she is a girl. What do you think?
But most of all
column8:
I want to go to the tooth palaces. So I am reading all about tooth fairies.
I am planning to make a tooth fairy doll.
I once stayed up very late but I fell asleep
column9: </ins> so I didn't get to see the tooth fairy!":::

column1:
103:::"Hi Little Fox readers!
Today I am going to talk about girls putting on makeup.
Elementary and middle school girls are starting to put on makeup!
They go to school with makeup on their faces.
But makeup is very bad for your skin.
Well.... maybe it is pretty on your face but it is not good for your skin. But a growing
number of girls are putting on makeup.
I want to put makeup on to look pretty.
But I am not going to put on makeup. Then again maybe I will try makeup.
I wish I had makeup too.":::

105:::"My birthday was on April 25th. I was so excited.
On Saturday we made a birthday cake. It was fantastic
column2: fabulous
column3: excellent
column4:
and
good. I loved it.
On Monday (Monday was my actual birthday) I had a birthday party
column5:
>twice; once with my class and again at home. The cake was very splendid.
For my birthday presents
column6: I got jeans
column7: a jacket
column8: short-sleeve shirts
column9: notebooks
column10: pencils
column11:
and a dictionary.
I thanked them all. In return I gave them giraffe-shaped banks. Then a boy squirmed and
he ran out of my class.
Then it was art time. The art teacher said I drew the prettiest picture.
We hung up our drawings in the art hall.
Then we had to read five books and I got a sticker for being the quietest. Then we played
hopscotch
column12: kiwitrap
column13:
and shoeescape.
After a while when we played chess I won!":::

column1: 106:::"Last Monday
column2:
I packed my bags beacause I had to go camping. But I hate camping.
It is the most disagreeable thing in the whole Earth and galaxy to me.
I checked again and again all night for anything that I might have missed.
We are going to have a campfire and talent shows
column3:
but my heart drops when I think
of camping.
I don't want to go. I also packed a flashlight
column4: <ins>a </ins>tent
column5:
and a notebook.
I have to challenge myself. I am determined to succeed.
But I don't want to go.":::

column1:
107:::"Today I am going to write about a story that I made up.
One day Jenna had a loose tooth. But when she got to the dentist
column2:
Dr. May told Jenna that her loose tooth was a fake tooth! Jenna was so sad.
But the next day her fake tooth fell out. She went to see Dr.May again.
But when she arrived at the office
column3:
the door was closed.
But she heard voices and music so she slowly crept toward the door and opened it.
Then her jaw dropped open. She saw Dr. May sitting on a chair with
some monsters standing next to her.
But when the monsters saw her coming they leaped into a U.F.O. and got away.
Then Dr. May told Jenna about how the monsters got there and why her fake tooth fell out.
She said
column4: ""That is a loose tooth.""":::

column1:
108:::"I am going to write about laughing.
There are many kinds of laughter
column2: for example cackling
column3: giggling<ins>
column4:
and guffawing.
The laughing contest was held in the U.S. to encourage people to laugh. It was America's first Laughing Competition.
The contest was organized by Albert Nerenberg.
He wanted to show people the power of laughter. ""Laughter is universal and contagious.
It makes people all over the world happy
column5:
said Mr.Nerenberg.
If we laugh often
column6:
our minds will be bright.
The more you laugh
column7:
the brighter your mind will become.
But there are bad types of laughter too
column8: </ins> like mocking
column9: gibing
column10: sneering
column11:
and many more. But good laughter
is very good for your health.
Do you laugh all the time?":::

column1:
109:::"Today I went out to play during lunch time.
When I went out to play
column2:
the sixth-grade girls were jumping rope
1000 times!
When they were finished I asked one of the seniors if I could also jump rope.
She said yes. So I jumped 20 times. When I was done I went to one senior
and tied her waist with the jump rope. Then I said
column3: </ins> ""Buy a donkey<ins>
column4:
"" and
everyone laughed. Just then my donkey untied the knot and she was free!
In our class we make up games
column5: and one of them is ""My donkey<ins>
column6:
"" which is what we
played after jumping rope. I leaped across the floor and I zoomed after her
column7:
but unfortunately
she was faster than me and I slipped and fell to the floor. Thump!
Then Miss Gwon told me it was time to go back to class.
We went to class and ate our snacks. After a while we were going to the bathroom
but someone called my name. It was mom! Then I went to the bathroom really quickly.
Then we jogged home together.":::

column1:
110:::"Today I went to a friend's house. Her nickname is Mugigae which means ""rainbow"" in English.
I arrived at her house around 4 o'clock.
Then we played ""Candy Land"" and ""I Got You Thief."" Then her grandmother asked if we
would like to make pizza so we said yes and then we made it.
We tasted it
column2:
and it was the best pizza I have ever made!
Then we played ""One Card."" But it was a little boring so we put on make-up and sang
along to Ru Fang. It was fun. But soon we were tired and then we rested and we played
""Roll."" It is a game where each person lies on the opposite side and then they roll toward each other with the blanket.
It's so very very fun. Then we played ""The Bouncing Peanut Butter
column3:
which is a competitive
game. I won! Then mother knocked on the door. So I had to go. It was a fun
column4: exciting
column5:
and good
day. Oh! Mother is calling me for dinner so I have to go~bye!":::

column1:
111:::"Today I went to the war memorial of Korea. I saw the motorcycles used
by the North Korean army during the Korean War.
I got to see the motorcycles with the shiny handles
column2:
the tank
with the cool seats
column3: and the F-15K
column4:
the Korean Air Force's lastest fighter
plane with maximum speed.
Then I went to the war experience room. It was very cool with the lasers
and the trees. I didn't want to go to the next room
column5:
the Laser Shooting Range but what
can I do? So I left the room.
Then I arrived at the Laser Shooting Range. I shot lasers with my family and it was very fun.
Then it was time to go home.
I suggested that we go to the outdoor exhibition area and the K-1 tank experience area.
Mom and dad said that was okay
column6: </ins> so we went. It was so fun that I didn't know it was already 6 o'clock<ins>
column7: </ins> so we went home. It was a fun day.":::

column1: 112:::"Today<ins>
column2:
I went to the stationary store.
This is because my mother gave me 5
column3:
000 won.
I bought one pack of crayons
column4:
two
balls of yarn
column5: one pen
column6:
and one pencil.
Then
column7:
I went to my house.
I told my mother what I bought.
Then
column8:
I carefully opened the pack of crayons and the pencil.
With the pencil I drew a fire truck
column9: then<ins>
column10: </ins> with the red crayon<ins>
column11:
I
colored the fire truck red.
Then
column12:
I looked at it.
I was very proud of my big fire truck.
Then
column13: </ins> with the pencil<ins>
column14:
I drew a big tree.
I pulled out a brown crayon.
I colored the branches.
Then
column15:
I pulled out a green crayon.
Instantly
column16: </ins> I wondered <del>about </del>if a big tree grew in the house<ins>
column17:
would I could climb the tree and eat apples?
Then
column18:
I imagined the big red fire truck was passing by my house.
I calculated how much was in my purse. 1
column19:
200 won was left in it.
Then
column20:
my mother told me that it was dinner time.
So
column21: </ins> I had to go. <mod target = bye>Bye</mod> bye~":::

column1: 138:::"My classmates are busy these days because we're going to have a speech contest soon. The speech contest is an important festival in our English zone. Each student chooses their own subject<ins>s</ins> and writes their own speeches. Then

column12:
""Your score was 10 and 9!""

column1: 145:::"My family went to Chung-do last weekend. We went there with my father's friends. We slept at a condominium. The first night at the condominium was the worst night I ever had. When I went upstairs to sleep

column1:
147:::"Do you know who came up with Mother's Day? A girl named Ann Jarvis came up with it.
Her mother took care of the wounded guards during the battle. When her mother died
column2: Ann Jarvis hoped people would remember her mother's good <mod target = act>deeds</mod>. So<del>
column3:
she gave white carnations to them and told them to remember her mother's good deeds. That became Mother's Day. And today was that Mother's Day.
I was so confused because I didn't have any ideas for presents. So
column4: </del> I thought <ins>about it </ins>for a while. Then<del>
column5: </del> I had <mod target = a>the</mod> perfect idea. I decided to make a carnation for my mother. First
column6: I picked up the red paper. Then I cut it into a beautiful flower shape. And then
column7:
I glued the carnation on a card. It perfectly fit the card. I thought about another thing I had to do. It was writing a card! I was in a hurry. I quickly wrote in the card. This is what I wrote:


Dear mom
column8: I'm feeling very thankful to you because you took care of me when I was sick
column9: and played with me when I was bored. So
column10:
I made a carnation for you. I hope you like it.
-LOVE SI YEON-
It was a very short card. But I hoped my mom would like it. I took it from my desk and tip- toed to the living room. My mom was there
column11:
busy looking for the news. And my dad was there too. He was snoring loudly.
I quietly put the card on the table and ran to my room. I waited for the sound of my mom's laughing. And there was a loud laughing sound! I hurried to the living room. I hid next to the sofa. But my mom saw me and said
column12: ""Come here
column13: Si Yeon
column14: my little baby honey<del>~""</del>.<ins>""</ins> So I came out. She said
column15: ""This carnation is very beautiful. I can't believe you made this all by yourself!<ins>""</ins> She hugged me very tight and said
column16:
""I will keep it for a long time.""
I was very happy to see my mom's happy face.":::

column1: 159:::"My family went to Vietnam and Cambodia for six days. First we got up at 3:00 am and rode a bus for 3 hours. We arrived at Incheon airport. At 10:00 we took a plane to Vietnam. Stewardesses wore ao dai
column2:

column3: Ho Chi Minh Square
column4: a lake<ins>
column5: </ins> and so on. There is one thing we <mod target = have>had</mod> to be careful<ins> about</ins><mod target = .>;</mod> <mod target = It's>its</mod> water. Because Vietnam's water has limestone

column8: </ins> Ha Long Bay in Vietnam and Angkor Wat in Cambodia were wonderful cultural heritage sites.":::

column1: 160:::"Chuseok is one of the most famous holidays in Korea. Chuseok <del>on the lunar calendar </del>is August 15 <ins>on the lunar calendar

and called ""Hangawi""."" It's like Thanksgiving Day in the U.S.A. and ""Joongchujeol"" in China.

I went to my grandparents' house in Busan on Chuseok. It took about 4 hours from Daejeon to Busan. There was a really heavy traffic jam so my family got annoyed. As soon as we arrived at my grandparents' house
column3: my grandmother
column4: my elder aunt<ins>
