column1:
417:::"Today my sister was really excited about her show. There were many performances because there are six kindergarten classes at my sister's school. So there were many performances to watch.

My sister's class did a fashion show. There was a lucky prize. We wrote our names on a sheet of a paper and put it in the box. I was very nervous
column2: there were many people trying to win the lucky prize. Finally they called my name
column3:
I was very happy! I won the lucky prize!

Then the show continued and it was time for my sister's class's performance. They sang ""Deck the Halls"" and sang some other songs. At the end of the show
column4: everybody who performed received a flower. My sister was happy. I was happy to watch the show too!":::

column1: 418:::"Today the fourth grade went to the aquarium in Shanghai. First we went to see the beluga whale show. The beluga whale was white and kind of small. The whale could jump out of the water and wave his tail just like we wave our hands! We rode on the glass<ins> </ins>boat and saw the shark<ins>
column2: </ins> <mod target = and>the</mod> stingray and <ins>the </ins>hawksbill sea turtle! I saw <mod target = nemo>Nemo</mod> and lots of other fishes. I liked going on the trip because it was really fun!":::

column1: 419:::"Today's our class assembly. I'm very nervous
column2: because I'm a narrator. Our assembly is about habitats. A habitat is an animal's <mod target = house>home</mod>. For example
column3: a tiger's <mod target = house>home</mod> is in the forest
column4: so a tiger's habitat is a forest! There are many animals that have gone extinct. There is the <mod target = Quagga>quagga</mod> which was last seen in 1870s
column5: the <mod target = Dodo>dodo</mod> <ins>which was </ins>last seen in 1681
column6: <del>and </del>the golden toad <ins>which was </ins>last seen in 1989
column7: and many more. Endangered animals are <mod target = Giant>giant</mod> pandas
column8: black rhinos
column9: polar bears
column10: and so on. And in Brazil we keep destroying the rainforest<ins>s</ins> too! So it was a very sad assembly.":::

column1: 420:::"Today we are having a match against Eton house<ins>
column2:
which is another school!
It took 40 minutes to get there. First we decided what positions everyone would be
column3: and I was the striker. The match started
column4: I scored the first goal! I was so happy. Then my friend Christopher missed the penalty shot! Later on the score was 2-0. Then Eton house scored a goal. Our team made a wall but the ball went past the wall and went into the net! The first half was over. When the match ended
column5: we won with a score of 7-1 and I scored so I was very
column6: very happy. And I like playing soccer too!<del>!

column1: 421:::"Yesterday was October 31
column2: which is Halloween! And my friends and I went trick or treating! I saw scary costumes<del>
column3: </del> <ins>like </ins>skeletons
column4: witches
column5:
and someone with a pumpkin on his head!!
First everyone went to Hannah's house. We got lots of candy!
Then we went to Woo Young's house. We got lollipops and biscuits.
Next was Tae Ui's house. It was really scary
column6: the front door was open
column7: pumpkins were everywhere
column8:
and a black sheet covered 3/4 of the doorway. And we also heard scary music. Then we saw a big skeleton in the house! Our final house was Jun Young's house. They made it look like there was blood painted on the wall. And there were pumpkins too!
I like trick or treating. But next time I hope I can go to more houses for trick or treating.":::

column1:
422:::"Today was the Diwali festival day at school.
We have just finished a unit on Rome in our humanities class.
In our humanities class
column2: we have just started to learn about Hinduism
column3:
which is one of the main religions in India.
Diwali is the name of a Hindu festival.
First we made Rangoli
column4:
which is a type of Hindu art.
This is how we made it. First
column5: we painted glue onto wood. Then we chose which colored sands we wanted to use
column6:
and then we spread the colored sands over the glue.
During our next lesson
column7:
we made a booklet about the story of Rama and Sita.
The teacher told us the stories about Rama and Sita for the Diwali festival.
I will give you a summary of the story.
Rama's mom wanted her other son to be the next king. So she asked the king to send Rama and his wife
column8: </del> Sita<del>
column9:
and the other son to go live in the forest for 14 years.
The king agreed. So they were sent to the forest. In the forest
column10: there was a bad monster named Ravana. He took Sita away and tried to marry her. Ravana was a very ugly monster that had 10 heads! But Rama saved <del>his wife
column11: </del>Sita<del>
column12: </del> from Ravana. After 14 years had passed
column13: Rama came back to the palace. Everybody welcomed back Rama and cheered when he became the next king.":::

column1: 423:::"Today is my friend Seong Jun's birthday! I was invited to her party and I ate lots of food until I was really full. I ate pizza
column2: <mod target = chickin>chicken</mod>
column3: kimbob
column4: and ultima (a type of juice). We played <del>with </del>the game ""Cannon and Invading."" It was really fun and we chased each other around. Then we played another game where we had to pop the other people's balloons. After the games we sang ""Happy Birthday"" to Seong Jun. She had a chocolate cake. I liked the chocolate cake too! Then we kept playing ""Cannon and Invading."" Then we had to go home. It was a fun day. I hope I can have a birthday party on my birthday.":::

column1:
424:::"Today is the second day at Shan Shan Island. We played some games and went hiking.
There were some steep areas on our hike. So we had to hold on for support to get to the top. Then we went fishing. My friend Henry caught many snails and found a lot of shells. And my friend Elias caught many
column2: many fish<del>es</del>. I caught four fish.":::

column1: 425:::"Today the fourth grade went on a trip to San Shan Island in Lake Taihu for two nights and three days. It took us one hour and fourty minutes to get there
column2: and we took a speed boat. The speed boat was really fun because it was really fast. When we arrived at the hotel
column3:
we ate lunch. Then we visited a home that belonged to a rich man. The house was about 200 years old.
After visiting the house we went digging for crystals. We dug really deep and I found two crystals. We also rode buggies
column4:
and it was fun.
Then it was dark. We made a campfire
column5:
and cooked marshmallows and bread.
We sang songs and told ghost stories. And then we played card games.
It was a fun day.":::

column1:
426:::"Today is Invader's Day at school.
The senior students went to China on a trip so we were able to use the whole playground during our break time.
All of the students had to wear an invader's costume.
Mom bought me an armor
column2: shield<ins>
column3: </ins> and helmet set
column4:
and she also made a simple ancient Roman soldier's costume.
There were no classes for the whole day. We only made wooden swords
column5: <ins>did </ins>crossword puzzles
column6:
l and other activities.
I thought my costume was quite nice.
One of my friend's helmets looked like Pororo's helmet from the cartoon.
After arriving at home
column7:
mom bought some clothes for my trip that is coming up this Wednesday.
I took out a suitcase and packed some clothes in it to pack for my trip.
This is my first time to going on a school trip that will be for 2 nights and 3 days. We are going to Sansan Island and Lake Taihu.
Just the thought of the trip makes my heart flutter.":::

column1:
427:::"Today my school held a cross country competition.
The junior school (for years 3-6) held the competition in the morning and the senior school held it in the afternoon.
Since the beginning of this term
column2:
we have been and training for cross country during our P.E. class. It's very hard.
We have to run around 1.6 km around the school. And the students in years five and six have to run almost double the distance.
Some of the courses are around the lake and some courses have you run on the track.
In P.E. class
column3:
sometimes I would come in 3rd or 4th place.
Before me
column4:
in first place would always be Christopher and in second place would be Thor.
I guess if I try my best then I'll definitely be able to come in 3rd place in the cross country competition.
The weather was quite good. Not so hot and not so cool. Last week's weather was quite cold.
During the competition
column5:
the girls in years 3 and 4 ran first. And then about 15 minutes later all the boys in years 3 and 4 started to run.
Today my physical condition was quite good and I had a good feeling about winning. Many parents were coming to watch. My mom shouted
column6:
""Fighting!""
I got a good start. I had a steady pace going. After 1/4 of the way through the course I started to run faster. I was in 3rd place and then I kept running.
Finally in the end Christopher came in first place
column7: Thor came in second place
column8: and I came in third place. After all the students in years 5 and 6 ran
column9:
the competition was finished.
I received my medal from Mr. Maguns
column10:
the headmaster.
Mom was happy and said
column11:
""I am very proud of you.""
After finishing the competition I wore my medal all day.
Running was very hard but I was proud of myself.
Next month there is an inter-school competition in Shanghai
column12: I want to attend the competition.":::

column1:
428:::"Today was math day. For the whole day we only did math.
I was happy that there was no Mandarin class (learning Chinese).
All of the middle school students had to wear their house P.E. uniforms.
All of the students at my school are divided into four houses.
The house system is used for competition and integration of students.
Houses can earn points in different competitions throughout the term.
The house with the most points at the end of the term wins the House Shield during the final Assembly.
Our 4 houses are Anand
column2: Howard
column3: Shackleton
column4:
and Wing.
Each house has its own color. The color for Wing is blue
column5:
which is the color of our P.E. uniform.
My house is Wing. If my sister comes to this school
column6:
her house will also be Wing.
Siblings are normally in the same house.
Last year during the inter-house math day
column7: Wing was the winner
column8:
but this year Wing came in 4th place. I did my best and I don't know why Wing failed this year.
My group had two leaders who are in their 6th year. My group moved to a different classroom every class period and tried to solve long and short math problems.
I think we did well.":::

column1: 429:::"Every Thursday after school
column2:
I go to science club.
The teacher said we should go out and catch some grasshoppers.
Alex and I were on the same team. The teacher gave us a net and a plastic bag.
We caught four grasshoppers. Alex said that they were yucky.
So I had to carry the plastic bag on the way back to school.
A lizard named Fred has been living at school.
Its original owner left the school when his family had to go back to their country.
So now the Fred the lizard lives at the school. We gave the grasshoppers we caught to Fred.
He ate the grasshoppers.
It was my first time to going around to catch grasshoppers and also to seeing the lizard Fred.
I really enjoy going to science club.":::

column1:
430:::"After dinner my family went out to watch the fountain show.
Beside the Jinji Lake
column2:
The water fountain show is performed beside Jinji Lake every Friday and Saturday night at 8 o'clock.
Suzhou is famous for its canals. So Suzhou is known as the Venice of Asia. There are also some lakes in Suzhou. I've heard Taihu is almost the second biggest lake in China. Jinji Lake is not as big as Taihu.
Many people take a walk or jog around the Jinji Lake.
And I live quite close to the lake.
It only takes 10 minutes to walk to the lake.
Today my family went to watch the fountain show for the first time since we've been here.
I watched a fountain show before at the Highone Hotel in Korea.
When my family arrived at the place
column3:
the show was almost ending.
I thought the fountain show was cool and beautiful.
The water went up so high while music played in the background. The water that splashed around looked like it could be a star in the sky.
The fountain water colors kept changing because of a laser beam.
My little sister asked my mom
column4:
""How does the water go up so high?""
I thought she might be impressed by the fountain's scale.
On the way home
column5:
my sister and I asked if we could buy the glowing toys.
But my mom said she didn't bring her wallet.
I want to go back again to watch the fountain show.":::

column2:
6th 2011

My family and Junyoung's family went to Shanghai on an express train.
The new train station looks like an airport. It's big and clean.
On the way to Shanghai we looked at the information TV which is where we could see the speed of the train.
It was traveling at 350 km/h. The train speed was so fast and we were really excited to be on it.
After arriving in Shanghai we took the Metro and arrived at the science museum.

When I was 6 years old and living in Daejeon
column3:
my family often went to the science museum there.
My mom asked me about what I remember from when I went to the science museum in Daejeon.
The Shanghai science museum was so big and crowded.
because it was a Saturday and so many people were there.
Every section had a long line so we would have to wait before entering another exciting place.
In the spider section
column4:
I saw a live tarantula spider. I wonder how they captured this spider.
I had so much fun in the play section.
The science museum was so exciting but we had to take the return train and go back home.
I was so excited to take the express train.
Next time
column5: I hope to take to express train and come to Shanghai again.":::

column1:
432:::"Host: Hello everyone!
I'm your host
column2:
Nick.
Wellcome to Nick's show.
Today
column3:
we invited some great guests!
Everyone say hello to them! (Steam comes out and when it clears
column4: there are people ready to argue<del>.</del>) Here is Hollywood star Jamie and a good student

James.

and please remember that you should not speak about another topic.

so please wait untill the seats are ready.

column8:
ladies and gentlemen...
Jamie
column9:
what do you think about friendship?

Jamie: I don't think friendship is important.
On the internet
column10: everyone says that <mod target = freindship>friendship</mod> is good for your health

but I don't think that way.
Because I don't have a lot of friends
column12:
and I'm very healthy.

What do you think
column13:
James?
James: I think friendship is important.
Because when I was six

I didn't have a lot of friend's and I couldn't get a lot of sleep.
Also
column15:
I was very lonely.
But now
column16: I no longer feel lonely<del>
column17:
and I get a lot of sleep and that is all because I have a lot of friends.

Jamie: There is more evidence.
Friendships can kill you...
James: What?
Jamie: The Daegu student died because he felt guilty. He thought that they could help the student who was stressed but ended up committing suicide.
Host: Let's finish this today.
We had enough.
That was a very good point
column18:
Jamie...
How about you
column19:
James?
James: Well... I think friendship can make you feel pleased and happy.
Some of my friends were very depressed when they had no friends.
But now
column20: they have a lot of friends and they say all the time
column21:
""I'm very happy!""
And also
column22: I'm very happy
column23: too
column24:
thanks to my friends...

James: Yes
column25: if you have something important to do

column27:
friends will help you.
You can spend time together and read.
You can also help each other by sharing information that you know.
Host: Jamie
column28:
have you thought about anything to say?
Let's hear your talk
column29:
please.
Jamie: You said ""spending time with your friend
column30:
right?

You can spend too much time with your friend
column31:
and not know what is going on.
So I don't think it is good to have a friend.
James: But I could tell my friend that we can finish playing games later and do homework first.
Jamie: That is not a good idea.
What if your friend doesn't obey you?
James: Um... Oh.....
Host: I think today's winner is Jamie!
Let's clap for Jamie and James!":::

column1:
433:::"Today I will talk about electronic books.
What do you think about electronic books? Do you think they are good or bad?
I think that electronic books are good for three different reasons.
First
column2:
we can download the books very quickly.
When we download an electronic book
column3: it only takes 2 to 3 minutes to download and <ins>start </ins>read<ins>ing</ins> a book
column4:
while ordering a book and waiting for the book to come takes about 1 day.
Second
column5:
electronic books are very portable.
We can bring them in our bags and carry them very easily.
And we can read the electronic books on the bus
column6: in the car
column7: on the street<ins>
column8:
and at school.
Lastly
column9:
we can feel the happiness of reading.
Any child can become happy while reading electronic books.
In some households
column10:
there are kids who are reading all the time because of electronic books.
The kids didn't know the happiness of reading before in the past
column11: but now
column12:
the kids are reading everything in the house.
So I think electronic books are good.":::

column1:
434:::"Do you know about Ho mi got?
Have you ever been there?
Today my dad
column2: Jamie
column3:
and I went to Ho mi got.
We were suffering from motion sickness
column4:
so we were very grateful when we finally reached the sea. The first thing we saw was the hand sticking out of the sea and the museum's entrance.
We went to the grand museum first.
In the museum
column5:
there was an animation above the museum entrance.
The animation was about a girl who was sleeping and had a dream.
The professor made a speech about what he made and how to use the system.
He was saying that the floor will open up and the people will fall into the trap underground.
The people would have no phone-calls
column6: no treats
column7: no weight loss
column8:
and no more carbon.
It was a very tricky thing.
We went into the first floor.
There was a flat glass that we could play on.
There weren't as many things to see
column9:
even though there were pictures.
So we went to the next floor.
There were many things on that floor.
We saw many things in there. I read some stories about the Ho mi got.
We saw water pressure gauges and lighthouse tools.
Lastly
column10:
we saw an animation about the Yun-o-rang and Se-o-nea.
The story was as fascinating to me as the Ho mi got.
It was a special trip for me.":::

column1:
435:::"Do you know the $2 shop? I had never been to a $2 shop before.
Have you ever gone to shop there?
Today mom
column2: Jamie
column3:
and I went downtown to celebrate the end of our long winter vacation.
When we got downtown
column4:
there were a lot of people who were coming and going.
We saw many people in the way and lots of shops. We found this shop called the $2 shop and I was kind of interested. It seemed like a very fashionable shop. The sign over the shop had a woman wearing fashionable sunglasses and walking a little dog toward town.
We went into that shop and saw the amazing things inside. Everyone was standing around and looking at the unusual things around them.
On the first floor
column5: there were many things. First
column6:
when you go inside the $2 shop you will see the walls on the side. Go straight to that wall and look for cellphone ropes or anything else that you might like!
On the left side
column7:
there are some cool drinks and snacks.
In the back
column8:
there are some figures and dolls.
I picked up a little doll.
On the 2nd floor
column9: you'll see some interior supplies that to help make your house clean.":::

column2: </del> Jamie<del>
column3:
and I went to Hab-chun.
We went to the clearing where we played all day.
Today
column4:
we played running man.
Did you see the person with supernatural powers in the Running Man program?
Well
column5:
I saw it and we decided to go to the building first to get started.
Who was the winner? It was my cousin
column6: </del> Seng-ju
column7:
of course.
And I was the last to get there.
So I got the worst one.
It was a death note.
So I needed to write a person's name on it.
But my survival odds were slim because I could only write down one person's name and no more.
Jamie's skill was to know all of our tricks. And he also had one chance to reflect when it's name was removed.
Finally
column8:
Seng-ju's skill was to restore the time to one hour before.
We started the game!
First
column9:
Jamie tried to grab me.
So I hid and wrote Seng-ju's name down.
Seng-ju was very angry when he got out
column10:
I mean he was huffing and puffing.
I felt sorry for him and guilty.
Then Jamie went right to me!
So I ducked into the shrub and boom!
I got Jamie's nametag.
I was the winner!
I was very happy at that time.
I think the death note was very good and helpful for me.":::

column1:
437:::"Today my family and I went to go sledding on the ice. It was the first time our family traveled somewhere together since the new year.
When we arrived
column2:
there were a lot of people.
There were about 30 people riding the sleds.
I beamed at the sight.
""Wow! Look at that thing!""
We rode on the sled right away.
It was very fun.
Then I had a very good idea to go sledding on a skateboard.
It was a lot of fun.
I played the whole time.
Then it was time to go.
I said bye-bye!":::

column1:
438:::"I visited Chung Dam for the first time this month.
The Chung Dam language institute is an institude that teaches English including spelling
column2: reading
column3:
and listening.
I don't like Chung Dam for three different reasons.
First
column4:
I don't like the students.
They play by themselves and they don't pay attention to new students (like me).
Second
column5:
I don't like the tests there.
They make us memorize 45 chunks of words in 7 days. But I also have two classes during the week.
So I only have three to four days to memorize everything. And I can't put everything in my head.
Finally
column6:
the pressure is too great.
My mom thinks I can settle into place over time
column7:
but I can't.
I can do my work whether or not I go to Chung Dam.
But why should I go to that place?
I can't understand her...
I never
column8:
never want to go there.
Last night I repeated this to myself when I was about to go to sleep
column9:
>: ""I don't want to go... I don't want to...""
So I hate going to Chung Dam.":::

column1: 439:::"These days
column2:
many people experience school violence.
There are many more cases these days
column3:
such as the middle school student from Daegu who recently died. He was always a target for his friends. The friends made him do everything they wanted to him do. They took away his books away from him so he couldn't study.
They even went to his house and ate everything there.
They hit him and it was kept a secret for a long time.
Finally
column4:
he became tired and he killed himself. He left behind a note for his parents.
We saw a video about that in school on Tuesday.
It was all about school violence. The student was being attacked by some other students.
I think that what is going on in schools is horrible.
First
column5:
the violence at school can cause people to become introverted or even think about dying.
Also
column6:
some students might think that there is nothing wrong with using violence.
Students need to study and be ready for their lives in the future.
But
column7: if they use violence to get everything they want in school
column8:
they won't be able to live honestly after graduation.
So I think school violence is very wrong.":::

column1: 440:::"Today
column2:
my dad and I went to go sledding.
The hill we went to was in Go-Reong and it took us a long time to get there. It took about 30 minutes.
But do you now why we went there? It's because we haven't gone on a family trip in a long time. But the problem is that my mom has an ache in her back
column3: tummy
column4: and head. My dad broke his leg

so he was sick too.
So he couldn't play and ride the sleds with us.
We drove and drove. Finally

we got to a clearing area where the pond was frozen.
Jamie and I both said ""Wow!"" and we both ran out.
We saw that the ice was very thick.
Then Jamie and I had a race. Ready~set~go!!!
We started the race.
I tried to go faster.
But I was getting tired
column7: so I closed my eyes
column8:
and then I pushed one more time!!!
Then it was over and I had won! I was very happy.":::

441:::"Today I played the ""Angry Birds Season 2"" game on my dad's cellphone.
First I saw a quick animation that showed how the birds' eggs were stolen.
A swarm of pigs were starving
column2: and the pigs saw the eggs. The eggs looked very appetizing
column3: so the pigs stole the eggs. The red bird
column4: which is the most common type
column5: saw that the eggs were gone. So the other birds came and also saw that the eggs were gone. They look at the empty nest for a minute or two
column6: then the yellow bird saw that the pigs were putting the eggs in the frying pan and trying to cook them. So the angry birds go to find and get their eggs back. Now
column7: I'll explain how to play <del>the </del>""Angry Birds<ins>.</ins>""<del> game.</del> First<ins>
column8: </ins> click the button on the front of the phone. Can you see some games? Pick <del>the </del>""Angry Birds"" <del>game </del>and select it to play. As I told you before<ins>
column9: </ins> there will be a short animation. If you want to skip it
column10:
just touch the screen with your finger. Then the game will start.
There will be a bird and a slingshot. Then you should pull the slingshot
to shoot the bird. You need to kill all the pigs to go to the next stage.
You can find and buy the ""Angry Birds"" games at the T-store for smart phones.":::

column1: 442:::"Yesterday
column2: I saw a thin hook and a rope. ""What's this? A chopstick? A spade?<ins> </ins>What do you think?"" I asked Jamie. Jamie said
column3:
""I dont know... Maybe we should pick this up and show it to mom and question her about this.""
""Okay
column4: I'll think about it..."" So I went into my classroom with the hook in my bag. But at that moment
column5: my classmate
column6: Lee Te Hoon was using the hook and making a muffler! I was shocked. It was the same size and same shape! So I asked him
column7: ""Ahh...Te Hoon
column8: what are you doing and what is that odd thing your holding?"" ""Hahaha!"" He laughed at me. I was a bit angry because he had a funny face. (Plus
column9: I don<ins>'</ins>t like him. He is fat and big. Also
column10: he acts like he is better than everyone else.) ""You don<ins>'</ins>t know what this is? It's a crochet hook! It helps you knit!"" ""Ahh..."" I was a bit ashamed because I never knew what one looked like before. Also
column11: the crochet hook did not look like the hooks that I saw in my storybooks. It was a bit smaller. It didn't have a little ball at the end either. And the last difference was that the real hook is connected by a piece of rope
column12: but the hooks in the storybooks never had this. So now you know what real crochet hooks are like. I think that I want to try knitting now. It looks very fun and it also helps your mind relax.":::

column5: thin
column6:
blonde hair.

column11:
too.

column12:

column13:
we played with those dolls.
Oh! I just remembered something! I also had a Cinderella doll.

Cinderella had a doll house that tells the time and says
column14:

too.

At that time
column16:

447:::"Today I started a story that I wanted to write many years ago.

column2:
Ge-due'.

So he goes into the 5-day market and sleeps there.
But a mean constable finds him and he has to go to prison.
But Gi-than's mom helps him.
So he got out of prison.

I am very happy.
Maybe someday I can be a good writer like Linda Sue Park.

column3:
too?

And I wish that someday everyone will read my story.":::

because I'm getting older each year.

column7: I might not feel like that.":::

column1: 456:::"Today
column2:
I went to an exhibition on insect specimens!
I went there with my mom and May.
May is one of my mom's students.

We walked for a very long time before we finally found it!
When we got in
column3:
it was so hot inside.
We saw many insects specimens and printing stamps of old insects.
After a while
column4:
I saw a super large moth specimen.
It was larger than my hand.
It was fifteen centimeters wide and ten centimeters long.
The moth's antenna looks just like the brush we use in the bathroom.
Its wings look like a very great artist drew on them very carefully.
After looking at them I was very happy and thought they were worth taking pictures of!
I love the insect specimen exhibition!~~~~~~~~~~

column7: we>. We</mod> held our hands together. It was so smooth and soft. My cousins took a photo with <mod target = the>a</mod> white tiger but it was laying there sadly. column6: but it would not break. It seemed like the egg was full of confidence and mocking my foolishness. I thought again

468:::"I want to tell you what I felt after reading ""Capturing the Moon.""
Today I read a story called ""Capturing the Moon.""
It was a story about a town from long ago. During that time
column2: they didn't have any light in their town. This made their lives very inconvenient. So the citizens were angry. To calm <del>down </del>the citizens' anger
column3: the wise elders from the town had a meeting. One of them said
column4: ""When night falls early
column5: we cannot just stay in our homes. We must continue to go about our business
column6: just as we do during the rest of the year. The darkness makes it hard for everyone."" So
column7: the elders scratched their heads and <mod target = tired>tried</mod> to think of a good way to solve this problem. Someone suddenly called
column8:
""We could put the moonlight into a bucket that we can put out and use when we don't have any light. We could use it!"" I thought that it was a foolish idea. But the people in the town did this the next time there was a full moon. In the end there was no light at all!
What a funny story! This story makes me feel that we have to think more wisely.":::

471:::"The Amazing Swimmer

Gertrude Elderle.

column5: fog<ins>
column6: </ins> and jelly<del> </del>fish. Finally she ended up finishing after only fourteen hours and thirty-nine seconds! She was much faster than the other men! I was so surprised <del>by </del>how a woman can swim without food and do so well. <mod target = During>As I was</mod> reading

column8: </ins> <del>and </del>strong body

column10: she won many medals in the Olympics! But I was really sorry when I learned that she became deaf after crossing the English Channel. I respect her career as a female swimmer. I want to be a strong woman and not give up just like Gertrude E<del>l</del>derle!":::

I think house chores are some of the hardest things in the world.
I want to say
column19: ""Mom
column20: I love you. I am so happy to be your son.""":::

column1: 481:::"Wednesday
column2: July 13
column3:
Rainy

Last Saturday we made Bibimbop for lunch in my class.
We were supposed to bring one or two ingredients with us.

We mixed what we brought in a large bowl with help from our homeroom teacher.

Bibimbop includes many different types of vegetables and ingredients such as pumpkins
column4: carrots
column5: eggs
column6: spinach
column7: sesame oil
column8: pepper paste
column9:
and so on.
The Bibimbop tasted much better than I expected.

It is also very good for your health.
They say that Bibimbop was created by putting and mixing together all the left-over food.
I think that Bibimbop is a very practical and delicious dish that shows a harmonious spirit.

My teacher also said
column10: ""Though we are different just like the ingredients in Bibimbop
column11: we can make a better creation when we get together."" And she added that being different is a blessing and that we need to be in harmony in order to become a better society.":::

column1: 482:::"Friday
column2:
July 1st. Sunny

Three days ago my mom came home from a business trip to Suwoon.
I was so glad to see my mom again.
So I wanted to cook fried eggs for her for the first time.
While my mom was taking a shower
column3:
I tried to cook them.

Unfortunately
column4:
I burned my finger on the frying pan.
My surprised mom rushed to me and put a piece of ice on my burned finger.
She spread a creamy balm over my burned finger.
My grandmother
column5: as well as my mom
column6:
was worried about my burned finger.
I said to them
column7:
""Don't worry about me. I'll be fine soon.""
However
column8:
it still hurt a lot.

After a while
column9:
I got a blister on my finger.
My grandmother told me not to squeeze or pick at my blister.

I felt inconvenienced even though it was only one finger.
From now on
column10:
I will be careful not to get a burn.

I also realized how precious health is.":::

column1: 483:::"Friday
column2: June 24
column3:
Rainy

It is getting hotter and hotter.
It is sultry and scorching hot.
Yesterday's heat index was quite high so I felt annoyed even when my sister touched me.
I couldn't fall asleep because of the tropical heat.
My mom turned on the air conditioner.
It seemed that she also couldn't stand the heat.
I really hate the sticky summer.
The rainy season has started too.
What is worse is that the news says a typhoon is coming to the Korean Peninsula.

And what is good about summer?
I like summer because I can swim outside.
My family will go to a valley in the mountains.
I had better try to look at the bright side of summer.":::

column1: 484:::"Friday
column2: June 17
column3:
Sunny

The final exams begin next week.
We have examinations four times a year.
The subjects we will be tested on include Korean
column4: English
column5: math
column6: science
column7: music
column8: arts
column9: physical education<ins>
column10:
and social education.

The exams give me a lot of stress.
I can't visit my grandparents' house and I can't play my favorite game
column11: soccer
column12:
with my friends.
I get very nervous before the exams.

I have trouble concentrating on studying because my younger sister is always bothering me.
Whenever I try to study
column13: she says to me
column14: ""Will you play with me outside now?"" or ""Please
column15:
read me a book.""
However
column16:
I need to do my best and study hard to get good grades on my exams.

I hope that the exams will be easier than I think they will be.":::

column1: 485:::"Friday
column2: June 10
column3:
Cloudy

We have four people in my family
column4: My family members include my dad
column5: mom
column6: my younger sister<ins>
column7:
and me.

We were all born in different cities.
My dad was born in Daegu
column8: my mom in Sangju
column9: my younger sister in Gumi<ins>
column10:
and I was born in Daejeon. Now we all live in Gimcheon except for my dad.
He lives and works in Daejeon on weekdays.
He comes home on Friday evening and goes back to work early Monday morning. Every weekend he says that there is no place like home.

My whole family tries to have a home filled with happiness
column11:
especially my dad who always supports me.

My parents have been married for 12 years.
They get along well together like a pair of lovebirds.

My mom also goes to work. She is busy taking care of my sister and me.
I like her very much although she is a little bit nosy.

Last
column12:
my younger sister is 7 years younger than me.
She always tries to copy me. She is nosy like my mom.

I love my family and I will try to live together with them happily. ^^

column1: 486:::"Friday
column2: June 3
column3:
Sunny

Last Sunday
column4:
we dropped by Upo Wetland on our way home from Geo Je Island.

Upo Wetland is the biggest natural inland wetland in Korea and is spread over four administrative districts in Changyounggun.
In March of 1998
column5:
it was officially signed to the Ramsar Convention.

We watched a 3-D movie about Upo Wetland.
I learned about the value of the wetland and environment through the movie.

Many animals and plants live in the vast wetland.
Upo Wetland can function as an excellent natural dam during monsoon or drought season.

However
column6:
there are only two restaurants near there. So my family couldn't eat lunch in a restaurant because there were already many people there.

I wish there were more restaurants near Upo Wetland. ^*^

column1: 487:::"Friday
column2: May 27
column3:
Rainy

Our family is going to travel to Geoje Island.
My daddy's friends and their families will all go on the trip with us.
I am so excited about this trip.
Geoje is located at the center of the Southern coast of the Gyoungnam province.
It is the second largest island in Korea.
Geoje is only 45 minutes to 1 hour away from Busan and Masan.

We are going to go on a ship to visit a famous garden.
When my daddy comes home after work this evening
column4:
we'll go shopping to buy new clothes and so on.

I am so happy just thinking about the trip.
We will have a wonderful barbecue party with the other kids and their parents in the evening.
I'll also play soccer with some of the kids.
I can't wait for this trip.":::

column1: 489:::"Thursday
column2: May 5
column3:
Sunny

It is Children's Day.
My parents bought me a rabbit as a gift for Children's Day.
We went to the rabbit farm to select a rabbit.
We chose a one month old female rabbit.
She is a white rabbit with some brown spots.

The owner of the farm told me that rabbits are intelligent
column4: social animals who need affection
column5:
and they can become wonderful companion animals if given a chance to interact with human families.
In addition
column6:
she said that male rabbits pee here and there to mark their territory.

I wonder if I will breed her.
I will take good care of her as if she were my baby sister.":::

column1: 490:::"Friday
column2: April 29
column3:
Sunny

My dad works in another city. It takes two and a half hours to get to his office. He usually comes home on Friday evening. He is home with us only on weekends.

I miss him during the weekdays. My family is supposed to have a nice dinner in a good restaurant with my dad. The restaurant is famous for sushi.

My parents will order sushi and my sister and I will order pork cutlet.
The food in the restaurant tastes like heaven. But I like the play lounge in the restaurant more than the food. My sister and I play in the play lounge while my parents talk over their meal.

I like Friday evenings the most.":::

column1: 491:::"Thursday
column2: April 21
column3:
Clear

I watched a video about Nick Vujicici in my class.

He was born in 1982 in Melbourne
column4: Australia<del>
column5: </del> without arms to wrap around someone<del>
column6: </del> <mod target = and>or</mod> legs to dance
column7: run
column8:
or even stand on two feet.

I was frightened by his appearance at first.
But the smile on his face is so friendly and bright.

What if I were in his shoes?
Maybe
column9:
I would feel frustrated easily and even feel like giving up on my life.

How does he live a normal happy life?
His parents didn't think him as a disabled person.
They treated him just like a normal person and helped him to do whatever he wanted for himself.
He overcame his disability thanks to his parents' love.

When he was young
column10:
he also struggled with depression and loneliness as he questioned why he was different from all the other kids.

However after lots of frustrating struggles
column11: he adapted to his situation and found ways to accomplish tasks that most people could easily do by using <mod target = his>their</mod> limbs
column12: such as brushing <del>his </del>teeth
column13: typing on a computer
column14:
and much more.

In seventh grade Nick was elected captain of his school and now he travels around the world
column15:
sharing his story and the importance of vision with millions of people.

Nick is a true inspirational and motivational speaker.

I was extremely impressed by him.
""I love Nick.""":::

column1: 492:::"Thursday
column2: April 14
column3:
Clear

Since yesterday evening
column4:
I have had a fever. But it was too late to see a doctor. I had a fever and felt severely ill.

My mom was up all night taking care of me. She tried to bring the fever down by putting a wet handkerchief on my forehead. She also gave me a massage.

I can understand how much I owe my mom.

This morning I went to the hospital to see a doctor. The doctor said that I had a cold. He gave me a prescription for medicine from the drug store.

I will eat three balanced meals a day and healthy food in order to not ruin my health.":::

column1: 493:::"Thursday
column2: April 7th
column3:
Rainy

In the afternoon
column4: </ins> my mom said
column5:
""It's spring. How about rearranging the furniture? It'll make us feel much better.""
I said
column6: ""Ok
column7:
mom.""
We moved the bookshelves from my room to the living room and also put a big table in the middle of the living room.
We decorated the table with fresh plants. Besides the table
column8:
my mom hung our testimonials on the wall. Now our living room looks like a library.

In addition
column9:
we made a decision not to watch TV anymore.
In fact
column10:
I didn't agree with my mom when I first heard her suggestion because I love to watch TV.
My mom firmly tried to persuade our family again and again not to watch TV.
I couldn't help but to agree with her even though I didn't want to at first.

However
column11:
before long I came to realize that we do a lot more things together as a family than we used to do before.
For example
column12:
we read more books and talk to each other more often.
Tonight I'm going to make toy cars using recyclable materials like plastic milk bottles and tops with my family.
I mean that we have more time to spend together as a family and we are much happier than we were before.":::

column1: 494:::"Thursday
column2: March 31
column3:
Sunny

My teacher gave us an assignment.
It was to draw an imaginary picture.
This assignment seems very interesting to me.
I drew robots playing soccer on behalf of the nation.
I made the robots play soccer instead of soldiers.
Nowadays
column4:
lots of people are suffering from radioactive contamination and many other kinds of terrors.
We don't need any weapons such as the nuclear weapons.
We don't have to lose our precious family members in war anymore.
When the demands between two nations are different
column5:
we should let the robots play soccer instead of fighting in a war. The winning nation will be decided by the robots' soccer game.
The loser nation should follow whatever the winner nation's demands are.
It is both funny and safe to play soccer. ^^

column1: 495:::"Wednesday
column2: March 23
column3:
Windy

My homeroom teacher gave us an assignment
column4:
an essay about friendship.

At first
column5:
a common proverb occurred to me.
""Friends make my joy twice instead of sorrow half""

Then
column6: I thought of the tv program ""Don't cry
column7:
Tonz""
The program is about a father (a priest) who devoted himself to help lots of poor leprosy patients in Africa.

He used to be a doctor and a teacher as well as a father.
He taught them how to play musical instruments and treated them with medicine.
He understood their poor conditions and tried to help them sincerely.
When he died
column8:
most of them cried for a long time and they said that the father was a true friend to them.
I was moved to tears.

EI made up my mind to clean up for my friend when he is sick and to share my textbook with my friend when he forgets his own at his house.":::

column1: 496:::"Friday
column2: March 18th
column3:
Sunny

I saw on TV that a terrible earthquake had occurred in Japan on TV.
Many houses and roads collapsed from the earthquake
column4:
and fires started here and there.
Moreover
column5:
lots of Japanese people were killed in the tsunami catastrophe.

A certain woman on TV kept crying. She said that she lost her young daughter in the tsunami.
I was so sad at the news. I want to help the poor Japanese.

I think we cannot prevent nature's incredible power
column6:
even though our technology is growing stronger.
We'd better prepare for the worst.

I don't like earthquakes and tsunamis.":::

column1: 497:::"Wednesday
column2: March 11th
column4:
sunny

I enjoyed playing soccer with my friends after school.
We had a great time.

And then
column5:
I found out that I had lost my cell phone.
""Where is my cell phone?"" I wondered.
I looked for it here and there.

All at once
column6:
my heart started to beat really hard.
I could hear my heart beating loudly
column7: ""THUMP
column8: THUMP
column9:
THUMP.""
""What if my parents know that I lost my cell phone? I will be punished!"" I thought.
I ended up bursting into tears.

Halfheartedly
column10:
I had to call my dad.
""Dad
column11: I lost my cell phone. I'm so sorry
column12:
I told my dad with a cry.
Contrary to my expectation
column13:
my dad told me good news.
He said
column14:
""That's okay. Someone picked up your cell phone and called me to take it back.""

I was so happy to hear that.
I think that our society is a good place to live in.":::

column1:
498:::"The First Day of the New School Year

Wednesday
column2: March 2nd
column3:
too windy


It is the beginning of the new school year.

I felt both excited and a little nervous. There were lots of unfamiliar faces. At first
column4: I was so sad because my best friend was not in the same class with me. However
column5:
I am very lucky because my new classmate sitting by me is generous and kind. We enjoyed talking about our new school lives.

In addition
column6: I couldn't wait to know who my new homeroom teacher was. I am in fourth grade
column7: class no. 2 and my new teacher's name is Jung Kyung-ja. She is 51 years old with two sons. Today I <mod target = came to know>learned</mod> that my homeroom teacher will be a good helper for my studies after listening to what she said in class. I felt more respect for my new teacher. After school
column8: while reading the paper my teacher sent
column9: my mom said
column10:
""Your teacher must be very nice and passionate.""

My mom gave me a special notebook for my new school year.
It is a question book. I have to ask a few questions to my teacher in class and then put down both my questions and my teacher's answers in it. My mom said that the notebook will make me pay more attention in class.

I made a decision to be a good student as well as a good friend to my classmates so as not to let my parents down.":::

column1: 499:::"Friday
column2:
February 4. sunny

The next day after New Year's Day
column3: I visited Hae-In Temple in Hap-cheon with my family. As a matter of fact
column4:
I went there for the purpose of my travel essay for the winter vacation assignment.

The temple has a fine view with lots of wonderful pine trees and clear valley water along the road by the entrance of the temple.

The temple has preserved the Tripitaka Koreana (팔만대장경) for many years. It is one of the world heritage sites for UNESCO as well as the national treasure of Korea. They say that it was made so that our nation can depend on the mercy of Buddha against neighboring countries' attacks. Even more surprising is that it was completed over 240 years ago.

I also saw Sa-ri
column5:
the three small crystals of Buddha (부처사리) for the first time in the temple. My dad said that it was found among the cremated remains of good monks. Some Buddhists pay their respects for Sa-ri with their hands. I thought it was truly amazing that Sa-ri came from the body of humans.

This visit was very helpful in learning about the culture of Korea.":::

column1: 502:::"Saturday
column2: January 29th
column4: <mod target = sunny>Sunny
column5:
but cold (at the buffet).

Last Saturday
column6: I went to the buffet with my mother and my sister. My father didn't go to the buffet with us because he was very tired from playing soccer. Every weekend
column7:
my father plays soccer with the other men who like to play soccer.

I went outside
column8: which was very cold
column9: and went inside my father's car
column10: which is white
column11: with my sister and my mother. My mother started the car and my mother drove the car to the buffet. The buffet felt very far from home to me. I was very dizzy while we went to the buffet. My mother drove to the underground parking lot
column12: which was a little bit dark
column13:
and my mother parked the car. I went outside the car with my mother. I was still dizzy when I went outside.

I went inside the elevator with my sister and my mother. Riding the elevator made me feel just as dizzy as riding the car. So
column14: </ins> I was even dizzier when I rode the elevator with my mother and my sister. When I went outside the elevator with my mother and my sister
column15: we had to wait about an hour because there were a lot of people who came to this buffet. While we waited for one hour
column16:
my sister and I went to the bathroom and played cell phone games. My mother just sat down on the green chair where we had been sitting and drank some water.

Finally
column17: we could eat our dinner. We had waited exactly one hour
column18: not about one hour. I sat down at the table where we would eat our dinner with my mother and my sister. My sister and I stood up from the chair and table and ran to the white dishes. My sister and I each picked up a white dish<ins>
column19: </ins> <del>and </del>chose the food that we liked<ins>
column20: </ins> and placed them on the white dish. <del>And </del><mod target = after>After</mod> I ate them
column21:
I stood up again and did that over and over with my mother and my sister.

I ate small chicken
column22: rare meat (steak)
column23: very thin pieces of pizza
column24: pink marshmallows
column25: chocolate cake
column26: very sweet brandies
column27: small potatoes (a vegetable that I like)
column28: fruit (orange-colored tangerines
column29: purple grapes
column30: a little green and yellow pineapples)
column31: other kind of meats
column32: <del>and </del>drank purple grape juice
column33:
and so on.

There were many healthy foods that I didn't like. So
column34: </ins> I was very ashamed of myself. I ate the food with relish with my mother and my sister and we all drank some green tea. We didn't drink much<del>
column35: </del> because we were very full from eating many kinds of foods. I was so full that I couldn't even move well and my sister couldn't either. <del>And </del>I wanted to take some pink marshmallows <mod target = to>for</mod> my father<ins>
column36: </ins> but the guests weren't allowed to take food home. So<ins>
column37:
I was very disappointed. My sister and I played together and then we had to go home.

I went outside the buffet with my mother and my sister and rode the elevator. Of course
column38: riding the elevator made me very dizzy<ins>
column39: </ins> as I thought it would. <del>And </del><mod target = then>Then
column40: </mod> we went to the underground parking lot<ins>
column41: </ins> which was a little dark like when we went inside the buffet. I got inside the car with my sister and my mother<mod target =
column42: >.</mod> <del>and </del><mod target = my>My</mod> mother started the car. My mother drove the car and we went home. Of course
column43:
I was very dizzy while we rode in my father's car.

I wish that I didn't get dizzy when I ride in the car
column44: </ins> <del>or </del>elevator<ins>
column45: </ins> or ship. <del>And </del>I wish that I will go to that buffet next time with my mother
column46: my father
column47: and my sister. I hope that my father will like the foods that are at the buffet.":::

column1: 503:::"Friday
column2: January 21st
column4: <mod target = sunny>Sunny
column5:
but cold (On Wednesday).

On Wednesday
column6: after <del>me
column7: </del>my older sister
column8: <del>and </del>my mother<ins>
column9: and I</ins> all ate lunch
column10: we changed our clothes
column11: brushed our teeth
column12: and washed our hands and faces. Then<ins>
column13: </ins> I packed the things that I needed <mod target = while>when</mod> going to the bookstore and rink with my sister and my mother. I also put tissues in my jacket pocket<del>
column14: </del> because I had a cold. So<ins>
column15:
I even dressed warmly.

And Then
column16: </mod> I went outside with them. Before going to the bookstore and rink
column17: my mother called for the hired rented vehicle and when I went outside with my mother and my sister
column18: the car was waiting for us. We got in the car. After the car arrived at the bus terminal
column19: we went outside the car and went inside the bus terminal<mod target =
column20: >.</mod> <mod target = and>We</mod> got <mod target = inside>on</mod> the bus. Before the bus left the bus terminal
column21:
we ate the bread and tangerines that we had packed. The bus began to drive to Seoul.

Not long after
column22: I slept on the bus. When I awoke
column23: the bus had already reached the subway station. We got off from the bus. Before we went to take the subway to go to the rink
column24: we went to the bookstore that we had decided to go to. We went to the bookstore because my mother said that my sister and I had to buy a book. My sister wanted to buy her favorite novel called ‘듀라라라<mod target = '
column26: '</mod> so my mother let her buy her favorite novel. She bought her favorite novel<del>
column27: </del> and we wandered <ins>around </ins>the bookstore<ins>.</ins> <mod target = and>We</mod> saw the comic book that we know and like. <del>And </del><mod target = then>Then
column28: </mod> we bought the book that we had to read. We bought the book that was about the boy who had gone and return<ins>ed</ins> from heave<ins>n</ins> and also <mod target = the>a</mod> book that was about a marshmallow. So<ins>
column29:
it is called a ""Marshmallow Story.""

After we bought the books in the bookstore
column30: we went outside the bookstore and took the subway to go to the rink. We took the subway for such a long time that I was beginning to get tired. While we were taking the subway

my sister read her favorite novel that we had bought.

Finally
column32: we reached the rink. My sister and I put on a pair of skates and I put on <mod target = the>a</mod> helmet. My sister didn't put on the helmet<del>
column33: </del> because she is old enough to not<ins> have to</ins> put<ins> one</ins> on<del> the helmet</del>. <del>And </del><mod target = then>Then
column34: </mod> we began to skate. My sister was much faster than me. So<ins>
column35: </ins> I didn't feel <mod target = that>like</mod> the skating was as fun as I thought it would be. Before going to another place
column36:
we ate bread with water.


After that
column37: </ins> we went to the subway station and took the subway. <del>And </del><mod target = then>Then
column38: </mod> we went to the place that sells hamburgers. I ate a chicken burger and my mother also ate a chicken burger with a tomato. My sister didn't eat a burger. Instead<ins>
column39: </ins> she ate corn
column40: chicken
column41: and bread with jam. I also ate chicken and bread with jam<ins>
column42: </ins> too. <del>And </del><mod target = then>Then

column44: </del> that I did not know<del>
column45: </del> because my mother wanted to drink coffee and I had to take <ins>some </ins>medicine (a pill) because I had a cold. My mother gave me medicine and water. I began to take the medicine with water. But<ins>
column46: </ins> I accidentally spilled the water. Fortunately
column47: the water didn't spill a lot. I took my last medicine with the water that was left. <del>And </del><mod target = then>Then
column48:
my mother drank a cup of coffee and we left the shop.

And Then
column49: </mod> we got inside the bus. Before the bus began to go
column50: we ate tangerines and<ins> then</ins> the bus started. While the bus was going to the bus terminal
column52: </ins> even though I was sleepy
column53: I couldn't sleep. When the bus reached the bus terminal
column54: we got off from the bus and we rode another bus that would bring us home. The bus began to start and the bus <mod target = stoped>stopped</mod> at the bakery that is near our house. We got off from the bus and we walked <del>to the </del>home. I was very tired
column55: but I was very thankful for my mother because my mother let us go to the rink and skate. I had asked my mother to go to the rink. But<ins>
column56: </ins> I was very unhappy when my mother told me to write a diary entry about going to the bookstore and <ins>the </ins>rink. I wish that the skating had been as fun as I had thought<ins> it would be</ins>.":::

column1: 505:::"Friday
column2: December 31st
column4:
sunny day (On Christmas)

On Friday
column5: December 24th
column6: we started winter vacation. Since it was 방학식
column7: I went home at ten thirty
column8: which was much earlier than usual. Every<del> </del>day except the special days like Saturday or 방학식
column9: I go home at one thirty. Of course
column10: because it is 방학식
column11: my classmates and I didn't eat lunch or drink milk at school. Every<del> </del>day my classmates and I also drink milk
column12: which tastes awful to me. On the way home
column13:
I was very happy because we will not go to school for a long time.

When I reached home
column14: I rested and ate lunch. Then I practiced violin for Christmas. I was going to play the violin at church
column15: because it is almost Christmas. I practiced violin in the evening. Since I was going to play the violin on the day when it was 방학식 for me
column16: I was very nervous. I was going to play two tunes. One tune was <mod target = ‘>""</mod>주님 다시 오실 때까지<ins>
column17:
."" These tunes are in the hymn book. That is why I was going to play "" and ."" I thought about that while practicing.

I'm not good at the violin. To me
column18: <del>the </del><mod target = ‘>""</mod>저들 밖에 한밤 중에<mod target = '>""</mod> was easier than the <mod target = ‘>""</mod>주님 다시 오실 때까지<del>'</del>.<ins>""</ins> I practiced playing the violin even when I was at church
column19:
before I played the violin for Christmas. My mother made sure that the violin sounded good and beautiful.

After I practiced a lot
column20: my mother gave me and my sister cookies when my sister arrived. She hasn't been with us. After the other people did a dance routine and praise
column21: <del>finally
column22: </del>it was <ins>finally </ins>my turn to play the violin. I was so nervous when I went on <del>the </del>stage. Since my violin's sound is soft
column23:
my mother asked to place a microphone near the violin. so the people could hear it.

After I played the two tunes

column1: 518:::"Saturday

column3:
Sunny day (Chuseok)

Chuseok is a Korean festival day. Chuseok is the Korean Thanksgiving Day. Chuseok is the day when the full moon rises. Because Chuseok is on August 15th
column4: </del> in the lunar calendar. On the 15th of every month in the lunar calendar
column5: the full moon rises up at night instead of another moon (like a crescent (new and old moon) or a half moon). <del>And </del><mod target = also>Also
column6: </mod> Chuseok is on August 15th in the lunar calendar. That is why on Chuseok
column7:
a full moon rises up at night. And August 15th in the solar calendar is the Independence Day of Korea. My family went to our maternal grandmother's house on August 15th in the lunar calendar (on Chuseok).

Before we went to my maternal grandmother's house

column9: instead of my ordinary clothes<ins>
column10: </ins> because it was Chuseok. We didn't go the day before

column1: 550:::"Today I would like to talk about my trip to Cambodia and Vietnam with my family. Well I can tell you that it was paradise. I was so excited when my grandpa told me about the trip. That's because I really like <mod target = having a trip>traveling</mod><ins>
column2: </ins> especially when I get a chance to go to another country. My first stop was to Vietnam. <mod target = In>From</mod> the sky<ins>
column3: </ins> Korea looks like they are having a festival of towers. But Vietnam looked different<ins>
column4: </ins> like they are having a harvest festival. When I got off <del>from </del>the airplane I couldn't stop moaning about the heat. It was fall there but to me it felt like an oven. When I got to the road<ins>
column5: </ins> it was full of motorcycles. It was amazing! I think Vietnamese people ride motorcycles because they don't have enough money to <mod target = offer a>buy</mod> car<ins>s</ins>. Even on the sidewalks<ins>
column6: </ins> kids who looked very young were saying ""<del>1</del>$<ins>1</ins>
column7: <del>1</del>$<ins>1.</ins>""<del>.</del> I felt really terrible for those kids who beg for money. If I had unlimited 1 dollar<del>s</del> <ins>bills </ins>I would make those kids rich. The best place I would say is the feet massage and swimming in the hotel pool. Especially because it's really hot in Vietnam<ins>
column8: </ins> we want<ins>ed</ins> to relax or cool off. Next stop was Cambodia<ins>
column9: </ins> where Apollo lives (a god of <mod target = son>the sun</mod> from Greek mythology). It was so hot that my face would have looked like a baked potato if I didn't cover my body with sun cream. In Vietnam I went to Angkor Wat. It's a palace that is almost 700 years old. It was very interesting to learn about a different culture from another country. I think it was a really nice trip and good experience. I hope I could have a chance to go to another country.":::

column1: 551:::"Hello! Guys<ins>
column2: </ins> did you ever run in a school class election? Well? Maybe only <ins>a </ins>few might have run <mod target = for>in</mod> elections. And for me<ins>
column3: </ins> this Wednesday
column4: I ran <mod target = for>in</mod> an election. And it wasn't just a normal election. It was a school vice president<ins>ial</ins> election. I really wanted to be a student representative but because <del>of the reason that </del>I am young<ins>
column5: </ins> I couldn't be a student representative. I am a 5th grader<ins>
column6: </ins> and only 6th graders had chances to become student representatives. It was not fair! I also kind of felt like the school is committing age discrimination. For 3 days I worked on <ins>my </ins>election campaign and I was so tired<ins>.</ins> <del>and </del><mod target = the>The</mod> worst thing is that my voice got hoarse. I was very worried because I only had 1 day left <mod target = for>before</mod> the speech. So I did my best to fix my throat problem. I ate throat candies and <del>also </del>drank some hot milk
column7: maesil<ins> </ins>(매실) and many other <ins>kinds of </ins>food<del>s</del> and drinks. Fortunately<ins>
column8: </ins> my throat got better than yesterday. Well it was still not good<mod target = . But>
column9: but</mod> I tried not to care about my voice. After breakfast<ins>
column10: </ins> I went to school very early because of the election campaign. And today was the day of our speech<ins>
column11: </ins> so while we were campaigning I didn't use my voice because of my throat condition. <del>After </del><mod target = about>About</mod> five minutes later<ins>
column12: </ins><del>??</del> <mod target = It>it</mod> was the time for my speech. OMG! OMG! OMG! I was so nervous that I almost freaked out and <del>I also </del>got goose<del> </del>bumps all over my skin. I kept drinking water and going to the bathroom. When I got <mod target = to the>in</mod> front of the <mod target = mike>mic</mod><ins>
column13: </ins> I was a legend. I felt like I was playing on the screen. And the result was that I became the school vice president. I got 227 votes. And a guy called A got 156 votes and B got 102 votes. I was so lucky. I felt so amazed <mod target = by>at</mod> myself. I got 227 votes! I. am. Not. A. human. And the date was 2013/8/28/Wednesday
column14: so it was the day that Little Fox showed the elected people in the English journal writing club<ins>
column15:
and there was my name 임*준. I felt so good that I felt like I can fly all around the world in only one second. I was so happy.

WHAT A LUCKY DAY!

Thank you for reading my English journal. Hope you have a nice day and keep on reading my journal because it will get more exciting every times!":::

column1: 552:::"Did you ever go to the dentist? Of course you did. And how do you feel when you go to the dentist<mod target = .>?</mod> Scary
column2: nervous
column3: sad<ins>
column4:
and other bad emotions.

Well for me
column5: I went to the dentist yesterday. <del>So </del><mod target = it>It</mod> all started like this. After school<ins>
column6: </ins> I was eating cereal and my molars hurt a lot<mod target =
column7: so>. So</mod> I told my mom and <mod target = my mom>she</mod> ordered me to brush my teeth. First I didn't realize why my mom asked me to brush my teeth but when we went out I realized it. ""I am going to the dentist!<del>!</del>"" I would <mod target = better>rather</mod> go to prison. When I came to the dentist I was hoping not to have any surgery. But unfortunately I had a decayed tooth so I was having a surgery. Unlike the day I became the vice president<ins>
column8:
I had no luck yesterday. The doctor was planning to get 1 tooth out but my tooth was strong so it was hard to get it out. It is very painful to pull a tooth out so I had anesthesia injected into my gums. Every sound and every movement was horrifying to me. After an hour (really) I got my tooth out. It really took a lot of time just to get a tooth out. I was feeling dizzy after I got my tooth out.

From now on I promise that I would take care of my teeth. I never want to go to the dentist again.

NEVER EVER AFTER!!!

THANK YOU FOR READING MY DIARY.
HOPE YOU ENJOYED IT...":::

column20: I said

column26:
the door was locked and I had to find the key.
Ding-dong! Ding-dong! My door bell rang. My best friend came! Wow! She came very quickly! Anyway
column27: I told Anna about the secret door and now we were looking for the secret key. We looked everywhere but
column28: we couldn't find it anywhere. We just found a lot of dust under the bed
column29: in the closet
column30: and on the floor. Then

column33: I found it! Yay! We unlocked the secret door and… … … … … … … … … … whoosh! A message appeared
column34: ""To the great place where you can find treasure…"" I read. We looked at each other for a while and we went inside the door. ""Wow… Where is this place? I want to go there! I want to travel there! How great!"" I muttered. The wind started to blow. The secret door started to spin. It spun faster
column35: faster
column36: faster
column37: and faster. It was going as fast as possible. Then<ins>
column38: </ins> everything was still. It was absolutely still and absolutely quiet. But

column40:
a bright light appeared.

I opened my two eyes. I woke up my friend. I think… we were on an isolated island. It was an isolated island! It was a great place where I could find treasure. Wait! Island and treasure… Those two words are often linked with pirates! Ah!! Oh! No! ""We have to get out of here!""
I could see that something was coming toward us and it was a pirate ship. The pirates grabbed us and now we were on the pirate ship. They were saying something but
column41: I couldn't understand because<del>
column42:
it was in their own language. I couldn't believe it! We were on a pirate ship? It was a real pirate ship. Oh my…
We had to get out of there. And We had to go home. We explained about what had happened and they just laughed and laughed for a long long time… Why were the pirates so foolish? I don't know… Anyway
column43: I dreamed of a pirate when I was my younger sister's age because I wanted to get treasures like pirates do. But
column44: not now. I think the pirates were too foolish to get something from the island. They have to be smart like my best friend
column45: Anna
column46:
and me! HA!

column47: we did some Taekwondo. The pirates all ran away or else they <ins>would </ins>have to become our slaves. So
column48: we got home safely. We found the secret door on the isolated island. It was in the tallest palm tree. We opened it with our secret golden key and we said
column49:
""We want to go back to our own home. We want to go home!""
The wind started to blow again. The whole palm tree started to spin. It spun faster and faster. Then
column50:
everything was still. It was absolutely still and quiet.
Wow! We were back! Hmm… It was a great adventure! And I am glad and also surprised that it was not a dream!
And We talked about our great adventure. And The time went by quickly!
Bye-bye and I hope that the other great adventure will start soon!":::

column16: </ins> there is <del>a </del>bad news. The bad news is <ins>that </ins>my favorite teacher will be going to another school next year
column17: so I won't see her anymore! She had been in this school
column18: my school
column19: for <mod target = 4>four</mod> years. After a teacher has been in one school for <mod target = 4>four</mod> years
column20: she/he has to go to another school. I will remember her forever! Maybe she will think about me<ins>
column21: </ins> too! Shh<mod target = ~>.</mod> Oh! I didn't tell you this! I am learning English from my English teacher! I was very happy to learn from a very similar teacher! I hope that she will teach me English well<del>
column22:
and I will try to do my best!
This is my second diary. I had fun while I was writing it. I hope you like it. Please wait for my next diary! Have a great day!":::

column1: 581:::"My favorite Korean food is samgyetang. It is called chicken soup (with ginseng)<ins>
column2: </ins> too! <del>And
column3:
I have another favorite food. My second favorite food is kimchi. I like both of them because they are traditional Korean foods.
First
column4: </ins> I like samgyetang
column5: the chicken soup
column6: because it is very tasty and I like chicken. It is also salty. I like salty food. But
column7: my parents and other people say that salty food is not good for your health. Samgyetang (chicken soup) is called <del>the </del>summer's health food. We have three days to eat <del>the </del>Samgyetang in summer. Foreigners might think that it is strange to eat warm food in the summer. But
column8: a very long time ago
column9: our Korean ancestors believed that when we have warm food on hot days
column10:
our bodies will become healthier.
My mother taught me how to make samgyetang. First
column11: buy all of the ingredients. We need a whole chicken
column12: salt
column13: jujube (a type of herb)
column14: water
column15: and garlic. Next
column16: pour some water into a big pot. Third
column17: put all of the ingredients into the pot and boil for about two hours until the chicken will be tender. Then
column18:
enjoy it!
Second! Kimchi! I like kimchi
column19: </del> because it is spicy and also salty like samgyetang. I think it can also taste a little sweet. You might not believe me
column20: but it is true. You should try some <mod target = Kkakdkugi>kkakdugi</mod>. It is a type of of kimchi made with radishes. It tastes a little bit sweet!":::

column1:
582:::"Do you know that some types of libraries have wheels?

It can visit any place where there are people who want to borrow books.

Can you guess what it is?

It is the bookmobile.
A bookmobile is a bus that carries books on shelves.

If a bookmobile visits our village
column2:
our village people go to the bookmobile and borrow books.

I like the bookmobile because it gives me a different feeling from school libraries or municipal libraries.

I can borrow three or four books with one library card.

There are some differences between the bookmobile and the municipal library.
First
column3:
there is a set time for the bookmobile to come and go for the bookmobile.
Second
column4:
there are less books available than in the school libraries or municipal libraries.

I think the bookmobile is very convenient.

It is very close to go to and fun.

If the mobile library was the bus that was for carrying the people
column5:
there would be some problems.
That's because the bookmobile is a bus that has no chairs!":::

My grandma

I love getting New Year's gift money from the adults.

After a New Year's greeting bow

The dogs gave me a big welcome.

Later
column13:

column1: 589:::"This time<ins>
column2:
I would like to introduce how to use Photoshop.

Photoshop is a photo editing software.

We can retouch or transform our photos or pictures using Photoshop.

Photoshop has many functions to make changes to photos.

I will explain some of them and their shortcut keys.

Move tool (Shortcut key: V): The move tool allows you to move
a selection or an entire layer of the photo by dragging it with your mouse or using your
keyboard arrows keys.

We can click the some object to select and move it by
dragging it with our mouse to where we want to move.

Magnetic lasso tool (Shortcut key: L): You can click to set the anchor
point for our magnetic lasso tool then move it along the edge
of your image to grab.

Clone stamp tool (Shortcut key: S): It lets you copy from one area
of an image to another using any type of brush.

There are a lot of tools besides the ones I mentioned above.

I modified my photo by lowering the transparency of a spot
on my face to hand in an application form for a Photoshop test at school.

It was great to modify the dot on my face.

I would like to know who made Photoshop
column3: how<ins>
column4:
and why.

And I will search for related Photoshop related information in detail.

I would like to recommend for you to use this Photoshop program.

And I would like to make fun photos using Photoshop with friends
column5: </ins> too.":::

and I couldn't live in a little country like Korea.

and study with him at schools in the U.S.

but we don't have enough money to go.

my father said he will give us enough money.

column14:
she will not be coming with us to the U.S.

I have a lot of things to think about.
My grandmother doesn't want to let me go to the U.S. because she thinks I am going alone.
Even if I go with my mother she will still disagree because she wouldn't want my father to be alone at home.
My mother and my father said that we have a lot of things to think about. Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh~I am sighing now.":::

column1: 630:::"Hello. I am Jiyong.<ins> </ins>Yesterday<ins>
column2:
in Little Fox I learned about
the Louvre
column3:
one of the biggest art museums in the whole world.
The Louvre is in France. There are 8.5 million people from all over the world who visit the Louvre each year.
Now
column4:
that's what I call a lot of visitors.
The Louvre is located in the heart of Paris
column5:
on the right bank of the Seine River.
It's home to around 35
column6:
000 pieces of art and nearly 13 kilometers of
galleries.That means it wouid take almost a year for a visitor to see everything
inside the museum!
When the louvre was first built
column7: <ins> </ins>way back in 1190
column8:
it was designed to be a
fortress to protect paris from its enemies. At the time paris was largest city in
Europe
column9: <ins> </ins>and over the next two hundred years
column10:
the city continued to grow.
Eventually
column11: </ins> the louvre wasn't big enough to protect the entire city.<ins> </ins><mod target = so>So</mod>
column12: <ins> </ins>in 1364
column13:
King Charles V decided to turn it into a palace.
During the centuries that followed
column14:
members of the french royalty continued
changing the louvre
column15:
demolishing some sections and adding new buildings and
wings
column16:
along with gardens and fancy decorations. French monarchs also collected
artwork
column17: filling the louvre with colorful tapestries
column18: <ins> </ins>elaborate carvings
column19:
and all
kinds of incredible paintings. Eventually the royal court decided to move to a new
place
column20: <ins> </ins>abandoning the louvre for a while.<ins> </ins><mod target = finally>Finally</mod>
column21: <ins> </ins>in 1793
column22:
goverment officials
decided to turn the buildings into a museum for the public.
Today
column23:
the louvre has three main wings.They're arranged like a giant
horseshoe
column24:
and in the courtyard in the middle of the wings is a big glass pyrmid.
Inside the louvre
column25:
visitors can wee art from many different time periods.There's a
helmet worn by a real roman gladiator
column26: </mod>Egyptian statues over 4000<ins> </ins>years old<mod target = ;>
column27:
and a sword used at the coronations of french kings. Most people
visting the Louvre stop to see the most famous painting tn the world: The Mona Lisa.
I will talk about The Mona Lisa next time.
Bye-bye.":::
