column1: 639:::"Last Friday was the beginning of the second half of the 5th grade. I was happy to be back at school. I met my friends and my teacher. We were all loud during our break talking about what we did over our summer vacations. During class
column2: the teacher picked some students to share about what they did during their summer vacation. I was picked. I said that I went to the Jangan Sea and swam in the water during the day
column3: and went to catch some clams at night. Ju-Young said that he went somewhere and played games with his cousins. Hannah told us that she went to Dae Myong condominium and played table tennis with her dad and her brother. After we listened to some of our other friends' stories
column4: our teacher said to remember them well. At first
column5: I didn't understand. However
column6: when we finished eating lunch in the cafeteria and we came back from lunch break
column7: we played two games. They were the consonant quiz game and BINGO<del> game</del>. We played the BINGO game first. Then
column8: I realized why our teacher said to rememer what the other students did during their summer break because on the paper
column9: there were boxes and inside the boxes
column10: there were instructions like
column11: ""Take out a piece of hair and give it to a student who had a haircut and get a <mod target = sign>signature</mod>."" If you <mod target = had>got</mod> BINGO three times
column12: you had to line up at the front of the class. I did not get three <mod target = BINGO's>BINGOs</mod> so I didn't get a prize<mod target = . But>
column13: but</mod> it was okay. There was another game left for me. It was the consonant quiz. There were group questions. We answered the questions that had <mod target = the>a</mod> hint using only certain consonants. Some were hard but others were very easy. We got a little ball if our group answered the questions correctly. The winning group had five little balls but we only had two balls. So
column14: we were almost in last place. However
column15: there was a benefit to being almost last. There was <mod target = a>the</mod> chocolate that Eun-Seu <mod target = gave>had</mod>. She got it in Russia.<del> But</del> <mod target = there>There</mod> were only two big <mod target = chocolate>chocolates</mod> so our teacher broke it. However
column16: <mod target = people cannot>she could not</mod> break the chocolate into the same size pieces so there were some chocolates that were small and some that were big. Also
column17: there were some that had almonds inside the <mod target = chocolte>chocolate</mod><del>
column18: </del> and some that did not. The winning teams got other presents like stickers. The losing teams did not have anything so the teacher said that the team that had the most balls among the losing teams got to pick the chocolate they wanted first. We were the second group to get the <mod target = chocolte>chocolate</mod>. Min-Yeong used to live in Russia so she had already eaten a lot of <mod target = Russia>Russian</mod> chocolate. She refused to eat the chocolate. I was happy to eat the chocolate. I chose the chocolate that had no almonds inside because I really
column19: really hate almonds. It was just a small piece of chocolate but it was delicious. Today was the first day of school so it was fun. I hope <mod target = everyday>every day</mod> in school will be like today where there is <mod target = lots>a lot</mod> of playing and laughing.":::

column1: 640:::"Today
column2: I went to Bundang where I learn Science. I was excited today because I was going to be getting a fish. Soon

column4: but</mod> now<del>
column5: </del> I will take<del> the</del> responsibility and take care of the fish well. The name of the fish I got is Blood Fin. It is small but very cute. I have seen that kind of fish in the library. I got two fish. Also
column6: I got the food that the fish eat. It smells like moldy bread. Yuck!<del>!</del> However
column7: they liked it. When I brought the fish home

They didn't seem to be bothered by me. I put my glasses near the mini fish bowl when the fish came beside it. The fish looked confused and frightened because of my glasses so it swam away and ignored the glasses. I thought it would be dizzy. I always think of my new fish. I was glad to have fish at home and I hope they will have a baby fish. It will be so cute<mod target = . But>
column11: but</mod> it will be hard to manage too many fish in a small fish bowl. Also
column12: I will have to change the water frequently so I <mod target = wouldn't>may not</mod> have time to do something else.<del> So
column13: </del> I think having an animal can be fun but it is also a great responsibility to not kill the <del>lives of the</del> animals that are weaker and smaller than humans.":::

column1: 642:::"Today
column2: my mom
column3: sister
column4: and I went to Job World where we can experience many different kinds of jobs. There are five jobs you can experience. I went to the airline
column5: physical therapy
column6: beauty shop (hair salon)
column7: military training camp
column8: and 119 safety center rooms. The first place I went to was the airline room. There were two different jobs that I could choose from. I chose to experience the pilot. column9: we went inside a training plane and learned how to handle some other things. The exciting part was next. We practiced what the pilots and stewardess do when there is a problem inside the plane. There was an air bounce outside. We stretched out the arms and went down. I was a fast slider. Now
column10: the second place I went to was the physical therapy (pt) room. We divided into pairs of two. The first time
column11: one person act as a physical therapist and the other person acts as a patient. Next
column12: we switched places. It was not very fun<ins>
column13: </ins> but I still learned many things. The third job was at the beauty shop or hair salon. There was a mannequin that had hair. Also during this experience
column14: we divided into groups. I designed the mannequin's hair with a middle school student. It was a lot easier than I thought it would be. Afterwards
column15: I went to the military training camp. This looked a little boring when I first started and I was right. We used a K2 gun to play a gun game. The gun was very heavy. I was exhausted. Also
column16: I walked around with toy guns. The last experience was the 119 safety center. We learned how to do CPR when a person cannot breathe. It was not real<ins>
column17: </ins> but we did some first-aid treatment to the mannequin. It was a good experience. I learned many things and the experience was thrilling. It was a great day<del>!</del>!":::

column2: I went to Lotte World. I only went there once when I was younger. So<ins>

column6: it was time to go on a real ride. We all rode the Flume Ride<ins>

column10: the second drop was enormous. A lot of water splashed onto me. Oh!":::

column1: 644:::"On Wednesday
column2: the 5th graders and 6th graders had their final exams. I was very nervous that day because I thought the test would be very hard. Last time
column3: all the questions in Korean were writing. There was also a listening passage
column4: which was very long and hard. Although I didn't fail last time

column9: </ins> but I just do not like writing things. Next was math. I hated math. Math was not so hard<ins>
column10: </ins> but I might have made a mistake so I had to be very careful or I might get many problems wrong. I checked everything over two times. However

column15: </ins> but everyone seemed very worried about science. However
column16: I was not very worried because I finished all the questions. I just thought about what <del>will </del>I <ins>will </ins>play after school. We all finished our exams and ate lunch in the cafeteria. I talked with my friends about the exams. Some friends were sad because they got many questions <mod target = worng>wrong</mod>. Others were feeling happy because they did not get any questions wrong<ins>
column17: </ins> yet. But<ins>
column18: </ins> everyone was happy that they could play after school. I was excited<ins>
column19: </ins> too. I did not get anything wrong yet<del>
column20: </del> and I will play because the exams are finished. Now
column21: I'm not nervous about my test. I will never be afraid!<del>!

column1: 645:::"Louis Braille was born in a small town in France in 1809. As a child
column2: he liked to help his father make saddles and harnesses. When he was only three
column3: he grabbed his father's awl. He tried to punch a hole in some leather<ins>
column4: </ins> but the awl slipped and made a hole in his left eye instead. If this happened today
column5: doctors probably could have saved <mod target = Louis's>Louis'</mod> eye. But<ins>
column6: </ins> in 1812
column7: nobody knew how to cure it. Within two years
column8: Louis was blind in both eyes. Also
column9: if this happened today
column10: Louis could have attended special schools and could have learned as much as any other child attending school. But<ins>
column11: </ins> back then
column12: blind people could not be taught to read or write. <mod target = Louis's>Louis'</mod> family took good care of him. They helped him to walk around his house and outside. He also learned to tell people apart by their voices and sounds they made. His oldest sister
column13: Catherine
column14: helped him learn to read. She made letters out of straw<ins>
column15: </ins> so Louis could feel their shapes. He did so well that he was accepted at the local school when he was only 7 years old. He memorized what the teacher said and he was the smartest kid in his class. Yet<ins>
column16: </ins> he was sad because he could not read the school books. So
column17: his parents decided to send him to the National Institute for the Young Blind in Paris. At first
column18: Louis had no friends. The kids in school played tricks on him. After a while
column19: they became friends. Louis read raised letters. But
column20: the letters were too big and it was hard to recognize the words. When he was 12
column21: a man named Barbier came to their school and taught night writing. From that
column22: Louis got an idea and made a new system for letters when he was only 15. The students loved it. They called it Braille. Strangely
column23: the other teachers didn't like it. However
column24: Louis didn't give up. Finally<ins>
column25: </ins> in 1844
column26: the principal allowed students to use Braille in school. Louis Braille was a great inventor. Even now
column27: we use simple Braille for people who are blind.":::

column1: 646:::"On Wednesday
column2: my school friends
column3: three teachers
column4: and I went to the Yeosu Expo. When we finished our school classes
column5: we rode a bus to the Gwangmyeong station. At the station
column6: we waited for the KTX. Finally
column7: the KTX came. It looked like a new KTX. It looked like an airplane. There was a place to plug in<ins>
column8: </ins> too. It was very fast<ins>
column9: </ins> but it looked like it was going slowly. We arrived 3 hours later at Yeosu Expo station. We waited for a minute and entered through gate 3. We first went to GS Caltex Energy field. We answered some OX Quiz and got a fan and water. Then
column10: we went to the LG Pavilion. There
column11: we saw a 3D TV. It was amazing. At last
column12: we took pictures. Also
column13: we went to the SK Telecom Pavilion. There was <mod target = the>a</mod> place to write a message to other people or <ins>to </ins>yourself. It will be delivered 1 year later. I wrote it to myself. It was exciting and mysterious. Finally<ins>
column14: we </ins>went to eat dinner. We ate noodles. At 1<mod target = 0:00pm>10:00 P.M.</mod>
column15: we watched <ins>the </ins>Big-O show. There was one big O in the river and the fascinating show began. Many people watched that show because it was amazing. After the show ended
column16: we took a bus to a condo. The fifth graders slept together in one room and sixth graders slept together in another room. We played until about 11:30 and went to sleep. I was very tired that day because I walked a lot for a very long time.":::

column1: 647:::"Today
column2: I was very excited to go to school. Today was playing day! At <mod target = 2pm>2 P.M.</mod>
column3: our class started to play running man. We divided into teams. There were three teams: blue
column4: orange
column5: and green. I was on the blue team. The rule was to shoot water with the <mod target = waterguns>water guns</mod> on the name tag of a person on the other team. Then
column6: that person would be out and have to go to <del>the </del>prison. Our team won the first game. So<ins>
column7: </ins> we were happy and really excited. However
column8: my clothes were very wet with water. I thought we would win the first game because there were many blue team members left near the end of the first game and there were only about three to five people left on the orange and green teams. The second game was a police and thief game. Our team was the police and other two teams were the thieves. Our team had to get the name tag of a person on the other team to get that person out. However
column9: the thieves could also attack. The thieves could shoot water onto our name tags and take the name tag away. Then
column10: the police would be out. I thought it was an interesting game. The people who were left were almost all the same ones from the first game
column11: but again
column12: our team won! Now
column13: it was the final game. There would<ins> be</ins> 100 points for the winning team. We might <mod target = loose>lose</mod> the game. Everyone tried hard to win. I think we lost in the final game. Then
column14: we might <mod target = loose>lose</mod> the whole thing!! But<ins>
column15: </ins> it is okay because it was a very fun <del>playing </del>day!":::

column1: 648:::"Yesterday
column2: our school 5th graders all <mod target = did>took part in</mod> a singing competition. I was part of a vocal ensemble with some of the boys and girls in my class. I was so nervous. We practiced in our classroom. We did just fine. Now
column3: it was time for the competition. There was one more vocal <mod target = enesemble>ensemble</mod> team from our class and one solo. Our team was second. I thought we would be in the middle<ins>
column4: </ins> but we had to go really early in the competition! The first person who sang a song was Jun-Pyo. We were next. We sang the song right<ins>
column5: </ins> but I hit a wrong note at the end. Our class had one more vocal <mod target = enesemble>ensemble</mod> team<ins>
column6: </ins> so it was okay. They did well with their motions<ins>
column7: </ins> but their voice was too small and because of the clapping
column8: their voices couldn't be heard as well. But
column9: they did well. Our class had one solo
column10: Kim Hyeong-Min. He is very good at singing. He was very good at hitting high-pitched notes. He also had a soft voice<ins>
column11: </ins> so I thought he would definitely win the first place in this competition because he was so different from the other boys. However
column12: there was one more person that also had a soft
column13: high-pitched voice. So
column14: Hyeong-Min was afraid that he wouldn't do well. When he went to sing
column15: he sang very well. He was a little <mod target = nervos>nervous
column16: </mod> so he shook during the song<ins>
column17: </ins> but not that much so I thought he did really well at the competition. When the judges announced the 1st place winners
column18: 2nd place winners
column19: and 3rd place winners
column20: I was surprised. Hyeong-Min got the second prize. Many students in our class thought he got 2nd place because the song he sang was too short. However
column21: it was good. We did not even get into 3rd place. The other team in our class got the 3rd place prize. Yesterday was an okay day.":::

column1: 649:::"There are many types of natural disasters. There are blizzards
column2: tornadoes
column3: and earthquakes. First
column4: a blizzard is a snowstorm that causes many problems. For example
column5: when a blizzard comes
column6: the plants die. Also
column7: the cars and trucks get covered with snow. When people drive during a blizzard
column8: there <mod target = will be>are</mod> many car accidents on the road and the traffic <mod target = will be>is</mod> jammed. So
column9: many people should not go out during a blizzard. If we really have to go out because of an important meeting or something
column10: we have to wear many thick layers of clothes. But
column11: it is safest to not go outside at all during a blizzard. Second
column12: the tornado is a twisting wind. The tornado blows all the people and houses away. So
column13: it is not safe for people to hide outside. People have to go underground. If you don't see anywhere to go underground
column14: go inside a safe building. That is probably safer than wandering off outside. Finally
column15: the earthquake is a very scary natural disaster. The ground shakes like something you would see in a movie. In Japan
column16: there was a big earthquake last year. Many people died from this disaster<del>
column17: </del> and some people lost their families and homes. So
column18: there are some ways to stay safe during an earthquake. When people are inside their house
column19: they have to go under a table or a desk <mod target = that>so they</mod> could protect their heads. When people are outside
column20: they must quickly go inside the nearest building which could make them safer. I hope you learned a little bit more about three natural disasters and how to stay safe.":::

column1: 650:::"On Tuesday
column2: our school had a big festival. My mom sold some things. I played with my friend
column3: Seo-Young. First
column4: we saw students from Kyeong Hee University doing Taekwando. It was surprising. Then<ins>
column5: </ins> we went to take the speed quiz. We got 6 questions right in 1 minute. We did Haligali<ins>
column6: </ins> too. I was not good at it so I lost the game. Also
column7: we danced for a dancing game. I got an F! For lunch
column8: we just ate chicken and ice cream. We did jump roping and broke the record! That was the first time I won. We were walking around when we met So-Min. She is very good at golf. She said <mod target = let's>we should</mod> go golfing. We all golfed. Her swing was perfect. The P.E. teacher gasped. She had a lot of people watching her.<del> ^^</del> Finally
column9: Seo-Young and I went to the swimming pool to swim. However
column10: she did not have a swimsuit<del>s</del> and could not swim. But<ins>
column11: </ins> I had a swimsuit. We just decided to take a shower instead. When I was putting up my clothes
column12: my other friends
column13: Ga-Eun and Yoon-Ha
column14: came inside. So<ins>
column15: </ins> I swam with them. We rode on a Banana Boat. We spent almost 3 hours swimming. We finally went outside when the swimming pool closed. I did not have to shower at home<ins>
column16: </ins> so I was happy. Now
column17: it was time to go home. My mom came and I went home. She was exhausted because she sold things all day while I was busy playing with my friends. Of course
column18: my mom had a bad day
column19: but I thought it was the best day ever!<del>!

column1: 651:::"On Thursday
column2: all the fifth-grade students at our school went on a two-day field trip. I was excited to go on the trip. First
column3: we got on a bus and rode it for almost 2 hours. We first went to the Jeongnimsaji Museum. There were towers
column4: which we glanced at. The next stop was Gungnamgi. We went outside. There were many trees
column5: flowers
column6: and lakes. The air was fresh. Then
column7: we were hungry. We all went to the grass field and ate lunch on the grass. After
column8: we went to another museum. There was <mod target = the>a</mod> grave of an ancient King and Queen. There were also other precious historical things. It was all gold because it had been for the King and Queen. We went to Hanok
column9: which was the place where we were going to sleep. My roommates were Min young
column10: Ha Jin
column11: Hannah
column12: Hae Eun
column13: Han Bee
column14: and Seo Young. We rested for a while and ate dinner. After dinner
column15: we ate some snacks and everyone went up the hill. Every class did something different. Our class played and played. After playing
column16: we went back and played in our own room. My roommates and I played the Zombie Game and other games. Also
column17: everyone ate chicken. We showered and our teacher came around to take <del>a </del>pictures of us. We had to go to bed at <mod target = 11:00PM>11:00P.M</mod>. I slept late. The next day
column18: we ate breakfast and went to another museum where they had very ancient historical things. After that
column19: we went to a garden. There were many types of plants. We looked at them together. Finally
column20: it was time to go back to school. It was a fun<ins>
column21: </ins> but also exhausting trip.":::

column1: 652:::"Today was Sports Day! I was happy when I woke up because it was Sports Day. Our family had a small breakfast. I just ate a snack
column2: my mom and dad ate ramen
column3: and my sister ate rice with laver. At lunch
column4: we all went out to a pizza restaurant where I ate a cheese and tomato sauce pizza. My mom ate cream spaghetti<del>
column5: </del> and my dad ate cream and tomato spaghetti. My sister had the same thing. It was delicious<ins>
column6: </ins> but there was no rice so I didn't feel completely full. After eating Italian food
column7: we went to the place we were supposed to go for Sports Day. The first event was rolling the ball. It was for children. Our family was the blue team. My sister and I went out to play the game. Our team won! Next
column8: there was <mod target = dodgeball>dodge ball</mod> for adults. I don't know who won. Everybody got a price. There was another game for the adults. It was kickball. Our team won again with the score of 11:3. Next<ins>
column9: </ins> it was the O
column10: X Quiz. My sister and I were doing really well in the beginning. However
column11: at the final question
column12: we lost. Then<ins>
column13: </ins> it was the moment I was waiting for
column14: running. I went out. The whistle blew and the race started. I ran as fast as I could. We were winning<ins>
column15: </ins> but the white team put up a good fight and almost won. But<ins>
column16: </ins> there was a foul because one university student
column17: a boy<ins>
column18: </ins> ran with a woman!<del>!</del> But in the end
column19:
our team won. I was proud of my team. 100 cheers for the blue team!
We won!":::

column1: 653:::"On Teacher's Day (May 15th)
column2:
I made a carnation and wrote a letter to my teacher who I had in third and fourth grade.
First
column3:
everyone in my class made a carnation.
It was very easy to make.
First
column4: </ins> with Korean paper (red)
column5:
we made the upper part of the carnation.
Next
column6: with green colored paper
column7:
we made the lower part of carnation and I wrote ""Happy Teacher's Day!"" on it.
Now
column8:
my carnation was done.
It was not very pretty
column9:
but I still thought my last teacher would like it very much.
It was time to write a letter to my teacher.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This is what I wrote:
Dear Yu
column10: Nan-Kyung teacher
column11: Hello teacher
column12: </ins> this is Jang
column13:
Hae-Rin.
Thank you for teaching me for two years.
You were the best teacher I have met.
You're fun
column14:
and we had many parties.
I want to be your student again.
I wish I was in third and fourth grade again so I could meet you almost everyday.
Bye! Have a nice day.
From
column15: Jang
column17:
I wanted to run outside and give it to the teacher.
After lunch
column18: my friend
column19: Hannah
column20:
and I went to the 3rd grade class to meet our teacher from last year.
We both went inside the classroom and gave our teacher the carnation and a letter.
My teacher was very happy.
She said
column21: ""Thank you
column22:
to us.
We talked with our teacher for a while.
She said we were the first students to give her a carnation.
But
column23:
I thought many other students would go and give our teacher a carnation.
And My thoughts were right.
The next day
column24:
she told Hannah and me that some other students visited her and gave her carnations.
I want to be a teacher like her when I grow up.
Teaching might be fun.
Also
column25: </ins> like many teachers
column26:
I can get many carnations and letters every May 15th.
I would be happy and the my students could also be happy to give a carnation and a letter to a teacher
column27:
similar to how I felt when I gave the carnation I made and the letter I wrote to my teacher.
So
column28: my dream is to become a teacher.":::

column1: 654:::"For Children's Day
column2:
our family went to my grandparents' house.
When we got there
column3:
my sister and I went to play at the playground with our grandfather.
When we got to the playground
column4:
we went on the swing.
The playground had a long
column5:
old-fashioned swing that I liked.
It was very fun.
We played for about 30 minutes before we went back inside.
When we were walking to our grandparents' home again
column6: I saw our uncle<del>
column7:
and aunt.
When my sister and I figured out that my two cousins were at my grandparents' house
column8:
we ran inside.
They were sitting and watching television.
We called them and we played games together like Jenga.
We also played dominoes.
My sister got mad because she lost many games.
She did not want to play anymore.
So
column9:
only my two cousins and I played.
We also played Haligali and Yut.
When we were playing Yut
column10: my cousin said
column11:
""Let's play the game in English.""
Actually
column12:
we ended up using Konglish.
It was very fun.
We decided that whoever did not use English would get a penalty.
We laughed and played together.
However
column13:
my sister just played alone.
At first
column14:
she played Haligali with us.
But
column15:
she lost again.
I told my sister she was in 4th place. I wasn't teasing her
column16: but she thought I was<ins>
column17:
so she went outside and played alone.
I could not understand her feelings.
She complained to our mom when we went to our car.
Then
column18:
we went to Costco and bought some food.
My sister wanted to get a Mickey Mouse character pen.
There were only two pens and they cost a lot.
Of course
column19:
my mom said not to buy things that we don't have to have.
She got mad at this and was angry for the rest of the day.
I thought she would be.
We went home after that and rested on our beds.
Although my sister had a horrible Children's Day
column20: I thought it was<ins> a</ins> fabulous day.":::

column1:
655:::"Today was the day before Children's Day.
I was excited.
But
column2:
I was depressed because the younger grades were going to have a school field day.
I saw them playing games and I wanted to do that
column3:
too.
I wanted to be a 4th grader again.
I first thought that our class today was going to be the same as always.
However
column4:
my thoughts were wrong.
My teacher said we would have 15 minutes to play outside.
I was playing when Hyung-Min accidentally pushed me and I got a scratch.
It was a huge scratch.
My friends gasped because it was deep and there was a lot of blood.
It didn't really hurt that much.
I went to the nurse and she made my cut hurt.
But
column5:
it doesn't mean that she made my scratch worse.
My teacher gasped
column6:
too.
But
column7:
it was ok except it hurt when I walked.
We went back inside the classroom.
The first thing our teacher said we were going to do would be a treasure hunt.
I was excited to do that.
I found a paper.
It had a number at the bottom of the paper
column8:
and a word above that.
I found two papers.
They were easy to find.
Later
column9:
we all matched the words in numerical order.
It took a long time because there were about 50 pieces of paper.
It was a fun game.
After we settled down
column10:
the teacher called out the numbers that we had on our paper and gave us snacks.
Each snack was different.
I got a butter waffle and chocolates.
I traded some of my snacks with my friends.
I wanted to trade my snacks for an ice cream
column11:
but I couldn't.
But
column12:
I was still happy to have the other snacks.
I hope everyday is like today.":::

column1:
656:::"I got a cell phone.
I was very happy.
At school
column2:
I told my classmates that I got a cell phone.
My friend
column3: </ins> Hannah<ins>
column4: </ins> told me she wanted a cell phone<ins>
column5:
too.
Her dad said that he would buy one for her on Children's Day
column6:
but her mom disagreed with her dad.
I was not happy to hear that.
I thought that I could communicate with Hannah using our cell phones when she got one
column7:
but my hopes died away.
But
column8:
there are other friends who have cell phones.
Some students asked me for my phone number and they told me their phone numbers.
But
column9:
that's just it.
I felt good because I had a cell phone in my pocket.
I felt like an adult.
My other friend
column10: </ins> Sun Min<ins>
column11:
taught me some of the functions in my cell phone.
She had never used a Motorola cell phone
column12:
but she was an expert at finding hidden functions on my cell phone.
She even sent me a picture through a message.
She is a kind friend.
But
column13:
I'm sad because I am not in her class.
I love my cell phone.
The cell phone is my second best friend.":::

column1:
657:::"Today was a very surprising day.
This is not a joke.
Today
column2: </ins> when my class was walking to our school cafeteria
column3:
we saw an ambulance and a firetruck.
Some of us thought our school had a fire.
Others thought it was just training for what happens when there is a fire.
I was very curious about this.
So
column4:
I asked the other class students about it while eating lunch.
They told me that during science class
column5:
they went out to pick some ants.
Then
column6:
they saw a fire in the schoolyard and their teacher went to get a fire extinguisher. Many other teachers also helped and the they also called 119.
When the fire was all put out
column7: the police car
column8: ambulance
column9:
and firetruck came.
I was relieved that nobody was hurt.
It was big news to almost everybody we knew today that we had a fire at school.
After school
column10: </ins> when I was playing
column11:
two 3rd graders told me that the cause of the fire was because of a boy.
One 4th grade boy
column12: </ins> who was alone<ins>
column13:
was playing with a lighter.
He accidentally tripped while playing and the fire got started.
He ran away quickly so he did not get hurt.
Many students don't know who he is
column14:
including myself.
I want to know who he his.
He should have learned a great lesson.
I will also be more careful with fires in the future.":::

column1: 658:::"Today
column2:
the fifth graders all went on a field trip.
I was very excited to go because I like going on field trips.
We each had a mini book.
We had to write down the answers to each of the questions.
It was not too hard.
We divided into groups of 8 people per group.
I have been to this museum before and it is huge.
I heard that this museum is the biggest museum in Korea.
There were not many people there because everybody else was in school.
First
column3:
our group went to the Prehistoric and Ancient History Gallery.
There were many artifacts that were used during the Paleolithic
column4: Neolithic
column5:
and Bronze Age.
The most important artifact from the Paleolithic Age is the hand ax.
The hand ax was used to hunt animals.
The most important artifact from the Neolithic Age was the Comb-Pattern Pottery.
At that time
column6:
people used the Pottery to make foods and store them.
I think the most important artifact from the Bronze Age is the Bronze Ritual Artifact.
This artifacts shows how people grew rice during that time.
Also
column7:
we looked at Baekje and Silla.
One important artifact from Beckje was the Gold Diadem Ornaments.
Beckje was different than the other countries because they put Gold Diam Ornaments inside the grave of their king.
Silla's important artifact was the Horse Rider-shaped Vessel.
Second
column8:
we went to the Medieval and Early Modern History Gallery.
We looked at the Celdon Roof-End Tiles that were used in the Goryeo time period.
The picture that was formed on the roof was astonishing.
We answered the questions and ate our lunch and snacks outside.
We had only one page left to answer.
We had to go to the Outdoor Exhibits Area to answer the questions.
Yu Jin and I went there first to find out the answers.
There was the Great Bell of Bosingak.
It was not a duplicate.
It was real and one employee that worked in this museum told us it was national treasure number 2.
We found all the answers after lots of walking and walking.
When we were going back
column9:
our 6 other group members also came to the Outdoor Exhibits Area where we had walked for a long time.
We called them and showed them our answers.
We were almost the first group who had finished writing down all the answers.
I was proud of my group.
Cooperation wins the game!":::

column1: 659:::"Today in school
column2:
our class had a special day.
It was fun.
In the morning
column3:
our teacher gave us cocoa.
It was delicious.
But
column4:
some people said it was not delicious.
I was surprised about drinking cocoa early in the morning.
Also
column5:
our teacher gave us choco-pie.
It was kind of strange.
Why would she give us all these things?
Today
column6:
we were supposed to have math for two hours.
I hate math.
But instead
column7:
we went outside for 30 minutes and played dodge ball and soccer.
We had many good players on our team.
So
column8:
we finally hit the last person on the other team and won the game.
I felt proud of my team.
Next
column9:
we ate lunch.
Lunch was more delicious than it is on other days.
I ate very quickly.
Our teacher said to write down why we thought our teacher gave us a special day.
Everybody's answers were pretty similar.
However
column10:
there was only one person who got the right answer.
The answer was just because my teacher loves us.
It was really simple.
I thought there would be a more complex reason than that.
But
column11:
I was wrong.
But
column12:
I did not care about getting it right.
I just loved our special day.
I want to have a special day everyday!":::

column1: 660:::"Today
column2:
I was very excited.
My teacher was going to come to my house.
So
column3: today
column4:
everybody in our school did not go to school.
I woke up a bit late today.
It was so good.
I felt free.
At about 9:00 A.M.
column5:
my mom called me and asked me if I wanted to go to AK Plaza with her to
buy a chair
column6: bed
column7:
and desk for my six year old cousin.
I agreed to go out with her.
We got dressed and went out.
We met my aunt and went to the mall together.
We arrived just in time. The mall opened right away.
All the employees bowed and we were welcomed.
We went upstairs and looked at many types of furniture with different designs.
I wanted to buy everything
column8:
but that would have cost a lot of money.
After spending a lot of time thinking
column9:
we finally came to a conclusion.
I think my cousin has all the luck.
I said to my mom that I had to also buy a new bed because every time I sit on it
column10:
it makes a strange sound.
So
column11:
my mom looked at some beds.
I wanted to get a bunk bed.
But
column12:
my mom absolutely disagreed with me.
I didn't like anything else
column13:
so I did not buy anything.
When we ended our shopping
column14:
it was lunch time.
We went to a spaghetti restaurant.
I have been there many times.
The tomato spaghetti is very delicious.
Also
column15: the combination pizza was delicious<ins>
column16:
too.
Although there was crab on the pizza
column17:
which I did not like.
Overall
column18:
I like this restaurant.
I will come here again next time.
We went back home.
At 5:00 P.M.
column19:
my teacher came to our house.
We had a short talk and my teacher looked at my room.
I think she was pretty impressed.
She looked surprised at my insect specimen.
The insect's name is Cyclommatus metallifer metallifer.
I thought it was pretty surprising
column20:
too.
At 5:30 P.M.
column21:
she left to go to my friend's house.
My mom was very relieved.
I thought it was a fine visit.Today was a fine day.":::

column1: 661:::"Today
column2:
our class had P.E. class.
The other students in the 5th grade told me that we would have to run 1 km in our next P.E. class.
I was shocked by that news.
When I woke up this morning and looked outside
column3:
and I was very happy.
It was raining!
So
column4: in P.E. class
column5:
we played a game.
It was called ""Catch the Duck"".
I will explain how the game is played.
First
column6:
we choose the tagger.
When the teacher says
column7: ""Duck 3
column8: goose 1
column9:
the tagger chooses three ducks and touches their heads.
Next
column10:
the tagger chooses one goose. The goose is like a catcher.
The goose can run to any part of the circle where the students are sitting to try and catch the ducks who are standing up.
Meanwhile
column11:
the tagger and the ducks have to run away and sit down where the other ducks sat.
But
column12:
they cannot sit again in the same place where they sat before.
It was a great game.
But
column13: </ins> instead of <del>not </del>running 1 km
column14:
we had to pretend that there was a jump-rope and jump for five minutes.
First
column15:
I thought that it would be a piece of cake.
But
column16: </ins> after about <mod target = 2>two</mod> minutes
column17:
my legs were in pain.
After finishing the five minutes of jump roping
column18:
I was sweating a lot even though it was cold today.
We all went to our seats.
Everybody got a mini book.
I was fed up with books.
I already had many books at school.
However
column19:
the P.E. teacher made all the students in our class look inside while the teacher explained more about the book.
There were many things to do like writing down what we did.
We have to exercise everyday
column20: write down what we did
column21:
and get one of our parents to sign it.
It seems like it will be a long process.
If we lose our books
column22:
we'll get into a big trouble.
We have to pay 10
column23:
000 won and buy the book again.
Our parents wouldn't be happy in that situation
column24:
so the teacher told us not to lose them.
So today
column25:
I have to exercise. I don't know exactly what I will do yet.
I was thinking about running for 5 to 10 minutes.
It would be very easy
column26:
but I don't know if I could do it everyday.
What else could I do to exercise?":::

column1: 662:::"Today at school
column2:
I was very excited because I was going to be in our school news called ""CCAM.""
After school
column3: Yu-Jin
column4: Sung-Eun
column5:
and I went to the room where we were going to film the news with a new teacher who was going to help us record everything.
Yu-Jin and I were the anchors and Sung-Eun was the reporter. At first
column6: I did not smile at all<ins>
column7:
so the teacher said that it looked like we were in a fight.
But
column8: </ins> as we recorded over and over again
column9:
my skills improved a bit and I tried harder to smile.
In contrast to me
column10:
Yu-Jin had the opposite problem of laughing too hard. It was the complete opposite between her and me.
When we read the words incorrectly
column11:
we kept trying harder and harder.
So
column12:
there were many recordings.
Being an anchor was hard
column13:
but I did not feel nervous.
Since the mike can record sounds that are small
column14: </ins> like a door that is slowly opening
column15:
we had to do everything over one more time when we heard some other sounds in the background.
When the anchor parts were done
column16: Sung-Eun
column17: who was a reporter<ins>
column18:
came out and said her part all on her own.
It did not even take a minute because there is only one reporter.
Her voice was a little small
column19:
but it was beautiful.
When we finished
column20: we cleaned up<ins>
column21: </ins> <del>and </del>turned off all the lights<ins>
column22:
and pulled up the screen.
The recording had taken us about two hours.
Time had passed very quickly.
It was about 5:30 P.M.
All of us were tired.
We went to the Multi-Media room to take a break.
The teacher gave us two muffins.
We thanked him and ate it after splitting it.
Then
column23:
we were on the computer for about five to ten minutes.
By then
column24: </ins> it was already 6:00<ins>
column25:
so we said bye to our teacher.
It was my first day of recording
column26:
but it was fun.
Next time
column27: I wish I could smile more.":::

column1: 663:::"Today<ins>
column2: </ins> I woke up very excited because my friend<ins>
column3: </ins> Hannah<ins>
column4: </ins> was going to come to my house. I kept asking my mom when Hannah was going to come. She was a little mad because I also kept asking her to call Hannah's mom to tell her to come to our house quickly. My mom said to do our homework and study first because when Hannah comes
column5:
my sister and I would not have much time to study more.
At about 3:00 p.m.
column6: my mom got a phone call from Hannah's mom. My mom told my sister and <mod target = I>me</mod> that we would meet Hannah at Outback Steakhouse. My sister and I kept urging to my mom to drive faster. Finally
column7: we arrived. At the restaurant
column8:
my mom ordered some food.
When the food came out
column9: Hannah's mom called my mom to tell her that Hannah had arrived. I ran out quickly and greeted her. She was holding an icebox. When I saw it
column10: I quickly realized that she brought an ice cream cake with her. I was thrilled that she brought it because I have never eaten an ice cream cake before. Hannah and I talked a little bit about what we would do when we got to my home. I think she was just as thrilled as I was because<ins>
column11: </ins> even though we go to each other's houses often
column12:
today was different. Hannah would sleep at my home and go home tomorrow afternoon.
We all ate the food quickly. When my sister went to a class
column13: Hanna and I played board games while waiting. We got permission to bring one of the board games home. It was very fun. <del>But

column1: 665:::"Fifth grade is finally over<del>
column2: </del> and at thirteen<ins> years old</ins>
column3: I'm one of the oldest students at school. Now
column4: I don't have to be scared of the sixth grade girls<del>
column5: </del> and I can talk down to any student I meet. One time
column6: I accidentally talked down to a sixth grade girl who <mod target = is>was</mod> very short<del>
column7:
and I had to say sorry whenever I saw her. It was a nightmare.
There are many benefits for being in the sixth grade
column8: but I think I miss fifth grade a lot. I'm in class 6<del>
column9: </del> and there are rumors that a bunch of boys who are really mean are all in our class! <del>And </del><mod target = after>After</mod> one year
column10: I will go to <del>a </del>middle school. I don't want to go to middle school because it is too short<del>
column11: </del> and I think it will make me feel like I am getting older and older. I don't want to be an adult
column12: I want to be a child forever. Even though it is just a dream
column13:
I really want to stay young forever after I read ""Peter Pan.""
When I finally become a real sixth grader
column14: I don't want to forget my friends who were in my fifth grade class. I hope that we will meet and play for a while<ins>
column15: </ins> even after the first day of sixth grade. Also
column16: I want to avoid the boys who I mentioned. They are really bad bullies<del>
column17: </del> and even hit girls <mod target = with>for</mod> no reason. I hate them<del>
column18: </del> and I want to avoid them so that I won't get in big trouble. <del>And </del><mod target = lastly>Lastly</mod>
column19: I want to be a relay runner during field day in the fall. It will be a lot of fun! I am really bad at running
column20: so I could only be the relay runner when I was in fifth grade. <del>And </del><mod target = that's>That's</mod> one of the reason<ins>s</ins> why I loved fifth grade. <del>And </del><mod target = during>During</mod> the sixth grade
column21:
we will do a traditional Korean fan dance. All of us must wear a hanbok and dance with a Korean fan. I really want to do that.
It will be a lot of fun when I go to the sixth grade!":::

column1: 666:::"Today is Valentine's Day. The girls in my class decided to make hand-made chocolates and give them to someone they love. But<ins>
column2: </ins> I didn't. <mod target = Because>That's because</mod> first of all
column3: I don't have any time to make chocolate. <del>And </del><mod target = second>Second</mod>
column4: I don't have someone who I secretly like. But<ins>
column5: </ins> why was Valentine's Day even started? At first
column6: I thought it was a holiday that chocolate companies made like ""Pepero Day"" on November 11th
column7:
but it actually comes from ancient history.
2
column8: </ins>000 years ago in Greece
column9: Feburary 14th was the day of love. It was the day of Juno
column10: the goddess of woman and marriage. Many young unmarried men and women gathered together<del>
column11: </del> and put their names into a jar. Then
column12: they stayed together until February 14th of the next year. Usually
column13: they would get married and have a happy marriage. But
column14: the happiness ended when Emperor Claudius declared a lot of wars. He needed lots of unmarried men to make strong soldiers for a large army. People who disobeyed this law were killed. There was a priest named Valentine<del>
column15: </del> and he helped many couples get married secretly. However
column16: he got caught by Claudius and was sent to jail. When he was in jail
column17: he fell in love with the jailer's daughter. The day before he was killed
column18: he wrote a love letter to her and signed it
column19: ""From your love<ins>
column20: </ins> Valentine."" That was how Valentine's Day was started. What a touching story. My friends succeeded on making chocolates and giving it to the boys whom they love. But<ins>
column21: </ins> I think only giving love and gifts to each other is useless. Like we do for other holidays
column22: we must think about the meaning of Valentine's <mod target = day>Day</mod> and then celebrate love. Happy Valentine's Day!":::

column1: 667:::"On Saturday
column2: I went to COEX with my mom. There was a Vision 2020 youth leadership forum at the auditorium. We were there for half of the day. Well
column3: I don't have a specific dream. I have lots of dreams; announcer
column4: artist
column5: diplomat... <del>And </del><mod target = there>There</mod> are things that would be good for a hobby<del>
column6: </del> and there are things that I really want to make<del> it</del>. But
column7: my parents want me to become a diplomat<del>
column8: </del> and I don't think I would be right for that. So
column9:
I came here to figure out my dream and how I can do things with my parents.
There were many professors who you can only hear from once in a lifetime: Chang-Gyu Hwang
column10: </ins> the national chief technology officer; Robert Root-Bernstein
column11: professor at Michigan State University; Jang-Sup Shin
column12: professor at the National University of Singapore; Jeannie Suk
column13: the first Asian woman tenured <ins>as a </ins>professor at Harvard University; and Dennis W. Hong
column14: a professor at Virginia Tech. My favorite speech was from professor Jeannie Suk who told us stories. She talked about her life from when she was young to now<del>
column15: </del> and how she wanted to be a ballerina. But<ins>
column16: </ins> her parents stopped her<del>
column17: </del> and there <mod target = were>was</mod> a huge fight between her parents and her. Her family dealt with the conclusion
column18: which were based on their opinions
column19: and she is now a professor at Harvard University today. At first
column20: I felt kind of bored because I didn't pay any attention to the forum. But after lunch
column21: it became really interesting. At the end
column22: other Chungdahm branch students and I did an interview. Also
column23: I had another interview from a different newspaper reporter
column24: too. Mom said
column25: ""You are so famous
column26: honey."" Of course<ins>
column27: </ins> that was a joke. I wish this event will become the halfway point of my life.":::

column1: 668:::"Winter vacation is finally over<del>
column2: </del> and I returned to normal life. But<ins>
column3: </ins> it is still hard to wake up early in the morning because I always woke up late during my vacation. <del>And </del>I'm really busy because of different academies and homework. Even though spring vacation is coming up soon
column4:
I miss my winter vacation already.
And We will have been going to school at 10:00 A.M. because of the cold waves. I agree that it was too cold yesterday. And My mom said that a cycle of three cold days and four warm days will come. It became really rare in the last 50 years because of pollution and changes in the weather from global warming. My lips are getting cracked and bloody. We have to be careful when we are going back home because the roads are slippery. I hate cold weather. But
column5:
the most terrible thing is that sometimes we can't do P.E. class because of the weather!
However
column6: there are also some advantages
column7: too. We can go outside and have a snow fight with our friends during lunch time. There is plenty of time to play outside. Yesterday
column8: our classroom and boys from another classroom had a snow fight; girls versus boys. It really hurt when one of the boys from my class accidentally hit my cheek with a snowball that had a stone in it. But<ins>
column9:
it was still really fun. And Our teacher gave us extra time to play.
Two weeks later is graduation. The sixth graders will go to middle school
column10: </del> and we will be the highest grade in elementary school. After one year
column11: we will go to the middle school
column12: too. I wish that time will stop when we go to middle school. I want to play with the same friends in school<del>
column13: </del> and I want to study with them. But<ins>
column14: </ins> it will be good to be in the highest grade at school. None of the other grades can harm us. Yay!":::

column1: 669:::"What did you do on New Year's <mod target = day>Day</mod>? Usually
column2: many families will go to their relatives' houses<del>
column3: </del> or go to their grandparents' house and have a great time.<ins> </ins>But this year
column4: our family spent New Year's <mod target = day>Day</mod> differently than we have before. Instead of going to another place
column5: we just stayed home. But<ins>
column6:
I think it was better than any other New Year's Day that I've celebrated!
When I woke up
column7: it was really different. Our family is always really busy in the morning because we need to get ready to go to our grandparents' house and take stuff. But today
column8: it felt like just another regular day. I was really disappointed at first because my sister and I usually get to play the whole day with our cousins. Mom said
column9: ""We don't have to be busy every year. Today
column10:
I decided that we can just stay home and do something else. It can be fun to do something new.""
So
column11: we studied for a few hours. We were still frustrated that we weren't going to our grandparents' house. Then
column12: mom allowed us to watch some movies. We watched the ""Simpsons"" and ""Harry Potter."" I felt like something was wrong because mom never allows us to watch movies. It was really fun
column13: so we watched the movies for about <mod target = 3>three</mod> hours. I wish I could watch them again now
column14: but mom put those things away immediately so that we can't see where she keeps them. We ate pizza for dinner. It was really good to see our whole family eating pizza together. Father and my brother came late because of their work. But<ins>
column15:
no one said a word because everyone was concentrating too much on eating.
Well
column16: it was different from the way we normally spend New Year's <mod target = day>Day</mod>
column17: but it was still really fun.":::

column1: 670:::"On Wednesday
column2: my friend and I went to ski camp. At first
column3: we were not that close to each other
column4: so we just sat down and slept. We woke up at <mod target = 6:00am>6:00 A.M</mod>. We arrived at Daemueng Vivaldi Park. We were surprised at the size of the resort<del>
column5: </del> and there was also an Ocean World. But<ins>
column6: </ins> because of the cold temperature
column7: we couldn't ride the slides which are connected to the outside of the camp. We ate lunch at the lodgings<del>
column8:
and went outside. It was all covered with snow!
We skied for four hours a day. Our teacher taught us how to ski faster and more smoothly. Not just that
column9: but he also told us how to ride safely. ""Safety is the most important thing when we are skiing
column10: he said
column11: and I also agree with him. But
column12: I can't enjoy the feeling when we are riding a lift. When I see the ground
column13: I can't even move. It is really scary. When I saw the sky
column14: my body almost fell out of the lift
column15: so I couldn't see anything. It was really fun when we speed up and move up and down. The boys in our group always went downhill when teacher was not watching them. When you go downhill
column16: you go so fast that it is almost impossible to stop. I tried once
column17:
but it was too fast for me.
At night
column18: we went to <del>the </del>Ocean World. But<ins>
column19: </ins> my friend said she will not go because she hates swimming. So
column20: I just played by myself for thirty minutes<del>
column21: </del> and I met my friends in the lodgings and played with them for <mod target = 2>two</mod> hours. It was really great! Except<ins>
column22:
there were two girls who kept using swear words to others and grumbling. They also pushed me when I was sitting on the lift.
The second day
column23: we went skiing for <mod target = 4>four</mod> hours again. Our group divided into two teams because there were too many people. There was a boy who was really rude to the girls. So
column24: the oldest girl scolded him. It was really delightful to watch. At night
column25: we went downstairs and rode some things like the merry-go-round. But<ins>
column26:
there were only PC rooms so most of the girls just went back to the lodgings and watched TV.
Then
column27: </ins> it was the final day. I really miss the place now. At that time
column28: I was watching TV with my roommates. It was the last camp of 2011 and I hope all things <mod target = goes>go</mod> well in 2012.":::

column1: 671:::"Today
column2: I went to <ins>a </ins>science academy to learn about different subjects you learn in middle school: natural laws
column3: chemistry
column4: biology
column5: and earth science. Today
column6: we learned about earth science. <del>And </del><mod target = because>Because</mod> of ski camp
column7: I came on Monday for <ins>a </ins>make-up lesson. There were three boys in the class and they looked at me like an animal in the zoo. They asked me some questions and one boy said
column8: ""Well
column9: you are different from those tattletale girls. You can be in our group."" What on earth they were talking about? They talk like they are in some kind of secret organization. But<ins>
column10:
they all looked nice and funny.
We learned about rocks. At first
column11: I thought everything was the same and that rocks are boring. In society
column12: we often call a person who is stupid ""rock head."" So<ins>
column13: </ins> rocks are usually associated with a bad meaning. But now
column14: I think rocks are really important to us. A long time ago
column15: all the continents were united. But
column16: because of earthquakes and volcanic eruptions
column17: they broke apart. After the volcanic eruptions
column18: the magma started to get solid. Then
column19: many rocks like granite emerged. There are three general kinds of rocks: igneous rocks
column20: metamorphic rocks
column21: and sedimentary rocks. Other things are also related to their names. For example
column22: sedimentary rocks are made by the layers of solid rock that have become stuck and joined together because of heavy pressure. Then<ins>
column23: </ins> we learned about how to tell different rocks apart. For example
column24:
if we can scratch rocks on
a streak plate
column25: </del> and it draws a line
column26: it has a weak hardness according to the Mohs scale of mineral hardness. But<ins>
column27: </ins> when the streak plate gets scratched
column28: that rock<ins>'</ins>s hardness is strong. I really learned a lot today!":::

column1: 672:::"On Tuesday
column2: my sister and I went to a CEO camp. It is about learning how CEOs think and follow<ins>ing</ins> those who helped Korea to become stronger! I already went there once
column3: so I felt more excited than usual. Also
column4: it changed into two days
column5: so we could learn and play more. At first
column6: everyone was really quiet because we didn't know each other. Even my active sister was just waiting quietly. But
column7:
everything changed because of the mission.
When we arrived at the rest area
column8: we had to take a photo of five people levitating (that means to take a direct picture of people jumping)
column9: take a ghoulish photo of someone
column10: and solve nonsense <mod target = quizes>quizzes</mod>. It was really hard. We were not friends at first
column11: but after taking pictures
column12:
we were busy talking about how to complete our mission. We did four more missions during this camp.
We went to Lotte
column13: Samsung
column14: Hyundai
column15: Hou-sung
column16: and Han Hua. These are the top companies which made Korea popular. For example
column17: Samsung
column18: Lotte
column19: and Hyundai were pioneers in making some of the best industrial products. <del>And </del>Housung makes electronics for the whole country. <del>And </del>Han Hua makes bombs. The bombs are used to help make tunnels or other things that need many hands. <del>And </del><mod target = the>The</mod> companies<ins>'</ins> first principals were really positive and none of them ever gave up. I really respect them and want to help them make Korea become the strongest country in the world! At night
column20:
we played all night with our roommates and ate pizza for dinner.
It was the best camp I have ever been to in my life! Also
column21: each team had to make its own newspaper<del>
column22: </del> and whichever team wins will win 700
column23: 000 won! Our team <del>did </del>really work<ins>ed</ins> hard on that newspaper
column24: not just to win the prize. But<ins>
column25: </ins> I still wish that we will win and get the prize.":::

column1: 673:::"The first day of 2012 was great for me! I hadn't got my birthday present and Christmas present because everyone had been too busy. So
column2: my mom said that this year
column3:
she will buy both of us two presents.
After the church service was over
column4: my mom
column5: my twin sister
column6: and I went to Dongdaemoon street and went shopping at APM. We loved the designs and clothes
column7: but it was mostly for teenagers. <del>And </del><mod target = the>The</mod> children sizes were too small for my sister and me. So
column8: we went to other shops to look for clothes. We went to a shop (I can't remember the name)<del>
column9: </del> and there were tons of clothes for us! But
column10: we couldn't find something that we really loved. <del>And </del>I don't like shopping because I don't like trying things on at the shop and see what kind of clothes fits me. It took <mod target = 2>two</mod> hours to buy my sister's clothes. After that
column11: we ate hamburger and ice-cream at the food store. It was really delicious
column12: but I still needed to find clothes. At first
column13: I told my mom that I wanted to buy something else instead of clothes
column14: but my mom said I must. So
column15: I felt worried. It was 6 pm
column16: almost night. We had to go early because we also had to buy my sister's sneakers. Then
column17: I found a great gray T-shirt at the front of the shop! I really loved the T-shirt right away. I tried it on and it fit perfectly! So
column18: we bought the T-shirt and also went to another shop to buy my sister's sneakers. After she chose her sneakers
column19:
we went home.
We put out everything we bought at the store. Most of them were my sister's. I bought only the gray T-shirt. I will wear that shirts in the summer. I wish that summer will come quickly. It was the best day so far in 2012!":::

column1: 675:::"I love to listen to Little Fox stories. There are lots of things to watch and everything is interesting. But
column2: there are two things I always watch when it comes out. They are Lemonade Detective and Kids Central. Today
column3:
I want to introduce these two series to you.
In Lemonade Detective
column4: Maggie starts a lemonade stand to earn money for horseback riding lessons. But<ins>
column5: </ins> Maggie's money suddenly disappears. Maggie's cousin Henry and his friend Cole help Maggie find her money. After finding Maggie's money together
column6: the three of them also form the Lemonade Detectives to help their neighbors solve mysteries. I wish our town had kid detectives like them. Then<ins>
column7: </ins> they could help us when something is missing or there is a big mystery. If there is a group of kid detectives
column8: I want to be a part of it<ins>
column9: </ins> too! Then
column10:
we could solve mysteries like the three Lemonade Detectives. Wouldn't that be so cool?
And In Kids Central
column11: Nina
column12: Izzie
column13: Bobby
column14: Jason
column15: and Ethan are in Kids Central after school because their parents are working late. They play
column16: cook
column17: and make fun things like bug spray<del>
column18: </del> or cook spaghetti. In our school
column19: we have after school programs like dancing<del>
column20: </del> or cooking lessons. But<ins>
column21:
I think it will be more fun to have Kids Central in our school because I want to do everything together and do it with my friends.
I hope many friends will be able to visit the Little Fox programs and watch lots of stories and animations!":::

column1:
676:::"Today is Christmas! I can't believe it! Today is finally the day that I have been waiting for.
But
column2: because the temperature was too low
column3:
we couldn't go sledding.
So
column4: my twin sister and I went to <del>the </del>church very upset. I couldn't concentrate<ins>
column5: </ins> even though I was the lucky guy who was chosen as the representative to pray<del>
column6:
and it was Christmas!
Can you imagine this? Does anyone just stay at home when it is Christmas? Everyone will go to a festival or to the movies. My friend said that she will go to Times Square to go shopping with her parents. I really envy her. I felt really upset with my parents
column7:
too. My parents never allow my sister and I to play outside when it is the weekend.
So when church was finished
column8: we sighed and were determined to finish our homework. But
column9: when we arrived at home
column10: our mom was not at home. So
column11: my sister and I played cellphone games while we waited for her. After 30 minutes
column12: she arrived <del>at </del>home. She said
column13: ""If you guys work hard until <mod target = 5:00pm>5:00 P.M.</mod>
column14: I will let you guys go sledding. Okay?"" We grinned. Finally
column15:
our family can go to ride a sled and have a fun time together!
However
column16: when it was 4:55 <mod target = pm>P.M.</mod>
column17: the winds blew harder and harder. We cannot even go to the living room because it was too cold <del>in </del>there. Only our bedroom was warm. So
column18: even we gave up on going sledding. Wheew..<ins>.</ins><del> </del>today was terrible. But
column19: because we couldn't go sledding
column20: my mom let us watch three TV programs! We can't watch TV very often because it interferes with our studying. So
column21: <mod target = it>we</mod> can usually only watch it once a month. So
column22:
it was a really amazing event for us. I was just finished watching ""Gag Concert"" and am writing in this diary now.
Well
column23:
it was quite a funny Christmas for our family.
Merry Christmas
column24: </ins> everyone!":::

column1:
677:::"Do you know any children reporters? I am one. I am the Kids Times reporter.
Yesterday
column2: only five reporters went to the Gueng-Gi children's museum. So
column3: I didn't go to school yesterday. But<ins>
column4: </ins> my friends said it was<ins> a</ins> really great day at school. They wrote letters to each other
column5: watched a movie
column6: and ate <mod target = spaggehtti>spaghetti</mod>. At first
column7: I was really depressed because I love those things
column8:
but now I think I was totally wrong and it was much better to go to the museum after going there.
At 11 A.M.
column9: all of us gathered at the cafe and went inside. It was awesome! There were some machines that make blowing sounds<del>
column10: </del> and a gold machine on the wall. <del>And
column11: </del><mod target = there>There</mod> were other rooms about different kinds of science; our body
column12: the Han river<ins>
column13:
and water..
But
column14: </ins> the most special part was that we did all of these things with disabled children. They were really noisy at first before we started the campaign. So
column15: we thought we really don't want to report on these kids<del>
column16: </del> and some didn't even to take part in this campaign.<ins> </ins>But
column17: once we saw the disabled children doing a mime
column18: it was awesome! They performed it just like professional singers and dancers would. But<ins>
column19: </ins> there was a big accident. When we took a photo
column20: one reporter who is only <ins>in the </ins>first grade sat next to a disabled child. Then
column21: the child began to hit <ins>the </ins>reporter hard because of where she <mod target = say>sat</mod>. So
column22: our reporter cried and the disabled child's mom took her to the bathroom. I am not the one who was hit
column23: but I felt sorry for her and her mom. <mod target = Because>That's because</mod> <del>then
column24: </del>everyone began to say that disabled <mod target = childrens>children</mod> are useless. I don't think so. It is all because of our stereotypes. We have to trash those bad biases. They are just different from us. Different is not wrong. That was the best lesson I learned from yesterday's trip to the museum.":::

column1:
678:::"""Tomorrow~Tomorrow~ The sun will come out tomorrow~!""
Annie's hopeful song during a time of despair still remains in my ear.
Yesterday
column2:
I met the red-haired Annie at the Sejong Center for the Performing Arts.
Annie never lost her bright image and delivered hope to other people even though she was abandoned in an orphanage.
She sang as she left the orphanage's nasty director and met the billionaire
column3:
Mr. Warbucks.
The world of adults is very complex! Annie helped deliver hope to President Roosevelt who was worried about the Great Depression.
I felt happy and joyful when Annie finally became Mr. Warbucks' stepdaughter.
Parents
column4: warm house
column5:
delicious foods... I have many more things than Annie.
But
column6:
I always take these things for granted and never feel thankful to the people who give these things to me. I gave Annie a big smile.
While I was going home
column7: I told my mom that I feel really envious of Annie because she has a really beautiful voice. Then<ins>
column8:
my mom said she also has a voice that delivers happiness . She said that I must learn to speak more softly because I always speak in a gruff manner.
I will go to the school broadcasting studio when I start the sixth grade.
I will try hard to make a voice that can give happiness to others like Annie.
Merry Christmas
column9: </ins> Annie<del>~</del>! <del>And </del><mod target = also>Also
column10: </mod> Merry Christmas<ins>
column11: </ins> everyone!":::

column1: 679:::"Today
column2: at <mod target = 10:30am>10:30 A.M.</mod>
column3: I took a big exam named the ITQ Excel test. I must pass this test to receive a certificate of qualification. I studied and learned about Excel for about four months. But
column4: even though I studied hard
column5: it was hard to make a filter
column6: chart
column7: and graphs. Also
column8: at first
column9: I tried to quit Excel and start using ICDL
column10: which is also another test that can be taken to move up to the highest level. But<ins>
column11: </ins> two days before the test
column12: my teacher asked me if I was going to pass the Excel test. I tried to say ""Yes<ins>
column13: </ins>"" but my mom said I must pass because of all my effort over the past four months. So today
column14:
I didn't go to church and went to A-Huen middle school instead to take the test. Many of my friends from school also came to take other kinds of test such as PowerPoint and Internet.
Finally
column15: it started. I can't remember everything because I only practiced ICDL for the last two days before the test. Ten minutes later
column16: I was falling into despair. I accidentally pushed some keys and everything initialized. Even though I pressed the Ctrl+Z keys
column17: which undoes things
column18: it didn't work. About 20 minutes later
column19: I finally made the main graphs. I still needed to do five more things. There were many problems while I was trying to complete the test. Also
column20: I had only about 30 minutes left to finish everything. Then
column21: I forgot the most important part. I thought that this part wouldn't be on the test
column22: so I didn't practice it before. After 20 minutes of going through everything in the Excel file
column23: I was finally finished with it! After the test
column24: my mom bought me chocolate to cheer me up!":::

column1: 680:::"My dream is to become a diplomat. One day
column2: I read a book about Korea's first UN Secretary General.<ins> </ins>He was born on the day when 4.19 began. It was a really difficult time in Korea. But
column3:
he made a tape by getting help from immigrants working in the factories. He learned English by practicing everyday. He was very humble and always gave help to his friends. He was so nice! All of these things helped him to become the UN Secretary General!
So
column4: I also made my dream to become a diplomat because of him. I wish he could be my mentor. But
column5: such a famous person couldn't give any help to a young girl in fifth grade. So
column6: I will now try hard to learn English more directly and converse with native English <del> </del>speakers. Now
column7: I am going to Chung Dahm Institute every Tuesday and Thursday. Even though I am in a high level
column8: I will not be proud of myself until I learn more carefully <mod target = to>from</mod> my teacher<ins>
column9: </ins> Steven<ins>
column10: </ins> and sound just like him. I wish that I will succeed and achieve my dream.":::

column1: 681:::"Last Friday
column2: one of the broadcasters from last year came to my class and said
column3: ""Hey! Please come quickly to the studio. Bring your friends who were also requested."" I was really thrilled and excited because the results were going to be revealed soon. Everyone who was requested came to the studio. ""The announcer is... Kim You Kyoung from Class 3!"" After the teacher made the announcement
column4: I couldn't believe it. Then I shouted
column5:
""Hooray!"" I just became an announcer. ""I will try hard to become a good leader. I will work hard!"" I thought in my mind.
So today
column6: I came to school by <mod target = 8:10am>8:10 A.M</mod>. Usually<ins>
column7: </ins> I go to school by <mod target = 8:30am>8:30 A.M</mod>. But
column8: I came early and went to the studio to learn about broadcasting and how to be a good announcer. My classmate<ins>
column9: </ins> who was chosen to become a cameraman<ins>
column10: </ins> came<ins>
column11: </ins> too. ""It is so cold
column12: I said. ""Yes
column13: it is really cold. I also have a cold
column14: he said. We sighed while we were waiting for <mod target = out>our</mod> other friends and seniors. Finally
column15: we all got together and began to learn and teach each other. After it was over
column16: our teacher came up to me and said
column17: ""You have to stay here and everyone else can go upstairs."" I was really annoyed. I thought
column18: ""Why? Why do I have to stay alone?"" He said
column19: ""You were so rude to your <mod target = principle>principal</mod>. You don't have any common sense
column20: huh?"" ""You are being so rude to your student
column21: I shouted in my mind. He scowled at me for 20 minutes and said that he will kick me out of the the studio. Never mind. I don't want to get in trouble by the mean teacher. It was a good and bad day.":::

column1: 682:::"A while ago
column2: I was learning about organisms at the science academy I attend. The academy is in Mok-Dong
column3: so it is really far away from my home. It takes one to two hours to get there. But
column4: it has better facilities there than the ones at my old science academy. Our teacher is really nice and has a good sense of humor. My friends are all good at science
column5: so they always help me when I have problem with my work. Today
column6: we learned about plants and their functions. We can divide plants into three parts: roots
column7: stems
column8: and leaves. They have many functions to make the plants healthy. Roots absorb many nutrients and give them to stems. Stems give them to leaves. Then<ins>
column9: </ins> leaves get them and photosynthesis occurs
column10: which is similar to circulation. Many words like tracheal tubes and cambium are too difficult to learn. <del>And </del><mod target = we>We</mod> also did some experiments. They were about how to increase production and stomata. My friend prepared everything well. So<ins>
column11: </ins> we saw them really clearly. Now
column12: it is finally over.":::

column1: 683:::"Yesterday
column2:
I went to a 4.19 museum with my old friends.
We went there by taking the subway. And There
column3: I met one of my old friends. But<ins>
column4: she really changed. She spoke swear words at me. And She used to be my best friend. ""Time can change things
column5: I thought. Well
column6:
it still made me feel somewhat bad.
Finally
column7: we arrived at the museum. When President Soungman Lee made Korea better
column8: he wanted to stay the president for longer. But<ins>
column9: </ins> according<ins> to</ins> the law
column10: the president can only serve one term. So
column11: he changed the law and become the president three times. Citizens were angry and didn't think it was a democracy
column12: but a despotic government. So
column13: at first
column14: university students began to protest in Seoul. <del>And </del><mod target = many>Many</mod> other people started protesting
column15: too. It became bigger and bigger. Then
column16: the Liberals and policemen started attacking citizens. Then<ins>
column17: </ins> one day
column18: a university student name Kim Ju Yuel died because of a bullet that went through his eyes! How terrible! How can policemen kill<ins> </ins>185 citizens? They have to protect them
column19: not kill them. It finally ended when President Soungman Lee announced that he would step down from his position and work hard for Korea. It was the strength of citizens that made it possible. I respect them because of the harmony that came after the protests.":::

column1:
684:::"Today is the last day of class for my level in the English academy I attend.
I started at the academy when I was 10 years old. At first
column2:
it was too hard for
a girl who had learned only the alphabet and couldn't converse with native English speakers. No one in my family helped me when I cried. I didn't know anything about how to do both the homework and online homework
column3:
or even how to preview the next lesson. They didn't even seem to care while I was doing my homework or worried about the schedule.
But
column4: </ins> I think that made me better at English now. I started at the level 'Mega<mod target = '.>.'</mod> Now
column5: I am in the third highest level. This year
column6: because it was really difficult for students in my level
column7:
we had to take a
test after studying for six months. But
column8:
we only studied for 3 months and had the final test. I felt really bad because I wanted to catch up to my friend who is in a
higher level. But
column9:
I studied hard to get to a higher level.
And I finally did! I got 84 out of 120. Maybe it doesn't seem that good
column10:
but I am proud of my work!
I learned an important lesson today: never give up!^^

column1: 685:::"Today
column2:
our class played dodge ball.
We had never played all together before because we always divide our class into half between boys and girls
column3:
and between those who want to play soccer and dodge ball.
But today
column4: our teacher told us that our class has to be united
column5: not separated. So
column6: even though many of my friends hated that idea
column7:
we agreed to play together.
The game finally started. But
column8:
there were only a few students who are good at dodge ball. I wondered how our team would be able to win. The other team had more than twice the number of people. I felt that we would absolutely lose at once.
And We really did lose the first game because I slipped and my friends accidentally caught me. And Then
column9: </mod> the boy who is really good at P.E<ins>.</ins> hit me with the ball! I never like playing defense. Also
column10: I never had to defend before. So
column11: many people felt disappointed
column12:
including myself.
When we played for the second time
column13: we won! The students on the opposing team accidentally hit the ball to the ground. So
column14: I grab it quickly and hit the boy who hit me during the first game. It was really exciting. I will never forget this game.":::

column1: 686:::"Tomorrow
column2: I will go to Yeo-yi-do and get a prize. <mod target = Because>That's because</mod> I
column3: or we
column4: won the second prize for a contest to ""make an advertisement<mod target = "".>.""</mod> We had to make an advertisement about Korea's CEOs
column5: the bosses of Samsung and Hyundai. You will probably have heard of these companies often because they are really common and famous these days. But<ins>
column6: </ins> <mod target = to>before they could</mod> become successful
column7:
there were many hardships in starting the Samsung and Hyundai companies.
The bosses were really poor and lived in poverty when they were young. And Sometimes
column8: they had to face some really dangerous situations; for example
column9: the boss of Hyundai fell into the deep sea with his scooter. So
column10:
