he finally got out of the scooter and came up to the surface. I think I would have given up if I fell into the sea. It is really dangerous.
So
column11: I went to a CEO camp<del>
column12: </del> and learned about the two companies
column13: Samsung and Hyundai. <del>And </del><mod target = we>We</mod> had to made an advertisement<del>s</del> about their lifestyles and our dreams. The prize was for 40
column14: 000<ins> </ins>won!<del>!!</del> That is a lot of money. So
column15: I will meet my friends there<ins>
column16: </ins> too! I wish tomorrow will come quickly!":::

column1:
687:::"Today was our school's arts festival!
Our class did sign language. And My twin sister's class had a little orchestra. She is really good at playing the violin.
It took a lot of time for us to choose what we were going to do. Some friends said
column2: ""Let's do tap dance."" But<ins>
column3: </ins> that would have been really hard for the boys. Some other people said
column4:
""Let's do magic. It will be easy after we practice.""
But
column5:
it would be too noisy and take a long time to practice it.
So
column6: our teacher chose sign language and also chose the song
column7: ""Beautiful World<ins>
column8: </ins>"" for our music. The girls concentrated really hard and finished early. But<ins>
column9: </ins> the boys said that they were done and that we spoiled it all. So
column10:
some of my friends and I had to give special lessons to teach them.
After one month
column11:
we all memorized it. We finished our part with a final bow. We also made some drawings.
And Now
column12: the day was finally here and the show was starting. We were third. Everyone<ins>
column13: </ins> including my friends and mom<ins>
column14: </ins> came to watch us. ""He<mod target =
column15: >...</mod>hey.. I'm so nervous. I want to go home
column16: my friends said. But<ins>
column17: </ins> we went up to do our sign language. Everyone clapped when we were done. I was really embarrassed after it was done. But<ins>
column18: </ins> I love that it is finally over. Teachers and other parents said we did the best. <del>And </del><mod target = my>My</mod> friends said
column19:
""You are the best! You Kyoung.""
Third grade
column20: fourth grade
column21: and sixth grade went after noon. We did better than them. Next time
column22: we will have field day. Field day is really fun
column23: too. It was one of the proudest days of my life.":::

column1: 689:::"Today is my friend's birthday. So after school
column2: some girls in our classroom went to VIPS to celebrate her birthday. I also went there with them. I played for five hours!<del>!</del> But as you know
column3:
time flies when you are playing.
When we arrived at VIPS
column4: a good smell came to my nose. ""Wow
column5: I want to eat quickly!"" Everyone ran to eat. Because today is Saturday
column6: we didn't eat lunch at school. I think we at<ins>e</ins> almost all of their food. After eating
column7: we went to a playground and played there for hours. We played <mod target = dodgeball>dodge ball</mod>
column8: hide and seek
column9: and catch. Then
column10:
our class boys came and played with us together. It was so much fun!
When I came home
column11: my mom was really angry. ""Why do you look so angry?"" I asked carefully. ""What? You still don't understand? You played for five hours. <del>And </del><mod target = still>Still
column12: </mod> you want to play. You are not concentrating on your project. Just play and give up on studying. Get out!"" my mom yelled. I was really frustrated. Why was she so mad? Everyone will be very tired after playing for five hours. <del>And </del><mod target = everyone>Everyone</mod> will want to play more after they play with their best friends. But<ins>
column13: </ins> adults never understand the children's world or imagination. My mom and I are still not talking to each other. Well
column14: it<ins>'</ins>s okay. Nothing will happen. I know this is a bad mindset
column15: but I cant stop thinking about this. Maybe I hit puberty.<del>. And</del> <mod target = most>Most</mod> of the things I did at <del>the </del>competitions failed or were bronze. <del>Ah.. </del>I don't think I'm good at anything. In the Bible
column16: God made us equal
column17: so everyone has something good. But<ins>
column18: </ins> I think God made mistakes in me. It is not that great of a day after all.":::

column1: 690:::"Yesterday was my worst day
column2:
ever.
I had a speaking contest
column3:
and we had to speak only in English.
My friends helped me with memorization
column4:
and also corrected some mistakes..
They said that if I get second place
column5:
they will kill me. (Just a joke!)
I felt happy to have the kind of friends who really support me.
Then
column6:
it started. One of my rivals had a lot of materials for his speech.
The third and fourth graders told stories.
The most interesting stories were ""The Lion and the Mouse"" and ""Other Stories of Cinderella."" They were really funny. I had also done this when I was in third and fourth grade. I think I might have looked like them.
Now
column7:
it was time for the fifth grade. We could choose any topic or theme we wanted and had to prepare a three minute speech.
I just wrote my own
column8:
using my own language skills. I did everything by myself.
But
column9:
it seemed like some other people had their mothers write their speeches for them.
My most difficult rival did really well. When she started
column10: she suddenly changed her voice and acted really differently. I talked about our language<ins>
column11: </ins> Hangul. But<ins>
column12:
I don't think I did better than her. I wish the judges would take away points for people who did not do everything on their own.
I don't feel that great about how I did. But
column13:
other people said I did a really good job.
It was the worst day ever.":::

column1:
691:::"Do you like cartoons? I love to watch cartoons and I also love to draw them.
I have three characters which I created when I was in 3rd grade.
So
column2:
my mom took me to the animation center at the Namsan Tower in Seoul so that I can learn how to draw cartoons from real animators.
First
column3:
there were many students who looked much older than me. I think they were at least in the sixth grade or maybe even older. I was reluctant because I've never drawn cartoons the way professional animators draw them. We introduced ourselves and started drawing.
Our teacher is a real animator and he is really good at drawing cartoons. He told us many interesting stories and showed us cool techniques. And We drew the same thing he drew. I got praised by our teacher for drawing things realistically. I felt very proud of myself!
After it ended
column4: my mom bought me cocoa. But<ins>
column5: </ins> not everything ended with happiness. I had to wait for an hour because of a parking problem. The crazy man with a car didn't leave any phone <mod target = numbers>number</mod> at the window for us to contact him! So<ins>
column6:
we had to just wait for him to come.
Later
column7:
our family ate pork cutlet for dinner. It was really delicious!
I will go to the Namsan Seoul Tower animation center every Saturday! Yippee!":::

column1:
692:::"I volunteered to be a part of a program called ""Education for the Talented Children."" We have to take three tests to finally be a part of the program. They are really hard.
At 2:30 P.M.
column2: our teacher told us (including my friends) to go to the 3rd grade's class. I predicted that it will be the exam. When we arrived there
column3:
many of our friends were already there and also waiting to take the test.
The test was filled with numbers and letters. It was different from last year's test. We needed lots of things to write and calculate. Most of the questions were about mathematics. I finally understood why many students were reluctant to take the test.
We also had a debate and had to defend our own project. We cut a shape to make the length longer and had to explain why we chose that shape. And Our teacher marked us for points.
By the time we had a break
column4:
my friends and I were really pale. Everything was too hard. I think I was too calm about the test before. I must study harder..
But
column5: I did my best. Now
column6: it is time for the final test of this program. When I pass this
column7: I can go take the second test
column8: third test<ins>
column9: </ins> and go to the Seoul education office!<del>!</del> I took the test last year
column10:
but I failed the final third test. I really want to pass this time and be a part of the program.
Many of my rivals also looked as pale as I did. I think it's because the last question was really difficult
column11: </del> and no one looked calm at that moment. I hope I pass.":::

column1:
693:::"Do you know Taekwondo? It is a type of Korean martial arts.
I go to Taekwondo class every Monday
column2: Wednesday
column3: and Thursday.<del>And</del> <mod target = today>Today</mod>
column4:
I went to Taekwondo class with my friends as usual.
We jumped rope and also played other games. I'm not good at jump roping
column5:
but I'm working hard to do better.
We played dodge ball. At first
column6: I got four of my friends out. Then
column7:
I got out.
During the second game
column8:
I got out at once. And I helped my friends to get our opponents out.
The game ended and we went outside.
""You Kyoung
column9: let's go
column10: my friend said. I cried
column11:
""Wait!""
""Why? Hurry up
column12: we are late
column13:
my friend said.
""I lost my sneakers! They are gone
column14:
I said.
It was really horrifying. Where are my sneakers?
Probably
column15:
some other child has my sneakers now.
I fell into despair. Those were my only pair of shoes.
I wore the other ones all summer long.
What should I wear tomorrow?
Whoever took my shoes should be punished! Of course!":::

column1: 694:::"Yesterday
column2:
we had a reading contest.
I was the leader of our class
column3:
class 3.
We had to read 20 books and memorize things from the books that we think is important
column4:
which is what I did. I really worked hard.
And Finally
column5:
the contest started at 3:00.
We had 30 questions
column6:
and I got 23 right.
But
column7:
there were two people who also got 23 questions right.
So
column8:
we had to answer more questions.
One student could not answer the questions about the author and was eliminated.
The other boy and I answered four more questions.
But
column9: I failed. I almost cried because I really worked hard<del>
column10:
and I did not get the result that I wanted. I was really sad.
I also got more bad news when I also did not do well in the computer writing contest.
There is a saying that after bad things happen
column11:
there are also good things that will happen.
But
column12: </ins> I think that is wrong
column13:
totally wrong.
That's because good things never happened after these bad things happened to me.
The bad things continue to exist.
I need somebody to talk to about this problem...":::

column1: 695:::"On September 28th
column2:
there was a big change from summer to fall. I remember that it was really cold that day because I wore a t-shirt and shorts.--
Because of that day
column3:
I started to think about the difference between summer and fall.
In the summer
column4:
we usually wear shorter and thinner clothes. There are many hot days and it also rains a lot. We love to eat ice-cream in the summer!^^ We also love turning on the air-conditioner or the fan. My family went to a swimming pool during our summer vacation! I miss my summer vacation a lot.

In the fall
column5: we usually wear longer and thicker clothes. The weather gets colder<ins>
column6: </ins> so we try not to eat ice-cream. It is the season <mod target = of>for</mod> reading books<del>
column7:
and my birthday is also in the fall. ^^ We use thick blankets because it is cold at night. I don't like the fall because my lips get chapped from the cold air. We use the heater instead of the air conditioner.

Also
column8: today is Gaechunjul
column9: which is the day that Dangun made Korea. It is October 3rd<del>
column10: </del> and it is a holiday in Korea. We have to learn about Gaechunjul. It is not a day where we can just play. We have to know what the holiday is about and why we celebrate it!<del>!</del> Hooray for Gaechunjul<mod target = ^^>.</mod>":::

column1: 696:::"Today
column2:
the whole fifth grade went on a field trip.
We went to the Pyengyang farm village. It was very different from the city of Seoul. There were bright colors outside when we looked out the window
column3:
and a lot of fresh air...
First
column4: </ins> we went fishing. At first
column5:
I thought it would be easy because fishing is my favorite thing to do when I go to the mountains.
But
column6: it was not easy. The fish were more than 40<ins> </ins>cm long! They were also slippery and not good looking. At first
column7: I almost caught one
column8: but one boy also tried to catch the same fish. So<ins>
column9:
I fell down and missed it. It took us an hour to catch two fish. Ha Ha
We made Injulmi and ate lunch. Our clothes were wet from trying to catch the fish. We ate the Injulmi that we made for dessert.
We had to wait to to digest the food! Afterwards
column10: we went to a deep
column11: cool
column12: clean pool of water and jumped! Everyone jumped on rafts and into the water. It was really cool. My two friends and I helped them play. One boy tried to push me<del>
column13:
and we fell together. It was really fun! I miss it a lot.
We changed our clothes. I accidentally almost cut my hand! Oh
column14:
it was terrible. Soon it was time to say good-bye. I couldn't believe that it was already time to go! I will miss them a lot!

it doesn't cause as much pollution as normal shampoo.

column29:
>.

721:::"4/7 Oh my god! Terrible news in Japan!]

I think all of you know what I am talking about from the title. On March 11th
column2: there was a really big earthquake in Japan. It was a 9.0 magnitude earthquake. I think that it was the biggest earthquake in the whole world. I have a friend in Japan. I was so worried when I heard the news. I ran to my room<ins>
column3: </ins> <del>and </del>turned on my computer<ins>
column4: </ins> and sent an e-mail to my friend (I don't know her phone number). She didn't reply quickly
column5: so I thought something terrible happened to her. To my relief
column6: she was okay. She said she lives in the middle part of Japan
column7:
so she didn't experience any damage.

I am so worried about Japan. If I think about the past
column8: I don't really want to help them. That's because in the past
column9: we were colonized by Japan. But<ins>
column10: </ins> it wasn't their fault that the earthquake happened. I am not an evil person
column11: so I gave 2<ins>
column12: </ins>000 won to help Japan. Actually
column13:
it was part of our school's project;;.

If there was no Japan
column14: I think we could have gotten both the tsunami and the earthquake. We can say thanks to Japan. But
column15:
we have bad news too. We will have to be careful because of the radiation that was leaked when the atomic power station (nuclear plant) of Japan exploded because of the earthquake and the tsunami.

You know what? South Korea is also in danger of much damage. Because of the leaking radiation
column16: you have to be more aware of radioactivity. You know <mod target = that>how</mod> it was raining today in Korea? You shouldn't have been exposed to the raindrops because there is some radiation in the raindrops. I am so afraid! My mom said that even if you get exposed to the raindrops<ins>
column17: </ins> as long as you wash it very well
column18:
the radiation will come off and you will be safe.

If you don't know much about radiation
column19:
you may think what's the big deal about getting exposed to radioactivity.....

If you get exposed to the radiation
column20:
you may get cancer or another severe disease. It is a scary thing.-_-

I hope you will not get exposed to radioactivity~!!!! You will have to get it off as soon as you can!! Plus
column21:
you shouldn't go outside often.

Good luck to all of us!!":::

column2:
I have to go to the Academy for Gifted Kids. Do you know what the Academy for Gifted Kids is? I'll tell you......

column3: but I took a test in December of 2011. I took the test at my school. The purpose of the test is to pick out three kids from our school to go to the academy. I was one of the three kids. 10 days later
column4: I went to take a test at the Seoung-Dong Elementary School. It was harder than the first test. There were more than 200 kids from all over <mod target = Deagu>Daegu</mod>. I was very nervous. But

Well

They sometimes take some personal information or national information and sell it to others.
It can cause war if people continue doing that. So

To

column3: ""Please

column1:

how can we protect ourselves from the real pirates in Somalia?
Well

column1: 812:::"[Nepal's living Goddess
column2:
'Kumari']

Dear Little Fox readers
column3: Hey guys
column4: it's Jinny again. A few days ago
column5: I heard some unexpected news from my English academy. Do you believe in gods? Do you believe in Buddha or are you Hindu? Actually
column6: I'm Christian<mod target = . But>
column7: but</mod> that isn't <mod target = a>the</mod> point. In a few cities in Nepal
column8: such as its capital city<del>
column9: </del> Katmandu
column10:
they have a living goddess named Royal Kumari or Kumari Devi.
Oh
column11: let me introduce myself first. My name is Jinny and I'm 14 years old in 2013. My elementary school is Seosan Elementary School<ins>
column12: </ins> and my middle school will be Buchun Middle School<del>s</del>. I didn't graduate from my elementary school<ins>
column13:
yet. Next Wednesday is my graduation day. I think I might write about my graduation day next week. Let's talk about it later. I need to tell you lots of things about Kumari.
Kumari is a young girl. All Hindus and Buddhists in Nepal and India admire her. Kumari comes from an ancient story. An ancient goddess named Taleju came to the ground looking like a pretty young girl. One day
column14: a Nepal<ins>ese</ins> king wanted to take her. Then
column15: she was really angry so she went back to the sky. When the king regretted his mistake and begged for forgiveness
column16: Taleju told to him to find a young pure girl to be her helper. She told him to admire her. This is the ancient story about Kumari<mod target = . Because> because</mod> Kumari is a living goddess
column17:
and she must have many qualifications.
Kumari must have 32 perfect qualities. Not all the qualities are made public
column18: but I knew about a few of them. Kumari can only be selected from young girls who are aged <mod target = 2>two</mod> to <mod target = 4>four</mod>. She must have be from the family named Shaka (descendants of Sukgamony)
column19: and she can only live in Katmandu
column20: which is Nepal's capital city. According to ancient text<ins>s</ins>
column21: Kumari musn't have any scars or blood. If Kumari bleeds
column22: she can't be Kumari anymore. Kumari must have cow-like eyes
column23: <ins>a </ins>snail-like neck
column24: <ins> and a</ins> tree-like body. Also
column25: she must be calm and brave. Kumari should have 20 teeth. The final test is to have Kumari sleep in a place full of dead and bloody animals. When they finish all of the tests
column26:
there are no doubst that she is a Kumari.
When the girls are living as Kumari
column27: her rank is even higher than the rank of kings. I told you
column28: dear readers
column29:
all of the Hindus and Buddhists admire her. Kumari lives in a palace. She lives in luxury while she is the Kumari.
Although Kumari are rich and do not do anything
column30: some people point out <ins>that being </ins>Kumari could be like child-abuse
column31: so they want to figure out the facts. <mod target = Because of>Due to</mod> this
column32:
Nepal's court investigates about Kumari's abuse.
In fact
column33: Kumari lives a very lonely life in her own palace. The government thinks that humans can't teach a goddess
column34: so a few years ago
column35: none of the people taught Kumari. And she couldn't go out by herself. Her mother and father would carry her during festivals. Outside
column36: Kumari shouldn't stand by herself. Kumari has to sit down in a golden chair and watch people pray to her. They only look outside during the festival times. At this time
column37: people think when they see her
column38: it brings them good luck. <mod target = And the>The</mod> worst part is no one cares about the retired Kumari. When she retires
column39: there are superstitions
column40: which is when<ins> a</ins> Kumari comes back to her family's home
column41: she brings bad luck to her family. Also
column42: when a former Kumari gets married
column43: it also bring<ins>s</ins> them bad luck. So<ins>
column44: </ins> a few decades ago<del>
column45: </del> Kumari often had to live in a slum for the rest of <mod target = her life>their lives</mod>. <mod target = But fortunately>Fortunately</mod>
column46: now<del>
column47:
people don't believe that anymore.
Now
column48: </ins> I'm going to explain some traditions about the Kumari. When people kiss on her feet
column49: she gives them a blessing. Blessing means a lot of gold for them. Also
column50: they give her a payment
column52:
I need to do other homework. Have a nice New Years Day!!

column1: 827:::"Dear Little Fox reader

column2: I have a question

column1: for you. How much do you know about Greek mythology? In ancient Greece
people made these myths. People made gods and goddesses like Jupiter
Pluto

column3: the gods and goddesses had many stories

column1: that gave inspiration to artists to make works about Greek myths. Much
of the art or sculpture<del>s</del> can be found at the Louvre in

It's because I want to tell you about my trip <del>from </del>last Sunday. <del>- Sunday 3rd
column2: September
column3:
2012.-

She asked me to translate the story of<ins> the</ins> Louvre. After my

column7:
not just the Louvre exhibition but also> with other exhibitions such as university opera concerts and piano concerts. And I think I am very thankful to Little Fox to help me make one of my greatest memories with my family.
Now

column1: early. Well

column3: </ins> actually. Maybe around 7:30? However

column1: family and I

we got there.

column1: buildings are high

it's hard to find the exit.
