column1: 829:::"I had two pet hamsters. They were given to me by my uncle on my 13th birthday. I called them Pearl and Ruby. Pearl was rather lazy and would curl up in a corner of her cage and sleep all day
column2: only getting up to eat. Ruby
column3: on the other hand
column4:
was really active and loved to exercise on the hamster wheel.
This morning
column5: I did not close the cage door properly when I removed the food bowls to fill them with food. When I returned with the bowls
column6:
I found the door ajar and Ruby was missing!
I panicked and ran around the house looking frantically for the missing Ruby. However
column7: Ruby was nowhere to bee seen. Suddenly
column8: I heard a high-pitched squeak from the bathroom. I ran toward the bathroom to hear another squeak
column9: this time it came from the small drain in the bathroom. I stared in horror as I looked down the drain
column10:
thinking that I would never see Ruby again. I was very sad and vowed to take better care of Pearl after the loss of Ruby.
The following day in the afternoon
column11: however
column12: the doorbell rang. A neighbor who lived downstairs from my apartment held out his hand to reveal a very disgruntled and smelly Ruby.The neighbor explained that Ruby had emerged from his rubbish chute and had given him quite a shock. Luckily
column13: he knew it belonged to me as I was quite famous for playing with my little hamsters around the apartment building. I was grateful and immediately picked Ruby up. The first thing I did was to give her a good bath. It would be safe to say<mod target =
column14: > that</mod> Ruby was not quite as adventurous after that little incident.":::

column1: 830:::"I do not see many people who fly kites in China<del>
column2: </del> even though it happens a lot in books. Despite this
column3:
I have always wanted to fly a kite.
After asking for one
column4: my parents brought home a large kite in the shape of an eagle. They said that it was for me<ins>
column5:
and I could have a go at flying it during the weekend when they were free to take me to West Coast Park. I waited anxiously for the weekend and was ready to go by the time it was Saturday.
We carefully set the kite up
column6: laying the pieces on the grass and putting them together. The kite was made from thin but sturdy pieces of wood and slightly stretchable cloth. While I was holding the ball of string
column7: my father picked the kite up and began running in the direction of the wind. When the breeze grew strong enough
column8:
he let go of the kite and it soared up into the sky.
I watched as the kite flew higher and higher as my father twirled the ball of string. He then taught me how to control the kite. The ball of string shook in my hands as the kite was whipped about by the wind. It thrashed this way and that
column9: like it was alive
column10:
and I held on to the ball of string as firmly as I could.
After a few minutes
column11: we tied the string down on the ground and continued to watch the kite flying in the air. It was not until evening that we brought the kite down and went home. I was very satisfied with our outing and hope to be able to fly the kite again someday.":::

column1: 831:::"This afternoon
column2:
my younger brother and I went outside to skip rope. Our mother told us we should play since it's summer vacation.
We murmured with discontent and went outside to skip rope.
After we had skipped about 100 times
column3: my brother said
column4: Sister
column5: do you want to have a contest?"" Whoever could skip the most without getting hooked by the rope would be the winner. I said <ins>""</ins>yes
column6: <ins>""</ins> and then the contest started. ""One
column7: two
column8: three...Go!"" Skip
column9: Skip
column10: Skip. Sweat dripped from my forehead
column11: and I was panting.":::

column1: 832:::"This afternoon at home
column2:
my mother and I were busy in the kitchen.
The community center in our neighborhood was holding a food fair the following day
column3:
and we had decided to help the community center by preparing some food to be sold.
After much debate
column4:
my mother and I decided to bring cookies to sell.
After all
column5:
who can resist a chocolate chip cookie?
Soon
column6: we set off for the supermarket and within an hour
column7: we had all our ingredients set on the table
column8:
and were ready to begin.
We were all ready to begin making my mother's chocolate chip cookies.
My mother's chocolate chip cookies are absolutely delicious
column9:
and I could not wait to learn how to make them.
Following her instructions
column10: I started by mixing the sugar and butter together in a bowl. After all the sugar dissolved
column11: my mother started to crack some eggs into the mixture while I was stirring it. She also added a few drops of vanilla extract into the mixture. Next
column12: she added some water and a few pinches of salt
column13:
followed closely by some flour and the all-important chocolate chips and chopped nuts.
I mixed the thick batter together with all my might while my mother prepared the oven and the tray. Before long
column14:
we were dropping spoonfuls of the mixture onto the tray.
By the time the cookies were ready
column15:
the kitchen smelled like chocolate chip cookies.
Eagerly
column16:
we took the tray out of the oven.
We sampled a few peices and found that they were extremly delicious!
Satisfied
column17:
we boxed up the rest and were ready to be sold the next day.
As I lay down to rest in the living room
column18: I already knew which food item would sell out first the very next day.":::

column1: 833:::"Today
column2:
our family went to a restaurant in the city.
It was decorated very beautifully with big ancient pictures and antique furniture.
I liked the shelf which was decorated with many bright colors.
After seeing these
column3:
we sat down and ordered our food.
The restaurant's service was quite good as there were coloring books and things for us to do.
Soon
column4:
the food came and we started to enjoy it. The food that I ate was a fresh vegetable pasta and tuna salad.
The food was unique compared to the food in other restaurants.
After dinner
column5: we ate ice cream for dessert<ins>
column6:
too.
It was a gorgeous dinnerBut>
column7: but</mod> I still think food that Mother makes is the best.":::

column1:
834:::"I had never had such a wonderful of an experience as the time when my friends and I stayed at a chalet a few days ago.
After booking the chalet
column2:
my friends and I stayed over at the Nanning Beach Resort.
It was my first time staying at a chalet
column3:
and I was very excited.
The day started out bright and sunny on a Saturday afternoon.
My friends and I made our way to the chalet.
When we arrived
column4: we could not help but marvel at the clear blue<ins>
column5:
water and the waves that gently washed over the shore.
After we had changed into our swimming suits
column6:
we ran to the beach to play.
Evening came
column7:
and it was time for dinner.
We started a fire in the barbecue pit
column8: and soon we were sitting aroung chatting
column9:
waiting for the food to cook.
Some of the food got burnt
column10:
but we still enjoyed it very much.
We stayed up late
column11:
telling jokes and playing board games.
We were having such a good time that we made a bit too much noise
column12:
and one of the guards came to tell us off for being too noisy.
It was not long before we grew too tired to stay up any longer and fell asleep.
The next day morning
column13: we felt sad because we knew it would soon be time to go home. <mod target = But>However
column14: </mod> we still felt happy inside because of the experiences we had shared the day before.":::

column1: 835:::"After my piano lesson
column2: my piano teacher
column3: Mrs. Park<ins>
column4: </ins> visited our house for dinner. We ate brown rice mixed with minced meat and other various dishes of cooked fresh greens and spicy red pepper paste. There were also some sesame leaves that made the mixed rice more special. After dinner
column5: my mothe<ins>r</ins> and my teacher started to talk. While they were talking
column6: I read some books. One of the book<ins>s</ins> was about Korea's traditional foods. Suddenly
column7:
I started to think of skewered stuff.
Skewered stuff is one of the dishes that Chinese people enjoy eating. They insert many kinds of food onto a skewer and roast them on an iron plate with oil. Many of the people who first ate skewered stuff from the street will get a stomachache and suffer from diarrhea for some days. However
column8: </mod> those who have gotten used to the street food
column9: really like to eat the skewered stuff and enjoy it. I got diarrhea<ins>
column10: </ins> too
column11: when I first ate it
column12:
but I like it now.
The skewered stuff is given with some sauces that are kind of like pepper paste. I ate this with both spicy and sweet sauce when I first came to China and ate the skewered stuff. Chinese people call it 烧烤（shao kao) and Korean people call it ggo qi.
I like the skewered stuff
column13: </ins> although it's not that healthy for you<del>
column14: haha</del>.":::

column1: 836:::"Today
column2: I was returning home after playing with my friends. I was walking along the road<mod target =
column3:
> and chattering with my friends when I saw a traffic jam about a hundred meters down the road.
""Could it be a road accident?"" I thought to myself.
My guess turned out to be correct. When I reached the spot of the accident
column4: I saw the cause of the accident. There was a bus standing
column5: and a man with a bike laying on the road. I think the bus knocked the man down. A crowd of curious onlookers had gathered at the scene of the accident. I pushed my way through the crowd and saw a policeman talking with the injured man. Luckily
column6: the man was not injured that seriously. Then
column7: I saw an ambulance coming
column8:
and it brought the man to the hospital.
One thing I was surprised about was that the crowd didn't do anything even when they saw that the man was injured. They just looked at each other like they didn't know what to do.
I did not stay to watch more because I was already late for my dinner. I pushed my way out of the crowd and hurried home.":::

column1: 838:::"It had been a good day before I saw that the tree just beside our front gate had fallen over
column2:
blocking the entrance into the house.
Worse still
column3:
I realized that it had been run over as there was a big red sports car smashed up against the tree. There was nobody inside the car.
Shaking
column4: I took out my cellphone and called my mother. In an unsteady voice
column5:
I told her what had happened. She was shocked.
However
column6:
there was little that I could do at the moment.
She told me to go inside and wait for her and my father to get home.
I climbed over the tree and went inside
column7:
wondering the whole time whether someone had been seriously injured in the crash or was doing something against the law.
A short while later
column8:
my parents came home. They were stunned to see the condition of our front gate and the red sports car.
Minutes later
column9:
I heard someone calling from the outside.
It was one of our neighbors. She came to apologize about what had happened.
Apparently
column10:
her son had forgotten to engage the handbrake when he parked his car.
Since our road was on a slope
column11:
the car slid down and knocked the tree over.
I was very relieved that nobody had been hurt. However
column12: it was still a very shocking sight to see when I came home.":::

column1: 839:::"We had a sleepover at Gloria's yesterday. It was a pleasant day
column2: and Clara suddenly shouted
column3: ""Do you want to have a sleepover?"" I answered
column4: <ins> </ins>""What sleepover?"" Clara said
column5: <ins> </ins>""That's a good idea<mod target =
column6: >.</mod> I like it!"" Gloria said
column7: <ins> </ins>""Oh
column8: right
column9: you can come to my house."" So
column10:
we decided to go to Gloria's house.
After school
column11: we went home and prepared personal things. Then we gathered together<del>
column12:
and took a bus to Gloria' house.
Her house was quite big. She uses a room with her younger sister. There were many interesting books on her shelves
column13:
I liked them. It was Gloria's turn to prepare dinner that evening. Gloria was going to make noodles.
Clara and I were Gloria's helpers. To make noodles
column14: you need noodles
column15: soup
column16:
and some vegetables.
First
column17: boil the soup. Then
column18: put in the noodles. After that
column19: fry the vegetables. Put the noodles on a plate
column20: then put the soup and the vegetables<ins> on</ins> last. Like this
column21: you can make delicious noodles.
column22: unfortunately>Unfortunately</mod>
column23: our noodles were a mess. After dinner
column24: we went upstairs and went into Gloria's room. We talked about each other's troubles<del>
column25:
and other things that we wanted to say before.
We secretly ate things
column26:
too. We went to sleep at almost 2:00 a.m.
It was a wonderful day although I didn't sleep that well.":::

column1: 840:::"Today
column2: a new student came to our class. Her name is Ji-Yun Lee<ins>
column3:
and her English name is Clara.
She is from Korea
column4:
like me. I was very excited when I heared a new student was coming.
She is very pretty. She has two big and clear eyes
column5: a sharp nose
column6: and small
column7:
pink lips. She looks just like a barbie doll.
When it was time to introduce herself
column8:
she spoke loudly and clearly.
I don't think she is afraid of strangers. When it was recess time
column9:
my friends pulled Gloria and I in front of the new girl and told us to talk with her in Korean.
Oh no! However
column10: </mod> I was quite happy to meet a Korean friend. So<ins>
column11: </ins> I asked her
column12: ""Hi
column13: what's your name?"" Her name was Clara. Her Korean name is Ji Yun
column14:
but most of her friends call her Clara.
She lived in Canada before she came to China.
She also gave us some Canadian candy
column15: which was was great! Her social skills were very good. She became friends with many Chinese students in one day by talking
column16: playing
column17:
and laughing with them.
I like Clara
column18: and I think we can be good friends.":::

column1: 841:::"I don't like doing homework
column2: which most kids don't like to do. So<ins>
column3: </ins> when my older brother approached me with an opportunity to do more of it
column4:
I was not exactly thrilled.
Still
column5: if I can help someone
column6:
I guess it would not hurt.
His job was to help write math problems for younger students.
Since I am a younger student myself
column7:
I could give him a good idea of what kind of problems I did every day in school.
He could also gauge how hard a question was
column8:
or how easy a question was based on my opinon.
We started on simple topics first
column9:
and then we started to do more difficult questions.
From trigonometry to algebra
column10:
we came up with many good problems for each topic.
It was hard work
column11:
but I soon got used it.
Finally
column12: we finished his job. Although it was a hard job to do
column13: I realized how many things I was learning in school every day just in Math classes. So<ins>
column14: </ins> I was thankful for that.":::

column1: 842:::"It was Children's Day on June 1st
column2:
and this reminded me of the Children's Day in Singapore.
Singapore celebrates Children's Day on the first of October. Children's Day is a holiday
column3:
which was one of the reasons why I looked forward to it.
The day before Children's Day
column4: however
column5:
is just as nice.
It is the day when the school holds a celebration for its students. First of all
column6:
we are allowed to come to school in our own clothes instead of our scool uniforms.
This way
column7:
it is more comfortable for us while we do our activities.
There is usually only half a day of school.
In the morning we would have a concert and play some games.
Most of the time
column8:
students preform during their concerts at school.
However
column9: </ins> on Children's Day
column10:
the teachers are the ones who preform for the students.
After all
column11:
it is meant to be a day of fun for the students.
Teachers often sing or put on comedic skits
column12:
usually to show their affection for their students.
The best skit I ever saw on Children's Day was when my teachers pretended to be a group of naughty students. One of my male teachers actually dressed as a female student
column13: which made everybody laugh and laugh. After the concert
column14: the teachers and the students are divided into <mod target = 4>four</mod> teams
column15: and we have little competitions from netball matches to cheering games. Often
column16: the teachers will hand out little gifts to all the students
column17:
normally chocolate or little sweets.
I like Singapore's Children's Day very much.":::

column1: 843:::"It was Parent's Day on May 10th. I was not aware of it until my friend Gloria asked me what I was going to do for my parents. I exclaimed
column2:
""Oh right! It is Parent's Day today!""
After school
column3: I went to the stationary store near our home<del>
column4: </del> and spent a long time looking at this and that. Finally
column5: I picked out <mod target = 2>two</mod> zipper bags and post-its from the store with a heart shaped plastic bag. Then
column6:
I went home and wrote a letter to my parents with my younger brother.
We waited until our parents came home.
After some time
column7: we heard the main door opening
column8: then we exitcedly took out the presents and walked in front of them. ""Happy Parent's Day to both of you!"" we cried. They were first shocked
column9:
but soon started smiling. They praised us that we were growing up well.
From this
column10: I learned that giving can make you happier than receiving.":::

column1:
844:::"My mischievous younger brother had another amusing accident today.
This afternoon
column2:
my mother returned from the market with a basket. She placed it on the table in the living room and went to the kitchen to wash her hands.
As there was no one in the living room at that time
column3: my brother could not resist taking a look at the things in the basket. When he discovered that there were some red ""sweets"" inside the basket
column4: he quickly reached into it
column5: took one ""sweet"" out and put it into his mouth. When he started chewing it
column6:
his mouth became hot and painful. The foolish boy started to cry loudly. Mother dashed out from the kitchen to wash his mouth with some cold water.
When my brother finally stopped crying
column7: Mother gave him a good scolding. She told him not to be greedy and not to take things without her permission. Everyone in the family had a good laugh when they heard about the incident later on. Everyone
column8: of course with the exception of my brother
column9:
found his experience amusing.
Ha Ha Ha ":::

column1: 845:::"We had our English midterm today
column2:
and we had our Math and Chinese exams last week on Friday.
I got 93 points for the Chinese exam
column3:
and 86 points for the Math exam.
I didn't really prepare and study for the English exam because I think English is very easy for me.
We learn phrases like
column4: ""Excuse me
column5:
or 'Is this your---?"" in addition to some short paragraphs.
English classes here are boring
column6: </ins> too. So
column7: there are only a few of us who concentrate on the teacher
column8: and almost everyone else is chattering
column9: playing mobile phone games
column10: reading novels
column11: doing homework
column12: sleeping
column13:
or screaming loudly.
However
column14:
there are also some who play and listen to the teacher at the same time.
I usually do my English homework
column15: or talk with my partner
column16:
Gloria.
I think it's the teacher's fault for being so boring
column17: and it's also our fault for not cooperating with the teacher.":::

column1: 846:::"Today
column2: I read a book about being safe and protecting myself. I learned that bad people can disguise themselves as kind and friendly people to get children's trust so they can kidnap them. To <mod target = avoid>prevent</mod> any of these unlucky things from happening
column3: you have to get back home before it gets dark<ins>
column4: </ins> and you need to avoid going on unfamiliar roads. For emergencies
column5:
you should always have a whistle with you.
It's also dangerous for you to hang your house key on your neck like a necklace
column6:
because you're telling people that there is no one at home.
I learned many things about protecting myself and how to keep away from danger. I also made sure about the things that were not clear and that I was curious about. I've got to take care of myself more carefully from now on.":::

column1:
847:::"I cut my hair short today in a Korean salon.
Before
column2: I wished to cut my hair<ins>
column3:
but now I regret cutting it.
Before I cut it
column4:
it was long and reached my elbow. It looked nicer that it does now.
I look like Cleopatra
column5:
the ancient queen from Egypt.
I'm thinking of going back to style it again.
It is not the hairstyle I thought I was going to get. Many of my friends said it was unfashionable.":::

column1:
848:::"We acted in a musical for Easter at our church.
The musical was called ""The Lamb which Underwent Death.""
It was an impressive and sad musical. It was about how people got controlled by the devil and how Jesus saved us from sin. I had the role of betraying Jesus and had to do some strange things. I thought of God's love toward us as everlasting and big.
After the musical
column2: the members that acted in the musical gathered together and played games. One of the game<ins>s</ins> is called Apartment Escape. You have to solve the mission and find each other's secret things that are hidden somewhere. It is an interesting game
column3:
but I personally didn't like this game.
We played for about three to four hours. After that
column4: we got a call from Teacher No (our team's teacher) for dining together. We went to a <mod target = cooking barbecue Restaurant>barbecue restaurant</mod> and ate<ins> a</ins> lot! We finally had a good dinner together! It came out to 450元. I don't know exactly how much it was in Korea<ins>n</ins> money
column5: but it was really expensive. We each ate an ice cream for dessert<ins>
column6:
too. It was a filling and fantastic dinner.
I was so tired and happy today. One important thing I learned today is that you have to work with each other in order to succeed.":::

column1: 849:::"We had a holiday from Monday to Wednesday. I think it is a holiday only in China
column2: and is called 清明节
column3:
or Fairness Day.

My friends
column4: Helen
column5: Jane
column6: Uncle Jo<ins>
column7:
and I went to a swimming pool far away.
It takes about 40 minutes to get there.
When we arrived
column8:
we changed into swimming suits excitedly and went into the pool.
I thought the pool would be a water playground
column9: but Jane took us to a plain pool. I asked
column10:
""Where are the other pools?"" but she was so happy that she didn't hear me.
I asked worriedly again
column11: ""Are...are there any more pools here?"" Jane shook her head. I couldn't believe it. I said
column12: ""We came this far to swim in this pool?!"" By that time
column13:
Jane was already far away ""dancing"" in the water.
I couldn't understand anything that was happening.
The water playground was just a part of my fantasy
column14: </ins> and I realized that it wouldn't be good for me to spend all my time complaining and blaming Jane. I swam to Jane and Helen. We had a swimming competition even though we are not good swimmers. Helen didn't know how to swim at all
column15:
so she only walked in the water because she's taller than us).
We played
column16: jumped
column17: splashed water
column18:
and played many fun games in the water.
One of the games we played is called Human Submarine!
The person who holds her breath the longest under water is the best submarine.
However
column19:
it's quite a dangerous game because you can die under water from the lack of air.
We played until Uncle Jo came to fetch us.
We had a good
column20: fun time at the pool. I wish we can go to a more fun and<ins> more</ins> memorable place together next time.":::

column1:
850:::"Today is the day when my tooth fell out!
I started to feel pain exactly one week ago.
It became more painful as the days went by.
My tooth would feel painful and itchy even when I was happily watching TV.
I groaned and screamed with pain which It might sound very funny to you).
I used my hand and slowly shook this annoying tooth.
It was painful
column2: but I couldn't have this tooth forever<ins>
column3:
and it's going to fall out someday!
I gathered together my courage and counted
column4:
""1---2---3!"" ""Ouch!"" I yelled.
There was a tooth covered with blood in my hand!
I ran to the washroom and rinsed my mouth out several times until there was no bloody smell.
I used some tissues to stop the blood and then my mother helped me to wash out my mouth.
After that
column5: I washed my tooth until it was clean and put it in a clear vinyl bag with a little label that says
column6:
""2012 March 26th Hoeun's tooth.""
I hope that this new tooth can grow healthily.":::

column1: 851:::"Some of my classmates
column2: Teacher Hong
column3: Teacher Kim<ins>
column4:
and I went camping today.
We took a bus and drove up to the mountain.
We arrived at a small cottage on the mountain.
When we walked up to the cottage
column5:
we saw that there were sharp pieces of glass sticking up on the roof. I think it was to prevent robbers from getting inside.
It was scary to look at those shards of glass.
We walked into the little cottage
column6: unpacked our things
column7:
and ""explored"" the cottage where we would be staying.
There were two dirty rooms and the door was worn out
column8:
so we thought that we would rather sleep outside than sleep inside the old and dirty rooms.
Teacher Hong told us to take out our personal packs of rice. Then she assigned the boys to go pick some branches with Teacher Kim and for the girls to wash the rice.
The water was so cold that I felt cold even though it was hot.
Teacher Kim began making a fire with the branches he and the boys brought back.
After that
column9:
he placed some rocks beside the fire and put an iron pot on top of the rocks.
He used a piece of meat to take away the dust on the iron pot.
He put some pieces of meat on it. I didn't know an iron pot was that useful because I've never experienced use one in different ways before. The meat roasted inside the iron pot was more delicious than what it tastes like using a normal grill. Ah~ I can still remember that incredible taste! I also learned that the smoke from the fire is very hot
column10: </ins> and it stings when it gets near your eyes and nose. After we ate this delicious supper
column11: we played a zombie game
column12: <ins> a</ins> red ginseng game
column13: indoor dodge<del> </del>ball
column14:
and others.
After a few hours
column15: we made a fire again and sat around the fire. We took out some marshmallows and sausages and put them on a stick. We held them over the fire and roasted them. <mod target = But>However
column16:
some of them were burned. We sang the song Marshmallow that IU sang while enjoying marshmallows.

From this camp
column17:
I became more independent and more mature. I also learned many helpful things.
I became closer with my friends
column18:
and we learned more about each other.
I hope we will go camping together next time.":::

column1:
852:::"It was an awesome day for me today because I bought a new phone!
I lost my phone months ago at my school.
After all this time
column2:
I finally got the permission to buy another phone.
I danced with joy and went to the shop that sells electronic devices with my dad.
When I walked into the shop
column3:
there were many different kinds of mobile phones displayed on the wall.
I liked the ones that had a touch screen
column4:
but they were all expensive.
Finally
column5:
I chose one that has both a touch screen and a key pad.
It was a 2 in 1 mobile phone that was made by 天翼
column6:
a moblie phone company.
It's pink in the back and white in the front. At first
column7:
I wanted to buy an orange one but it was all sold out.
I bought a pink Rilakkuma case for my mobile phone.
I promised myself to always take care of this new phone. I won't lose it like I did with my last phone.":::

column1: 853:::"Today
column2: my friends and I prepared a surprise birthday party for our friend
column3: Min-Ju. Min-Ju's English name is Grace. It was not actually her birthday<del>
column4:
because we made a mistake and thought it was the wrong day!!

We didn't realize it until she told us. We prepared a cake covered with chocolate and pretty toppings. We told the baker to write ""Happy Birthday Min-Ju"" on it
column5:
too.

We also prepared a cone hat (the kind you wear on your birthday) and a personal gift.
For my personal gift
column6:
I prepared a hand-made little pouch and a letter.
The little pouch is blue
column7: and <mod target = on>in</mod> the middle
column8:
""Min-Ju's"" is written on it.

When it was time for her party
column9: we called her to a room that we always go to when we play together. After<ins> a</ins> few minutes
column10: she appeared. The room was dark of course<ins>
column11:
as it was a surprise.

She called us
column12: </ins> and when she thought there was someone close to her
column13: she began to use her phone's light<mod target = ; we>. We</mod> turned on the light and screamed
column14: ""Happy Birthday
column15:
Min-Ju!""
At first
column16: her expression seemed like she wasn't that surprised
column17:
and then she smiled.
She asked ""When is my birthday?"" We answered
column18:
""Don't you know? It's March 6th!""
""And what's today's date?"" she asked.
""Isn't it March 6th?""
She looked at me and then showed her mobile phone to me. ""Uh....""
It was March 5th!!
I nearly fainted when I saw the number five
I felt so sorry for her
column19: </ins> too. <mod target = But>However
column20:
kind Min-Ju forgave us and enjoyed her early birthday party.

It was time to cut the cake and enjoy the party.
Min-Ju thanked us and said it was so impressive and thoughtful of us to prepare such a beautiful cake.
Although
column21: we don't like cream very much
column22: we specifically chose this cake because it had a lot of cream on it. It was for Min-Ju
column23:
and we were planning on giving Min-Ju a birthday cream punch! We ate some pieces of cake and quietly waited for the right time.

Suddenly
column24: I saw So Young moving to Min-Ju and suddenly realized there were some cream on Min-Ju's cheek. ""Hey! So Young!"" Min-Ju yelled<ins>
column25:
and she smeared some cream on So Young's nose. That is how the ""cream-war"" began. Cream flew here and there.
""Get it!""
""No
column26:
your'e going to get it!""
.....Finally
column27:
we used up all the cream.
There was cream everywere. I looked at the mess we made. We simply washed it off and calmed down.
The calm didn't continue for that long
column28:
because we started to play another game called the Fool game.

How do you play this game? It's quite simple and but a little complicated to explain.
First
column29:
the ""fool"" says a number (from one to five) and uses his hands to hold up a different number from the one that was just said.

When the ""fool"" gets it wrong
column30: the other players have to imitate what the ""fool"" did twice
column31: and also call the person a fool twice. It seems easy<ins>
column32: </ins> but it is a very
column33:
very difficult game to play.

We played
column34: ate
column35:
and chatterd for half a day.
Although it was an early birthday party
column36: I still think it was the most memorable party in my life.":::

column1: 854:::"Today
column2: I went to a sauna with my family. The sauna's name is ‘Yong(永）-Chun（春）-Quan（泉）'. It kind of translate<ins>s</ins> into Forever Spring River. It has three floors. The first floor has female and male bathhouses. The second floor has a chess room and massage room. There is also a big
column3: wide dining room
column4: <ins> an</ins> Internet room
column5: <ins>a </ins>cartoon room
column6: <ins>a </ins>playground for children
column7: <ins>a </ins>library
column8:
and a theater on the third floor. The sauna is an amazing place.
The food in the dining room was very delicious. There are different kinds of food and juice. I liked the rice noodles the most among the many foods there. The rice noodle is made of rice
column9: as the name suggests. It has a special flavor<ins>
column10:
and it is different from the ramyeon noodles that Koreans eat. Chinese people eat rice noodles often and enjoy it very much. Rice noodles also have many different flavors so you can't get sick of it.
There are also other things on the first floor that I didn't mention until now
column11: like a swimming pool. After we ate dinner
column12: we changed to our swimming suits and went to the swimming pool. The pool was 1.5 m deep<ins>
column13:
and my brother and I played with a beach ball there.
After that
column14: we went to the Doctor Fish pool
column15: and it was awesome! I always dreamt about experiencing the Doctor Fish pool and know what it would feel like. Today is the day that I can accomplish this dream! In the pool
column16: there were black and grey doctor fish<del>es</del> that would swim far away when I went close to them. I was surprised that they could see me. I forced myself to calm down and slowly put my toes into the pool that were full of doctor fishes. Then
column17: I put the rest of my foot in the pool. Suddenly
column18: there was a ticklish feeling on my toe
column19: and I saw a fish biting on my toe. I was so frightened that I screamed and raised my foot up. Through a lot of time and effort
column20: I put my feet back into the water. In the beginning
column21: it was very itchy and stung a little. After a while
column22: it felt like a massage tool. It was not as painful as I first though. <mod target = But>However
column23: </mod> when you look at the fishes biting you
column24:
it's quite creepy.
After that
column25:
we also went to a sandbar. We used shovels to bury our younger brother. It looked like a grave with a head poking out.
When it was time to go home
column26: I was sad to leave. I promised myself that I would try to come back here again next time.":::

column1: 855:::"Last Monday
column2: my school winter vacation finally ended! All the students went back to school. I was very excited. I was excited about meeting my teacher
column3: meeting my friends
column4:
and us talking to each other. I looked forward to it.
When I entered the classroom
column5:
everybody looked at me to see who it was. I sat where I sat last December. Then I changed my seat to another classmate's seat and talked to my friends. We were having so much fun that we didn't notice what time it was.
At 10:30
column6: we went to the leture hall to hold the assembly for the beginning of school. I was so cold
column7: especially my feet. I tried to be patient
column8: but that didn't stop me from moving around. It was like bathing<ins> in</ins> the warm water outside during the winter
column9: except for my feet. Now<ins>
column10:
you'll know how painful my feet felt and how cold it was.
For this reason
column11: I couldn't focus on my schoolmaster's speech. I was <mod target = FREEZING!!>freezing</mod>! All of the students were as cold as me. I complained about the lecture hall's heating. Our school has no heater. So
column12: when winter comes
column13:
the lecture hall is freezing. It is colder inside than it is outside.
It was an unpleasant way to begin school. I was in a bad mood all day!! ":::

column1:
856:::"My family went to Busan to meet my father's relatives and have a good time. We went there by KTX which is a very fast train.
When we arrived there
column2: it was evening<ins>
column3: </ins> so we slept at a hotel near the Busan Station. The hotel wasn't very good. It was a little hot and a little bit old-fashioned. We tried to sleep<ins>
column4:
but we changed up our mind and went to the bustling streets of Busan. It was very crowded even though it was almost night. We ate a Japanese dish called takoyakki and wandered through the streets. It was fun.
The next day
column5: my dad and I got up early to see the famous market in Busan called the Busan Jagalchi market. It is a very famous market in Busan<ins>
column6: </ins> so we were very excited at first<ins>
column7: </ins> but we were disappointed because it was just like the markets in Seoul and Geong Gi Do. It wasn't that enjoyable for my dad and <mod target = me>I</mod>.":::

column1: 857:::"Last Saturday and Sunday
column2:
my family went to Dan-Yang for one day and two nights. It took almost three hours to get there.
When we arrived
column3: we first went to the restaurant to have lunch. We ate <ins>peppery </ins>madarin fish <del>peppery </del>soup. It was very delicious. It was spicy
column4: but I was fascinated by the deep taste. My family was hungry
column5:
so we each ate two rice bowls. My family never ate like that before! Ha-ha!
After we had lunch
column6: we went to a cave called Go-Su cave. This cave is very famous in Dan-Yang. It was made over 450 million years ago. It has many beautiful stalactites and stone pillars. The scenery of this cave <mod target = were>was</mod> very beautiful and wonderful. We had a hard time climbing this cave. It was very difficult to climb. However
column7:
we didn't complain about this.
After we passed through this large cave
column8: we went to a place called Do-Dam Sam-Bong. This place was supposed to have a great view of Dan-Yang. We climbed stairs to get a better view of this. It was hard to climb like the Go-Su cave. The stairs made my legs tired. I finally reached the top<mod target = . But
column10: but</mod> when I looked out
column11:
I couldn't hide my disappointment. The view at the top wasn't beautiful enough. It was a stupid decision.
After taking a picture
column12: we went to our lodgings to rest and sleep. The place where we were staying was very quiet<ins>
column13: </ins> and the scenery was wonderful. We were very pleased with this. We spent a wonderful night there. I want to go back again!":::

column1: 858:::"My family went to Dae-Jeon for two night<ins>s</ins> and three
days. My cousins and my maternal grandmother live in Dae-Jeon. We went

there to meet my maternal grandmother and my cousins.
We didn't go to Dae-Jeon first. We went Bu-Yeo first because my mother's father's elder brother had died. So
column2: </ins> we had to go to the funeral hall. When we got there
column3: we first bowed to my mother's father's elder brother's picture<del>
column4: </del> and had dinner. My mother and my father were busy talking with my relatives
column5: so we had to play with my cousins<ins>.</ins> <mod target = (these>These</mod> cousins aren't the cousins that are in Dae-Jeon<mod target = )>.</mod> <mod target = who>The cousins we played with</mod> are close to my elder brother's and my age. <mod target = But>However
column6: </mod> my cousins were playing mobile phone games. They were so immersed in the game and excited while playing<mod target =
column7: > that</mod> they would shout every time they lost a game<ins>
column8: </ins> and they completely ignored us. So<ins>
column9: </ins>

column1: my elder brother and I were very bored. There was nothing to do but

wait. It was the most boring funeral I've ever been to in my life.
Well
now let's move on to <ins>the </ins>next day. The next <del>day in the </del>evening
column2: we went to

column1: my cousin's home to stay overnight. When we arrived there
column2: we first ran

column1: to the lizard's breeding house to see him. My cousins are also breeding a
Beard<ins>ed</ins>-Dragon like me<ins>.</ins> <del>(</del>If you want to know more
column2: you can find out more

column1: in my third diary entry<del>)</del>. My cousin's lizard is bigger than my lizard<ins>
column2: </ins> so

column1:
it's good for petting.
When it was close to midnight
column2: we rushed to

column1: the TV to hear the New Year's Eve bell ring. When the bell rang
column2: I

column1:
couldn't hide my happiness that I am now 14 years old.
Happy New Year everyone!":::
859:::"Yesterday
column2: for Christmas Eve
column3: my family went to Myoung-Dong in Seoul. We went there to see a performance called ""Amadeus."" It was about the story of Salieri who was a famous musical composer
column4:
and Mozart who was a genius musical composer.
The story begins when Salieri tells everyone that he was a participant in Mozart's death. Then the stage changes to a scene from over 32 years ago.
At that time
column5: Saliari was the Royal Court musician in Austria. He was jealous of Mozart because he was <ins>a </ins>genius musical composer. He was afraid that Mozart would become more famous than him. So
column6: he started to hate Mozart<del>
column7: </del> and began to say bad things about Mozart to other people
column8:
especially the people in the Royal Court.
The performance was very interesting and fun to watch. I didn't know that Mozart lived a very prodigal life and was surprised by his character. I always thought Mozart was a very nice person
column9:
but he didn't seem like a nice person in ""Amadeus.""
Well
column10:
it was the most interesting performance that I've ever seen. I want to recommend it to you.
Ah
column11: and I also want to say Merry Christmas!":::

column1:
860:::"I want to tell you about my student life starting from elementary school. Let me tell you first about when I was in first grade.
I had just moved to the country before that year
column2: </ins> and I was excitied to go to school and make new friends. At that time
column3: I thought to myself
column4: ""I can do well!"" When I went to school
column5: I was very happy. I learned how to play soccer every day. So<ins>
column6:
I played soccer after school. It was fun. My friends and I once had a game against sixth graders. We won with a score of three to one. Later I found out that the sixth graders had purposely lost the game. My life during second grade was also very similar to what it was like during first grade.
When I was in third grade
column7: we moved to the city again. I was very sad to leave the country
column8:
but there was no choice.
Time passed
column9: and I adapted to my life in the city. I made new friends and played with them<ins>
column10: </ins> too. <mod target = But>However
column11: </mod> I think <mod target = grade 3>third grade</mod> was the unhappiest year for me. After one year had passed
column12: I started <mod target = grade 4>fourth grade</mod>. During this grade
column13: something amazing happened. I became the first in my class. I could not believe myself at first
column14: but as time passed
column15:
I accepted it.
Then I had to move here when I was in fifth grade. I adapted at the new school quite fast. It only took about two to three days.
I am in sixth grade now
column16: </ins> and I am having a joyful year. Next year in February
column17: I'll be having a graduation. I hope that nothing bad will happen during that period. Bye<del>~</del>!<del>^^</del>":::

column1: 861:::"Today
column2:
I played table tennis with my older brother in the evening. We walked there in about 10 minutes. The weather was cold and cloudless. I was full of excitement as I went over to the table tennis table.
When we arrived
column3: we first practiced <del>for </del>a little. If we don't practice before
column4: the game isn't as fun. My older brother is better than me
column5:
so I was already tired after practice.
Eventually
column6: the game began. I served first. My older brother was very calm because he knew that I am not better at table tennis than him. He missed the ball several times. I did my best<ins>
column7: </ins> but my body didn't obey me
column8: especially my hands. They were frozen. So<ins>
column9: </ins> I couldn't control my hands and my body very much. I think this problem affected my skill level while playing. I was very disappointed <mod target = about>by</mod> this<mod target = . But>
column10:
but my older brother said my movement was better than before. I was happy to hear this comment.
I won the first game with a score of 21 to 17. The next game
column11: I won with a score of 21 to 18. I was excited to win the games
column12: but I knew that my brother took it easy on me. So<ins>
column13: </ins> I will play fairly next time!":::

column1: 862:::"Hello
column2:
I would like to talk about my life from now on. Let me talk about my life when I was born.
I was born in Seoul
column3: Korea. I was born on February 20th
column4:
2000. I was the second son in my family. I have an older brother.
After I was born
column5: I lived in Seoul until I was <mod target = 3>three</mod> years old. We lived in an apartment near my grandparent's house. So<ins>
column6:
my grandparents were able to come to my house easily.
When I was four years old
column7: I moved to Uiwang city. There
column8: I attended kindergarten<ins>
column9:
and I made some friends. My friends and I often played together after kindergarten was over. It was very fun.
After four years passed
column10: my family moved to the country in Yang-Pyung. There
column11:
I'd entered Dan-Wall school. I made a lot of friends including Nam-Chun and Su-Heon. They were good friends.
When I was in grade three
column12: I moved to the city again. I was very sad to leave
column13: but there was no choice. Thankfully
column14: my friends in the city are good like my friends from the country<mod target = . But
column16:
but I sometimes miss my friends in the country.
I think my life is happy and wonderful!!!":::

column1: 863:::"Hello
column2:
Little Fox readers!

I would like to introduce you to my friends
column3: Dong Hyun
column4: Gyung Chan
column5: Joon Young
column6:
and Joon Ha.
First is Dong Hyun. He is skinny
column7: has curly hair
column8: and is about 140cm tall. He likes baseball. He is better than me at baseball<mod target = . And>
column9: and</mod> he is very talktive and kind. <mod target = But>However
column10: </mod> he is always late. That's the problem. One time
column11:
I waited for him and Gyung Chan for almost 45 minutes. I was very upset.
Second
column12: is Gyung Chan. He is the best friend that I made after the <mod target = 6th>sixth</mod> grade. He is about 160cm
column13: around average weight
column14: and a little tan. He is very kind and gentle. He never speaks ill of others<mod target = . Except>
column15: except</mod> when he is very
column16:
very upset. Gyung Chan is one of the kindest friends I have.
Next is Joon Young. He is the tallest person in my class at about 163cm. He is average weight and he wears glasses. He is good at baseball
column17: </ins> too. When he throws a ball
column18:
I can't catch it because I'm too afraid.
Finally is Joon Ha. He is a little bit taller than me
column19: </ins> and he is a little fat. His face is round and friendly looking. So<ins>
column20: </ins> I am very satisfied with this. He likes making people laugh. I think my friends are very nice and good!":::

column1: 864:::"Last Saturday
column2: my dad
column3: my older brother
column4:
and I went to the playground to play baseball. We went there by bicycle. We arrived there between fifteen to twenty minutes later. There were many people playing different kinds of sports like soccer and baseball.
We tied our bicycles and played baseball. First
column5: we made a triangle and passed the baseball. My dad was good at this
column6: but my brother wasn't good at this. When he threw the ball
column7: he would throw the ball too high and fast. So
column8: I couldn't catch the ball<ins>
column9: </ins> and I had to run a lot to get the ball. It was hard work. I had to run several times to get the ball. I was very tired
column10:
and angry too because my brother threw the ball so high.
Next
column11: we practiced hitting the ball. At first I was the catcher. I had practiced hard with my friends so it was easy to catch my brother's ball. <mod target = But>However
column12: </mod> sometimes
column13: it was still hard to catch my brother's ball. So<ins>
column14: </ins> I would have to run again to get the ball. Next
column15: I was the pitcher<ins>
column16: </ins> and I threw the ball as fast as I could<mod target = . But
column18: but</mod> I couldn't strike anyone out. I thought
column19:
""the condition is bad now.""
It was a very fun time. Next time
column20: I would like to go with my friends and play baseball with them<del>~</del>!":::

column1: 866:::"Today
column2:
my family went to Seoul Grand Park. We went to the zoo there. We got to the zoo on an elephant train.
At the zoo
column3:
we took a lift to go upward. The scenery was fantastic! The colors on the mountain were beautiful. There were many different colored leaves on the mountain.
When we reached the final destination
column4: we first saw otters swimming in a pool. They were very cute and friendly. I wanted to touch the otter's skin. It looked very soft. Next
column5: we saw some bears. They were scary looking<ins>
column6: </ins> but when people throw fruits to them
column7:
they were not scary looking.
We saw peacocks
column8: </ins> too. They were walking at a quick pace. I took pictures of them. Some people held their hands out to the peacock<mod target = . But>
column9:
but we didn't do that because a sign said ""Don't give food to them. They will bite you!""
After that
column10: we went to see deer
column11: crocodile<ins>s</ins>
column12: and some other animals. I think the parrot
column13: armadillo
column14: and some sloths were the highlight. The parrot looked like a parrot that you see in books<ins>
column15: </ins> and the armadillo was staying in its place so that we could take a picture of it. <mod target = And the>The</mod> best part of all<del>
column16: </del> was<ins> that</ins> there were two sloth cubs <mod target = moving at>hanging on the</mod> mother sloth's body. They were very cute and friendly<ins>
column17:
too!
Well
column18: we saw many animals at the zoo. It was very happy<del>
column19: </del> and lucky because when we went to see the animals
column20: all of them were behaving like models!":::

column1: 867:::"Last weekend
column2:
we went to Hoing-sung Gun. Hoing-sung Gun has many mountains and is famous for its beef.
When we went there
column3: we ate <del>a </del>beef-bibimbap. It was very delicious. Honestly
column4: I don't normally like bibimbap<ins>
column5:
but this beef-bibimbap was different. Maybe it tasted better because the beef was good.
Next
column6: we went to the mountain to see many sheep. But<ins>
column7: </ins> the weather was too foggy up on the mountain that I couldn't even <mod target = saw>see</mod> more than 3 to 5 meters in front of me. So
column8: we changed our schedule and decided to go directly to where we were planning on staying. The way <del>getting </del>to our accommodations for the night was difficult at first because of the foggy weather. My family was afraid <mod target = to go>of going</mod> fast because we thought
column9: ""If we go fast
column10:
we could get into a big car accident at any moment.""
Well
column11: in any case<ins>
column12: </ins> we arrived safely <mod target = to>at</mod> the place where we would be spending the night. Our accommodation was made of logs<ins>
column13: </ins> so it looked comfortable and nice. Inside
column14: it was very warm. So
column15:
we warmed up our cold bodies.
In the evening
column16: we ate Gon-de-re Bap. It tasted a little bitter<ins>
column17: </ins> but I ate it thinking
column18:
""This will make my body healthy.""
And After eating dinner
column19: we went deeper into the woods to see lots of stars above us in the sky. When I saw the stars
column20: I couldn't conceal my emotions. The stars were very beautiful and shining brightly. <del>And </del><mod target = sometimes>Sometimes</mod>
column21: we even got to see a shooting star. It was a very beautiful and interesting time for me. I wanted to stay there forever!":::

column1: 868:::"Yesterday
column2: my father
column3: my older brother
column4:
and I went to Kintex. We went there because there was a Korean electronics exhibition at Kintex. It took us an hour to get there.
At the exhibition
column5: there were many different kinds of electronic products such as cell phones
column6: 3D TVs
column7: 3D computers
column8: and a robot cleaner. First
column9: we saw the 3D electronic products and cell phones. The 3D TV was <mod target = FANTASTIC>fantastic</mod>!<del>!!!</del> The people and other things on the 3D TV looked real. So
column10: it is more thrilling to watch on a 3D TV than a 2D TV. But
column11: the 3D TV made me dizzy. So
column12:
I had a headache afterwards.
Next
column13: </ins> we saw cell phones made from another company. The speed of the phones was really fast. <del>And </del><mod target = the>The</mod> designs of their models were beautiful<ins>
column14:
too.
After seeing the 3D TV and cell phones
column15: we saw a 3D computer. My brother and I had a chance to play a 3D game (Fifa <mod target = online>Online</mod> 2) on a 3D computer. Everything looked very realistic<ins>
column16:
just like it did on the 3D TV.
Next
column17: we took a concentration test. I went first and received a score of 95. My older brother had a score of 73. <del>And </del><mod target = my>My</mod> father had a score of 68. I was glad to have the highest score. I had a very interesting time.":::

column1: 869:::"Last Thursday
column2:
my class went on a field trip to Kyong-Bok Palace and the National Museum of Korea.
First
column3: we went to Kyong-Bok Palace. It took us an hour to get there. When I saw the Kyong-Bok Palace
column4: I was very excited and interested. The size of the palace is very
column5: very big! <del>And </del><mod target = it>It</mod> is beautiful with many elaborate details. I saw many pictures of buildings and palaces on the internet <mod target = or>and</mod> even visited some before
column6:
but none of them are as beautiful or as elaborate as the Kyong-Bok Palace.
Kyong-Bok Palace has three gates that can be used to enter. They are very beautiful
column7:
too. My class saw many beautifully-made places like Gyeong-Whoe-Roo.
Next
column8: we went to the National Museum of Korea and had lunch before we entered the museum. The museum is one of the biggest museums in the world. It is very big and enormous. I felt like I was a little ant. The building was huge! The museum had many wonderful things. It had something that was one million years old<del>
column9: </del> and a crown that had been made during the Shin-Ra Dynasty. The crown was made of gold and other expensive materials. But<ins>
column10: </ins> the crown was never placed on the king's head during the king's life. The crown was put on his head at the king's funeral because the crown weighs more than one kilogram. That's a lot of weight to put on a king's head. Ha-ha!":::

column1: 870:::"On Friday afternoon
column2: my group
column3: Joon-young
column4: Seung-woo
column5: and I
column6: went to the police station. On Thursday
column7: my teacher gave us a homework assignment to interview a person who has a job. We thought and thought about who we wanted to talk to. Finally
column8: we decided to interview a police officer. So<ins>
column9: </ins> Seong-woo and I went to the police station to make an appointment. Surprisingly
column10:
it was very easy to make an appointment. We told them we would come back the next day.
We met at Joon-young's house and left 20 minutes later than we were supposed to. I was very angry at this situation because I didn't have a lot of time and wanted to leave earlier.
We arrived at 3:30 in front of the police station. We parked our bicycles and went in. The police officer greeted us kindly
column11: </ins> so we were very happy. After a <mod target = whlie>while</mod>
column12:
I explained to the police officer about our interview assignment and interviewed him.
Joon-young was the camera man and I was the interviewer. I asked him the questions that I had made in school. The police officer kindly answered my questions. It was very fun to interview the police officer. He told me about the thief he had caught
column13: </del> and how to be a police officer. While I was interviewing the police officer
column14: I thought ""If I had made more questions
column15:
I could have asked at least ten more questions.""
When the interview ended
column16: the police officer and I shook hands <ins>with </ins>each other and said good-bye. It was very interesting to interview a police officer. If I <mod target = had>have</mod> another chance to interview a person who has a job
column17: I would interview a police officer again!":::

column1: 871:::"Last Wednesday
column2: I presented my project called
column3: ""How to take care of a lizard and a description of my pet lizard."" It was held in the history room around 1:30 pm. I was very nervous so I couldn't concentrate during my other school lessons. <del>And </del><mod target = my>My</mod> heart was beating violently. After lunch
column4: I went to the history room and waited until 1:30 when the presentation was supposed to begin. I waited anxiously<ins>
column5: </ins> watching the clock and tapping my <mod target = feat>feet</mod> to calm my excitement. In the history room
column6: I saw other boys and girls waiting to give their presentations like me. They were talking loudly so I wondered
column7: ""Why aren't they anxious about the presentation like me?"" While I was thinking about that
column8: the presentations began. First
column9: a little girl in the first grade<del>
column10: </del> presented her project. She talked about how two groups grew plants. One group spoke using nice words and the other group spoke using bad words. The project was special and interesting. Next
column11: another girl in the second grade presented<ins> her project</ins>. Her project was about spending time with <mod target = the>a</mod> Japanese girl. But
column12: I thought it was too boring. After a little while
column13: I presented my project. I spoke the words correctly and loudly. The teachers' reactions were nice and good
column14: better than my expectations. <del>And </del><mod target = after>After</mod> I finished my presentation
column15: they gave me <mod target = many claps>a lot of applause</mod> and cheers. I was very happy after presenting my project. I want to do it again next time.":::

column1: 872:::"Yesterday at school
column2: my class divided into 6 groups and made nine different types of food. My group made a seafood dish
column3: green onion pancakes
column4: and Sujebi<ins>
column5:
a type of Korean soup made with pieces of dough.
First
column6: we made the green onion pancakes. My friend's mom already made the dough for us<ins>
column7: </ins> so it was not hard to make the pancake. We just had to cook it in a greased frying pan. After
column8: we cooked it in the frying pan
column9: I secretly tasted one of the pancakes. When I tasted it
column10: I thought
column11: ""Wow<ins>
column12: </ins> this pancake was deliciously made!"" But<ins>
column13:
I didn't tell my other classmates what I thought about the pancakes because they were too busy paying attention to making the Sujebi.
First
column14: <ins> </ins>we boiled the water with anchovies and some seaweed. We boiled the water for about ten minutes. Next
column15: we chopped some squash and added it to the boiling water. Next
column16: we added pieces of dough to make the Sujebi. <del>And
column17:
We also added some garlic and soy sauce.
When the food was finally done
column18: I tasted some of the Sujebi soup. When I tasted it
column19:
I couldn't say a word because it was so delicious.
After a while
column20: </ins> all of us came together to eat the food we made<mod target =
column21: >.</mod> I ate everything very happily. I want to make food again next time. It was very fun to make the food ourselves.":::

column1:
873:::"My family went to my father's family's house and my mother's family's house during Chu-Seok. Chu-Seok is a Korean holiday in which people eat a special type of rice cake called 'Song-Pyun' and hold a ceremony to remember their ancestors.
For Chu-Seok
column2: we went to my father's family's house to hold a ceremony. During the ceremony
column3: there are many kinds of food such as fish
column4: fruits
column5: meat
column6: and vegetables. It looked very delicious. After holding the ceremony
column7: we ate all that food. Oh
column8: the food was fantastic and excellent. We watched TV after eating breakfast. The TV programs also have specials to celebrate Chu-Seok<ins>
column9: </ins> so it was very fun. In the afternoon
column10: we went to my mother's family's house. There
column11: we met my cousins
column12: my uncles
column13: and my aunt. It was very fun to have so many relatives to celebrate Chu-Seok together
column14: but it was also very <mod target = noise>noisy
column15:
too. My older brother and I played with our cousins who are 16 years old and 17 years old. We spent the night at our cousin's house and we also met our cousin's pet lizard. We were very excited to touch it.
This year's Chu-Seok was very fun and exciting. Hopefully
column16: </ins> it will be even even more fun next year!<del>!

column1: 874:::"Today
column2: I want to introduce you to my pet lizard. It's twenty one centimeters long<del>
column3:
and weighs twenty three grams. Its name is 'Ma-Dol It's a female lizard. and It's very cute and sweet.
My family and my cousin bought Ma-Dol on July 16th at a shop that sells reptile animals. My brother and I were very excited to buy a new pet lizard. At the shop
column4: we saw many different kinds of lizards such as a Beard-Dragon
column5: Gei-Ko
column6: and Water Dragon. <del>And </del>I also saw some snakes. They were very nice and cute<ins>
column7: </ins> but a little more expensive than the lizards. I couldn't decide which lizard to buy. So my cousin
column8: who accompanied my family
column9:
chose a baby-size Beard-Dragon for us.
After looking at the other baby lizards
column10: we decided to buy this baby lizard. It cost eighty-thousand won<ins>
column11:
but the price increased to one-hundred ninety-five thousand won because of the things that my pet lizard would need to live safely and happily.
Now
column12: my pet lizard is growing well. She is gaining weight and growing fast. Every morning
column13: I clean my lizard's waste. I also give her five worms to eat before going to school. I wish that my pet lizard will live as long as it can and have a happy and joyful life!":::

column1: 875:::"Today
column2: my family went to the bicycle shop. Since the weather was fair and the sky was cloudless
column3: my dad decided to go to the bicycle shop. We needed new bicycles because my bicycle
column4: my brother's bicycle
column5:
and my mom's bicycle are all too old to ride.
When I arrived at the bicycle shop
column6: I was very excited. In front of the shop
column7: there were many new
column8: modern bicycles lined up. They were very nice and looked expensive. While I was looking at the different bicycles my parents found the perfect bicycle. It was nice and beautifully made. I told my parents that I wanted to buy this bicycle. So
column9:
my parents bought that bicycle for me and my elder brother. And My mom found a cheap bicycle with a basket on it. We were very happy to buy new bicycles.
In the evening
column10: we rode our bicycles from our home to Induckwon city. We had a great time riding our bicycles. I will ride my new bicycle very often!<del>!!

column1: 876:::"August 13th
column2:
2011
I went to the Yulgok leadership academy camp for one night and two days. The Camp participants
column3: including my brother and myself
column4: gathered at Sungkyunkwan University<del>
column5: </del> and wore traditional Korean clothes for nobility. <del>And </del><mod target = then>Then
column6: </mod> we visited Sungkyunkwan<ins>
column7: </ins> which was the main university during the Chosun Dynasty. We went around the dormitory where Sungkyunkwan's students used to sleep<del>
column8: </del> and Myungryundang<ins>
column9: </ins> which is where the monument carved by Gojong
column10: the king of Chosun Dynasty
column11: is located. While we were looking around the campus
column12:
we saw two ginkgo trees that were 500 years old. The trees were very tall and thick.
After visiting Sungkyunkwan
column13: </ins> we learned how to drink tea and how to bow to seniors. Next
column14:
we moved to the Jawoon lecture hall which is located in Paju city. It is a place where you can see Yiyi's portrait. He studied at the Jawoon lecture hall.
We looked around the Yulgok memorial hall
column15: too. In the hall<ins>
column16:
we saw the masterpieces of Yiyi's mother and his elder sister. And We listened to the lecture about Yiyi's leadership by professor Kim Yongjae. His lecture was so interesting and instructive that time flew by.
Today was an unforgettable day for me. That's because I learned that Yiyi was a very great scholar who had abilities of critical thinking
column17: insight
column18: and positive thinking.":::

column1: 877:::"I'm still studying for the final exam for the Ban-Ki Moon English Contest. I'm very nervous because this might be the last chance for me to get a new phone. My mother won't let me have a new one because she thinks that my phone already costs too much. I have to win 4th place so that I can get a new phone... So<ins>
column2: </ins> I have to study extraordinarily hard...":::

column1: 878:::"Ban-Ki Moon is the UN Secretary-General. Ban-Ki Moon succeeded in getting re-elected as the Secretary-General of the UN for another <mod target = 5>five</mod> years. My mother says that the UN Secretary-General was elected to work for another <mod target = 5>five</mod> years<del>
column2: </del> because everyone knows that Ban-Ki Moon is very talented and a hard worker. I also read about Ban-Ki Moon in a book. I learned that Ban-Ki Moon is very good at writing down whatever the people around him says. He is also very talented at writing
column3: too. Do you know why I am telling you about him? <mod target = Because>It's because</mod> I have to compete in the Ban-Ki Moon English Test (<del> </del>the final test<del> </del>)<del>
column4: </del> and if I win 4th place
column5: I will go to the UN for free<mod target =
column6: >.</mod> <del>and </del>I will also <ins>get to </ins>change my old cellphone into a new one! My mother promised to buy me one if I win. I hope I will win the competition!":::

column1: 879:::"My English academy teacher told me that I have won the first prize in a competition in which the top 30 students are chosen to go to Canada. There were about 500 students who competed. I won the first prize<del>
column2: </del> and my brother won the second prize. Ten students were awarded for each prize. I am one of the top ten students out of all the students who competed in this competition<del>
column3: </del> and my brother is one of the 11-20th highest students among the competitors. I am really proud of myself. I'm looking forward to going to Canada.":::

column1: 880:::"On July 28th
column2: I went to Ocean World water park with my English academy classmates. First
column3: I decided which friend I would want to play with. I selected <mod target = 4>four</mod> friends<del>
column4: </del> and we had a good time playing in the water. I rode almost every ride in Ocean World<del>
column5: </del> and it was fun. I didn't have time to ride four of the best rides though. There are <mod target = 6>six</mod> in total
column6: but I have only been on <mod target = 2>two</mod> of them. But
column7: I guess people liked the new rides. I hope I can visit Ocean World again.":::

column1: 881:::"I am going to compete with about 300 GnB English Academy students to go to Canada. I need to be at least in the 30th place so I can go to Canada. I <mod target = REALLY REALLY>really
column2: really</mod> want to go to Canada because I have <mod target = NEVER EVER>never ever</mod> gone abroad. It could be my last chance. I have to win. Everyone
column3: wish me luck.":::

column1: 882:::"I am going to the Ocean World water park on July 28th<del>
column2: </del> with my English academy friends. I can't wait. I am thinking about who I am going to play with and what rides I can go on. I can't wait for this day. I can barely sit still right now. I cannot think of anything else. I cannot think of my homework
column3: my studies
column4: or anything else. I will dream about Ocean World tonight.":::

column4: </ins> why did they want to hold the Olympic games in PyeongChang? I don't understand. What's the difference between Korea and the other countries wanting to host the Olympics? Does Korea have an easier course? I don't understand the reason why everyone is so happy about it...":::

column1: 885:::"I recently watched a movie called 'Kung-Fu Panda 2<mod target = '
column2:
>.' and it was really exciting!
In 'Kung Fu Panda 1

column8: but his face looked wicked. Po and the Furious Five went on a grand adventure to remove Shen. They had almost lost because of those amazing weapons of death. But<ins>

column10: </ins> which was the only way to stop the wicked weapons. Shen was still alive<del>

column13: </ins> they had a final fight. Shen used his power to try to kill Po

column16: </del> and Po quickly moved away from the building. But<ins>

column18: </ins> he died. In the middle of the story

column20: </ins> he had killed most of the pandas. Some pandas ran away

column24: </ins> <mod target = She>she</mod> put Po in a box with some food. <del>And </del><mod target = she>She</mod> ran off. But<ins>

column26: </del> and it was so huge

column29: he was blown away <ins>be</ins>cause of that <mod target = canon>cannon</mod>

column1: 886:::"I competed in the Ban-Ki Moon English Contest on June 13th. I competed in it last year<ins>
