column1: 890:::"This morning
column2: I started to read a book titled Oliver Twist. A famous writer in England named Charles Dickens wrote the book. The book's title is known to many people. It was known to me for a long time
column3: but I hadn't actually read it seriously. I found the first and second volumes of Oliver Twist in my bookcase. I have both the English and Korean versions at home
column4: and I decided that I would read the Korean and English versions together
column5:
comparing them so that I can understand them better.
A poor woman died after her baby was born. The baby was sent to a workhouse
column6: and <ins>was </ins>named Oliver Twist. The boys there wanted more food
column7: and they chose Oliver to ask for more. Oliver carried out the task
column8: and he was treated cruelly as a result. The workhouse didn't want him anymore
column9: and gave him to an undertaker. The undertaker was kind to Oliver
column10: but the undertaker's family was unjust and bad to Oliver. Oliver escaped after being beaten by the family. He was wandering the street when he met a boy from a group of boy beggars. He joined the group
column11: but he was greeted with a huge incident. The boys were pickpockets on the busy London streets
column12: and that day
column13: Oliver left with two boys. The two boys stole a gentleman's handkerchief
column14: and the gentleman realized his handkerchief was gone. Oliver did not steal the handkerchief
column15: but he was accused of stealing it because he was standing right behind the gentleman. <mod target = But>However
column16: </mod> the truth was discovered a few hours later
column17: by a bookstore owner. The gentleman took Oliver to his home
column18: and fed him well<mod target = . But>
column19: but</mod> the group of beggars weren't that happy<del>
column20: </del> because they lost Oliver. They sent two girls to get Oliver back. That's as far as I have read
column21:
but I think the story is going to be great fun.
I've researched about the book on Wikipedia. It said that the story depicted England's social life
column22: and Charles Dickens was criticizing the social evils. I felt sorry for Oliver Twist
column23: and I was really angry at the unjust laws that prevented the boy from living freely as a human should.":::

column1:
891:::"There are many ways to die. Some people die of accidents. Some people die peacefully when the time comes. Some people die of sicknesses. Some people die of wars.
Recently
column2:
Andre Kim died. I imagine hundreds of people will be there at his funeral to mourn for his death. This made me think about death.
I think death has two faces. One is a bad face
column3:
and one is a good face. The bad face is the death takes people we love away from us.
This is why we have negative thoughts about death
column4: but</mod> we must not forget that death has a good face. The good face is that without death
column5:
life is meaningless.
If there was no death
column6: we would suffer every day because people would always be increasing and not decreasing. We should leave this world when we <mod target = should>are suppposed to
column7: </mod> and go into the afterlife. Before we go
column8: we should leave a simple legacy
column9: say goodbye properly
column10: and leave quietly. That is what we should do for the world.":::

column1: 892:::"My English Gifted Institution is called ""CEEGY""
column2: an abbreviation for the ""Center for English Education for Gifted Youth<mod target = "".>.""</mod> It is CEEGY vacation currently
column3: and after the vacation
column4: it will be the third semester. I miss all the CEEGY students
column5: even those who didn't talk with me or play with me a lot. So<ins>
column6: </ins> I'm writing a letter to them. I'm not going to send it to them<del>
column7: </del> because that would be too embarassing<mod target = . But>
column8:
but maybe writing the letter will help me to remember all the wonderful memories of my friends. (I'm trying not to remember the bad memories!).

To: CEEGY Friends
It is really hot these days
column9: right? I hope all of us stay healthy during the vacation. Every Saturday
column10: I remember how I used to grab my bag at 2:45 PM and ride to Kyungpook University when it wasn't CEEGY vacation. I think our vacation is too long. Our vacation is more than one month
column11: and even during CEEGY weeks
column12:
we have two weeks of vacation because of our school tests.
I went to Kyungpook University on July 30th and brought the CEEGY books. There were eight books
column13: and two of them were workbooks. The workbooks contained information about debating. They are our first workbooks. I read them at home
column14: and I think these workbooks will turn our CEEGY lessons more into a school lesson. It's fine with me
column15: though. I think I will feel great after studying hard at CEEGY and returning home
column16: rather than just playing. Our lessons were close to playing and talking
column17:
but it will be different now.
From the CEEGY books
column18: I read ""The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time"" and ""The Giver"". Both of them are really fun
column19: and I think they are very creative books. The protagonist of the first book I mentioned is a fifteen-year-old boy who is a bit strange. He hates yellow and brown
column20: and he also hates when somebody touches him
column21: even his mother and father. <mod target = And>Also
column22: </mod> he is great at math<mod target = . Also
column23: he>and</mod> detests lying. The second book I mentioned is also interesting. A whole new community enters there
column24: and the protagonist is a twelve-year-old boy named Jonas. This new community is too orderly
column25: I think. Oh
column26: I'd better not tell you more<del>
column27:
because that would spoil the surprise and the fun. Remember what I told you and read the books when you get them. They're great!
Last of all
column28:
I will jot down some words to students of different ages.
1. Those Who are the Same Age as Me (Elementary Grade 6): Sandy
column29: Jacklin
column30: Neil
column31: Seanybear-We should be proud that we are the youngest at CEEGY! I have big hopes and expectations for the third semester. You are the most congenial with me
column32:
especially Sandy! Let's not lose our special friendship!
2. Those Who are One Year Older than Me (Middle Grade 1): Lena
column33: James-I've heard that the life of middle schoolers is very different from the life of elementary students. Is it true that there's no vacation with middle schoolers? Let's study hard! Lena
column34: let's not lose our friendship! And James
column35:
I hope you make lots of friends at CEEGY. I don't want to see you being an outsider for the rest of the CEEGY semesters.
3. The Oldest in CEEGY (Middle Grade 2): Kelly
column36: Peter
column37: Mike
column38: Clara
column39: Ann
column40: Nick
column41: Lisa
column42: Jessica
column43: Susie
column44: Becky
column45: Jennie
column46: Tony
column47: Martin
column48: Sally
column49: Julie
column50: Shawn
column52: Sarah-I always respect you. You must be wiser and smarter than me because you're two years older than me. I've only been friends with Kelly
column56:
but I hope to make more friends when CEEGY vacation ends! Bye.
See you on September 4th!
From

column1: 893:::"My head feels light. What? No
column2: I don't mean that I've gotten <mod target = more stupid>stupider</mod>! I mean that my hair feels light. Why? <mod target = Because>It's because</mod> I had a haircut
column3:
of course!
If there was a contest that picked the person with the most hair
column4: I'd take first prize. Well
column5: I would have taken first prize
column6: because<mod target = -> </mod>wow
column7: I had so much hair! I've seen three or four hairbands break because they couldn't hold all my hair together. Even the biggest tweezers couldn't have held all my hair together. Every person who touched my hair exclaimed
column8:
""Wow! You have lots of hair!"" or something like that.
Strange
column9: I felt quite proud of that
column10: and when my mom suggested that I should go to the hair dresser
column11: I refused. <mod target = But>However
column12: </mod> as I lived through the summer
column13: I couldn't bear it. It was so hot! The fan was turned on for hours. It seemed like it would burst into flames any minute. Finally
column14:
I agreed with mom. We would go to the hair dresser.
I went to a hair dresser's shop called L.":::

column1:
894:::"This diary entry is a bit religious. I hope readers won't mind. ^^
I went to summer camp at church from the 19th to the 21st. All elementary students were welcome
column2: but there were some kids who didn't get to come. That's too bad! Why
column3: you ask? Just read on
column4: I'll tell you about my summer camp! We went to Kyeongju's Youth Hostel
column5:
the place where people from the show ""One Night Two Days"" once visited. It was a clean place with good facilities and big rooms. There were also two guest rooms. I'll explain about the guest rooms later on.
On the first day
column6: we had a camp opening worship with lively songs. That night
column7: we all had a big party with costumes of our own! I didn't have any bombastic clothes in particular
column8:
so I brought a hair band with rabbit ears.
On the second day
column9: well--that day was a highlight. We went swimming in the morning
column10: and in the afternoon--oh
column11: it was great! There was a team of elementary students (grade 3~grade 6) named Noa. Noa is short for ""Singing Children"". I loved them so much!! Noa's members danced to worship songs and they were great! After their performance
column12: they all scattered and <mod target = came>went</mod> to different classes. There was a handsome fifth grade boy in my class called Gun Lee
column13: and when I took his hand in mine when we all had to pray holding each others' hands
column14: <mod target = his hand>it</mod> was warm and I liked him. After praying
column15: we had a chance to dance with the Noa members. I knew the song and the dance very well
column16: and I danced as well as I could<del>
column17: </del> just like the Noa members. Then the Noa members gave signs to us<mod target = -we>. We</mod> already became fans of them! There was this tall
column18: handsome boy my age called Seung-ho Baek
column19: and he gave a sign. I told him that he danced really well
column20: and he lowered his eyes and thanked me shyly. And guess what? Those Noa members slept--yes
column21: slept--in our youth hostel that night! In those two guest rooms I talked about earlier! We all went wild over it
column22: especially me. My younger sister met Seung-ho a few times
column23: and she told me that Seung-ho asked about how I was doing
column24: and that he said that I looked smart and diligent. That Noa group was really great
column25:
and I found myself being a fan of them.
Oh
column26: I think I talked too much about Noa... anyway
column27: it was a great summer camp. I am going to another church summer camp today. I hope that summer camp will be as great as this one!":::

column1: 895:::"Summer vacation.<mod target = .. if>  If</mod> you hear the word
column2: you feel elated
column3: you feel your spirits soar high up in the sky
column4: and you feel as free as an eagle. We are free of school. That's all. We have lots of time to do what we want during vacation
column5:
and that's what makes us all happy because there is much more freedom!
Yes
column6: that freedom delights us<mod target = . And>
column7: and</mod> ""us"" includes me. I usually <mod target = didn>don</mod>'t like vacation<del>
column8: </del> because I love<del>d</del> school so much<mod target = . But>
column9: but</mod> on my first summer vacation<del>
column10: </del> I realized that summer vacation is much greater than I thought. I had many privileges. From then on
column11:
I came to like both school days and summer vacation.
I have many plans. First
column12: I will travel a lot. Half of my trips are related to my church. The rest are family trips. I will gain loads of experience and have fun! Second
column13: I will read a lot. I haven't been able to read a lot of books on school days. I plan to read thirty books this summer vacation. No less
column14:
no more: thirty.
I can't wait for vacation to begin. I just can't wait!":::

column1: 897:::"July is here! Yesterday was the first day of July. I love July<del>
column2: </del> because it is my busiest month of the year<mod target = ->. </mod>I like being busy rather than being bored and having nothing to do. First
column3: July 13th is my mother's birthday and July 15th is my birthday. From July 13th to 14th
column4: <del>there </del>will be the national test <del>(</del>Wow! It must be fantastically difficult
column5: <ins> but</ins> I'm looking forward to it!<del>)</del> <mod target = consisting>It consists</mod> of five subjects: Korean
column6: Math
column7: Social Studies
column8: Science
column9: and English. Vacation starts on July 20th. From July 19th to July 21th
column10: and from July 25th to 26th<del>
column11: </del> I will go to church camps<mod target = . And>
column12: and</mod> from July 30th to July 31th<del>
column13:
our family will go on a trip.
Busy
column14: isn't it? There are camps
column15: birthdays
column16: and tests. It's the sort of month that I like a lot. I especially look forward to July 15th
column17: when it is my birthday. I think I will invite three friends. Maybe So-mang
column18: Ji-hyeon
column19:
and Seung-ji? Or I could invite Su-bin and Min-ju.
Anyway
column20: I think I love July. I'm looking forward to all these events I've babbled about
column21: especially that national test (groan
column22: groan
column23: groan)!":::

column1: 898:::"I am so glad that my test is ove<mod target = r. But>
column2: but</mod> I am in no position to be so happy and carefree<del>
column3: </del> because I don't have time to celebrate<ins>
column4:
nor am I free of care (ha ha).
There's a test for sixth graders soon on July 13rd and 14th. It's a national test
column5: and after you take the test
column6: they tell you your grade compared with all the students in Korea! You have to prepare thoroughly<del>
column7: </del> or else you'll have to pay the price for playing just because the final exam is over. I was going to go into my class homepage when I went into another class' homepage by mistake. For fun
column8: I checked the writings updated there<mod target = . And>
column9: and</mod> suddenly<del>
column10: </del> I found luck. There was a writing posted by that class'<ins>s</ins> teacher
column11: and it was about the national test! I was so happy
column12: and I printed the material right away. Now I know all about that test
column13: and my friends don't! I was especially happy about that fact
column14: but then again
column15: sharing information is a good thing to do. So<ins>
column16:
I took the material to school today and shared all I know with my friends.
On Monday
column17: all the sixth graders will get to know their test results. I'm so nervous. I'm afraid that I'll get a bad scoreBut>
column18: but</mod> I'm also hopeful about my future. <del>Ha ha~

column1: 899:::"Our school held the annual English speech competition today. I've participated in this competition two times<mod target =
column2: >. Once</mod> when I was in fourth grade and<ins> once in</ins> fifth grade. I won the best prize both times
column3:
but I didn't practice a lot for this competition. That was why I was so nervous.
I was the last one to make a speech. My speech was about my younger sister. Even though I didn't prepare a lot
column4: I think I did well. I have many experiences with English competitions
column5: including speaking. I'm not the least bit nervous to speak in front of many people. You feel crazy with nerves just before the teacher calls out your name and asks you to stand on the stage<mod target = . But>
column6: but</mod> once you get started with your story
column7: you sort of sink into your story and be a part of your story
column8: rather than just telling it to the people. Of course
column9: when you forget your lines
column10: you return to the real world and quickly glance at the tattered paper. That's what I felt. It was a wonderful
column11: tingling sensation. Through the competition
column12:
I was able to confirm my love for English once more.
I hope I win first place. That will make me it a three-peat. A three-peat is a fabulous thing for one to make. I love English
column13: and I'm trying hard to develop my skills.":::

column2: man! It is test period again.That's why I can't write a lengthy diary entry today<mod target =
column3: and>. It'll be like that</mod> next week
column4: and the week after that. I'm too busy doing school homework
column5: my Center for English Education for Gifted Youth homework
column6: and studying for my tests. My whole day flows by after I do those things. Being busy is a whole lot better than being bored to death<del>
column7: </del> because when you are bored
column8: you don't have things to do and you don't feel very profitable. <mod target = But>However
column9: </mod> now that I'm super busy
column10: I'll have to hurry up and concentrate on all my studies. I have 24 hours<del>
column11: </del> like everybody else. I'll have to be thankful that one day isn't one hour or thirty minutes or something. If I use my given time well
column12: I'll profit more than others<ins>
column13: </ins> and I'll get <del>super </del>great test scores!":::

column1: 901:::"I have a pretty little diary. It has many pictures of girls
column2: drawn by Youk Shim Won. I don't know who that is
column3: but it's a nice diary<mod target = -->. </mod>I got it from Mr.C. You may think that I use it for writing secret things and I lock it tightly
column4: but I do not. Of course
column5: nobody is supposed to read it
column6:
but it really doesn't have any secret things written inside it. It shows who I am through the things that are written inside it.
I write study plans inside the diary. First
column7: I write the date<mod target = --> </mod>completely
column8: from the year to the day of the week. Then I write down my plan for the day. I write down the time
column9: what I will study
column10: and how. I also write down what kind of studies I will tell my sister to do. My mother doesn't return until 6:30
column11: and I have to take care of my little sister all the time
column12:
including making sure she does all her studies. Example (not for today):
1. 3:30-4:30--school homework (sister: math)
2. 4:30-5:30--math (Problem Solving Guide Workbook: Level 1 and 2/Hardest Questions: more than 10 problems)
column13:
sister: write a Bible verse
If I write more study plans and try to live each day according to those plans
column14: I will be able to learn a lot and study a lot. I think this is a good way to study
column15: and I recommend this way of studying to every student.":::

column1: 902:::"My grandfather was born in Japan in August 1945. When he was just one hundred days old
column2: Korea was freed from Japan. It was then that he started to live in Chilgok
column3: in northern Kyeongsang province. The Korean War started when he was five
column4: and he spent his childhood life terribly as a refugee. In the place where he resided
column5: there was the hard-fought field of the Nakdong River
column6: the cruelest and the bloodiest place during the Korean War. Many South Korean soldiers and North Korean soldiers were killed there. There is a story that the soldiers' blood mixed together in the Nakdong River
column7: which made the place even more frightening. A War Memorial Hall was established there to cherish the memory of the brave South Korean soldiers. The war destroyed almost everything
column8: and my grandfather did not have enough food<mod target = --consequently>. Consequently</mod>
column9:
he suffered very much. America helped Koreans to get back in shape. Grandfather says that this is why he lives and prospers so much now. He told me that we now have our own responsibility to help poor neighboring countries.
Grandfather had a lot of best friends--the number ranged from five to ten. He and his friends chased each other around happily in the field. Grandfather loved to catch grasshoppers and dragonflies
column10: and they helped their parents farm. He says that life was more like African tribal society life at that time rather than civilized life. Grandfather lived in the countryside
column11: so of course he did those kinds of things with his friends. These days
column12: best friends play sports games together and hang out in urban areas. <mod target = And they>They</mod> do their favorite pastimes during leisure time. They never chase each other around and search for insects. I suppose kids who lived in grandfather's time were healthier than us<mod target = --they>
column13: </mod> played a lot outside
column14:
and they enjoyed nature more than us.
Grandfather also flew kites
column15: rode sleds
column16: and played marble games. When he was in elementary school<del>
column17: </del> he <del>says </del>liked the spring and fall picnics
column18: and he also liked field day. My grandfather has a shameful memory about field day
column19: when he was in fourth grade. He was running a 100 meter course
column20: and at the middle of the course stood a math problem that the runners had to solve before they could go on. He couldn't solve it
column21: and so he came in last. I guess grandfather's childhood lifestyle was a lot different from mine. I don't play a lot of games in my spare time. I read books or idle around. No one flies kites
column22: rides sleds
column23: or play<ins>s</ins> with marbles these days<mod target = . But>
column24: but</mod> it would be nice if those kinds of healthy games would continue to be played. Boys play a lot of computer games
column25: and organize comic clubs to draw comic strips in their notebooks. Girls are all different. Some of them crochet
column26: some of them draw
column27: many of them enjoy pop singers' photos and stickers
column28:
and some of them read a lot of books. Both boys and girls watch TV dramas every day.


The contents above are a part of my personal essay on my family's history. I'm doing a project called Family Oral History for CEEGY. It is all about interviewing our older family members and researching our family history. It is a very valuable project for me
column29: </del> because not only is it fun
column30: but it will also be a lasting legacy for future generations.":::

column7: but it also makes me happy. If I write a beautiful card for my teacher

column9: that makes me really happy. On Teacher's Day

column14: I'll just have to fire up and work hard on my cards.<del>..

column1: 904:::"There is a poem titled ""Alchemy""
column2:
written by Sara Teasdale. The poem is the following:

I lift my heart as spring lifts up
A yellow daisy to the rain;
My heart will be a lovely cup
Altho' it holds but pain.

For I shall learn from flower and leaf
That color every drop they hold
column3:
To change the lifeless wine of grief
To living gold.

""Change the lifeless wine of grief to living gold."" That's my favorite expression in this poem. This expression shows why the title is ""Alchemy"". Alchemy is all about changing a base metal to gold
column4: and this poem is actually about turning something into another thing-something bad into a glorious
column5: valuable thing. If scientific alchemy is about base metals and gold and silver
column6: I believe the poem says that the alchemy of life is about changing grief to happiness and joy. As I mulled over this poem
column7: I was thankful that humans have the ability to change emotions<mod target = . Because> because</mod> without this ability
column8: we would live like reeds
column9: our lives corrupted by bad
column10: rough emotions. Alchemy is also all about choice. If we choose to stay happy
column11: we would use the potions of smile<ins>s</ins>
column12: positive attitude<ins>s</ins>
column13: and brightness to make glittering happiness. If we choose to be unhappy
column14: we would do nothing for our lifeless wine of grief to change to living gold-it would just stay as a lifeless wine
column15: and we would have to drink it. We should use the magic of alchemy well in our lives<del>
column16: </del> to live a happy life <mod target = enjoying>to enjoy</mod> living gold instead of a dull life drinking <ins>the </ins>wine<del>s</del> of grief.":::

column1: 906:::"I got a perfect score on my test! I'm very happy about the result. Our class produced three students with perfect scores

column4: but I kept it to myself and didn't even smile. The moment I begin to show happiness
column5: my friends and all the other students will begin to hate me<mod target = --> because </mod>that is the way elementary students react to <mod target = perfect score-makers>people with perfect scores</mod>. I've gotten used to it. This is the fourth time I got a perfect score on a school test
column6: and my mother and my mothers' friends from church were very happy. My younger sister congratulated me also. I like this moment of glory
column7:
even if it is very temporary.
However

column10:
so that I can make another perfect score in June.

I think.
For now

column1: 909:::"I have started to read Animal Farm with interest
column2: not only because I have to read it for my English Gifted Education Center
column3: but also because it is very fun. In the book
column4:
there are commandments called ""The Seven Commandments"". I have begun to focus on these commandments. Here they are:

""THE SEVEN COMMANDMENTS. 1. Whatever goes upon two legs is an enemy. 2. Whatever goes upon four legs
column5: or has wings
column6:
is a friend. 3. No animal shall wear clothes. 4. No animal shall sleep in a bed. 5. No animal shall drink alcohol. 6. No animal shall kill any other animal. 7. All animals are equal."" (24-25)

So
column7: </mod> I have written a letter to Snowball
column8:
a smart pig who runs Manor Farm now that Jones is gone.

To: Snowball
Snowball
column9: these commandments may seem fair to you and your comrades
column10: but from the way I see it
column11: they are not reasonable commandments. Rule seven and rule five seem good
column12:
but the rest of the commandments are very unreasonable.
Let's look at rule one. You said that birds' wings are legs
column13: but they aren't. Legs support our body and help us to walk
column14: and wings don't help the birds walk
column15: and they don't support the birds' bodies. Birds have two legs
column16: too. So you should say
column17:
""except for birds"" at the end of the rule. Got it? Then change it.
Rule two is unreasonable also. Say that Mollie betrays you and goes off wandering back to Jones. Mollie still has four legs. Can you still say that Mollie is your friend? No
column18: she is not<mod target = -> because </mod>she's your enemy. If anybody in the farm betrays you
column19: or if any animal attacks you
column20: they are your <mod target = enemies>enemy</mod>
column21:
not your friends.
Rule three and four. Snowball
column22: you like doing scientific experiments
column23: don't you? Instead of avoiding the humans' possessions<del>
column24:
you can take them into your laboratory and use them to make life for the animals more comfortable. Don't just avoid them-make them your own. You avoid everything related to humans. That's stupid. Change and develop the human possessions into your possessions so that your life and your comrades will have a better life.
Rule six seems fair
column25: but for especially good reasons<mod target =
column26: > because</mod> you can kill another animal. For example
column27: if a comrade betrays you and brings grave danger
column28: you are free to kill that comrade. It is evil
column29: but that is the only way. However
column30: the bad thing is that it brings feuds<ins>
column31: </ins> <del>and </del>wars<ins>
column32: </ins> and quarrels. So<ins>
column33:
I advise that you keep that rule.
So
column34: </mod> I have said all I want to say. If you don't want to change your commandments
column35: then don't. <mod target = But>However
column36: </mod> I'm just asking you to consider my advice and review your commandments. Also
column37: I ask you to reconsider your new maxim: ""Four legs good
column38: two legs bad"". It isn't specific enough
column39:
so it would be nice if you could change it.
I hope your life goes well
column40: and I sincerely hope Jones will not return to your farm. <mod target = But>However
column41: </mod> he may return<del>
column42: </del> if you don't get your animals in focus. In order to do that
column43: you should change your rules. Well then
column44:
bye.
Sincerely
column45:
Anne (my nickname is Anne.)

I hope you guys read Animal Farm
column46: </ins> too<mod target =
column47: >.</mod> <mod target = it>It</mod>'s a very famous novel. It's not actually a novel
column48: but it's a kind of long fable. Anyway
column49: it helps you to understand about animal values
column50: and that's what makes the book so special!":::

column1: 910:::"I'm reading a book titled Animal Farm
column2: written by George Orwell. At the beginning of the story
column3: an old male pig named Old Major gathers all the farm animals and tells them his view about humans. He says that humans are all wicked
column4: and humans are the only egotistic<ins>al</ins> animals on Earth. The animals give birth to baby animals and produce milk. Who are the ones who take those things? Humans! Old Major says that humans rob the animals' fruits of hard labor
column5: and they never reward the animals with comfort<mod target = -they
column6: >. </mod> <mod target = instead>Instead</mod>
column7: <ins>they </ins>kill the animals when their death is drawing near. Old Major also says that all animals with four legs or wings are friends
column8: and all animals with two legs (by this
column9: he means only humans) are enemies. He tells the animals never to trust humans
column10: and he hopes that someday
column11: there will be a sort of rebellion or protest that will make the humans stop dominating the animals. There is even a lullaby between the animals that sings of a bright future<mod target = . And>
column12:
and this bright future means a future that is human-free.
Old Major was right. It is true that we humans use the animals for our own good
column13: as if they weren't alive. I can perfectly well imagine what I would have thought if I were an animal. I would be so angry
column14: I would really cause a rebellion to happen
column15: <ins>even </ins>protests and demonstrations and everything! I feel sorry for the animals<mod target = . But....>
column16: but</mod> if I were to answer the animals in response
column17: <del>I would say-I mean
column18: </del>I would have to say
column19: ""I understand how you feel. We're very sorry. However
column20:
there's nothing we can do. We can't only live by eating fruits and vegetables and herbs. We need meat.""
The best we can do is to love and care for the animals we don't have to kill for meat. We shouldn't only raise awareness for endangered animals
column21: but we should also preserve animals near us
column22: like cats and dogs. Animals are a part of our world and our community<mod target = -we>. We</mod> should value their lives the same as<ins> we would those of</ins> human beings<del>'</del>
column23: and we should understand that they rightly share the ownership of this world.":::

column1: 911:::"Nowadays

I came to like Friday because Friday is the only day with ethics).
The first chapter of ethics is called
column12: ""Sincere Life"". In this chapter
column13: we share our thoughts about being sincere<del>
column14: </del> and promise ourselves to be sincere always. What is being sincere<mod target = ? And> and</mod> how can we be sincere in our lives? My new ethics teacher helped us understand that by having us share our thoughts in groups and write our thoughts with colored pens on a large sheet of drawing paper. She also told us to pick the best idea and write a password with it<mod target = -for example>. For example</mod>
column15: we drew a castle and a ball of thread for ""sincerity"" in Korean. It was really fun
column16:
and it helped us to understand what ""being sincere"" is all about.
My idea was that ""sincerity"" is a prop for success. We never see a successful people who are not sincere. My group thought this was a good idea
column17:
and we picked this as the best idea and printed it out into a password. Our ethics teacher liked the idea also.
How can I be sincere in my own life? I could exercise for at least thirty minutes every day. I could get up at 4:30 in the morning and prepare my school lessons. I could read three books every day for my younger sister. I promised myself that I will put these into action every day
column18: and always keep in mind to be sincere. Today's ethics class was a very successful one
column19: and I will never forget the valuable lesson I learned today.":::

column1: 912:::"I'm reading a book written by a reporter who spent most of his <del>reporter </del>life on reporting Ki-Moon Ban

column20:
and> where he was finally elected as Secretary General.
Ki-Moon buildt sturdy passion and great kindness from his youth. That's why he is so great now. His studies and works are quite stunning. One time

So<ins>
column3:
we can't play right after the second exam is finished.

so we went to the KT building near Lotte Mart.

column1: 926:::"Our class is now doing a school project. On May 21st
column2: the teacher told us that we'll have a presentation on June 11th. She told us not to meet outside of school to do this
column3:
but it is only allowed to be worked on during class.

There wasn't much time
column4: </del> because we only have this class once a week so we had to do it as fast as we could. Our group chose two topics. One is ""Our own eco-friendly car"" and the other is ""A new eco-friendly city."" We decided to draw the city on paperb<ins>
column5:
and I was chosen to draw an eco-friendly car.

The car that I designed looks like the TF-x
column6: the flying car<mod target = . But>
column7:
but mine is designed to use compost as its fuel.

The other team's ideas looked good
column8: but our eco-friendly city is perfect compared to the other teams' work. I hope next week's presentation is successful.":::

column8: and we wrote him a thank-you. I am chatting with him on kakao talk these days. He taught me how to grow taller and recommended that I play volleyball. He also taught me how to overcome my bad results. He's such a nice teacher!":::

I went hiking on Mt. Bukhan. After we walked for about 30 minutes

column6:

Tomorrow is the last day of our trip

column1: 931:::"Yesterday at a nearby park
column2: we had a sketching contest. We had to walk there to join the contest. I went there with two of my friends. The teacher told us to get there by 8 a.m.
column3: but even at 7:30 in the morning
column4:
there were lots of people at the meeting spot.

We could choose between writing and sketching
column5: and I chose to sketch this time. We took our place at a pretty quiet spot. In front of me
column6:
there was a short path with trees all around so I decided to draw that scene.

I drew my picture for an hour and a half
column7: and for the <del>next </del>30 minutes<ins> after that</ins> I painted it. At first I tried very hard to make my picture look good
column8:
but it didn't come out as well as I had expected.

After the contest was over
column9: we ate jajangmyeon for lunch and then went to school to join our school club. We already finished making a pencil case
column10:
and yesterday we started to make a pouch.

Yesterday was a very happy day. The best thing about it was that we didn't have to study for 7 hours. I hope every one of my days will be like yesterday!":::

My dream was to be a diplomat

column5: I still want to go to a foreign language high school. So<ins>
column6: </ins> I was very happy when I thought I got all <ins>the </ins>problems correct in English. <mod target = But unfortunately>Unfortunately</mod>

column8:
and I cried a lot because I couldn't believe it. I thought I wouldn't be able to go to a foreign language high school.

My friends told me ""That's a nice result

column17:
and songs.

column1: 934:::"From next Monday to Wednesday
column2:

To me

column4:
""All questions on the exam will be related to the graphs and the map.""

We took seven performance assessments up until now. I got an A in technology
column5: home economics
column6: and Chinese language class. During P.E.

we had three tasks and one more question on technology and economics.

All of the results will come out through a result paper after the exams are over. Right now
column10: English is separated into three classes. The highest class is ""Melon""
column11: the next is ""Apple
column12: and the last is ""Kiwi."" After the exam
column13: the three classes will be separated again depending on our results. I'm in the Melon class now
column14:

I'm not good at studying
column15: but I want to. So<ins>
column16: </ins> now I'm practicing hard. I hope this exam's result will be nice!":::

column1: 935:::"On Monday at school
column2: we had a ceremony to celebrate Science Day. This was the 15th annual ceremony
column3: and its intention is to let us know about the importance of science. Up until now
column4: I drew pictures of our future planet for Science Day
column5:
but this time I wanted to try something new so I chose to write a book report.

Most of my classmates chose to draw an imaginary picture. I was nervous at first because
column6: like I said
column7: it's my first time writing a book report for Science Day
column8: but it got easier later. I read a book that has scientific information in it and wrote about it and also some of my own ideas. It was hard work because I had to write at least 2
column9: 000 words. I was relieved when our teacher told us
column10: ""You should finish your work by the <mod target = 2nd>second</mod> class
column11: but <del>if </del>you can finish it by the <mod target = 4th>fourth</mod> class if you don't have enough time."" <mod target = But luckily>Luckily</mod>
column12:
I managed to finish it by the second class.

I chose 2 subjects and one scene for my report. I wrote about how we can develop technology and talked about different scientific facts. I wanted to win the first prize
column13: </del> because it is the equivalent of being the president of <ins>the </ins>students for half a year<mod target = . And>
column14: and</mod> that is also equivalent to getting full marks <mod target = for 3>in three</mod> subjects. I don't know when the results will come out
column15: but I hope <mod target = it does>they do</mod> as soon as possible.":::

column1: 936:::"A few days ago
column2: a new student named Shin Dong-Ha came to our class. Our teacher told us
column3: ""Don't tease Dong-Ha<ins>
column4:
and try to be nice to him"". He can't control himself so he has to take medicine three times a day after each meal.

After Dong-Ha came
column5: our class became very noisy. One day
column6: when we were about to start the Chinese language class
column7:
he said he didn't want to learn this subject and screamed loudly. He also tried to throw books out of the window.

Another thing happened today. While we were learining about why we have to study
column8: he shouted and said ""I don't want to learn this. It's no fun!"" and tried to go out. The other students stopped him. After he talked to our teacher
column9:
he finally went to the individual classroom.

I felt a little sorry for him because he a lot of people don't like him since he is different from us. I think we all have to take care of him well. I hope his school life gets better.":::

column1: 937:::"On Tuesday
column2: I went to the 2013 Seoul Motor Show that was held in Kintex. They say this motor show had recorded the highest number of visitors. This was the second time I visited the motor show since I went to one before when I was a second grade student in elementary school. I don't remember exactly what it was like back then
column3:
but I'm sure there was much more to see this time.

My mother brought me to Kintex
column4: </ins> but I went inside the show by myself. There were fancy cars like<ins> the</ins> 24 3.5is and <ins>the </ins>BMW x6 M 50d<ins>
column5:
but my favorite two cars were the Trago XCIENT and the YEBBEJANA.

I especially thought the TRAGO XCIENT was fabulous! It was the biggest dump truck I've ever seen. It weighs 25.5 tons! That is so heavy! It took three years to study how to make the car
column6:
and it cost about 2000 billion won!

I'm surprised by our technology of making cars. I wonder what the 2015 motor show will be like!":::

I hope we have this class everyday

column1: 940:::"Since I'm a middle school student
column2: I have to enter a club<mod target = . And>

and the one I want to join is a reading club because I like books and there will be other benefits that will help us when we enter high school. Today was the interview day to enter the club.

After my class had finished
column4:
my friend and I went to our school's library. There were already lots of students who wanted to have an interview like us. The teacher said
""It will take a while for your turn to arrive"". So
column5:
we read a book while waiting.

About 20 minutes later

column7:
the students in the higher grades wanted me to introduce myself. So I said ""My name is Han-Kyung-Min and I'm a first year in class 7. My hobby is to play the flute and I like to read books.""

Then they asked me
column8: ""If you have a camera
column9: what would you like to take a picture of?"". <mod target = And>So
column10: </mod> I said<ins>
column11: </ins> ""I would like to take a photo of our environment
column12:
and explained why. Every questions made my heart pound.

Lastly

column14:
there was a line and two circles. I had to think hard but I finally drew something that I thought would be the best.

The result of this interview comes out tomorrow. I hope to get the result I want
column15: especially since I did my best!":::

column1: 941:::"Last time in my diary
column2: I wrote about my school briefly. <mod target = But now>Now</mod>
column3:
I'm going to tell you about my school in more detail.
My school opened in 1989 and has a 24-year history. We also have lots of fun activities like skating
column4: ribbon making
column5: and a band. I thought the book reading activity sounded like fun so I supported it since I love books<mod target = . But
column7:
but skating sounded more interesting later. I have wanted to skate since I was in the fifth grade in elementary school. My friends think making coffee sounds more fun.
We started to eat at about 12:10. The highest grades get to go to the dining room first. I think it's a kind of special rights for our seniors. Then the students in the second year go
column8: and then it's our turn. Our school meals taste very nice. My friend and I always wait for meal time because we are always hungry. Afterward
column9: we go back to our classroom
column10: prepare for our next lesson
column11: and then play. I was willing to go to<ins> the</ins> school's library with my friend so I can read a book<ins>
column12: </ins> but the books didn't match with my friend so I lost a chance to look inside the library. I just hoped that library cards will be given out so we can <del>just </del>borrow books<del>
column13: </del> because I want to borrow books written by my favorite authors
column14:
Roald Dahl and Jeff Kinney. I especially love ""Matilda"" and ""The Diary of a Wimpy Kid.""
I have two hobbies. One is playing the guitar and the other is watching movies. My favorite song is ""Canon
column16:
and favorite movie is ""Coraline."" I have watched ""Coraline"" (코렐라인 비밀의 문) more than 25 times. This interesting movie is also known as ""Coraline"" (코랄린) the book.
My favorite subject is English. I've studied English for about 4 years and 3 years have passed since I started to study English with Little Fox. Thanks to my studies
column17: I have gotten lots of certificates in both writing and speaking. I'm looking forward to seeing my future through this English program.":::

column1: 942:::"Date: February 20
column2:
2013

Today was our orientation day for middle school. I was so nervous and excited because it was my first time seeing the classroom
column3: teachers
column4: and friends that I'll spend time together with during my first year as a middle school student. We all settled into our seats. Soon
column5: the teacher came in. He wasn't tall but he seemed friendly and nice. Then he introduced himself and told us all about our admission into the middle school. The date would be March fifth
column6: and we had to gather together wearing our school uniforms into the school gymnasium. Our classroom is on the fourth floor right beside the corner that leads into another hall. Man
column7: it was like a nightmare. We had muscle pain in our legs going up and down the stairs about three times a day when we were at our elementary school. <mod target = And sadly>Sadly</mod>
column8: our new classroom means that we now have more stairs to go up and down during the day! It<ins> is</ins> on the same floor
column9:
but we have more twists and turns in the middle school.
After the teacher's explanation
column10: we went to receive our books. They were heavy for me to carry
column11: but I made the way back to my house<del>
column12:
like a turtle.^^
My biggest concern is about how I am going to spend my first year. Surely
column13: there will be more to study and learn. I have a dream of becoming a diplomat. To make my dream come true
column14: I must concentrate much more than I did before to get <del>a </del>better score<ins>s</ins>. Soon we'll have an exam to separate our grades in Math
column15: Science
column16: Social
column17: English
column18: Music and other subjects. The more I practice and study
column19: the more likely my dream will come true in the future. I am very sure of it!":::

column9: </mod> we needed to cooperate<del>

it was fun sleeping in the tent and playing games.
It was hard
column12: but it was fun and I had a good time!":::

column1:
949:::"Do you know the city called ""Ansan""?
It is full of foreignersBut>
column2:
but Koreans do not treat them well.
Many foreigners get ignored and neglected by us.
I saw a news report that some children in Ansan threw rocks at a foreigner.
Why do people treat foreigners poorly? Why?
It's because we Koreans have a bias in our mind.
We discriminate against them and ignore them because they look different.
Then how could we fix our bias?

First
column3: we should understand their difference
column4:
but not discriminate against them.
Should we look down at the foreigners because they eat their food with their hands?
No. No cultures are wrong or evil. We should respect all cultures.
Second
column5:
we should never judge people by their appearance or race.
For example
column6:
I often think that black people are scary because they have dark skin.
I should erase this thought….

Many people know that discriminating against foreigners is bad
column7:
but still do so.
We should try hard to be friendly to foreigners as well!":::

column1: 950:::"Everyday
column2: I wish<del>ed</del> I could have a pet<mod target =
column3:
>. I want something I can play with and touch.
I had fishes in my house
column4:
but they didn't interest me.
However
column5:
one day father brought a hamster!
Yes. He didn't buy it. He brought it.

The story goes like this.
One day
column6:
my father and my little sister went to the playground.

column7:
they saw some kids torturing a little hamster!

column8: </ins> my father stopped them

and he took away the hamster from them.

At first
column10: I thought that it was a mouseBut>

but I searched the internet and realized it was the ""Golden Hamster.""

My father named it ""Alice"" because it came from the ""PlaygroundLand"".
It got some fur
column12:
and I think it's because it is well fed.

Now
column13:
it's getting tortured again!

and does other horrible stuff.

column16: </mod> it will be okay<del>

column1: 951:::"Last Saturday
column2:
my family went to an art gallery.
We saw a special exhibition.
It was about ""dogs without owners"".
The title of the exhibition was ""1
column3:
025"".
That artist carved 1
column4:
025 wooden dogs in 5 years!
The wooden dogs were based on real dogs in a dog orphanage.
I think the artist was deeply inspired by the lost dogs.
I felt proud for the artist because she carved them really diligently.
I also felt sorry for the dogs at the dog orphanage.
The dogs got lost because of illness or by accident! How sad.
From now on
column5: I will have a diligent and loving heart for <del>the </del>lost dogs!":::

column1: 952:::"Before lunch
column2:
I always get hungry. I feel like I could eat a horse.
After I eat lunch
column3:
I throw away leftover food. I waste several spoonfuls of rice or soup.
But I don't blame myself. I blame those who serve me lunch.
Next time
column4: I think I should ask them to give me lessBut>
column5: but</mod> when I see them giving me food
column6:
it seems like I can eat it all up.

On the other side of the world
column7:
there are people who are in war and in other bad conditions.
For instance
column8: many people who live in deserts have no food <del>n</del>or water
column9:
and have to stay thirsty and hungry very often.
For me
column10:
I throw away leftover food! I feel bad because I don't care about those unfortunate souls.

I know there are people in other countries who can't even drink water.
column11: >So
column12:
from now on I should not throw away food.
For those unfortunate souls
column13: I will check the exact amount I can eat and only put that amount on my plate!":::

column1: 953:::"With my mom and dad gone
column2: I came back home. ""Hello?"" I said<mod target = . But>
column3: but</mod> nobody answered. It seemed as though my mom and dad went somewhere

column5: </ins> to <mod target = fill>alleviate</mod> my boredom

column8: but</mod> my mom and dad didn't come. Then
column9:

My sister and I chose to go to Lotteria. I had a burger and my sister had a salad. We just went out with a cheese stick though because the atmosphere wasn't good. Anyway
column10: the burger was good and delicious. Then we went back home to have good night!":::

column1:
954:::"Bookworm

What do you do during recess time at school? Do you play? Or do you study? Personally
column2: I go to the school library and read some books. It's because I have no one to play with
column3: and I don't like to study. That's why I go to the library
column4:
which is very near.

There are many friends who go to the library. All of them read comics
column5: </ins> but I usually read science or math books<del>
column6: </del> such as books about algebra and geometry. The most interesting book I recently read was about differential and integral algebra. I didn't understand much
column7:
but I learned some of it.

My sister said it is wise to read books from time to time. She said that you will use that knowledge when you grow up. So now I'm trying to read many books and be a bookworm.":::

column1: 955:::"Today
column2:
I will introduce you to my art teacher. She is class ten's homeroom teacher.

She teaches differently from other teachers. She tells us to be creative and always reminds us to think differently.

She is fun because she jokes with us
column3: but</mod> when she is really angry<del>

column6:
because she likes me.

column8:
she is really fun and a good teacher!

column1:
959:::"""Something really cool happened today!
I had a dream that really happened after I woke up.
In my dream
column2:
I was at a department store looking at a pair of gold pants.
Then
column3:
I remembered- it was Monday!
I grabbed my bike and rode to school.
But then……

Then I woke up.
I just ignored my dream and ate breakfast
column4:
until I realized it was 8 o'clock!
I rode my bike to school without even brushing my teeth.
The school bell rang while I was tying the lock onto my bike.
I ran to my classroom as fast as I could.

Safe! Hooray! I was safe!
I thought of my dream again.
It was a ridiculous dream
column5:
but it was cool that I was late in both the dream and in reality!
I learned a lesson
column6: >:</mod> I should not wake up late<mod target = …..."">.</mod>":::

column1: 960:::"As time flows
column2:
my vacation is getting nearer! Yay!
Before that
column3:
I have to take my midterms next week.
I promised myself to study hard this week.
I stayed at the school library after class to study with other students and prepare for the midterms.
I was going to eat dinner at school
column4:
so my mom made me kimbab.
There were some rules we had while studying:
1. You shall not distract others.
2. You shall not go out of the school during recess time.
3. You shall not move your seats.
4. Etc.
The people who don't go to academy applied for the study club.
I was sad because I was the only 1st grader.
At 4:40 p.m.
column5: I started to study
column6:
but oh no! I didn't bring my pencil case!
I only had a single pen
column7:
so I worked on my science workbook.
At 6:00 p.m.
column8: it was time for a break! Yay! My mother brought me some food
column9:
and I was hungry so I consumed it all.
I asked her to get my pencil case.
So
column10:
she got it for me! Yay!
At 6:30 p.m.
column11:
it was time to study again.
I memorized some texts.
At 7:50 p.m.
column12:
it was time to go home! Yay!
I think I earned confidence for the midterm!
I shall continue to study diligently!":::

963:::"It was a really dumb day.

column2:
I attended the middle school entrance ceremony.

column3: </del> I was nervous

but I had to go anyway.

but I listened.

column7:
and the teachers were more strict.

After attending one day of school
column8:

I have to study more hours for more subjects. The biggest difference is that different teachers teach different subjects.

Yet
column9: </ins> I think middle school will be fun<del>

so I am trying not to get nervous.
