column1: 967:::"After graduating from elementary school
column2:
I missed my teachers.

I missed my first grade teacher the most.

I wanted to meet her again
column3:
so my mother and I called her out for lunch.

We filled our stomach at a buffet.

We talked about my first grade year.

I wanted to go back to that period to relive that time.

My teacher encouraged me by saying that I still had potential.

I thanked my teacher for still remembering me and encouraging me into my middle school years.

I will not forget her and keep up my studies and become a great programmer!":::

column1: 968:::"Today
column2: I went to the museum that showed van Gogh's pictures to us. I had to travel there by subway for almost one hour standing
column3: which made my mother and <mod target = me>I</mod> very tired<mod target = . But>
column4:
but it was worth it.
When we first entered the museum
column5: there were pictures of van Gogh's brother
column6: his sister
column7: his mother
column8: his father and many others. <mod target = And in>In</mod> the last picture
column9: there was a picture of van Gogh<ins>'s</ins> and his brother's graves. It sure was very beautiful. The moment I saw that grave
column10: I begun to think that maybe
column11: just maybe
column12: van Gogh was not afraid of death and becoming old like other people
column13:
but a man who knew how to see death in an different ways. Yes. My guess was right.
We viewed picture after picture and listened to the museum guide. There is one interesting story that I remember. Van Gogh liked to use his name ""Vincent"" more than his last name. Also
column14: he only wrote his signature on pictures that he personally liked. There are some other facts that showed van Gogh's mind about art. Even though he became so poor<del>
column15: so poor</del> that he had to use old canvas and draw something else on the back of it<mod target =
column16: and so poor>or</mod> that he had to cover the old painting that was first drawn on the canvas with new paints
column17: he never gave up his love for art. I was really impressed by how a man could love something so much that he gave up his own life to draw pictures. <mod target = Because >Since </mod>he used cheap paints
column18: there are many pictures that are not as brightly colored as <mod target = it>they</mod> used to be when he had first painted them <mod target = some>almost one</mod> hundred years ago. Some of them have already become much darker. Some of the pictures have had <mod target = its>their</mod> paint already peel off. <mod target = But>However
column19: </mod> it was just beautiful by itself existing in this world that we live in. If you know even a tiny bit about van Gogh
column20: you will easily find out that his paintings during one point in his life were very dark and creepy. He used dark colors such as black
column21: purple and dark blue. This made his pictures look very scary. However
column22: after he went to Paris
column23: his paintings changed into brighter colors. Maybe he was quite desperate to earn money. He painted brighter and brighter picture<ins>s</ins> until <mod target = some>the</mod> months before his death. Right before his death
column24: he was mentally ill. When he was ill and stayed in the hospital
column25: he painted the picture ""Starry Night."" I think this is the most beautiful pictures that I ever saw in my life. Sadly
column26: this picture was not in the museum. <mod target = But>However
column27: </mod> every time I see this picture
column28:
I feel as if I am seeing the night sky from a hill top. So many stars are gleaming towards me. It is so dreamy. It seems as if I am apart from this world where people worry so much and talk back about each other. It just seems that life and death is nothing more then a dream. It is so so beautiful that it just seems as if the bright stars are gleaming in front of my very eyes.
If you have the time I really hope that you can go to the museum or read a book about van Gogh and know how much he loved art.":::

column1: 969:::"You know that there is always a bad thing and a good thing every day. There is nothing like a perfect day for human beings. Even if you had the best birthday party ever
column2: there might be some other problems that you might be suffering from inside your mind. However
column3: today I suffered from a lot more bad things than good things. First
column4: because I did not finish my math homework
column5: my mother was very
column6:
very angry at me.
Due to this
column7:
my morning was not a good morning but a bad morning.
Then came the big one that almost spoiled all of today's little good things. I live in a tall apartment so it is very important for me to use the elevator
column8: but</mod> I had to wait 7 minutes for the elevator. It kept going to 20th floor and the 14th floor
column9: and would go back and forth from the 20th floor and 14th floor. At last after waiting 7 minutes
column10: I entered the elevator full of people. When I got in
column11: it looked as if it will just burst out because there were so many people on it. <mod target = But this>However
column12: that</mod> was not all. The elevator stopped at every floor
column13: starting from the twelfth to the first floor. It was such a horrible time and everyone in the elevator was muttering things like ""Why is the elevator like this"" or perhaps some other words that did not seem polite. So<ins>
column14: </ins> there I was. In the middle of <ins>a </ins>crow<del>e</del>d people muttering something under their breath. I felt so miserable. I was already five minutes late to my math academy class<mod target = . And>
column15: and</mod> I was so upset by it
column16: I almost slid down the slippery ice
column17:
which might have caused me more problems.
The last one came just then. When I arrived at my math class and listened to my teacher explaining
column18: </del> I felt so tired that I <ins>though I </ins>was just going to fall asleep. Then
column19:
my teacher gave my classmates and me tons of math problems to solve plus so much homework that it made me dizzy just by looking at it.
Now
column20: as I am typing these very words
column21: I am feeling more and more miserable. Not only because of the problems I faced today
column22: but also because of the terrible headache that just hit me right now.":::

column1: 970:::"I was really looking foward to seeing this soap opera. I did not have an opportunity to watch it when it was on T<ins>.</ins>V<ins>.</ins> because of two reasons. I had a big test when it was on
column2: and since it was on cable T<ins>.</ins>V<ins>.</ins>
column3: I could not watch it at the right time<mod target = . (> because</mod> <mod target = My>my</mod> television does not have any cable TV channels.<del>)</del> So<ins>
column4:
I watched all of them at my grandparents' house. It took me two days to watch it all.
The story is not very simple. It is a love story
column5: but a type that I have never seen before. The main characters are Yunjay and Siwon. They have been friends since childhood. Their parents were friends<ins>
column6: </ins> too<mod target = . But>
column7: but</mod> Yunjay's parents are dead because of an accident. So<ins>
column8: </ins> Siwon's parents take Care of Yunjay and his brother. They grow to love each other
column9:
but there are so many things waiting ahead for them.
I really loved this story. There is a surprise ending
column10: and I was very surprised by it. Also
column11: when I noticed that another friend of Siwon
column12: called Junhi
column13: was gay and loved Yunjay
column14: I was very surprised. I was surprised not only because he was gay
column15:
but because Siwon was understanding and remained friends with him.
Although I really liked this soap opera
column16: I wondered: Why do so many people like this soap opera so much?<ins>""</ins> Then I found some reasons that made sense to me. The reason why is because it makes people think of their past. We are now living in a digital world. Everything changes so quickly<mod target = . But>
column17: but</mod> in the show
column18: it goes back 15 years in the characters' lives. For older generations
column19: seeing Siwon's mother and father must make them think of their lives as mothers and fathers of teenagers. It makes them think of the old cell phones they were using
column20: and what shows they watched. Though life in our country was very hard because of <ins>the </ins>IMF
column21: they must have some good memories about those times<mod target = . And>
column22: and</mod> this show made them think about it. For the people in their late 20's and early 30's
column23: it made them think of their lives as teenagers. In the show
column24: there are many T<ins>.</ins>V<ins>.</ins> stars they once liked as teenagers<del>
column25: </del> in shows such as H.O.T and Jack's Kiss. Also
column26: things in the show
column27:
such as PePe and damagochi made them think about how they used to play with friends.
As for us
column28: who are teenagers now
column29: it makes us think about how it would be to live back then
column30:
when there were no smartphones and computers that were very slow.
However
column31: I liked this show mostly because Seo In Kuk
column32: who acted as Yun jay
column33: was so handsome. It made me become a fan of his. I will write some other interesting things next week.":::

column1: 971:::"I was inside the plane at sunrise. My father booked the ticket
column2: so that we <mod target = can>would</mod> arrive at my grandmother's house before lunch. So<ins>
column3: </ins> all of my family members woke up around 5 o'clock. Although I was very sleepy
column4: I followed my parents to catch a taxi near the bus stop. The airport is not really far from my house. It just took about 20 minutes to arrive there. It is good to live near the airport because whenever I have time
column5: I can go shopping at the malls near the airport with my friends. Anyway
column6: our family sat in the airplane seats for 45 minutes. All of us slept until we arrived to Kimhye (it is near Busan) airport. When we arrived
column7: my grandfather and grandmother on my father's side were waiting for us inside their car. After saying our hellos and some shaking of hands
column8: we finally settled in and rode in the car for about one hour. We were not heading for their house but were heading for my grandparent's house on my mother's side. We were planning to stay there for one night. As soon as we arrived
column9: we ate breakfast. My grandmother's food is always very delicious. I think it is because she only uses good ingredients to make food and also because of her secret recipe. My grandfather is a rock collector. Even though he lives in an apartment
column10: there are hundreds of rocks placed neatly inside the glass. He likes to water his plants and take care of his garden<ins>
column11: </ins> too. There is a miniature garden inside his apartment. There are miniature trees<mod target = . And>
column12: and</mod> my favorite tree is the one that looks like a tree that is at least a hundred or more years old. Since my grandparent's apartment is a very sunny place
column13: all the plants grow well. My grandparent's farm is quite near their apartment. We have to ride in the car for 30 minutes. There are lot<ins>s</ins> of plants growing there. Every summer my cousins and I<del>s</del> visit their farm and help them water their plants. Although there are no animals at the farm
column14: it is quite easy to spot a frog or a fish in the nearby river. There are so many plants growing there. Most of them are edible. My grandfather likes to carve wood<del>s</del>. So
column15: there are Jangsengs that he carved standing <mod target = in>at</mod> the farm entrance<mod target = . But> but</mod> because it is winter now
column16:
I could not visit there.
We decided to stay inside the house and watch T.V. and talk to each other. After a few hours I got bored of what the adults were talking about. So
column17: I sneaked inside the room where there were old albums. While I was going through the pile of albums
column18: I found a child who looked very similar to me. It looked as if I was inside the old picture. However
column19:
I soon found that it was my mom who was inside the picture. She looked very pretty in the pink skirt that she were wearing. I even saw my grandparent's black and white wedding picture. It was ""Incantada (that means charming in Spanish)!""
You know that sometimes it is very hard to think about what our parents or grandparents looked like when they were young
column20:
but that will be solved once you see the albums or diaries of your parents. It is quite fun to see them dressed in the old fashioned clothes.
Anyway
column21: good night everyone. Sweet dreams.":::

column1: 972:::"This movie was so <mod target = impressive in scientific ways>impressively scientific</mod>. Today
column2:
I will write a review about this movie.*
This movie is a great movie with imagination and action combined together. There were parts where the story was not quite connected
column3:
but still it was a good movie.
What I thought was special about this movie were the things that appeared in the movie.
The cell phone that was inside the hand was the best. We can use it to connect to each other by showing our faces when you put your hand onto a glass. To call someone
column4: the light comes out from your hand and you can see the numbers. If you press it
column5:
you can connect to another person. I think this is a very unique style for a cell phone. It makes me think that maybe engineers who work at Apple or Samsung could develop this kind of cell phone in the future. I will be the first one to buy this cell phone if they really make it.
Also
column6:
the huge elevator that goes through the core was spectacular. There was no gravity so you can fly.
There was also a mask that can change your face. If you place it on your neck
column7: it will change your face into someone else you want to be. I think they made it possible by developing hologram skills. By using the light
column8:
it might be possible to cover your face with another image to make a mask like this possible.
Anyway
column9: I really want you to see this movie.":::

column1: 973:::"Ghosts are always a mystery for human beings. A ghost is not
something that we normally see. Someone who has seen a ghost is going to
believe that it exists
column2: but someone who has not seen it
column3: will be afraid

column1:
of it or just not believe in it.
Well
column2: today
column3: I am going to write about the topic of ghosts. I don't think it is funny to tell somebody ghost stories<mod target = . But>
column4:
but the reason I am writing about ghost is because I want to tell you about my idea about ghosts.
First
column5: I searched the website and found out that a ghost is a person's soul. <del>(</del>However
column6:
this may not really be a correct answer to you so I will write what I think at the end of this diary.)
Many

column1: people say that they have seen ghosts. Maybe it was your cousin or
teacher or many others. They may have seen it for real but most of them
are just making up stories. They may say to you that they have seen a
ghost standing in the dark looking at them<mod target = . And>
column2: and</mod> you may either think
column3: ""Well
column4: I don't believe it
column5: or ""Oh it is really scary. It might be real."" <mod target = But>However
column6: </mod> your mother will simply say that <mod target = it>they</mod> does not exist. <mod target = And you>You</mod> may not know
column7:
whether to believe your mom or the people who say that they have seen ghosts.
If

column1: you read a book about ghosts
column2: you will find that there are many types

column1: of ghosts. I will tell you about some of the different kinds of ghosts.
First
column2: there are ghosts which are in a particular place and do not have

column1: any resentment towards something. These ghosts may be seen by the people
who come<del>s</del> to that place
column2: whether for shelter or to live. <mod target = But>However
column3: </mod>

column1: these types of ghosts cannot go to other places because they <del>are </del>just <del>
born (I don't know whether ghosts are born but whatever) to </del>live <del>only </del>in
that place<ins> only</ins>. Second
column2: there are ghosts who have resentment towards people

column1: because they were killed by somebody or for some other reason. People
who come to the place where they are living become the target. Even if
the target moves to another place
column2: the ghosts can keep following them in

column1: some way such as going inside their dolls
column2: stick<ins>s</ins>
column3: notebook<ins>s
column4: </ins> or some

column1: other object. Third
column2: there are ghosts that came to this world because of

column1: some people who want to use them. They are just souls that are
controlled by the people who called them. Fourth
column2: there are fairies who

column1: are the guardians of a particular land or plants. There are some other
types of ghosts
column2: but these are the ghosts that are most commonly seen or

column1:
felt.
Now
column2: I will tell you my idea about ghosts. By searching about

column1: ghosts
column2: I found the answer that I really wanted. It was written in the

column1: book called ""Ghost Dictionary."" Ghosts are minds. Everything in the
world has a mind<ins>
column2: </ins> and the minds that are visible are ghosts. There are

column1: many different minds. There are minds that contain resentment towards
something. There are minds that love their country. There are minds that
think of their family members. There are minds of animals that cannot
speak. The mind has the biggest power in the world. It is our minds that
occur in our world and the world <ins>to </ins>which dead people go. It is in our
minds that scary and peaceful things occur. It is our minds that become
animals and humans. It is all in our minds.":::
974:::"Do you know any gay couples? Well
column2: I don't<mod target = . But>
column3: but</mod> since I am very interested in this topic<del>
column4:
I will write my opinion about it in this diary.
Actually
column5: before I write about gay couples or gay marriage
column6:
I would first like to say that there is no law in Korea about gay marriage. What that means is that it is not illegal to have a marriage or other legal rights because there is no law about it.
Actually
column7:
I agree about allowing gay couples to marry and adopt children.
Just because there is a small amount of people who are gay and normally people marry someone of a different gender
column8: it does not mean that they are strange or odd. They are also couples<ins>
column9: </ins> too. If they are a couple and want to marry
column10:
I think they should be able to.
Also
column11:
I think that it should be legal for them to adopt a child.
If they adopt a child
column12: they can give the same amount of love or even more to children they adopt in comparison to other couples. For example<ins>
column13: </ins> in America
column14: most gay couples are wealthier than other couples their age. I am not saying that only money is needed to raise a child<mod target = . But
column15: >but</mod> because they are wealthier than other people
column16:
they will be able to provide the adopted children with a much better environment and education.
We should all be treated equally under the law.
However
column17: people who do not agree with me will say things like this: ""Do you want to grow up in a family with two fathers and not a mother? How about two mothers and not a father?"" I thought about this question and found a perfect answer (at least for me). Why don't you ask the orphans? If a gay couple wants to adopt a child
column18: they can ask the child's opinion first<mod target = . And>
column19: and</mod> if the child wants to live with them
column20: they can adopt the child. <mod target = But>However
column21: </mod> the child should be at least over 12 because before that age<del>
column22: </del> they might not know what it means to be gay. <mod target = And>Also
column23:
there is a possibility that they might not be able to make a good judgement for themselves.
I think I will end my diary here
column24: but maybe by reading my diary<del>
column25: </del> you can think of this issue too.":::

column1: 975:::"Today
column2: my mother
column3: my younger brother
column4: and I baked some pizza. It was lunchtime
column5: and mother suggested making a pizza. Of course we all agreed. However
column6: the pizza that we baked was not an ordinary pizza. My mother named it pocket pizza
column7: because it is very small
column8:
like a muffin.
I will tell you the recipe. First
column9: slice ham
column10: peppers
column11: mushrooms
column12: onion
column13: carrots
column14: and other vegetables and fry <mod target = it>them</mod>. Then put a dumpling skin inside the muffin tray. Make it look like a wiggly flower. Put tomato sauce inside the dumpling skin. Spread it using a teaspoon. After that
column15: put the fried vegetables on top of the the tomato sauce. Finally
column16:
put pizza cheese on the top of the pocket pizza. Put it in the oven until the sauce boils and the cheese melts.
After making it
column17: all three of us ate it. Even though it was very hot
column18: we quickly made it cold by cutting it. It was very delicious
column19: not only because I made it<ins>
column20:
but it also really tasted good. I guess I don't have to go to the pizza restaurant anymore to taste the best pizza.
I have personally liked cooking ever since I was a kid. Well
column21: my dream is not related to cooking<mod target = . But>
column22: but</mod> still
column23: it is good to learn how to cook. Someday
column24: when I become an adult and live alone for some years
column25:
I should at least cook my own food.
Now
column26: good-bye everyone.":::

column1: 976:::"Good news! I became the mother of a sea monkey! Sea monkeys are little shrimps that live in Americas salt lakes. I went to the market to buy some things for my younger brother<ins>
column2: </ins> and I found this sea monkey breeding kit
column3:
which I bought immediately.
I opened the box and read the instructions. I opened the small plastic capsule where the eggs were. They were pure white in color and looked like salt. I wondered how they could grow into a fully-grown shrimp. Anyway
column4: I placed everything into a jar and mixed it with some warm water. It should be over 20 degrees <mod target = Celsius>celsius</mod>. Since it's winter
column5:
I kept it warm by placing the jar inside a bucket of warm water. I hope it grows well and becomes shrimps after one month. After that I will try to breed something else.
To search for more information
column6: I typed it's name on the internet. While I was searching
column7: I noticed that some people made up some funny tings about sea monkeys. For example
column8: one said that you should grill some of the sea monkeys and eat them. However
column9: there was some useful information<ins>
column10: </ins> too. One wrote that<ins> </ins>""if your sea monkey dies
column11: and you want to make it alive again
column12: you should dry the dead sea monkeys as fast as you can and when it is completely dry
column13: you should put it back into water. By doing that
column14: you can make the eggs inside their bellies become fully grown shrimps again."" Well
column15: I am not sure if this is true
column16: but if it is dead after one month
column17:
which is the time when it becomes fully grown I will try this. I think it is worth a try even if it fails.
I don't know if it will grow well and become a fully grown shrimp
column18: but I just hope it will<del> be</del>.":::

column1: 977:::"I started learning Spanish yesterday. It was my first time learning Spanish
column2:
and I was very excited. Learning a language is always a pleasant thing.
At 10 o'clock
column3: I signed into Skype and waited for the teacher to call. I turned on my camera. The teacher who teaches me lives in Peru. I have a fifty-minute lesson. Then the bell rang. I pressed the green button. She was a woman with red glasses and looked beautiful. She has long hair and a pretty face. She was also very kind. I started learning things like Hello is Hola
column4:
and what the difference is between Un (masculine/male) and Una (feminine/female). All of these things were new and odd but very fun to learn. I am learning letter by letter.
I hope that one month later
column5: when the winter vacation ends
column6: I can read a book for children<del>
column7:
written in Spanish. I will practice hard until then.
For me
column8: learning languages and meeting other people who speak different languages<del>
column9:
is a pleasure. I always enjoy talking with other people and discussing the latest issues.
I think that maybe
column10: just maybe<ins>
column11: </ins> if I learn more languages I can have a job related to the kind of work where I can speak different languages and discuss the latest issues from all over the world. Anyway
column12: I should concentrate on my work now. Good-bye.":::

column1: 978:::"From last Thursday until today
column2: there was a big test at our school. I studied hard
column3: so I got a good grade. Science was the hardest. It was so hard that I just wanted to sleep after finishing the first page. When the test was over
column4: my best friend and I went shopping <mod target = at>in</mod> Insadong. We first ate our lunch and then met at the subway station. Insadong is one of the best places in Seoul. There are a lot of buildings around<ins>
column5: </ins> but when you go onto this one street<del>
column6: </del> you will feel like you are in 1980's. The things
column7: such as the buildings there are very traditional and very old. There are a lot of galleries. There is even a gallery that shows traditional <mod target = knifes>knives</mod>. We went into one of the clock shops. However
column8: the owner of the clock shop was on the phone and looked very
column9: very angry. When I tried to see the big clock on display
column10: she said
column11: ""Do not go there
column12: in a very
column13: very impolite way. I wanted to buy a little clock
column14:
but her impolite behavior towards the customers made me so angry that I just went out to the street. I do not want to go to that store again.
We visited a few more galleries and went to the coffee shop. I bought coffee and some snacks and shared them with her. We watched the lights of Insadong shining brightly below the coffee shop window. Then I remembered that it was almost the end of the year. I think I should prepare for next year.":::

column1: 979:::"Yesterday
column2: my grandmother sent me some boxes of kimchi<ins>
column3: </ins> and I got <mod target = it>them</mod> today. It was in front of my house door. When my mother was back from work
column4: we opened the box and tried some kimchi. It was<del> so
column5: so
column6: so
column7:
so delicious! I was really thankful to my grandmother.
Have you ever eaten fresh kimchi with rice or some meat? It is so delicious that it will make you eat until your mouth is burning.
There are many kinds of kimchi. For example there is white kimchi
column8: or dongchimi. Some of them are made in spring. Some of them are made in the summer
column9:
or fall. We make kimchi in every season.
However
column10: the red kimchi <ins>is </ins>made from <del>of </del>cabbage<del>
column11: which is made</del> in winter
column12: is my favorite. The region it was made in makes the taste of the kimchi different. For example
column13: my grandmother lives near Busan. Unlike many of those who buy jeotgal in markets
column14: she makes it by herself. She uses anchovy jeotgal
column15: pepper
column16: salt
column17: cabbage and many other vegetables when she makes kimchi. She puts it in a jar after it is finished. In other regions
column18: they make it differently<mod target = . But>
column19: but</mod> you can find out whether it was made in the upper or lower regions just by trying it. When you eat kimchi from the upper regions
column20: it is usually not very salty and light. It is because the upper regions are colder than the other parts. When it is cold
column21: the food does not really decompose. Think of it this way. When you put the food in the refrigerator
column22:
it does not really decompose.
In the lower regions
column23: the weather is warmer than the upper regions. They put a lot of salty things
column24: like salt
column25:
jeotgal and many other things that taste salty. This is because food goes bad more easily in the lower regions.
There are some particular regions near the sea that make kimchi with cabbage and sliced fish
column26:
or clams.
But
column27: I want to say that kimchi is delicious. Some of your grandparents might send kimchi to you or maybe your mother makes it. Be thankful to them. Kimchi is one of the most delicious foods ever in history.":::

column1:
980:::"I have never thought about how much a mother can do for her own child.
For example
column2: ever since last week
column3: my mother and I have both been very tired. It is because my mother stayed up late with me. When I am studying until late<ins> at</ins> night
column4:
my mother stays up with me and reads books. I am so thankful.
Today
column5:
I want to share with you some stories about how strong a mother's love towards her children can be.
I saw in the news that a mother called Kera Cobella had given up her life to save her child. She could not give birth to two of her babies because they died in her womb. Then she became pregnant with her third baby and was so happy about it
column6: but</mod> she did not realize that she had cancer. After some time
column7: before she gave birth to her baby
column8: she found out that she had cancer. Doctors said that she should give up her baby
column9: get surgery
column10: and take medicine
column11: but she did not. She gave birth to the baby. By then she had cancer all over her body
column12: and lost sigh<ins>t</ins> in one of her eyes<del>t</del>. She died this summer. Her husband said that when the baby grows up
column13:
he will tell him about his mother's brave choice. At her funeral hundreds of people came and cried for her.
This story made me think deeply about how much mother can love a child. I think if I was in a situation like that
column14: I would not give birth to my baby and worry about myself. Of course<ins>
column15: </ins> I will be sorry for my baby<ins>
column16:
but I think I will live more eagerly for my baby who saved my life.
Second
column17: there is also your own mother who is sitting beside you or maybe working hard at her workplace. Sometimes
column18: when you are angry at your mother
column19: try to understand her. Mothers are the ones who love you best in this whole world. Of course<ins>
column20: </ins> I am not a very good daughter<ins>
column21: </ins> too. I make a lot of mistake and sometimes fight with my mother. <mod target = But>However
column22: </mod> from now on<del>
column23:
I will try to please my mother and understand her more then I did before.
If you are willing to fight with your mother
column24:
you should think again. Think of how your mother understood your mistakes. Think about your mistakes. Try to understand her.
Thank you.":::

column1: 982:::"For attractive lips
column2:
speak words of kindness.
For lovely eyes
column3:
seek out the good in people.
For a slim figure
column4:
share your food with the hungry.
For beautiful hair
column5:
let a child run their fingers through it once a day.
For poise
column6:
walk with the knowledge that you never walk alone.
People
column7: even more than things
column8: have to be restored
column9: renewed
column10: revived
column11: reclaimed
column12:
and redeemed; never throw out anyone.
Remember
column13: if you ever need a helping hand
column14:
you will find one at the end of each of your arms.
As you grow older
column15:
you will discover that you have two hands;
one for helping yourself
column16:
and the other for helping others.

These were the words of Audrey Hepburn. I liked the part where she said
column17: ""As you grow older
column18: you will discover that you have two hands; one for helping yourself
column19:
and the other for helping others."" The reason I wrote Audrey Hepburn's poem is because I want to talk about doing something for others.

Today
column20: when I attended my academy class after school
column21: my teacher told me the story about Mother Teresa's house for the dying. She went there because she wanted to help those who were sick and close to death. She tried to wash the<ins>ir</ins> clothes
column22: but they were so dirty that she just vomited the first time. She said she went out immediately<del>
column23: </del> because she could not cope with it. There were mountains of cloth<ins>e</ins>s for her to wash<ins>
column24: </ins> and she said she could not handle it. She described the people inside the house
column25: the blood
column26: and the smell. I<ins> </ins>was shocked. I sat at my seat
column27: imagining all the things that she described. She described dirty people
column28: blood dripping out from their <mod target = body>bodies</mod>
column29: the smell
column30: and all the other things. Then suddenly
column31: I felt a strong emotion. I wanted to go there right away and help those who were lying weakly in their beds. I wanted to help them in any way I could<mod target = . And>
column32:
and I started to research about it.
One of the reasons why I was interested in Mother Teresa's house for the dying is because I like India. Many of my friends who are in America are from India. Also
column33:
I enjoy yoga and like to do research about India. It is such an interesting country.
Anyway
column34: I read some words from the volunteers who worked at Mother Teresa's house for the dying. All of them said that it was really dirty. However all of them said it was one of the most beautiful times they ever had. By washing <mod target = these patients and feeding them>and feeding these patients</mod>
column35:
they said that they felt no worries but only happiness that they could help these people.
As I researched
column36: I thought about the things I can do to help these people. First
column37: since I cannot go there right now
column38: I will donate my pocket money to the children in Africa and help them go to school. Also
column39: I plan to go there when I become an adult. Then
column40: I read the sentence that said
column41: ""People liked my massage."" YES!!! I have a very strong finger and when I massage my grandmother or my mother
column42: they always say that they feel really good when I massage them. I think I will be able to massage the patient<ins>s</ins> in the house. I really want to go there. As Mother Teresa did
column43: I will feed those people and love them as if they are my family. I will go there as soon as I go to the university. Until that time comes
column44:
I will still think of another way to help others.
Good-bye everybody.":::

column2: before I tell you the real story
column3: I want to inform you that my diet diary has been cancelled. It was because of my mother. She absolutely disagreed. However
column4:
I am still drinking a lot of milk.
What I want to tell you today is about the house that I want to live in. I want to live in a very small wooden house. I already found some pictures of it. It has two floors. On the first floor
column5: there is a bathroom with a very small bathtub
column6: sink
column7: and a toilet. Also<ins>
column8: </ins> there is a small kitchen. There would be a box-sized refrigerator
column9: tiny sink
column10: one gas stove with a box-like oven below it
column11: some rooms for storing dishes
column12:
and a table for one person.
On the second floor
column13: there will be some books
column14: a computer
column15: and my bed. I think it will be very fun to live in that house because it is simple and would be very easy to concentrate in<del> it</del>. The biggest advantage of living in that house is that it takes only a small amount of money to build that house. My house is a box-like structure and looks like a big wooden box when you look at it from the outside. <mod target = But>However
column16: </mod> I want it to be <ins>as </ins>simple as possible. When you buy a big house
column17: it will cost you a lot of money<ins>
column18: </ins> and it takes a lot of effort to clean up your house every day. Sometimes<ins>
column19:
you will feel tired of cleaning your house.
As soon as I become an adult
column20:
I will build this house straight away.
I don't know whether I will build it in the city
column21: or in the mountains
column22: or by the sea
column23: or by the lake
column24: but I am sure that I will live in my dream house someday.":::

column1: 984:::"Yesterday was my friend's birthday. It was so
column2: so much fun. The day before yesterday
column3: I went to the beauty shop with my mother to buy a present for my friend. It was a cleansing oil
column4:
which makes the pores of your nose large so the blackheads can go out. It is made with ashes from a volcano.
Yesterday when I woke up
column5: I finished my math homework
column6: and dressed up to meet my friends. My best friend and I celebrated her birthday. She got two presents
column7: one from me and another one from my best friend. My friend gave her a leather diary. It was pink and even though I do not like pink
column8: I still thought it looked beautiful. We went to a fast food restaurant
column9: and ate some hamburgers after my friend saw our presents. Then
column10: we went to see a short 4D video. There is a small 4D shop in our town called ""Max Rider."" It is almost like an amusement park squished into one room. We selected 'Space Adventure."" It was very exciting. The door closed
column11: and we wore special glasses to see the 4D screen. There is a big car in the middle of the room that looks like a bumper car that shakes
column12: rattles
column13: and even makes water vapor come out. It was as if we rode a real bumper car and it was running<del>..</del>.There was a front seat and back seat

column15: which shakes more than the front seat. When the video started
column16: snakes came out and hissed in front of my eyes
column17: at least that was what I saw
column18: and there were all kinds of space monsters coming out. It was really thrilling<del>
column19: </del> and scary. We watched ""Goblin World<ins>
column20:
"" too. It was not as scary as ""Space Adventure"" but very speedy and fun.
After that
column21: we went to the singing room
column22: and sang for an hour. My neck felt as if it was going to break. Anyway
column23: I sang so many songs. As I sang loudly
column24: it was as if all my stress just disappeared into the air. You
column25: who is reading my diary
column26: might know that feeling of your stress disappearing as you sing. After an hour of singing
column27: we went to the beauty shop to buy some makeup
column28: such as pretty tint
column29: lip balm
column30: mascara
column31: and eye shadow. Later<ins>
column32: </ins> when I came back home and told my mother that my friends<ins> and</ins> I bought some makeup tools
column33: my mother was surprised. She said when she was a student
column34: she and her friends did not buy or put on makeup. They thought it was for adults
column35: not for students. However
column36: if you are a girl
column37: and you are going to go to middle school
column38: you will definitely learn how to put on makeup by <ins>watching </ins>the older students <del>at school
column39: </del>or <del>by </del>your friends<ins> at school</ins>. Oh<ins>
column40: </ins> don't say<ins>
column41:
""I won't!"" because I thought that I wouldn't when I was in elementary school too ^ ^.
Anyway
column42: after we bought some makeup
column43: we went straight to the trampoline shop
column44: where we paid money
column45: went in
column46: and bounced until our muscles were burning. It was really fun. When I jumped up high and touched the ceiling

column49: I have to wait until next year to have my birthday party. I can't wait!<del>!! </del>":::

column1: 985:::"Have you ever heard about little mom<del>
column2:
or an unmarried mother?
I think if you
column3: whoever is reading my diary
column4: passed your twelfth birthday
column5: you might have heard about it from your mother or from your health teacher at school. Today
column6: my best friend and I discussed this topic in school. My best friend and I went to the library this very morning
column7: and found a book called ""Kissing My Life"". It was about a young girl
column8: who is seventeen
column9: having a baby and being an unmarried mother. She became an unmarried mother by her boyfriend
column10: and had to choose between just having surgery to kill the baby inside her womb
column11: or giving birth to the baby. <mod target = And in>In</mod> the end
column12:
she gave birth to the baby and became an unmarried mother.

This is a very important issue. I also researched this problem
column13: and it turns out that in many schools
column14: teachers just pressure the unmarried mothers to get out of their school. I really disagree. Even if it is wrong to have a baby at that age
column15: the school should lead them <mod target = to>in</mod> the right <mod target = way>direction</mod>
column16: and should not pressure them to give up their studies. Even though they became a young mother and gave birth to a baby
column17:
it does not mean they should give up their studies.
Also
column18: there is another very serious problem<mod target = ;>:</mod> many people see them as if they are like a prisoner or an animal inside the cage of a zoo. In the newspapers that I researched
column19: people looked at them in a very <mod target = wrong>improper</mod> way<del>
column20: </del> and treated them with a very <mod target = wrong>bad</mod> attitude. At least
column21: they should treat the unmarried mothers as humans. Staring at them and pointing their fingers at them is very
column22:
very inappropriate behavior towards them.
Lastly
column23: there should be more systems that help unmarried mother<ins>s</ins>. They should be protected. They should be safe and be able to study. However
column24: it turns out that there are many unmarried mother<ins>s</ins> in Korea
column25:
but a very small amount of public shelters for unmarried mothers. They should definitely increase the amount of public shelters.

My diary ends here
column26: without <ins>a </ins>conclusion. I hope you
column27: who <mod target = is>are</mod> reading my diary
column28: will think carefully about this problem and come to your own conclusion.":::

column2:

but the reason I decided to diet is because of something other than becoming skinny.
I have a very big secret
column6: and I did not tell anyone
column7: even to my friends<mod target = . But>
column8: but</mod> I am going to tell you
column9: who has been reading every single word of my diary<del>
column10:
because I think you will understand me.
I eat my breakfast just like everyone else does and lunch like everyone else does
column11: but</mod> the problem is that I become a massive
column12: and sometimes monstrous<ins>
column13: </ins> eater when it comes to dinner. I eat so much that even my family gets surprised. <mod target = And after>After</mod> that
column14: I regret my actions. It is <del>(for sure) </del>a very
column15:
very bad action.
Some of you guys might not be able to understand my actions
column16: but</mod> if you experience that problem yourself
column17:
you will understand me. It is a really sad thing that you cannot control yourself.
I think that I should keep on growing
column18: so I planned <del>for </del>a diet that is both good for stopping myself from eating too much at dinner<del>
column19:
and growing a lot.

This is my plan:

First
column20:
I will not eat anything except to drinking water after six in the evening. (I am doing well ever since the day I decided my diet. I am eating my dinner before six.)
Second
column21: I am going to try to drink at least 600<mod target = ml>milliliters</mod> of milk a day
column22: which means three cups of milk. <del>(</del>I am keeping up with this well<ins>
column23: </ins> too. I drink one cup in the morning
column24: one cup before lunch
column25:
and the last cup just after my dinner.)
Lastly
column26: I exercise for one minute a day. I guess you will be surprised by the phrase ""one minute exercising."" It was on the BBC channel
column27: and I was surprised by it<ins>
column28: </ins> too. I learned that you can lose weight by cycling as fast as you can for one minute. First
column29: you should cycle for 20 seconds
column30: as fast as you can. Then
column31: you rest for five seconds and do it again two more times. It is really effective and it is even better then walking or jogging for one hour!!! <del>(</del><mod target = And so>So</mod> far
column32: I think it is pretty effective<del>
column33: </del> because I always catch my breath after this exercise. Also
column34:
I try to stretch at least three times a week for five minutes.)
I hope this fixes my problems and will let me grow tall as I can.
I will write my ""Diet Diary (DD)"" once a month
column35: and tell you about hardships of doing this diet and also some achievements. Good-bye for now<del> ^^</del>.":::

column3:

too.
We rode our car for about a minute or two

column14: and went to the swimming pool. The pool was both inside and outside. They were both very warm. My little brother and I rode the slides. My favorite slide was inside. It was the blue one
column15: which was very

column17: talked
column18: laughed
column19:
and rested. It was such a lovely time.
After spending a few hours inside

we went to the doctor fish zone. We placed our feet and legs inside the
pool where the doctor fish live. My parents and I giggled as the fish ate the dead skin on our feet. It really tickled. But no fish went to my little brother because his feet were so clean. I really wanted to buy them and put them in my house
column21:
so I could put my feet in my bathtub and enjoy.
We went outside after that and enjoyed the hot water in the cool

Now
column23: I want to go back to that Saturday and play with my brother in the hot spring pool again.":::

988:::">I am not going to talk about the kind of dream that is about what a person wants to become in the future.
I am talking about the kind of dream that people have when they sleep. Today I will tell you about what I dreamed about the day before yesterday. It was both the scariest and strangest dream I have ever had in my life.
As always
column2: I went to sleep. Then<ins>
column3:
I dreamed about something. It goes like this:

You will all know that I visited the Czech Republic almost a week ago. In my dream

column5:
and she never said it again.
I did not know about the change in date until the test came

column8:
so surprised.

column9: when the grades came out<del>
column10: </del> my teacher saw one of the test sheets
column11: which was mine
column12: and read it. ""You got a 0 in all the subjects!"" she said<del>
column13:
pointing to me. Everyone except my friends laughed. My face got red....

Then
column14: </mod> all of a sudden
column15: I recognized that it was a dream
column16: just a dream
column17: and I was inside of it. It was nothing more than a dreamAnd>
column18:
and I got up from my bed.

When the weekend ended and I went to school

I told my friends about it.
They all laughed until they cried. Well
column20: I burst into laughter<ins>
column21:
too.
It is now Monday evening
column22:
and I started thinking about my dream again while I write in this diary.
I still think that it was really scary.
However

it was funny in the end.

Have you ever had a fantastic dream before? Then what are you waiting for? Just tell it to your friends
column24: </ins> and it will be a really nice memory for you.":::

column1:
989:::"I went to the Czech Republic for a week and came back yesterday.
It was very fun and exciting
column2:
and I went right after I finished my test.
Today
column3:
I want to tell you about the very best part of my journey.
It happened when I was visiting Karlovy Vary.
Karlovy Vary is a city famous for its hot springs.
The hot springs are different from ones in other cities because we can drink the water
column4:
and it is very good for our bodies.
There are about twelve different hot springs
column5:
and the taste of the water is different at each one.
Karlovy Vary is also famous for its special cups
column6:
which are made of glass and have a glass straw that looks like a handle.
I bought one that looks like a cat with a long tail.
A surprising event happened after I bought my cup.
I was passing by the shops and looking at various cups.
Then I suddenly heard the song ""Gangnam Style.""
I was so happy that I danced to ""Gangnam Style"" with my brother in front of the shop.

Have you ever experienced the feeling of hearing a song from your home in another country?
I have.
I really
column7: really like PSY now.":::

column1: 992:::"Dear Diary
column2:
What our ancestors said was true.
The enemy turns up at the wrong place.
That is exactly what happened today.
In our middle school
column3:
we trade seats twice a month. That's once every two weeks.
We sometimes just sit where our teacher tells us to
column4: and other times<del>
column5:
we pick number cards and sit in the place that matches the number.

column6:
I stood in line. I picked up the card that had 25 on it. It was a good seat for seeing the teacher. It was in the second row from the front.
However
column7: after all the people picked their numbers and went to their seats
column8:
I suddenly let out a scream.
""Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!""

There is a girl in my school who I had a fight with.
At one time
column9:
we were best friends and went everywhere together.
However
column10:
we have become enemies since the fight.
At first
column11:
I hated her so much that I really wanted to do something bad to her.
Then I just tried not to care about her.
I ignored her.
The results of my efforts were surprising.
My bad feelings disappeared
column12:
and I felt as calm as a lake.
Even if she did something to me
column13:
I did not care.
I realized I have other friends
column14:
and I just became good friends with another girl.
Also
column15: I learned a lot from that fight with herBut>
column16:
but I still feel uncomfortable around her.

I think you get what I am talking about by now.
It was that girl who sat next to me.
We did not even look at each other's faces for a whole day.
I wonder how we'll do group projects.

However
column17: </mod> I believe that when time passes
column18:
our relationship will get better.

Oh
column19:
one more thing.
I think she screamed
column20: </ins> too<ins>
column21:
when she realized my seat was next to her.^^

Good night

column1: 993:::"Today<ins>
column2: </ins> I borrowed a book called ""Kira-Kira"" from the library. It is an English book<ins>
column3:
and I liked it very much.

""Lira-Kira"" is about a young girl named Katie Takeshima and her sister Lynn.

Kira-Kira means glittering in Japan
column4:
at least that's what Lynn said to Katie.
Katie's family was very poor. They lived back in 1950. Katie's father worked in a large factory and her mother also worked in a similar factory like her father. However
column5: </mod> even though it was a difficult time<del>
column6: </del> the family was always happy<mod target = . However>
column7: but</mod> after some years pass<del>
column8: </del> Lynn become ill and faces death. The whole family is filled with sadness. Only Katie believes that Lynn will get better<ins>
column9:
and they will happily live together in California where Lynn and Katie always dreamed of living. Katie has hope that all the things will get better. Lynn had always taught Katie that her life will be Kira-Kira.
Although this story has a very sad ending
column10: I think this story is very beautiful. I also started to like the word Kira-Kira <ins>and </ins>was able to see everything <mod target = like>as if it was</mod> Kira-Kira. If you see everything as happiness and hope
column11: the world will look different. The world will look more beautiful than ever. Everything will look so lovely
column12:
even your bad teacher or your annoying brother. I learned to understand everybody and their own thoughts and also learned how to change my own thought to make things better one than before.

This book taught me something very important. This book was not a fantasy book or a comic book. It absolutely did not make me beam or smile.

However
column13: </mod> by reading this book and seeing the life of Katie
column14: I was filled with hope and happiness. I became thankful that I was born
column15: thankful for living in my own home with my own family
column16:
and thankful that I have a dream and a future. Everything became as if it was Kira-Kira after I read this book.

Since it was time for supper after I finished this book
column17: I went to the living room and had a delicious dinner. I was thankful for everything. I was thankful to my mother who cooked this delicious dinner. I am really thankful<mod target = l to> for</mod> this book
column18:
""Kira-Kira."" It changed my attitude towards my own life and towards the world!

This book itself shines.":::

column1: 999:::"Yesterday I went to the Schlitterbahn water park with my host family and my family. Schlitterbahn water park is one of the largest water park companies in the United States. They have three water parks in Texas and one water park in Kansas City. Right now the biggest water park in the United States is the Schlitterbahn water park that's in Texas
column2: but they say that in about six years the Kansas City<ins> </ins>Schlitterbahn water park will be the largest water park in the whole <ins>of </ins>North America
column3: but I still think that Aquatica<ins>

column12: </del> because we were getting really hungry. The food was amazing. I ate a foot long hot dog<ins>
column13: </ins> and it was really a foot long. Usually<ins>

column15: it's really not a foot long or it's smaller

column18: </ins> and we had lots of fun together. I still thank my host mom for this.":::

1001:::"Last week I went fishing with my host dad and my host brother in America. We went to <del>the </del>Truman Lake that's in Kansas City. Truman Lake is a very popular spot for fishing<del>
column2: </del> because it has lots of crappie and white bass. The boat that we used was called the Ranger. It is used for lake fishing
column3: and our fishing helper was Mr. Blake<ins>
column4:
who is really good at fishing. On the first day we caught about 40 fishes. We caught a lot of crappies and some white basses.
It was really late when we were done fishing on the first day
column5: so we had dinner really late that day. We stayed at Park Fled Inn. It was a motel
column6: but it's services were really good like a hotel's. It even had breakfast downstairs in the morning. Our first day ended like that
column7:
and the next day we went to the same lake on the same boat with the same helper.
We caught about 50 fishes that day. The limit for the amount of fish you can catch is 50. It was really cool that we were able to reach the limit. That's a lot of fish! The best thing of all was catching a catfish. A catfish is called meggie in Korean. I didn't catch it
column8: but my host brother did. It was really cool to see a catfish so close. Our fishing trip was great. I think it will be one of the great<ins>est</ins> memories that I had with my host family.":::

column1:
1019:::"Going to America was one of the best experiences of my life.

I'll tell you guys more about exactly what I did there and why it was one of the best experiences of my life.

On August 14th
column2:
I first arrived in America.

Everything was so different from Korea
column3: </ins> and I didn't really have any friends or families there<del>
column4:
because I

was the only Korean who was there.

I met my host family who looked really nice and kind.

I went to their house where I would stay to unpack and go to sleep
column5:
since it was 2 a.m.

I started getting friendly with my host family and talked to them about Korea and their country
column6:
the U.S.A.

When I talked to them I could tell right away that they are nice people.

The next morning I started to meet my friends and neighbors. All of them were nice to me
column7:
and they asked a lot of things about my country and told me a lot about their country.

I started to like football after I started going to school and getting closer with my friends.

I started going to football games and even played a little.

Anyways
column8:
I would like to tell my Little Fox friends about my experiences in Florida and New York.

In October
column9:
I went to Florida for the first time.

We went to Palm Beach and stayed at the Palm Beach resort.

We went fishing and swimming
column10:
and we also ate a lot of delicious foods.

I hope I can go back to Florida when I go to the U.S.A. again to see my host family this summer.

Florida was one of the best places in the U.S.A. that I went to.

There was a another place that I went to in the U.S.A. I think you guys can guess it

right away! It's where the Statue of Liberty is
column11:
>: New York!

In New York I walked
column12: I think</del> about 10 miles per day<ins>
column13:
I think.

I was so tired everyday that I actually went to sleep at 8 p.m. and slept until 10 a.m. every day like a baby.

Well
column14: </ins> I saw and experienced a lot of things
column15: like riding in a New York city taxi
column16: going to the top of the Empire State building<mod target = .>
column17:
and eating a New York city hot dog. It was so delicious.

After going to New York
column18: I went to another place <ins>in </ins>Florida again
column19:
but this time I went to Orlando.

If you like the Orlando Magic
column20: <mod target = a>the</mod> famous basketball team
column21:
you'll probably know where Orlando is.

Orlando is not just famous for basketball
column22: but it's also popular for Disney World
column23: Aquatica
column24:
and Sea World.

All three of these places were awesome
column25:
but I think the best place was Aquatica.

Disney

column1: World was good
column2: but there were too many people so we really couldn't

column1:
ride a lot of the rides. It was a different story at Aquatica.

We went to Aquatica early in the morning
column2:
so we could ride a lot of the rides there.

We rode really fun rides like the Oka Maka which looks like a giant badminton ball
column3:
and toilet twisters which sucks us like a toilet.

It was a lot of fun there.

Finally
column4:
there is Sea World.

In Sea World
column5: there are a lot of shows
column6: like a dolphin show
column7: seal show
column8:
and other things.

I hope I can go to America again if there is a chance
column9:
because it was one of the best

things that I have experienced and I will never forget it.":::

It was the toilet
column10:
and I think it is the greatest invention that humans have made.
Before that invention
column11:
Rome's roads were full of poop.
Through the invention of the toilet
column12:
Romans got rid of many diseases and were able to talk about politics in the public bathhouses.
Can you imagine living without a toilet?

column13:

also
column14:
we wouldn't be able to live in a high-rise apartment building because we have to run down as fast as possible every time we have an emergency. Or maybe people could use a poop carrier even though I wouldn't want to do that at all. Before the invention of the bathroom there was a movable bathroom in Rome. They carried big clothes and a bucket so when someone needed to go to the bathroom they would cover him with the clothes and make money doing this.
Don't think of the toilet as something dirty.
The toilet is a very useful and clean invention.":::

and she went to buy a gorgeous watch chain to replace the old strap that Jim had to carry his watch.

column15: too. When Jim came

he was startled by her wife's very short hair. Della was so frightened by her husband's reaction and behavior about her now very short curly hair.

column1: 1067:::"I am fortunate to have good parents
column2: so it is easy for me to identify the qualities that make them good. These qualities are unconditional love
column3: trust
column4:
and respect for their kids.
All mothers and fathers love their children. They nurture them and keep them from harm. But
column5: </ins> not all love is unconditional. Some parents would not love their children if they married someone of a different religion or from a different ethnic group. Some parents would not love their children if they were of a different sexual orientation. However
column6: most of the parents in the world love their children unconditionally<del>
column7:
and that fact makes most of the children in the world happy.
Part of unconditional love is trust. Also
column8:
most parents trust their children to do what is right. They know we would never do anything to hurt them or to disgrace them. They trust us so we trust them. We are confident that they would never do anything dangerous or stupid that that would hurt us.
Because of the fact that our parents love us
column9: they also respect us. They treat us as individuals. They accept our differences. They do not expect us or force us to be like them. They want us to be our own person. They want us to make our own way in the world
column10:
not follow in their footsteps behind them.
Without their parents' love
column11: children would not be as confident as they are now. <del>And </del><mod target = without>Without</mod> their trust
column12: children would not be free<del>d</del> to do what they want to do. <del>And so on
column13: on the other qualities and conditions.</del> All of the children in the world should have such good parents and be happy their whole life.":::

column1: 1070:::"The one skill I would choose for success is tolerance. I do not define success economically. I define success socially. To succeed in the future
column2: we will need to be tolerant of one another's background
column3: opinions
column4:
and lifestyles.
The world is becoming increasingly mobile; we no longer are able to live and work only with the people who went to the same schools and
went to the same parties as our parents and us. Now
column5:
we will work directly with people whose backgrounds are completely different from ours.
We must be tolerant of these differences as they must be tolerant of us if we are to live and work together amiably.
We cannot stop speaking to people or start a war just because there is a difference in opinions. We must learn to be tolerant of one another and respect these differences in opinions. We have to find a common ground
column6: an idea we can both agree on. Once we have <mod target = agreement>agreed</mod> on one subject
column7: it will be easier to settle differences in other subjects. Different people have different lifestyles. We must accept these differences even though they may be different from what we are used to. Women can live on their own
column8: hold important jobs
column9:
and raise children on their own. Men can stay home and take care of children. Social holes can change and we must be tolerant of these changes.
To succeed socially
column10: you must adapt to differences. You must be tolerant of all people regardless of their background
column11: opinions
column12: and their lifestyles.":::

column1: 1072:::"Nowadays
column2: some people <mod target = may hold the opinion>believe</mod> that boys and girls should attend separate schools

column4:
I agree that boys and girls should attend separate schools. My reasons for this point are listed as follows.
I agree with the statement because single-sex education provides an environment for both boys and girls to concentrate on their studies. Research shows that a single-sex school environment can eliminate the distraction from members of the opposite sex
column5: </del> and therefore<ins>
column6: </ins> is academically beneficial to students. They will be able to focus more on their academic curriculum<del>
column7:
and prepare for their future education and career. The single-sex setting eliminates social distractions and allows for better concentration and academies.
Next
column8: traditional gender stereotypes are often reinforced in single-sex academies. Boys tend to be taught in a more regimented
column9: traditional
column10: and individualistic fashion <mod target = and>while</mod> girls<ins> are</ins> in more nurturing
column11: cooperative<ins>
column12:
and open environments. This will develop their virtues and prepare them for their future roles in society.
Taking account of all these factors
column13: we may reach the conclusion that boys and girls should attend separate schools. Of course
column14: there are <ins>also </ins>disadvantages <mod target = of>to</mod> single-gender education. A lot of effort should be made to ensure that a single-gender education system will be successfully implemented.":::

column1: 1074:::"Most students in the world struggle with having so much homework. Many teachers believe that daily homework is the only key to improving education and school success. <del>And

column14:
they will be of great benefit to the students.
In conclusion

column1: 1085:::"Last weekend<ins>
column2: </ins> my family and I went to the ice-skating rink. My sister has been bugging me since she went there with my younger brother two weeks ago. But<ins>
column3: </ins> at first I didn't want to go because it would probably be cold there. But<ins>
column4: </ins> to be truthful<mod target = ;>
column5:
it was because I was afraid of the mistakes I could make on the slippery ice.

Mistakes like falling flat on my face or even bumping into everyone while they are having a good time.

So
column6: </ins> I tried avoiding my sister who kept on asking<ins>
column7: </ins> <del>and </del>sometimes bribing me with a small amount of money<ins>
column8:
or saying she will give me something that I will appreciate.

Then
column9: </ins> when she was starting to get tiresome after <mod target = 2>two</mod> days had passed
column10: my parents almost forced me to go saying that they will eat lunch out. Finally<ins>
column11:
I gave in to my parents and the next day we were off to the ice rink!

Driving there by car
column12:
it didn't take long before we reached there.

When I entered the door
column13: we borrowed <mod target = 3>three</mod> pairs of skates and started to enter the rink where some of the people were speeding <ins>by </ins>quickly as if they were competing against each other
column14: which gave me butterflies in my stomach for just catching a glimpse <mod target = at>of</mod> them. But<ins>
column15:
my sister pulled me along so I sighed loudly and went in.

It was probably because of the bundled up clothes that I didn't feel cold. I was really scared
column16:
almost terrified because it was only a matter of seconds before I started crashing down to the ice.

Fortunately
column17: </ins> my sister let me grip the bars which I assumed were for starters<del>
column18:
and she guided me toward them.

Thankfully
column19: </ins> I skidded along the gleaming ice and I got a full view of the skating rink. I realized that there were not so many people there<ins>
column20: </ins> as I expected it to be crowded. Later<ins>
column21: </ins> I found out that it was because we arrived a few hours early. As I balanced myself cautiously on the sharp points of the skates
column22: I found myself moving forward rather slowly. So<ins>
column23: </ins> after I put a little more effort into it
column24:
I was actually skating on ice.

I think it was easy for me because I used to play outside with roller blades when I was a few years younger then I am. After a few more minutes
column25: </ins> I felt myself gliding across the ice. When that was finished<ins>
column26: </ins> I rewarded myself with hot cocoa. It was even more tasty than I remembered
column27:
probably because I had been skating around and around the rink for a couple of times.

Then
column28: </ins> my mother told me we should get going <ins>now
column29: </ins>saying how hungry we must be. I didn't want<del>ed</del> to leave that place<ins>
column30: </ins> mostly because of how much fun we had<ins> </ins>(and also the tasty cocoa). But<ins>
column31: </ins> my tummy grumbled in protest so we got into the car. While I was thinking in my car about what happened today<ins>
column32: </ins> I came up with a conclusion that I should never judge something before I <mod target = had>have</mod> even tried it. It is <del>a </del>pretty common knowledge when it comes to trying new food. But<ins>
column33: </ins> I had seldom experienced <ins>that </ins>with a sport<ins>
column34: </ins> so it felt new for me. I should probably test it out with other things<ins>
column35: </ins> too<ins>
column36: </ins> just in case.":::

so maybe I'll see them again. I'll never forget them...

column7: I wasn't planning on telling the other teacher

but it was really touching and I was thankful to them for being always being nice and funny.

column1: 1090:::"Do you like reading? Do you go to the library often? If you think you are a bookworm who can't live without books

column3:
I can live without books.) join me with this talk about 'books.'

Firstly
column4: I'd like to talk about How to Kill a Mockingbird. But<ins>
column5: </ins> it's not related to actually shooting mockingbirds. Mockingbirds symbolize innocent people who do no harm to <del>the </del>society. The prosecutor (also the narrator's father) says <ins>to </ins>never kill a mockingbird. The author talks about a few ""mockingbirds"" that die<ins>d</ins> <mod target = with>for</mod> no reason. The part where there was a trial <ins>on </ins>whether the black man was guilty or not was really interesting and fun to read. But<ins>
column6:
it was sad to see such discrimination between the blacks and the whites.

Now
column7: </ins> I'd like to talk about The Catcher in the Rye<ins>
column8: </ins> which I just finished a few days ago. This book was also fun to read (I can't read boring books). The story is about a boy who lives by himself for two days after he gets kicked out <mod target = by>of</mod> his fourth school. In the middle of the story
column9: the boy
column10: Holton
column11: says that he wants to be a catcher in the rye<ins>
column12: </ins> who catches children who are falling off the cliff. I think he is trying to say that he wants to guard children's innocence

column14: Phoebe<ins>
column15:
a lot and tries to protect Phoebe from losing her innocence. Holton goes back to his normal life and he ends the book by saying he misses his friends in his school. You should read this book.

Thirdly
column16: I love the book Goose <mod target = girl>Girl</mod>. This is a fantasy series and I read this book more than three times. Isi has <mod target = a>the</mod> power to talk to animals and control <ins>the </ins>wind. Enna can control fire. Rin has the ability to control people by words. It's so cool. column18: </ins> too. So<ins>
column19: </ins> if you have a chance

read One Thousand Days and Princess Academy.

column21: </ins> if you finish the series

which looks really stupid.

column1: 1093:::"There's a soccer game every year at my school. It's called Sincheon World Cup. Our team was one of the best. But<ins>

column5:

The first round was for boys. One boy in my class did handling and the other team got a penalty kick! And Class 11 scored. It was 1:0. We were so disappointed. Suddenly
column6:
another student from Class 11 kicked the ball and it went straight in!! We stopped cheering.

The second round was the girls' turn. But
column7:
Class 11 was stronger than we thought!! We didn't get a chance to score. I hated the girls in Class 11 so much.


The third round was the boys' turn again. Nobody scored.


We lost the game 2:0. Everyone was surprised. We thought it would be at least be 2:1.

It was the end of the game. We aren't going to play any games anymore. It was sad
column8: but we quickly cheered up<del>..</del>. It was a hard day.":::

column4:
she always ran to the playground and played with her friends until dark.
She went to a piano academy and she was one of the top students. She wanted to be a pianist. She read a lot of books
column5:
but she didn't study for her tests. That was Sarah's life until she was in the 3rd grade.
Then
column6: </ins> her life changed when her family moved to Seoul (she used to live in Suwon<del>.</del>)<ins>.</ins> She didn't like it there. She had to make new friends and meet new teachers. When she started 4th grade
column7: she met a great teacher. Sarah liked her and she liked her class. She still played after school
column8:
but she began studying for tests. She was very happy.
When she became a 5th grader
column9:
she began studying more. She worked hard and she loved her teacher.
When she was in 6th grade
column10: she became quiet. She no longer played after school
column11: but she studied and read books. She went to ILE
column12: an English academy
column13: and learned a lot. She met a teacher named Julie. Julie gave Sarah the book
column14:
""Tuesdays with Morrie"" when Julie left the academy.
Then
column15:
she became a middle school student. She still went to ILE and met a cool teacher named Jason. He was nice to Sarah and Sarah always laughed at his jokes. She also went to a math academy.
A year later
column16: she became a second year student in middle school. She went into Lex Kim instead of ILE. It was hard. She always learned how to get great test scores and how to excel at tests. But<ins>
column17: </ins> Lex Kim was different. She began to think about her future. She wanted to be important. She wanted to do something for her country. She began to look at the world around her. The head teacher told her about opportunities
column18: hopes<ins>
column19: </ins> and<del>
column20:
dreams.
Meanwhile
column21: her math teacher told her she had talent. She wanted to believe that. But<ins>
column22:
there seemed to be so many students who were greater. She was easily depressed.



Now
column23: the girl wonders whether her story will have a happy ending. Sometimes<ins>
column24:
she wants to relive her past again so she can be better and to fix her mistakes... She wants to be stronger and more confident...
Only one person can end her story. Whether it will be a happy ending or a tragic ending
column25: nobody knows. Whether it will be thick or short
column26: nobody knows... But<ins>
column27: </ins> that's the joy of stories
column28: right?":::

column1:
1101:::"I think Japan needs to look at their history more objectively. Japan should admit their faults and apologize sincerely to Korea and China instead of denying their wrongs and teaching their citizens the wrong history.

Japan's prime minister
column2: Shinzo Abe<ins>
column3: </ins> compared the Yasukuni shrine to the Arlington National Cemetery. The Yasukuni shrine is where Japan honors veterans who died during the Japanese colonial era. Japan also wants other countries to show respect at the Yasukuni shrine. However
column4:
Korea's Foreign Minister Choi Tai Young has said that the Yasukuni shrine is a facility that enshrines war criminals and glorifies a war of aggression.

Though I like Japan culture
column5: I dislike the <mod target = Japan's>Japanese</mod> government who declares that the sexual abuse of Asian women during wartime was totally necessary and does not apologize sincerely to Korea.":::

column1: 1110:::"Hi! Because my life is so boring and I have nothing to say

I would like to talk about North Korea.

Before

column4: some say

column6: </ins> after North Korea identified itself as a nuclear power in its Constitution and after its nuclear test last month

and is determined to follow the way of countries like Pakistan. I agree with these people and believe that the North is actually planning to attack the South.

column10:
which only made North Korea declare that they will no longer speak about dismantling its nuclear program.
I hope Kim Jeung Un will get some sense and stop all this nonsense. Do we really need a bloody fight right now? We should find ways to unite the two Koreas

Korea will be a much more powerful and wealthy country. We should be ashamed of ourselves for being the only country that is separated!

Stay up late just to show off?
Scribble in my journal whenever I have time?

WHAT WAS I THINKING?
WHAT WAS I THINKING?
WHAT WAS I THINKING?
column11:
this>This whole thing disgusts me.


About myself.

"" even while knowing that it was a total lie.

column1: 1138:::"Thursday
