column3:
if you go outside - and I'm warning that you'd better not - you'll see that you just CAN'T go anywhere without getting wet.

Rain is what matters these days.
Well
column4: I mean
column5:
it has been raining for almost three days straight. How much damage did the rain cost?
There were a few landslides and roads were damaged! News reports also said that many people have died
column6: got injured
column7:
and are missing.
It keeps raining
column8:
even now while I'm writing this from inside my comfortable home.
I feel sorry for the people who live on low ground level. They are usually poor and can't do anything except to see watch the water damage their homes. Even the lucky people whose homes haven't become a huge swimming pool or water tank
column9:
water still gets water inside and makes all their stuff damp. Many people have to place plastic sheets and other things to cover their furniture.
The streets are terrible
column10: too. It's <del>like </del>as if we're walking underwater<del>
column11: </del> with water splashing everywhere. I guess it'll be more convenient to wear raincoats instead of taking an umbrella. It's hopeless to stay dry and <ins>when </ins>you see a bunch of raindrops slam onto your umbrella
column12: <del>and </del>the rain bounces off to your arm or somewhere else they are not supposed to go. Rain boots are a good idea
column13: but it's better if you wear long rain boots and not short ones like mine. The rain pours into your rain boots if they are not tall enough<ins>
column14:
which was my experience. You really don't want to face that kind of problem yourself.
Don't even let me get started on the landslide problem!
It's just terrible. The landslide caused buildings to collapse
column15: which is what happened on Tuesday. <del>And
column16:
The structure that collapsed was not an empty building: it was a pension!!!
So
column17: in the middle of the night
column18: a pension collapsed because of some huge
column19: nasty landslide<del>
column20: </del> and there was a bunch of people in the building! Some didn't make it out alive. Others lived
column21: but were injured physically<del>
column22: </del> or mentally. <del>And </del><mod target = there>There</mod> are still some people that the search and rescue team couldn't find yet under that huge pile of rubble from the broken building. I was really surprised to hear the news about the building<del>
column23: </del> and also<ins> felt</ins> a little ashamed because I was enjoying the rain! After such hot and dry days
column24: the rain came<del>
column25: </del> and I was staring out the window
column26: enjoying the cool wind<ins>
column27: </ins> <del>and </del>thunder rumbling<ins>
column28:
and lightening striking across the sky. I even hoped that it would rain all week.
THAT was FOOLISH!! The thing that victims would want the most is for the rain to stop and the damages to be repaired! And I was wishing that the rainy days would last! I AM selfish.
TERMINATED.":::

Jack Hall is a climatologist on an expedition in Antarctica with his colleagues

column17: </ins> when suddenly an ice shelf breaks in half and Jake almost falls to his death. Later<ins>
column18: </ins> back in New Delhi
column19: Jack presents his findings on global warming at a UN conference

column21: except for Professor Terry Rapson of the Scotland Climate Research Center. Professor Rapson believes in him<del>
column22: </del> and he tells Jack that the temperature in several places in the North Atlantic simultaneously dropped 13 degrees Celsius below<ins> zero</ins>. Jack thinks that the Ice Age is coming
column23: due to global warming. (When the Earth gets overheated
column24: the Earth will try to get everything<ins> back</ins> in control<del>
column25: </del> by cooling down the whole world's temperature. So
column26: as the North Poles' ice melts

column30:
6 to 8 weeks at most.
Around the world

column33: Japan
column34: and a series of devastating hurricanes in Los Angeles
column35: killing thousands of people. Spacemen are able to see a huge storm system spanning the northern hemisphere
column36:
which delays their return. Jack's theory about the Ice Age becomes a reality in seven to ten days time.
Meanwhile

column40: J.D.<del>.</del> The weather in NYC becomes very violent

column42: and seek shelter there. <del>And

column44:
Jack begins his expedition to New York with Jason and Frank. Frank dies on the way trying to save the others. They continue on their way.
At the library in New York
column45: everyone is leaving the city in an attempt to survive. Sam <ins>tries to </ins>convince<del>s</del> them that they'll die if they go out
column46: yet very few people listen. The remaining people light a fire and they stay

column49: </del> and Sam and the others set out to get some penicillin to cure her leg. But<ins>

column52: trying to find food (or even some humans
column53: I think). <del>And </del><mod target = even>Even</mod> though they get caught at first
column54: they successfully return from the hungry wolves. Soon<ins>
column55: </ins> <del>and </del>the eye of the <mod target = superstorm>super storm</mod><del>
column56: </del> starts to freeze everything. (You should really watch this scene!<del>!!!</del> It's magnificent<del>
column57: </del> and also scary. The whole city freezes from the top<del>
column58: </del> and the frost starts to creep into the building. It was ironic that humans can escape from 'cold air'
column59: since it usually travels by the wind and humans cannot walk OR run faster than the wind. But<ins>
column61:
even though he was dragging the whole pack of necessary supplies. )

and finds the public library half-buried in snow.

column23:
so I will write today's diary again.
These days
column24:
I'm learning about atoms and compounds.
I'll review yesterday's lesson.
Well
column25: there are a few ways to make compounds<ins>
column26: </ins> but for now
column27:
we learned about covalent bonds and ionic bonds. How do I start? Right.
All atoms have electrons and their orbits
column28: right? <del>And </del><mod target = except>Except</mod> for 'rare gases<mod target = '
column30: '</mod> all other atoms want to fill their orbits and stay stable. There are two ways to fill their orbits: covalent bonds and ionic bonds. (<del> </del>But<ins>
column31:
don't think that there are only two ways to make a compound! There are more. )
First of all
column32: a covalent bond is characterized by the sharing of a pair of electrons between atoms or other covalent bonds. Take water for example... Yeah
column33: water! W-A-T-E-R
column34: water we drink
column35: water we use
column36: and water we cannot live without. Yeah
column37: water is a covalent compound<del>
column38:
made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom!
(Water is amazing! Its unique features keep us and even fish alive. I'd like to explain it to you now
column39:
but let's wait until later. I have to explain about making compounds.)
So
column40: water's molecular formula is H2O<del>
column41:
and that means that water molecules consist of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. Its degree of coupling is 120 degrees each.
Let me tell you how it happens. First
column42: 'neutral' hydrogen atoms have one proton and one electron. <del>And </del><mod target = you>You</mod> know
column43: the first orbit of the atom (closest to the proton) is made when there are two electrons exercising. So<ins>
column44: </ins> hydrogen atoms need one more electron to fill their first orbit. An oxygen atom
column45: on the other hand
column46: has eight electrons
column47:
and it needs two electrons to fill its second orbit.
Did I mentioned that nonmetallic atoms love to take electrons
column48: but do not want to give them up? Well
column49: now I did. It's really hard to take other's electrons without permission
column50: right? <del>And </del><mod target = there>There</mod> is no 'left out for free' electrons for them to take. So<ins>
column51:
our dear hydrogen atoms (H for short) and oxygen atoms (O for short) meet and negotiate.

O: Hey
column52:
H! I need two electrons. Would you mind giving some to me?
H: Are you kidding??? I have only one electron! You have eight. Give some to me. I want to stay safe.
O: No way
column54:
I want to fill my orbit! I don't want to give my precious electrons to you!
H: That's what I'm saying!
O: Well? There must be some way for us to both be satisfied without fighting.
H: How?
O: I've got it! You need one electron
column55: and I need two electrons. So<ins>
column56: </ins> you bring one of your friends now<mod target =
column57:
> and then all three of us can be satisfied!
H: I don't know what you're saying
column59:
dear Oxygen? H told me that you figured out a wonderful way to make us all good.
O: Sure
column61: I'll give you one electron each<del>
column63:
you each give one electron to me.
H: Oh
column64: that's good! I get the one electron I need<del>
column65:
and you get the two electrons you want!
O: Let's do it.
(after a while)
H's friend: We changed!!!
O: Yeah
column66:
what do we call ourselves?
H: Water. I looked it up in the dictionary.

A little stupid
column67: but I hope this helps you understand more about covalent bonds.":::

column1: 1145:::"Thursday
column2:
May 2

I'll write the answer to the problem I posted in my last entry.
(distance that the train runs for 10 minutes) = (gap between two trains)+(distance you walk for 10 minutes)
Distance =Time*Speed
Speed of the train: X
Gap between two trains: Y
10X=Y+40
column3:
10X-Y=40


(distance that the train runs for 8 minutes) = (gap between two trains)-(distance you walk for 10 minutes)

8X=Y-40 8X-Y=-40


10X-Y=40
-8X-Y=-40
2X =80
X=40

(Speed of the train)=40km/h

I guess this answer is correct.

column6:

column10: 50 women<ins>
column11: </ins> and two babies for each couple. The Builders said that they should forget about their lives above the ground<del>
column12: </del> and to keep their former lives as a secret from their children
column13: so they don't wander around looking for the exit. In the underground city<del> -</del> called Ember<ins>
column14:
- everything seemed perfect with bright lights provided by hydroelectricity and food (from the Greenhouse and storage rooms full of cans).
And Finally
column15: there is a document with instructions that the Builders left behind to prepare for the time when Ember becomes endangered. The document is called the Instructions for Egress
column16:
but it got lost by the seventh Mayor of Ember and no one knows about it.
That is until Lina finds out and plans to find an exit from Ember with Doon.
In Lina's time
column17: everything is lacking in Ember. The potatoes are diseased<del>
column18: </del> and there are hardly any cans left for the citizens. Only privileged ones<ins>
column19: </ins> such as food workers and the Mayor<ins>
column20: </ins> have access to food
column21: keeping the cans to themselves. <del>And </del><mod target = the>The</mod> light that supports Ember is beginning to flicker<del>
column22: </del> and the people of Ember know that they are doomed. There are ""Believers
column23: who believe that someone<ins>
column24: </ins> <del>- </del>frankly
column25: the Builders themselves<ins>
column26:
- will come and rescue them.
When Lina and Doon finally exit Ember through a secret hallway built by the Builders
column27: they realize that their previous world was nothing but a small ball of light deep underneath the ground. <del>And
column28: </del><mod target = they>They</mod> send the message to the remaining people of Ember<del>
column29:
and the story ends there.
There are other cities like Ember in many books. Take ""The Giver
column30: </ins>"" for example. <del>(</del>It is another one of my favorite books.<del>)</del> Jonas is living in a so-called utopia. The government controls everything: the food they eat
column31: what dreams they have
column32: what feelings they feel
column33: etc. Since everything
column34: almost everything
column35: is controlled
column36:
they don't even feel anything about killing. The government calls it ""releasing"" and everyone takes that for granted.
Until
column37: Jonas becomes the Receiver of Memory
column38: a special person who remembers all of the memories of the past
column39: he doesn't even know anything is wrong. With the help of the last Giver
column40: who gives Jonas all the memories
column41: Jonas learns about everything: colors
column42: wars
column43: real happiness
column44:
and about killing.
Too shocked that everyone is ""releasing"" old people and weak babies mercilessly
column45: Jonas leaves the town
column46:
thinking of a way to tell the people about real life and real emotions.
Well
column47: both books are talking about cities made and controlled by the government. Everything is perfectly controlled
column48: until someone tries to break the control. Some say <del>when </del>if another World War happens again<del>
column49: </del> and after almost all<ins> the</ins> people die
column50:
there could be some country like that.
Well

column23:

like flying. I think the fact that there's no place to put your feet makes the ride more exhilarating.

1) King Viking

column33:

column34: yet. But<ins>
column35:
don't go too far. I've seen some kids who went too far and...... it's your choice.

Stress out!!

When you feel like you're tired from all those other rides

Listening to music
column39:
around and around!

Sorry. That was a complete joke. It's a mini roller coaster for really small kids.

but we really enjoyed the talk and cookies on the bus.
Anyway

column10: sophisticated building stood there<ins>.</ins> <del>and </del><mod target = it>It</mod> was beautiful and brand-new. Guided by the camp's staff
column11: we could see our apartment
column12: the place we were to stay during our time in the Song-am Space Center. In our 'room<mod target = '
column14: '</mod> there were two floors
column15: and on the top floor

half of the ceiling was glass. The glass was transparent so we could see the stars shining when we lay down. I have never seen anything like that. It was magnificent.
As soon as we put down our bags and gathered together
column17: the teachers divided all of us into two group<ins>s</ins> and started the activities. I was in 'A' group

column19: such as Sirius
column20: Polaris<ins>
column21: </ins> and Altair. It was boring<del>
column22: </del> and teachers didn't let us take the activity paper we made. It was really annoying. I wanted to put it up <mod target = on>in</mod> my room and enjoy the glowing of important stars. After that

column24: you should wear some sort of special glasses or the screen will be all blurry. But<ins>
column25:
this was nothing like that. Do you know about planetariums?
A planetarium is a theater that is shaped like a hemisphere
column26: </del> and you go in and ""sit."" (Even though
column27: ""lay down"" is more accurate

column30: </del> and a regular 3D-movie doesn't make you feel like you're a part of the scene that is playing on the screen. Anyway
column31:
it was good.
Finally

column33: </ins> steak<ins>
column34: </ins> <del>and </del>french fries<ins>
column35:
and rice. It was delicious.
But
column36: </ins> they seemed to forget that we needed salad. Well

column38:
can they?
After dinnertime
column39: we had a little recreation time and went to sleep. You know what? We stayed up <mod target = untill>until</mod> 3 A.M
column40: eating <mod target = snakes>snacks</mod> and talking
column41: surfing the internet
column42: and whatever. I cannot say that I was totally fine the next <mod target = morinig>morning</mod>
column43: but hey

After breakfast

new friends. First days are always thrilling. And I guess everyone feels the same way about that.

the P.E. class. It is really hard. I'm not really good at this.)

never studying.

teachers do that.

with many good friends and good teachers.

Today

l'll write a small summary about this story.

-When Lady Saren refuses to marry a man she fears

There's a happy ending

and I could tour the world through books. Isn't that beautiful?

column1:
1160:::"-Script Report-

Time travel has been an interesting and mysterious topic for people. People imagined about interstellar traveling by time warp and space warp. In addition
column2: scientists
column3: especially physicists
column4: started to find out the secrets of time travelling<del>
column5:
and they discovered that the only way to travel through time was to accelerate faster than light.

Dr. Harold G. White
column6: who works in NASA as a physicist and an engineer
column7:
is trying to find out whether humanity can time travel in the future in the floating white rounded-shaped laboratory.

They are following the theory of one Mexican physicist named Miguel Alcubierre
column8: who discovered <ins>that </ins>faster-than-light speeds were possible
column9: <mod target = buy>but</mod> did not contradict with Einstein. Alcubierre referred that the machine
column10: which gathers the speed in reality
column11: could never be constructed. In his theory
column12: <del>the </del>space has both forces: expansion<del>
column13: </del> and contraction. His theoretical propulsion system controls space-time
column14:
by generating ‘warp bubble'. It is to make the spaceship to expand and contract with opposite directions.

Dr. White strongly believes that they can succeed in the project because of the advancement in their propulsion system
column15: >.</mod> <del>and </del><mod target = they>They</mod> say that the ring around the warp bubble is the major key to solve the warp-travel matter. However
column16:
they do not think about making this experiment expanded because the current technology cannot accomplish a bigger warp bubble. Dr. White just wants to prove if the warp bubble exists.

There are contrary opinions about the experiment. Those who assists White's opinion are the people like Steve Stich
column17: deputy director of engineering at the Johnson Space Center
column18: and Richard Obousy
column19: a physicist who is president of Icarus Interstellar. They are saying the experiment is able to succeed with <ins>a </ins>longer time scale and their constant effort. Others like Edwin F. Taylor
column20: a former editor of The American Journal of Physics and senior research scientist at M.I.T
column21: and Neil deGrasse Tyson
column22: astrophysicist at the American Museum of Natural History
column23: disagree<del>s</del> with him. Saying White's experiment is absurd
column24:
they referred that the experiment needs far-advanced technology that could be exist in the future.

Even Dr. Alcubierre himself
column25: </del> is <mod target = telling>saying</mod> that his theory is just<mod target =
column26: > a</mod> ‘theory<mod target = '.>.'</mod> By using the warp bubble
column27: the spaceship consumes an amount of exotic matters. Moreover
column28: as they use the warp bubble
column29: they cannot get any signals within the ship as the ship is travelling faster than light. Ironically
column30: <ins>a </ins>pilot cannot turn it on or off either. As a result
column31:
the machine is practically impossible.

Time travel has been the dream of humanity until now and for the future. For now
column32: it is impossible to make the machine<ins>
column33: </ins> but in the near future
column34: I strongly believe that it could succeed perfectly and humanity's boundary will be further than<ins> in the</ins> present's.":::

column1: 1162:::"Already

and then came the refreshing autumn atmosphere.

What have you done during the summer? Did you have a vacation at the beach

I just sigh and feel sorry for myself.

However

Everyone

""Have you spent your summer vacation in a way that you really enjoyed and was fulfilling?""
Some may answer it proudly

column1: 1163:::"For three days
column2: Koreans had a fabulous <del>time-</del>resting period<mod target = .>
column3: </mod> Chuseok. In the Korean tradition
column4: when the long weekend holiday comes
column5: people visit their hometowns to meet families and strengthen harmony among themselves. They have ancestral rites
column6: remember<del>ing</del> their ancestors<ins>
column7:
and setting tables with all the delicious food. And That is one of the most important parts of spending the holidays.

However
column8: since my family does not have ancestral rites
column9: we just spend Chuseok with our relatives. We often meet together around this period

right?

However

column21: (well

heading for the Andromeda galaxy. And that is the word.

I always feel terrified and confused when I prepare for school exams. It disturbs my mind more violently than ever. The longer I sit in the chair

column31: </del> and that is not a very<del>
column32: </del> good<del>
column33:
situation. I do not want to repeat bad outcomes again. Never.

Well
column34: Chuseok passed without special events or stories. It just passed like normal days; the only difference is that the relatives visited our house. That's all. Chuseok passed like neither fish nor fowl. I have not finished preparing for any subject. Just the pressure<ins> alone</ins> made me depressed. Hey
column35: hey. What is this situation? I just do not understand the situation. What have I done until now? The answer is for our parents
column36: I guess…":::

we talked about the differences between men and women because there was a related article in the textbook.

*In offering help to their partners
column5:
women are more inclined to express sympathy and share examples of their own similar experiences. Men are more likely to help by problem-solving or offering suggestions.

WOMAN: So today
column6: </ins> <mod target = ~~~>something</mod> happened and my friend<ins>
column7: </ins> whats-her-face<ins>
column8:
betrayed me like it was nothing. I'm so sad and heartbroken..
MAN: If she's such a bad friend
column9:
why don't you just stop seeing her?

MAN: Or you can confront her and make her apologize
column10: and</del> <mod target = them>Then
column11:
maybe forgive her?
WOMAN: I don't know... I can't believe our friendship was that shallow.
MAN: Or
column12: if you're that angry
column13:
you should slap her and shame her in public.
WOMAN: Enough! Don't you have any emotions and sympathy?
MAN: What do you mean? I was just trying to help.

MAN: If you just keep ignoring my suggestions
column14:
what are you going to do about that problem?

-awkward silence-

MAN: I said I'm sorry...
WOMAN: Why are you sorry?
MAN: I'm really sorry.
WOMAN: Do you even know what you did wrong?
MAN: No... Seriously

I just want to stop fighting with you!
.
.
.

This is so awkward.":::

I mean

column1:
*Please note:
This article was taken from my personal blog archive.
Because
column2: </del><mod target = come>Come</mod> on
column3:
the big test just ended this past Wednesday and I don't feel like writing.



Or shall I call it an exam?

So
column4: </ins> I've gone through all of the tests I had to take in middle school. <del>And </del><mod target = by>By</mod> ""middle school""
column5:
I mean a Korean middle school.

Let me briefly tell you about the Korean school system.
- A new semester starts in early March.
- There are two semesters (1st
column6: 2nd) and two vacations (summer
column7:
winter) per year.
- A baby is already one years old at birth. So
column8:
anyone born in 2004 is eight years old now. (You also grow a year older on New Year's Day.)
- 8~13 year old = 1st~6th graders = Elementary school
14~16 year old = 7th~9th graders = Middle school
17~19 year old = 10th~12th graders = High school

Get it?
So
column9: </ins> I am 16 in Korea<del>
column10:
and 15 in the U.S. (born in May 1996).
And Why on earth am I explaining all of this?

Anyways
column11:
you get tested on 11 different subjects:
- Korean
- Math
- Social Studies and History (combined)
- Science
- English
- Ethics
- P.E.
- Techniques and Home Living (combined)
- Chinese
- Music
- Art

I know ""Techniques and Home Living"" sounds weird! They teach you about jobs
column12: food
column13: basic engineering
column14: etc. To me<ins>
column15: </ins> it is the most boring subject ever. I like English and math. But<ins>
column16: </ins> the math teacher is so tacky. Cheap red hair
column17: honeybee-inspired striped top in yellow and brown
column18: and finally
column19: the most disgusting grass colored pants… eww. She reminds me of <ins>a </ins>traffic light: red
column20: yellow
column21:
and green.
I have to go to my teacher's apartment soon to get math lessons. Oh
column22: </ins> come on
column23: it<ins>'</ins>s the last day of exams! But<ins>
column24: </ins> to make more money
column25: she needs to make me come as much as possible. It costs 50<ins>
column26: </ins>000 won (about $44) a lesson
column27: which lasts for like 3 hours. Total steal
column28: eh? I am so happy that I can help her get wealthier everyday! Woohoo! For the non-Koreans
column29: you realize I'm joking
column30: right?":::

column1:
1170:::"She is the skinniest thing in the world.

And Probably the palest

too.

She is 5'3"". Not bad
column3: but she wants to be as tall as me (5'6""). I understand her because I once wanted to grow up to be 5'10"" tall. <del>And </del><mod target = then>Then
column4: </mod> I realized how freaky and stupid that idea was because one day<ins>
column5:
I saw a weird lady who looked like she was 6 ft. tall.

Her Naver ID is ""71remon."" ""Remon"" was supposed to be ""lemon."" My other friends and I always make fun of that mistake. It never gets old.

She is the baby of her family. She is treated like a princess
column6:
which is totally unacceptable. Nobody cares or nags at her about her mediocre grades. She claims that she overpowers her brother in oral and physical fights. Her brother is a 27 year old SNU graduate. End of story.

She can't look into my eyes any longer than 0.75 seconds. She would quickly look away and flash an awkward smile or laugh. Some people tell me that my eyes look like they are trying to tell them something or read their minds. But
column7: </ins> I don't feel self-conscious or guilty about this. <del>And </del><mod target = hey>Hey</mod>
column8: I'm not a psycho
column9: get over it!":::

column2: </ins> this will be a short entry because tomorrow is the last day of midterms! I haven't slept for <mod target = 2>two</mod> days straight and now things are getting serious... <mod target = oh>Oh</mod> goodness
column3: now I don't even feel the slightest hint of sleepiness. My advice is
column4: ""Never try this at home kids!"" You may have more time to study and get better grades
column5: but not sleeping will ruin your brain and soul. You will no longer be a sane student. Not only that
column6: pulling an all-<mod target = nighter>niter</mod> is also bad for your skin. Massive breakout! Not wanted. Anyways
column7: guys
column8: what should I do?! I am forced to go <del>to </del>karaoke with my friends tomorrow<del>
column9: </del> to ""celebrate"" the end of midterms. This won't be much of a celebration for me
column10: since I don't like singing or tambourines. Oh<ins>
column11: </ins> wait. I think I heard a curse word in the song ""Sixth Sense"" by Brown Eyed Girls?! That song sucks <mod target = btw>by the way</mod>. The lyrics will make your hands curl. Lastly
column12:
I am sorry for writing this kind of lame journal entry. I promise that I will write something nice to read next week. :)

P.S. The energy drink called HotSix tastes exactly like carbonated Bak-kas.":::

column1: 1173:::"Before I start
column2: I should let you know that I'm not into K-Pop. <del>And </del><mod target = no>No</mod>
column3: that doesn't mean that I feel secretly superior or something. I do not have any ""bad feelings"" towards a certain group of singers
column4:
so don't worry and read on.

In my opinion
column5: there is a major problem with the Korean idol fandom. First of all
column6: I've never seen a country
column7: other than Korea
column8: in which fan girls gather and create a name for their fandom. For example
column9: Cassiopeia
column10: Beauty
column11: Girlfriend
column12: etc. <del>And </del><mod target = they>They</mod> say things like ""I'm a Hottist (or Hottest
column13: whatever)
column14: and don't you dare criticize our 2PM! Are you insane?"" Things like that bother me. Do you really have to identify yourself by who your favorite idol group is? <del>And </del>I even heard that there is a kind of ""hierarchy"" among all those fandoms. For instance
column15: because TVXQ made their debut way before SHINee did
column16: SHINee fans must not denounce TVXQ and their fans under any circumstance. Seriously? You guys are all just middle <mod target = schoolers>school-ers</mod>. Do you realize how stupid it is to fight over someone who doesn't even know you exist? I can never understand these girls
column17:
even though we are of the same age.

I have tons of things to write about
column18: but my midterm is in <mod target = 9>nine</mod> days. So<ins>
column19:
I'll stop here. Wish me luck!


For your information
column20:
Cassiopeia: fans of TVXQ
Beauty: fans of B2ST
Girlfriend: fans of Boyfriend
Hottist: fans of 2PM
---Yeah. It's even confusing for me
column21: </del> and I'm a middle school girl.":::

column1: 1174:::"I have always been interested in volunteering. Although<del>
column2: </del> volunteering for 18 hours a year is mandatory for middle school students like me
column3: I actually enjoy doing it. There is not much to do when you are only sixteen years old. The only options are usually to organize some books in a library
column4: clean the floor of a building
column5: etc. They just won't let you do something meaningful and valuable. In fact
column6:
they are already doing you a favor by giving you a chance to fill in your mandatory volunteering hours.

So
column7: </ins> I was looking for volunteer work the other day<del>
column8: </del> and found out about the opportunity to be a translation volunteer. I had to become one of them! I applied for it right away. About two days later
column9: I got a text message saying that I made it. <mod target = YES>Yes</mod>! The organization is called Compassion. It's an international aid group. They sent me the necessary programs and I started translating the letters. My job is to translate Korean letters (that sponsors send to the foreign kids they sponsor) into English. After I'm done
column10: the letters are sent to needy children in Africa
column11: Southeast Asia
column12: Southwest Asia
column13:
and South America.

Sometime later I found out about the community of Compassion mates and sponsors. There
column14: I read about a girl who sponsors two children. She is a college student who earns her living by working a part time job at a convenience store. Originally<ins>
column15: </ins> she was only sponsoring one boy. She exchanged letters with the boy and she felt sorry for the boy's sister who couldn't get a sponsor for years. So<ins>
column16: </ins> despite the fact that she is not so well-off and just a student
column17:
she decided to also sponsor the boy's sister.

I was very impressed. Sponsoring 2 kids costs 90
column18: </ins>000 won a month. It is surprising how she would pay that much money for children she never met in person. It is not only money<ins>
column19: </ins> but also her compassion and love towards the children that touched me. <del>And </del>I was happy that there are still people who would help others no matter what. I promised myself that I will sponsor a needy child when I get enough allowance to do so (I only get 20<ins>
column20: </ins>000 <mod target = Won>won</mod> a month. Excuse Moi!). Anyways
column21: I'm glad that I applied for this volunteer work and found out about this amazing girl. Thank you<ins>
column22: </ins> Compassion<ins>.</ins> <del>:)

column1:
1175:::"Today was my last day of remedial classes. We were assigned to our classes. I am in class 7.
Well... It was a little strange. When I went to school for the remedial class
column2: there were a lot of friends from Duckwon middle school
column3:
so it was very comfortable to be there.
But now
column4: there is only a small amount of friends that I know in my class. Well
column5: I have to concentrate more on making friends from now on. I wish that I will be able to make many friends<del>
column6: </del> and be a kinder person.":::

column1: 1176:::"I'm very sorry that I didn't submit my entry last week. I forgot that I had to write a diary entry. Today<ins>
column2:
I'm going to tell you about our school's remedial class.
Students were assigned to schools through a lottery system
column3: </del> and I was assigned to <ins>a </ins>school that I wanted to go to. So
column4: at first
column5: when I heard that I was assigned to Duckwon High School
column6: I was very exited. Well
column7: at the time<ins>
column8: </ins> I didn't know that I had to take a remedial class. Although it is little bit tiring to go to school early every day
column9: there are some benefits<ins>
column10: </ins> too. (Positive thinking...positive thinking...<del>ha...ha...ha...^^""</del>) Because I go to school early every day
column11:
it is much easier to settle into high school life.
Tomorrow
column12: </ins> we will take a test on Korean
column13: Math
column14: and English. I hope I get a good score on that test
column15:
so I can join the advanced classes.
Wow... now that I'm in high school
column16:
I feel like time goes by so quickly. I think I have to use my time more meaningfully. There are only 14 days left until the first day of the school year. Study hard! And Fighting!!^^*



*A remedial class: 보충수업
*lottery system: 추첨제
*assigned to : 배정받다
*settle in: 적응하다
*advanced classes:특별반
*meaningfully: 알차게
*the first day of the school year: 개학일":::

column1:
1177:::"My sister is going to be a university student soon.
I hope she enjoys the school curriculum and college life.
I'm worried about her because she has to go to a college she didn't want to go to.
She passed the entrance exams for Sung Kyun Kwan University and Daegu Teacher's College for Elementary School.
My parents told her to go to Daegu Teacher's College for Elementary School because when you go to the Teacher's College for Elementary School
column2: you don't have to be anxious about finding a job after graduation. Although it is difficult to pass a teacher's certification examination
column3: it is better then other jobs. If you have a passion for students and children
column4:
it will be worth it.
But
column5: </ins> my sister doesn't seem like she is that interested in children. But anyway
column6:
she finally chose to go to the Teacher's College for Elementary School.
I know that she always really wanted to go to Seoul. However
column7: this was a really big decision and she had to consider reality and our family circumstances. So in the end
column8:
I think she chose the right thing. It will be better for her future and I think that she will live a life without regret.
Sister~!! Please enjoy your college life. I will always cheer for you!!
Remember that I am always right besides you!
P.S. Your graduation day is coming up!! So
column9: tomorrow
column10:
I will buy you a fancy bag for your
graduation gift! Hey
column11: aren't you going to buy me a present<ins>
column12: </ins> too? My graduation day is <mod target = comming>coming</mod> up<ins>
column13: </ins> too!<del>! Hee hee</del> I always love you
column14: my sister!<del>!

column1:
1178:::"I had a great time with my relatives during this holiday.
I played with my cousins and went to the house of our eldest relative where
we bowed to our grandfather and grandmother for the New Year.
After a late breakfast
column2:
we made a round of New Year's calls to earn money and to wish the villagers a happy new year.
This year
column3: </ins> my earnings were very good. I earned close to ￦300
column4:
000!!
Mommy asked me what I'm going to do with my money. Hmm....
I'm going to save some of the money
column5:
and spend a little of it to eat yummy things.
I want to go to Albero
column6: a family restaurant
column7:
and eat spaghetti. Cream spaghetti is so delicious!!
Later at night on New Year's Day
column8:
my family played hwatu together. It was really fun!
During the four day long holiday
column9: I talked with my relatives a lot
column10:
went to the downtown area with my
cousins
column11: ate pizza
column12:
and watched funny TV programs. It was great!!
And The best part of all was on the last day of the holiday when I got to spend a great time with my family.
We went to Home-plus and ate a delicious dinner at the food court.
Originally
column13:
we were going to watch a movie and then eat dinner.
But
column14: </ins> there were a lot of people there and as a result
column15:
all the tickets were sold out!
We didn't have a choice but to just eat dinner. It would have been a better holiday if we had also watched a movie. But
column16: whatever
column17: it was enough and I still had a great time! <del>^*^

column1: 1179:::"At 9 <mod target = am>A.M.</mod>
column2:
I went to the health club with my mommy and my sister.
I was wandering around the place..
And I thought that I should try walking on the running machine.
But
column3: </ins> suddenly<ins>
column4:
-- I fell down! It hurt so much and I thought I would start crying.
But
column5: </ins> there were a lot of people staring at me<ins>
column6:
so I tried to laugh it off.
I just kept walking and walking even though my legs hurt. I think they will be better after a little more time passes.":::

column1:
1180:::"Today was a fantastic day!

I played all day long with families from my church.

First
column2:
I went to church. (We had promised to meet there at 9:00 a.m.)

After
column3: </ins> when everyone arrived<ins>
column4:
we went to see a movie.

We watched ""Mission Impossible 4.""

It was so cool
column5:
especially Tom Cruise!! He was so handsome!!

I want to marry a person like him when I grow up. He is so hot!

Anyway
column6: after the movie<ins>
column7:
we went to eat lunch.

We ate steak at Outback steakhouse. It was really delicious.

Sometimes
column8: </ins> what I choose from the menu is very greasy<ins>
column9:
so I find it hard to eat. The last time

I went to that restaurant
column10:
I didn't think it was delicious.

But
column11:
the menu I picked today suited me very well.

After we ate lunch
column12:
we separated with each other.

The fantastic thing is that I didn't pay for any of this
column13:
not even a hundred won.

All I needed was my two legs to walk and my mouth to eat!

What a wonderful world this is.^^ hahaha..

column1: 1181:::"Right now
column2:
I don't feel well because I had some trouble with my music project.

Actually
column3:
this project is a group project.

But
column4: </ins> my teammates have no interest in this project. So<ins>
column5:
I have to do it all by myself.

My teammates just kept saying ""I don't know how to do it. So...you do it. I guess you can do it..."" Huh!! How dare they say that to me!! I don't know how to do everything either.

So
column6: </mod> I said ""Neither do I!"" (<del>Because </del><mod target = even>Even</mod> though it is a music project
column7: we have to edit everything with a computer and I am computer illiterate. If we don't finish it
column8: we will be punished<del>
column9:
and have to sit on the floor outside in the freezing air. I don't want to be outdoors!!)

But
column10: </ins> there was no use in talking with them. As a result
column11:
I have to do it all by myself.

The thing that I got most angry about was that my family didn't help me a bit! (They are good at using the computer.) So
column12:
I had to do it all by myself.
When I was done with this project
column13:
I felt very proud of myself!
Now
column14: </ins> I think I am much better at using the computer!":::

column1:
1182:::"I was studying at school when I heard the news.

The news told us that Kim Jung-Il
column2:
the Chairman of the National Defense Commission of

North Korea
column3:
is dead.

It was surprising news.

I knew that he was sick
column4:
but I never imagined that he would die.

It looked like he would live forever.

My friends and I were scared because all the disorder in North Korea could result in a war.

We heard that Daegu will be the second target for a missile after Seoul because almost every combat plane in South Korea is at Daegu.

So
column5:
we won't have any time to escape when the war starts.

And My older sister is at my uncle's house in Ulsan to visit our cousins.

What if I never see her again?

I hope this situation will be carefully taken care of immediately.":::

column1: 1183:::"After the exam
column2:
the third graders went on a graduation trip.

The destination of our trip was the Buyeo youth center.

Many people told me that it was the most awful place to go for a graduation trip.

At first
column3: I thought so
column4:
too.

But
column5:
I think the trip was still meaningful in its own way.

I spent a lot of time playing games with my roommates and ate a lot of crackers
column6: jelly
column7:
and candy.

We also walked along the historical sights near the center.

The most interesting destination that I still remember was the 백제 부여 museum.

There were a lot of things to see such as ancient treasures and the models of how ancient

people lived during that time.

My friend said
column8:
""Why is everybody looking at these so quickly? I want to look at these

more closely and carefully.""

I agreed with her.

Even if it was a little boring
column9: </ins> we should look at everything carefully
column10:
especially since it is about the way our ancestors used to live.

I also liked the pond called Goong-Nam-Gi.

It was clear and beautiful at the same time.

I felt a great desire to have a similar pond in my own house
column11:
even though we don't have a

garden.":::

column1: 1184:::"Last week
column2:
I went to Andong with our club-members.

We started our journey at 8:30 a.m. and came back home by 7:00 p.m.

We arrived first at Sin-mu-dang.

It is a tree at which people make wishes for their luck or pray.

I listened carefully to the guide.

She told us a lot of legends about the different treasures one by one.

It was very fun and interesting.

I really wanted to see Andong Kwon's house.

But
column3:
it wasn't on our schedule and we didn't have much time so I couldn't see it.

But
column4: the lunch was great! It was really delicious<ins>
column5:
so I cheered up a little.

The next thing on our schedule was to take a boat.

We took a boat and crossed the lake
column6:
then we went up the mountain.

Up in the mountain
column7:
the scenery was magnificent!

It was wonderful!

Everything looked so quiet and peaceful while we passed different villages on the lake.

I loved the scenery.

And Then we went down the mountain to see the Ha-hae mask dance.

I was ""the chosen one"" because the cow peed on me! Well... it was not a real pee though
column8:
just water.

But
column9:
still!! It wasn't very funny at all...

After the mask dance was over
column10:
we returned to our house.

It was a very tiring and long journey
column11: but it was very fun!":::

column1:
1185:::"Hi!

Let me tell you about some news that many people are very curious about. I heard that An Chul Su will give half of his share of the company to society. He said that he wants his money to be used to help the poor children get a better education. I think he is very warm-hearted and generous for doing this. However
column2: this is just my personal opinion. Some people never think of anything in a good way. Because An Chul Su is the director of Seoul University's fusion technology and science department
column3: they think of him in a negative way. People don't believe that he is genuine. They think he is donating <ins>simply </ins>to secure his future political status. When I read this article
column4: I thought ""Why do people always think of everything in a negative way? Why can't they just say thank you to An Chul Su?"" Anyway<ins>
column5:
he is doing a good thing. The people who are critical about An Chul Su rarely volunteer to help society. They should be ashamed of themselves. I want to follow the example of An Chul Su who volunteered to help society. It is something that should
be rewarded.":::

column1:
1186:::"Today was the last day of my school exams. I was so happy and a little bit sad at the same

time. Because This means that my middle school life is going to end.

I am afraid of becoming a high school student.

I see what my sister goes through and high school must be really hard.

Well... it might be rewarding if I can get good grades like my sister
column2:
though.^^

My older sister is a high school senior
column3:
so she took the college scholastic ability test.

The great news is that she passed the primary examination for Seoul National

University.

My family is so happy and I'm proud of my sister.

Oh! And Thanks to Little Fox
column4: too<ins>
column5:
because my sister got a perfect score in English.

I think that the reason she could get a perfect score was because she listened to ""Little

Fox"" regularly and liked English very much.

From now on
column6:
it is my turn to study hard.

It might be hard. But
column7:
if I study hard I will be paid for my hard work.

Go! Ye-Un!! Go!!

column1:
1187:::"Hi!

I'm very tired now because today was our school's festival. We played all day at

school. We watched the first and second graders sing and play the recorder. They looked very cute. Today's

feeling was kind of strange. That's because I never thought that I will be in the third grade. But

now
column2:
I am! And It is already almost the last month of the year! How sad. I will enter high

school soon. I want to continue to be a middle school student. But
column3:
oh well. I can't

control that anyway. Let's go back to my story. Hmm..yes! I'm an executive for our

""English newspaper"" club. So this year
column4:
our club opened an ""English board game cafe""! Wow!

It was successful. Many students came to our cafe. But
column5: </ins> I think they came to our cafe to eat
column6:
not to play

board games because our cafe gave them free cookies and drinks. They looked

so happy. But we (our club's executives) were very tired. My friend kept saying ""Oh! I am

so tired that I could die."" I still felt happy though
column7:
after our cafe closed. It was fun to

talk with friends
column8: younger students
column9: and also serve cookies and drinks for the first time. I will remember this day in my heart as one of my precious memories.":::

column1:
1188:::"Hi! Let me tell you about a book which was very moving and contained a lot of historical

information. I read a read book called ""Land"" which was written by the author Park Gung Lee.

I think she is terrific! That's because I felt like my soul could feel what was going on in the story

while I was reading the book. And It was really very fun! I cannot say more. I heard some friends

say that they didn't think ""Land"" was very interesting and that it was boring. But
column2:
I wonder how they could say that.

Huh! It's the most wonderful story I have ever read. Well
column3:
some people might not like

these kinds of stories. But
column4: </ins> I like these kinds of stories the most! I think that this was such a great book because it contained important historical incidents. I could learn more and think about history. The other reason why I liked this book so much is because is the story written by a Korean author. So<ins>
column5: </ins> the book had Korean people's thoughts and sentiments. I can also feel and understand the way our people thought about nobles and the caste system. So<ins>
column6:
I think this is the best story I have ever

read. I just want to say thank you to the author
column7:
Park Gung Lee! Don't you feel like you have to read this

book now? Why are you hesitating? Go to your school's library and borrow it!":::

column1: 1189:::"After I read about Apollo 11
column2: I think that people's adventurous thoughts and actions make our world a more convenient and surprising place to live. I hope that NASA will plan another project soon<ins>
column3:
like making a building where people can go visit the solar system. It will be awesome. Don't you think so? I really want to travel around the solar system.

The building could be a place where people can go visit. Like many people
column4: I also always think about what it would be like to have a ""cloud academy."" This is what I think about whenever I ride in a car and look at the sky. I think it can be <mod target = possibe>possible</mod>. I want to open a ""cloud changing academy"" and make funny and beautiful shapes in the sky with the clouds such as flowers
column5: apples
column6: rabbits
column7:
or patterns. They can be anything! The clouds will probably make drivers feel more delight while they are driving whenever they look at the sky.

Everybody should study hard and come up with some creative and unique ideas to make the world a better place! Come on! Let's all do this together!":::

column2: let me tell you about a book which was very moving<del>
column3: </del> and contained a lot of good advice. I read a book called ""Consideration."" It was written by the author Han Sang Bok (한상복). I read this book because it was recommended to us by our school principal to read during our summer vacation. I thought it was boring at first
column4: but as the time went by
column5:
I found myself still reading even when my mom would call for me.
(Mommy got angry at me at the time because she called me five times to tell me to eat dinner.)
The book's main characters are a busy man named We
column6: his wife
column7: his daughter named Yena
column8: his co-workers
column9:
and his adviser. We seemed like a very busy man.
And He really was. He concentrated so much on his work and making money that he didn't have much time to talk with his family. So his relationships
column10: even with other people
column11: were getting bad. But<ins>
column12: </ins> he began to think about how other people were thinking. He realized that when you deal with people
column13: if<ins> you</ins> act after you consider the way they think and feel
column14: then their reaction to you will be better. We started to always think abut how the other person will feel. For example<ins>
column15: </ins> he would wonder
column16: ""If I say this to him
column17: will he get upset?"" As a result of his consideration of others
column18: his relationship with others got better. Of course<ins>
column19: </ins> his relationship with his family improved<ins>
column20: </ins> too. When I was done reading this book
column21: I think that consideration for other people is one of the most important things to <mod target = do>have</mod> in the world.":::

column1:
1191:::"Hooray~!!
Today was my last day of our school exams.
I am so happy now!
Yesterday
column2: there were three subjects on the test: science
column3: Korean
column4: and social studies. I think I did well in social studies and Korean
column5: but the science exam was really difficult. I though<ins>t</ins> it was strange because my top two favorite subjects are math and science. Hmm.. If I think about it
column6:
maybe my way of studying for those subjects isn't the best. I felt very nervous during the science test. I usually never feel like that after I study a lot. I just like to solve the problems.
My friend said to me that I study so hard that whenever she looks at me
column7: she can always see how hard I try. My friend said that constant effort is the most important thing and that I always study really hard. She also said that I am a person to copy and learn from. (When I heard this
column8:
I felt really proud of myself.)
Even I think I studied hard. But
column9: </ins> the way that I study is the most important thing. So<ins>
column10: </ins> I'm going to change my study method from now on. Before
column11: I studied one subject for a long time. However
column12: I heard that when you change a subject every other hour
column13: learning performance <mod target = is increased>increases
column14:
so I am going to try that.
Of course
column15:
I'm going to try to enjoy studying. I should control my mind and concentrate on my studies.
Just do it!! Fighting!!

column1:
1192:::"Oh! I have been feeling so tired recently.

I think I am getting lazy.

The school exam is coming up soon
column2:
but I don't feel anxious or nervous.

I just feel sleepy. What can I do? When I was in the second grade last year
column3:
I studied really hard. I studied at school during recess time.

I never rested and I always studied. I think I even studied during our school festival and my friends told me
column4:
""Hey! Stop studying! Take some time to rest!""

But
column5: </ins> I was always busy. I don't know why I was so busy. Well... I really cared about doing well on the school exam though. But<ins>
column6:
now?! What am I doing now? I think I should study hard again.

No pain
column7: No gain! <mod target = FIGHTING>Fighting</mod>!<del>^^

column1: 1193:::"Wow!<del>!</del> Long time no see
column2:
everybody!
It has been a long time since I wrote my last entry about the IAAF.
I went to my grandma's home for the Chuseok holiday.
My grandma's home is in Moongung. (Do you know anything about Moongung?
It is famous for having a lot of historical drama studios. There is also the railroad bicycle in Moongung. It is really fun if you eat a hot dog while riding on a railroad bicycle!! The hot dog tastes even more delicious. Go to Moongung and try some!!)
This year
column3: the Chuseok holiday was very long. I think it was about five days.<del>
column4: I ate a lot of the food that was prepared for the ancestral rites. (I think the most delicious food was the fried calamari. I also really liked the yakgwa which was very sweet!!) I had a great time playing with my cousin. But
column5:
the problem is that my school exam is coming up soon! Oh my God!
I haven't started studying yet. What am I going to do? So
column6:
from now on I have to go to my room and study for the exam. Good bye! See you next time!
Thank you for reading my diary.":::

column1:
1194:::"Go let's go together~!!
Go let's go for tomorrow~!!
Have you ever heard that song??
It is the theme song for the Daegu World Championship in Athletics.
The World Championships in Athletics opened here in Daegu and lasted for nine days.
It was a great pleasure to be able to have and see lots of famous athletes so near to us.
The thing that attracted most people's attention was the ""curse"" of the daily program's cover model. It is very strange that in general
column2: </ins> the person on the program's cover would not do very well and receive low scores. But<ins>
column3:
there were a few exceptions to the curse and some people did well even though they were on the cover and had happy faces. The most well-known and popular athlete was Usain Bolt.
But
column4: </ins> a surprising thing happened. Bolt was eliminated from competing in the final for having a false start in the 100<ins> </ins>m race. It was a sad moment for all of us. He was upset
column5: but the next day<ins>
column6: </ins> he appeared in the exercise yard with his cheerful attitude as if nothing had happened. In the 200<ins> </ins>m race
column7:
Bolt cruised through to the final which he won with a time of 19.40 s. He made his world fans laugh with
a funny movement and as always
column8: </ins> made his trademark<del>
column9: </del> ""lightning"" sign. When he won the 400<ins> </ins>m relay (along with his teammates)<ins>
column10:
he danced around the stadium with his teammates.
And Everybody laughed. There is are also some athletes who touch the heart. The sprinter with a prosthesis leg is one of them. He is the first disabled athlete who competed in the World Championship in Athletics. He practiced a lot and didn't give up.
For nine long days
column11:
many athletes laughed and cried during the championship. It is awesome that I got to see this all in Daegu! I will always remember the World Championship in Athletics.
See you next time~!!":::

column1:
1195:::"Wow!
This is the first time I have written an English diary in a long time.
Now
column2:
let me start.
It's a problem that our economy is shaking. I read a newspaper article in the morning that explained how America's credit rating has decreased from AAA to AA+. I became really worried.
That's because if America's economy suffers
column3: it is clear that our country will also be affected by it a lot. As I had expected
column4: I found that a lot of people started selling their stocks. This also worries me. People are busy selling their stocks because stock prices are collapsing. As a result
column5: a CB (circuit breaker) is going on. (A CB is when there is a large sell-off of stocks. The term is derived from an incident called Black Sunday. Black Sunday was America's worst stock price collapse which happened in 1998.) Anyway
column6:
people who bought a lot of stocks are sighing and worried. I think the recent global economy is not doing well.
America's economy is suffering
column7: along with the economies in France
column8: Germany
column9: Canada
column10:
and England.
Why is every country so affected by other countries? When one country's economy is shaking
column11:
a lot of nearby countries' economies also shake with them. It is just like a domino effect.
I just hope that every country is okay and can quickly rise like a roly poly toy.
Ever since last year
column12:
there have been so many terrorist attacks and conflicts with other nations. So many people have died. I don't think it is an individual's responsibility for all of these problems.
It is all of our faults. All of us. The solution is to love each other
column13:
and care deeply about our neighbor. (Although it is very hard to do that.)
Many children are starving
column14:
and our neighbors are crying because of a lack of money.
We have to make more effort to promote the welfare of the people and make donations to the poor. If we all fulfilled this
column15: we would live in world where everyone is laughing and happy.":::

Dear my diary Pinky
column5:
One of my Catholic neighbors is in the hospital because of a serious motorcycle accident. He is a boy who is in the first year of middle school.

The terrible accident occurred last Thursday (as far as I remember).
At about 10 p.m.
column6: after his academy class
column7: he was going home and waiting for the traffic light to change from red to green. <del>And </del><mod target = when>When</mod> <mod target = finally it>it finally</mod> changed to a green light
column8: he walked across the crosswalk. But then<ins>
column9: </ins> <mod target = ->as </mod>he was crossing the middle of the crosswalk<del>-</del>
column10: a motorcycle came up to him all of a sudden<mod target =
column11: >.</mod> <mod target = in>In</mod> a short time
column12: <mod target = and>it</mod> hit him<del>
column13:
and the two men flew away in opposite directions. The poor little boy flew over 30 meters and fell down in front of one bus stop and slid over 5 meters. He had already passed out because he was hit on the head by the motorcycle. And The motorcyclist also had also already passed out when he flew away and fell down. And The worst thing is that both of them aren't awake even now.
According to a classmate of the little boy's
column14: he <mod target = had>has</mod> a tube going through his head at the hospital because his head is filled with a lot of blood that has to be taken out. Oh
column15: I can't imagine! <del>And </del><mod target = she>She</mod> said that he doesn't even have his own face because of the sliding! Oh my
column16:
I feel so bad for this boy! I was really sorry to hear that...

Many people say that there's no hope for him because there was a lot of impact to his head.
I agree that there was a lot of impact to his head
column17:
but I think there is hope for him. He will be able to wake up and live in his own consciousness as usual if we pray to God for him.

Let us pray to God to save him! And Let us wish that he will live!":::
